idea_7: This feature provides Sprint and Marathon boards with varied path lengths, adjusted safe zones, and bonus checkpoints while keeping the original game rules intact.
idea_8: This feature lets players collect and use three tactic cards in casual modes, enabling actions such as rerolling dice, extending safe squares, or changing turn order with cooldowns and limits.
idea_9: This feature lets users design custom logos and mascots with layered shapes, fonts, and game elements, which appear on tables, profiles, and tournament brackets.
idea_10: This feature introduces seasonal events where players complete tasks like combo captures or winning via safe routes to progress and earn cosmetic rewards.

idea_1: This feature allows you to tap the dice to see a live dashboard showing roll distribution, streak alerts, and a post-match seed for randomness verification.
idea_2: This feature lets users create custom game rules with drag-and-drop tools, generate a code, and play only with others using the same rules.
idea_3: This feature lets users play multiple turn-based games with 24-48 hour time limits per move, shows game summaries when returning, and provides reminders and a My Turns inbox to track moves.
idea_4: This feature lets two teams of two players each play together, share home entries, use one assist per game, and communicate with voice and quick strategy options.
idea_5: This feature displays a heatmap of missed risks, blocked paths, and capture threats after each match, provides one-tap replays of alternative moves, and shows a tactical progress rating.
idea_6: This feature displays a life-size Ludo board on a table using AR, lets phones control the game for pass-and-play or remote viewing, and includes auto-zoom and token tracking.
idea_7: This feature provides short game challenges based on real match situations. Completing consecutive challenges unlocks new dice trails and game boards.
idea_8: This feature allows you to play against recorded moves of other players, compare your performance, and view shared replays and leaderboards to track progress.
idea_9: This feature compresses assets and limits animations to reduce data use, automatically reconnects when needed, uses timers, and displays a mini-practice board during short disconnections.
idea_10: This feature provides a solo or cooperative map with themed boards, NPC bosses, special rules, and limited-time chapters that unlock cosmetics and emotes.

idea_1: This Feature connects you with partners and an AI coach that offers live prompts, timing cues, post-call feedback, a shared doodle pad, and prompt cards.
idea_2: This Feature shows live captions, lets users adjust voice clarity and volume, converts typed messages to speech, and connects users with accessibility settings.
idea_3: This feature allows users to share an invite link to form a group of two or three people, connect with another group, and rate each other after the chat.
idea_4: This feature allows you to add tags or notes after each call to create private Vibe Cards for organizing your queue and reporting inappropriate behavior anonymously.
idea_5: This feature allows you to chat with nearby users by selecting distance and city-based rooms, displaying local topic tags without sharing exact locations.
idea_6: This feature allows users to select topics for matching, uses AI to connect compatible people, and lets users add more topics with one tap to reduce wait times.
idea_7: This feature plays a shared playlist for both users, reduces music volume during conversations, shows song lyrics, and provides optional voice effects and soundboards.
idea_8: This feature uses animated avatars instead of cameras, applies content filters, lets guardians set schedules and view usage summaries, and connects users only with other KidSafe participants.
idea_9: This feature gives coins for respectful behavior, feedback, and challenges, which can be spent on cosmetic effects, priority regions, or donations, and includes streaks and mini-games.
idea_10: This feature lets users choose a future location and time to connect with people there, offering translation, time-zone details, weather updates, and safety notifications.

idea_1: This feature begins video chats with 60-second tasks that match both users’ interests and languages. Completing tasks awards badges and extends chat time.
idea_2: This feature translates speech in real time, shows subtitles, offers optional voice dubbing synced with lip movements, and lets users tap to hear the original voice briefly.
idea_3: This feature allows users to set conversation rules before matching, shows shared acceptable topics, alerts about rule violations, and can skip matches if rules are broken.
idea_4: This feature begins video chats with a blurred screen that clears after both users agree, blurs backgrounds, adds a session watermark, and detects screen recording.
idea_5: This feature allows users to join temporary chat rooms based on mood, lasting 30 minutes, where they are matched with others sharing the same theme and receive changing rewards.
idea_6: This feature arranges a rematch within a week if both users rate a chat positively and displays shared prompts to continue the conversation.
idea_7: This feature allows users to share virtual objects, draw together, and play gesture-based games across screens, with points and power-ups saved after reconnecting.
idea_8: This feature connects users with nearby people, provides automatic translation, displays safety tips, and uses time limits and city badges to manage conversations.
idea_9: This feature lets users host small group chats with timed speaking turns, a speaking queue, and basic moderation controls. Viewers can join 60-second speaking rounds.
idea_10: This feature uses an on-device system to detect long silences or interruptions and displays prompts such as topic cards, pace tips, or quick games to the user.

idea_1: This feature offers lessons on transit skills, provides practice routes, gives prompts during first rides, and tracks user progress with badges.
idea_2: This feature allows you to invite friends, see their anonymous commute tips, create shared routes for events, and send quick requests for travel advice.
idea_3: This feature lets you set and save trip preferences like least walking, step-free access, fewer transfers, quiet car, stroller-friendly, or coffee stops, and use them in searches.
idea_4: This feature provides live captions of transit announcements with large text and vibration alerts for stops, route changes, and safety messages, with optional audio through earbuds.
idea_5: This feature lets users add tags and photos to transit lines, stops, and stations, applies automatic blurring and moderation, and shows aggregated information in search results.
idea_6: This feature allows you to view your commute at various times and days using past data and forecasts, save your plan, and get automatic updates about changes.
idea_7: This feature tracks trips, off-peak travel, walking segments, and reviews to accumulate points that can be exchanged for transit passes, discounts, donations, or gifts.
idea_8: This feature lets users find and connect with verified riders on the same route and time, providing chat, meeting guidance, privacy settings, and group options.
idea_9: This feature updates routes according to weather and air quality, adds travel time, suggests covered paths or alternative transport, and provides alerts with gear and shelter information.
idea_10: This feature lets you download city maps, station layouts, and schedules for offline access, and shows live updates and departure times when connected to the internet.

idea_1: This feature uses on-device AR to guide users through stations and interchanges, indicating optimal doors and exits, and includes an accessible mode showing elevators, ramps, and detours.
idea_2: This feature predicts and displays crowding and seat availability by car or section using historical data, sensors, and rider reports, and shows where to stand and board.
idea_3: This feature identifies possible missed connections, recommends adjustments such as walking faster or changing vehicles, requests holds from operators, and updates routes with notifications if necessary.
idea_4: This feature shows a safety score based on lighting, crime reports, crowd levels, and time of day. It also enables live location sharing and automatic safety check-ins.
idea_5: This feature lets users report temporary disruptions like moved stops or blocked sidewalks with photos, which are then added to routes and updated automatically.
idea_6: This feature uses your location and past service data to track transit arrivals offline, shows a confidence meter, and updates the route automatically when online.
idea_7: This feature lets users track selected stops or lines, check details such as amenities and elevator status, and contribute to improving data accuracy and update frequency.
idea_8: This feature offers personalized commute time suggestions to avoid crowded periods, displays estimated time and stress savings, and monitors off-peak travel streaks.
idea_9: This feature allows you to create simple if-then rules for routing, such as avoiding uncovered transfers in rain or prioritizing safety after 9 pm, and works with system Shortcuts.
idea_10: This feature offers a high-contrast mode with landmark images, large prompts, and vibration alerts. Caregivers can approve routes and add custom voice instructions.

idea_1: This feature adds swipe and tap actions during scenes that fill a momentum meter, unlocking additional dialogue, reputation, or alternate story paths without stopping progress.
idea_2: This feature allows users to save weekly genre and creator coupons that automatically apply discounts, free outfit trials, or bonus passes during premium-choice checkout.
idea_3: This feature lets you speak your dialogue choices, automatically selects matching options, offers optional character voiceover, and allows you to record or share voice notes.
idea_4: This feature allows you to play a mini-game to collect items for decorating your character’s room or story sets and earn coins that can be exchanged for passes or rewards.
idea_5: This feature displays a spoiler-free map of story arcs, shows locked branches generally, and allows you to pin paths to save and organize replays with time and cost information.
idea_6: This feature shows gem costs for stories, suggests lower-cost choices in important scenes, lets users set a spending limit to skip costly options, and provides a short undo for premium selections.
idea_7: This feature allows creators to measure scene areas, place characters automatically, preview and record camera movements, and suggests spacing to prevent character overlap in scenes.
idea_8: This feature allows users to create a Story Club to share passes with up to five people, track reading progress, host group reads with live reactions, and access rotating premium content.
idea_9: This feature offers templates, fonts, mascots, and stickers sized for Episode covers and logos, enabling users to create, export, or apply images to their stories.
idea_10: This feature allows players to collect trait cards by reading and completing challenges, which can then be used to unlock specific choices set by creators without using gems.

idea_1: This feature lets two players control different characters in the same story, with their choices connecting at specific moments to share information and access unique endings.
idea_2: This feature displays a map of story branches after each chapter, showing explored paths and letting users spend tokens to preview short clips of unchosen options.
idea_3: This feature allows players to select emotions such as trust or envy instead of dialogue lines, which affects the tone, character relationships, and future scenes.
idea_4: This feature records choices made in stories by the same author or universe and applies their effects to characters, events, or items in other stories, with an optional toggle.
idea_5: This feature identifies continuity errors, unused story branches, and pacing issues by simulating multiple playthroughs, and provides suggestions for dialogue edits and gem placements.
idea_6: This feature lets players change camera angles, filters, and music after chapters to create and share edited scenes. Authors can view and highlight selected edits.
idea_7: This feature allows readers to adjust sliders for romance, horror, violence, and language, modifying related dialogue, outfits, and scenes while maintaining the story's continuity.
idea_8: This feature lets early viewers watch new episodes together, vote on one choice that changes the episode, and gives authors live chat, reactions, and viewer information.
idea_9: This feature allows players to collect skill cards during the story and arrange them between chapters to unlock and influence different gameplay choices.
idea_10: This feature lets players share links that display highlights up to a chosen scene while hiding later content. Recipients can begin the story from the start.

idea_1: This feature lets users save and use time-limited coupons for upgrades, furnishings, and bulk amenities, with coupons changing according to location and guest season.
idea_2: This feature lets users connect check-ins, cleanings, and service tasks within specific times and includes weekly challenges and leaderboards to track performance.
idea_3: This feature allows users to take photos and timelapse videos of the hotel with filters, stamps, and frames, use a selfie booth, and create shareable exports with hotel tags.
idea_4: This feature allows managers to record voice memos that are converted into tasks with priority levels, reminders, action links, and options to organize into checklists or save for later.
idea_5: This feature lets users set up build orders, staff schedules, and procurement contracts that run offline for up to 12 hours and provides a summary report afterward.
idea_6: This feature generates playlists for various hotel areas according to the time of day and enables adding custom 20-second jingles or voice announcements for elevators and events.
idea_7: This feature removes time limits and forced ads, slows game pacing, adds calmer sounds, and lets players choose to watch ads to earn rewards.
idea_8: This feature pre-qualifies loans for hotel expansions, shows monthly payments, payoff time, ROI impact, and provides a checklist of requirements for funding access.
idea_9: This feature lets you manage a car rental desk by assigning parking, tracking cleaning and maintenance, providing insurance or tours, and handling check-in with dynamic pricing.
idea_10: This Feature lets users split rooms into smaller units or merge adjacent rooms into suites using drag controls. It shows effects on demand and housekeeping and allows batch changes by floor.

idea_1: This feature allows adding recurring VIP guests with changing preferences and optional tasks. Completing their requests unlocks new décor, passive benefits, and increases reputation.
idea_2: This feature lets users create, save, and use hotel layouts, share and import blueprints with cost information, and adjust designs to fit various floor plans.
idea_3: This feature lets users schedule time-limited events, manage staff bookings, rent temporary spaces, and purchase supply bundles to support event needs.
idea_4: This feature assigns traits to staff, offers a drag-and-drop shift planner with lineup suggestions, and includes skill trees for training and managing roles.
idea_5: This feature manages vendor contracts for linens, ingredients, and amenities, tracks variable prices and lead times, and supports both bulk purchases and just-in-time deliveries.
idea_6: This feature lets users simulate how upgrades impact revenue, ratings, and wait times using recent traffic and staffing data, allowing side-by-side comparisons.
idea_7: This feature lets players compete asynchronously against a ghost version of another player’s hotel, using the same budget and time limit to compare revenue and ratings.
idea_8: This feature monitors energy, water, and waste usage, tracks Eco Credits, and lets users choose upgrades such as solar, greywater, and linen reuse that impact costs and demand.
idea_9: This feature lets users manage incidents such as lost luggage or overbooking through several steps, with results affecting ratings, staff morale, and insurance expenses.
idea_10: This feature adjusts room rates and package offers based on demand forecasts to manage occupancy, wait times, and revenue.

idea_1: This feature offers interactive lessons on radar patterns and storm structures, includes practice exercises with instant feedback, and monitors your progress over time.
idea_2: This feature shows neighborhood forecast accuracy scores based on user ratings and provides AI-generated summaries of common forecast errors in the area.
idea_3: This feature allows users to earn points by submitting verified weather reports, completing safety lessons, and answering questions. Points can be redeemed or donated.
idea_4: This feature offers spoken alerts, adjustable vibration settings, high-contrast maps, and can place a voice call if a severe weather alert is not acknowledged.
idea_5: This feature downloads radar images, forecast audio, and evacuation maps for saved locations, updates them automatically when online, and manages storage to reduce space used.
idea_6: This feature lets users select filters for precipitation, storm movement, lightning, air quality, and pollen, save their choices, and share them using a QR code or link.
idea_7: This feature lets users add and arrange optional map layers like aviation ceilings, marine swell, wildfire smoke, storm-chaser tracks, and agronomy indices.
idea_8: This feature allows users to create a shared board to plan weather-related events or routes, where participants can comment, vote on times, add backup plans, and share updates.
idea_9: This feature shows daily UV, air quality, hydration, and wind-chill information based on your location and activity, with reminders and outdoor time recommendations.
idea_10: This feature allows you to view daily temperature, rain, or snow forecasts for your locations, monitor your predictions, compare results with others, and contribute to charities based on your outcomes.

idea_1: This feature provides departure times and routes based on radar weather data and updates routes during travel to help avoid rain, hail, or lightning.
idea_2: This feature shows the next 10–30 minute period without rain and sends notifications with timing, wind, and UV information for planning activities.
idea_3: This feature uses your camera to show storm direction, lightning distance, estimated arrival time, cell tops, hail chances, and a live compass overlay in augmented reality.
idea_4: This feature displays moving pollen and spore plumes using wind and plant data, offering street-level allergy risk forecasts and visualizing pollen patterns on a map.
idea_5: This feature displays local power outage risks and estimated restoration times based on weather data and sends alerts before storms in your area.
idea_6: This feature shows the likelihood of hydroplaning, black ice, and slick roads by using radar data, road temperatures, and recent dryness to provide risk levels and speed advice.
idea_7: This feature uses taps, car wiper data, and optional windshield or camera images to enhance radar accuracy and shows a confidence meter for your location.
idea_8: This feature uses a phone photo to estimate floodwater depth by comparing nearby objects, provides safety alerts for vehicles and pedestrians, and recommends safe crossings and alternate routes.
idea_9: This feature predicts hail areas 15–90 minutes ahead, sends alerts, suggests nearby covered parking, and tracks hail cores in real time.
idea_10: This feature shows a 10–20 second time-lapse of radar images for your area, identifies important weather events, and lets you save or share the video.

idea_1: This feature allows players to perform chain flips and trampoline bounces in a physics-based environment with cliffs, cubes, and moving obstacles, earning multipliers for smooth landings and combos.
idea_2: This feature allows you to use voice commands to trigger actions like detonating explosives or freezing, and lets you record custom sounds for Buddy to repeat.
idea_3: This feature allows you to create weapons by recording sounds that determine their attack patterns, damage, and timing. You can also save and share these weapons.
idea_4: This feature lets users rent premium weapons or scenes for 24 hours, arrange their usage order, and automatically resets the room after each rental.
idea_5: This feature allows you to create words from letter tiles to trigger attacks, with longer or rare words causing stronger effects. Daily challenges offer letter skins and bonuses.
idea_6: This feature allows users to select digital coupons from a deals list and automatically use them during checkout for weapons, skins, or rooms while completing event challenges.
idea_7: This feature offers an optional 3D Glimmer pass that includes visual effect skins, gliders, weekly giveaways, and enables family library sharing to sync subscribed items across devices.
idea_8: This feature displays blast-radius and pathline overlays to measure distances, areas, and chain reactions before placing traps, with snap and magnetic surfaces for accurate positioning.
idea_9: This feature allows you to build a deck of attack cards that execute combo sequences automatically, share deck codes, compete in timed arenas, and enhance synergy perks.
idea_10: This feature opens a live Buddy photobooth where users can take photos or short videos with poses, filters, and stickers, and share them with overlays.

idea_1: This feature lets users combine two items to create a hybrid with combined properties, inherit rarity traits, unlock synergies, and share or rate blueprints using short codes.
idea_2: This feature allows you to place anchors, hinges, ropes, springs, and magnets to build physics-based devices around Buddy. You can save setups and earn combo multipliers.
idea_3: This feature allows you to place Buddy in your room using AR, throw virtual items that interact with real surfaces, and automatically mask people during recording.
idea_4: This feature allows you to convert weapons into instruments, create and record tap sequences on a beat grid, adjust timing for effects, and export short music clips.
idea_5: This feature allows you to play daily challenge rooms with different layouts and effects, compete on leaderboards, and earn badges that influence rewards.
idea_6: This feature allows you to record a combo run as a ghost, challenge others to beat your score, remix shared runs by swapping items, and view popular ghosts in a feed.
idea_7: This feature allows you to change Buddy’s personality traits, which influence his taunts, dodges, and behavior. He responds to your weapon choices and gains new reactions over time.
idea_8: This feature allows you to play short story episodes by placing or timing items to help Buddy complete heists and earn cosmetic sets and collectibles.
idea_9: This feature allows you to collect scrap from destroyed items to craft temporary gadgets, boosters, and weapon skins. Crafting can be queued offline and sped up with ads or currency. Blueprints are earned from events and ghost remixes.
idea_10: This feature releases several mini Buddies controlled by shared AI and a combo meter, enabling players to use area effects and traps to control the group and increase multipliers.

idea_1: This feature allows you to loop and slow down song sections, isolate vocals or instruments, complete challenges to earn badges, and share private recordings with others.
idea_2: This feature conducts a hearing test to adjust EQ, dynamic range, and loudness for each ear, and provides controls for vocal clarity and volume safety.
idea_3: This feature allows you to find nearby artists and fans, see local charts and events, follow local music, and create a City Sampler playlist for offline use.
idea_4: This feature lets users enter numeric codes to tip creators or unlock exclusive content, enabling access to downloads shared by artists.
idea_5: This feature automatically downloads music for offline listening when severe weather is forecasted in your saved locations and preloads playlists for cities on upcoming trips.
idea_6: This feature allows you to swipe through 10-second music clips to create a mixtape and connect with nearby users for chatting or playlist collaboration.
idea_7: This feature verifies artists using audio fingerprinting and linked social accounts, reviews commenters manually, and changes account visibility according to verification outcomes.
idea_8: This feature lets you control playback by clapping or whistling to play, pause, skip, or find tracks when the player or Car Mode is open.
idea_9: This feature provides a car mode with large buttons, clean-lyrics playlists, download-only playback, session timers, and locked profiles for parental control during rides.
idea_10: This feature allows users to post 15-second voice or video reactions tied to specific timestamps and filter reactions by helpfulness or mood. Creators can compile reactions into stories and highlight reels.

idea_1: This feature updates your offline music library overnight when connected to Wi-Fi and charging, replacing old downloads with new ones based on your listening habits while keeping pinned tracks.
idea_2: This feature allows you to choose your commute time or data limit and then downloads a set of tracks based on your selected genre or mood.
idea_3: This feature stores one high-quality file per song and generates lower-quality versions on the device, allowing users to select which tracks retain full quality.
idea_4: This feature scans your offline music library to sync beats, crossfade songs, and trim intros or outros for continuous playback without needing an internet connection.
idea_5: This feature allows nearby users to add songs to a shared playlist during a session, and the host downloads the final playlist for offline use via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct.
idea_6: This feature identifies nearby music using audio fingerprinting and lets you save available songs offline on Audiomack with one tap, without uploading raw audio.
idea_7: This feature downloads synchronized lyrics for offline use and karaoke, lets users edit lyrics with artist approval, and saves sing-along recordings as shareable clips.
idea_8: This feature downloads short clips of new songs based on your preferences for offline listening and automatically downloads full tracks when you mark them as favorites while online.
idea_9: This feature compresses songs you haven’t played recently to save storage space and restores them to full quality when you play them, according to your settings.
idea_10: This feature lets users tip or use boost credits to prioritize a track’s offline downloads in their city, influencing local discovery and download recommendations.

idea_1: This feature allows users to record narrated diary entries with captions and voice effects, attach voice notes to items, and share approved story postcards.
idea_2: This feature allows players to jump, flip, and pose on a trampoline and rooftop park, earn medals, unlock decorations and photo poses, and complete obstacle courses.
idea_3: This feature allows users to find digital coupons in Malibu and use them at shops, cafés, or markets, including daily tasks and simple math activities for budgeting.
idea_4: This feature creates a private Family Album that organizes screenshots, clips, and milestones into stories. Parents can approve shared content and join co-play sessions.
idea_5: This feature allows users to complete tasks such as sweeping, brushing pets, wiping mirrors, and icing cupcakes, with sounds and vibrations, unlocking new décor themes afterward.
idea_6: This feature allows users to collect songs, make playlists for rooms, change sound settings, record introductions, add sound effects, and sync music with mini-games.
idea_7: This feature allows players to position characters and pets with gadgets to defend rooms from waves of glitter gremlins, using upgrades such as outfits and kindness boosts.
idea_8: This feature allows users to earn Dream Tokens by completing approved tasks, set savings goals, enter family gift codes, and choose extra tasks for more rewards.
idea_9: This feature lets players run a supermarket by stocking shelves, scanning items, arranging displays, helping customers with recipes, and completing budgeting tasks to earn rewards.
idea_10: This feature includes hidden switches, codes, and mini-puzzles that unlock new rooms, rooftop gardens, and portals, each offering a short story quest with weekly updates.

idea_1: This feature lets users change the house layout by moving walls, resizing rooms, adding floors, and placing stairs or elevators with automatic path updates for characters.
idea_2: This feature lets up to four players join live Sleepover Parties to play cooperative mini-games such as cooking, dancing, and taking photos. Parents can manage time limits, approvals, and chat settings.
idea_3: This feature uses AR to place Dreamhouse furniture in your surroundings, allows you to take photos, and lets you unlock items by finding certain shapes and colors nearby.
idea_4: This feature lets users design fabric patterns by drawing or adding stickers, then use these designs on clothes and accessories for a runway challenge with lighting and scores.
idea_5: This feature allows users to train pets on an agility course with swipe and rhythm controls, earn badges, unlock pet items, and organize pet shows.
idea_6: This feature changes the weather and seasons, allowing activities such as sledding, kite flying, surfing, and movie nights. Players complete tasks to earn décor items.
idea_7: This feature allows players to run small businesses in the Dreamhouse, make products, manage orders, and deliver items using a scooter game.
idea_8: This feature allows users to pose characters, change camera angles, add speech bubbles, record voice with captions, and share their creations in a moderated gallery.
idea_9: This feature suggests décor sets and color palettes based on your room and items, lets you apply them with one tap, and adjust the style using a slider.
idea_10: This feature allows you to design puzzles by placing clues, locks, and switches in rooms. You can share your puzzles and try puzzles created by others.

idea_1: This feature offers AI-based practice drills and bots that adjust to your friends’ playstyles, helping you improve game skills and share practice playlists.
idea_2: This feature lets users play mini games on console and the Xbox mobile app while games download, unlocking dashboard themes and profile items.
idea_3: This feature allows users to submit star ratings or 15-second voice notes after playing, summarizes community feedback for each update, and shows reviews from experienced players.
idea_4: This feature saves unlocked game soundtracks to playlists accessible on multiple devices, allows offline listening with Game Pass Ultimate, adjusts music during voice chat, and displays lyrics when available.
idea_5: This feature offers audio stories and mini-games based on game worlds for kids to use during rides, with offline access, easy controls, voice commands, and a caregiver lock.
idea_6: This feature allows users to stream or view removed demos, trailers, and limited-time game versions, while adjusting controller settings and compatibility when available.
idea_7: This feature recommends games based on weather and travel, changes themes at night, preloads cloud games for trips, and schedules updates during good network times.
idea_8: This feature detects local outages and storm alerts to pause downloads, save progress, delay updates, reroute cloud connections, and provide a stable patch option for tournaments.
idea_9: This feature automatically applies coupons, combines Microsoft Rewards points, compares prices from different stores at checkout, and provides referral links that offer benefits to both users.
idea_10: This feature allows users to find nearby co-op partners or locations within a chosen distance, with options for verification, privacy settings, group filters, and voice introductions.

idea_1: This feature allows you to begin playing a game from a chosen moment in a capture or stream by loading a cloud snapshot or demo if the game is not owned.
idea_2: This feature allows the Xbox mobile app to show maps, inventory, chat, and a ping wheel separately while syncing macros and loadouts with the console.
idea_3: This feature saves multiple paused game states to the cloud, enabling you to switch between console, PC, and mobile and continue playing from the same point.
idea_4: This feature reviews your gameplay clips and controller data to find areas to improve, offers short practice drills with visual and vibration signals, and tracks your progress.
idea_5: This feature starts 15-minute game sessions with preset settings, automatically matches players with teammates, and saves a summary clip and loot information after the session ends.
idea_6: This feature allows users to create and share playlists with levels, modes, or user-created maps from different games, automatically playing each part and tracking friends’ times and votes.
idea_7: This feature schedules updates during low-use times, reduces bandwidth with local caching, displays carbon savings, and offers badges and store rewards for regular use.
idea_8: This feature turns key game sounds into vibrations on the controller and phone, shows optional icons, and lets players share, rate, and customize profiles.
idea_9: This feature displays network latency, jitter, and packet loss, selects the optimal Xbox server or route, applies home QoS on compatible routers, and notifies ISP problems.
idea_10: This feature updates games, manages age filters and multiplayer settings, shares join links, ends sessions, and sends progress and screen-time reports to parents.

idea_1: This feature allows you to bounce and fling slime over trampolines and obstacles to perform tricks. You receive ingredients and rare add-ins based on your results.
idea_2: This feature records a short voice note and changes its pitch, speed, and emotion into a color palette, texture, and bubble pattern that you can save and edit.
idea_3: This feature stores changing discounts on pigments, glitters, and molds, applies them automatically at the craft counter, and lets players complete mini challenges to earn bonuses or unlock recipe bundles.
idea_4: This feature allows you to record slime sounds with noise reduction and layering, assign them to poke gestures, and capture sounds using a record widget synced to the app.
idea_5: This feature allows you to borrow premium community slimes for 24 hours to play with, record, and view their recipes, then returns them cleaned and saves a remix blueprint.
idea_6: This feature offers a step-by-step checklist for mixing, color theory, and add-ins, displays upcoming tools, and includes an optional parent mode with goals and breaks.
idea_7: This feature allows you to use slime as a pressure- and stretch-sensitive instrument with note pads and effects, record short loops, and share them with visual effects.
idea_8: This feature uses your camera to measure a surface or container, calculates ingredient amounts, and displays a scaled AR slime puddle that you can interact with.
idea_9: This feature allows you to design logos and mascots for jars using templates, neon outlines, and slime effects, then save the designs as PNG files.
idea_10: This feature lets up to five family members edit slimes and share ingredients. Subscribers get seasonal items and can join special events.

idea_1: This feature lets users adjust slime resistance and vibration by moving their fingers. It creates a custom squish profile for consistent feel across devices.
idea_2: This feature allows users to pour and stretch slime on real-world surfaces using AR, record short videos, sample colors from the camera, and change slime colors with realistic effects.
idea_3: This feature allows you to enter a prompt to create a slime with a recipe, colors, and add-ins. It also shows variations and explains each ingredient’s role.
idea_4: This feature allows you to capture photos of materials to create colors, patterns, and shapes for slime, and record sounds to trigger slime reactions.
idea_5: This feature allows users to join shared rooms to interact with the same slime at the same time, using synchronized physics and spatial audio, and includes mini-games.
idea_6: This feature allows players to adjust temperature, activator levels, and humidity to modify slime properties and includes challenges to identify and correct overactivated or underactivated slime.
idea_7: This feature turns hand movements into sounds: kneading adjusts bass, stretching changes pitch, and popping creates percussion. Users can save, export, and share sound settings.
idea_8: This feature adds puzzle levels where players use slime to move marbles, build bridges, or mix colors. Completing puzzles gives ingredients, stickers, and frames.
idea_9: This feature offers guided ASMR sessions with breathing rings that expand and contract slime, a sleep timer, high-contrast visuals, larger controls, and an eyes-closed haptic and audio mode.
idea_10: This feature lets users share recipes, label art, and sound packs with remix permissions and attribution, supports tipping, challenge playlists, and weekly content highlights.

idea_1: This feature offers video and AR lessons with pre-filled shopping carts, tracks progress through practice activities, provides savings, and lets friends join and compare results.
idea_2: This feature lets you invite others to create a shared shopping cart, chat, vote on items, earn referral rewards, and see friends’ frequently bought products.
idea_3: This feature allows users to customize ready-to-eat meals and kits, see current prices, save favorites, use bundle deals, and schedule contactless pickup or delivery.
idea_4: This feature allows users to complete tasks such as scanning receipts, answering daily quizzes, or playing games to earn points for discounts or donations.
idea_5: This feature offers children games, music, and educational activities without ads during shopping. Parents can set time limits, and children earn coupons or stickers for participating.
idea_6: This feature ranks products by diet, size, sustainability, and price-per-use, displays a match score, and provides verified-brand badges along with community questions and answers.
idea_7: This feature allows you to create and use shopping lists offline, view store maps, product images, and prices, and scan barcodes to add items for later checkout.
idea_8: This feature displays items such as allergy medicine, rain gear, and snacks based on weather and travel plans. It shows stock availability, pickup times, and offers auto-restock alerts.
idea_9: This feature streams announcements to earbuds, displays captions and transcripts, adds vibration alerts, and offers large-type and high-contrast display options for hearing and vision support.
idea_10: This feature uses the camera to show labels on shelves that hide items not matching your selected criteria, like price or dietary preferences, and allows saving and sharing filters.

idea_1: This feature organizes your purchased items from e-receipts, monitors quantities and expiration dates, sends reminders before items run out or expire, and enables easy reordering.
idea_2: This feature guides you through the store using your shopping list, current aisle traffic, and shelf locations, with optional augmented reality and accessibility settings.
idea_3: This feature learns your brand, diet, and price preferences to choose approved substitutions for grocery orders and shows any credits or refunds right away.
idea_4: This feature monitors price changes on purchased items in chosen categories and automatically adds Walmart Cash for any price drops within a specified time frame.
idea_5: This feature lets you return items by handing them to your next delivery driver or scheduling a pickup without a box. It uses one QR code for multiple returns and provides instant provisional credit.
idea_6: This feature detects your arrival using license plate recognition and geofencing, assigns a parking spot, notifies staff, and confirms your curbside pickup order automatically.
idea_7: This feature lets multiple users share a budget, manage shopping lists and subscriptions together, and assign or split purchases among household members during or after checkout.
idea_8: This feature allows you to take a photo of a part or battery to identify its details, find matching products available in the store, view their locations, and access simple guides.
idea_9: This feature generates weekly meal plans using your pantry items, dietary preferences, and store deals, then adds needed ingredients to your cart to reduce cost per serving.
idea_10: This feature allows you to track specific items at certain stores, view estimated arrival times, reserve items for pickup, and receive notifications when items are nearby.

idea_1: This feature lets users book available last-minute FastTrack slots, choose add-ons such as family assist or carry-on pre-check, and make payments directly in the app.
idea_2: This feature generates scannable color patterns for trays and bag tags, enabling cameras and agents to link items to individuals without using personal information.
idea_3: This feature shows packing guides in your suitcase, simulates movement, detects items that might cause extra screening, and suggests changes to reduce X-ray clutter.
idea_4: This feature displays 3D X-ray images of laptops, chargers, and liquids from different angles and offers packing suggestions based on your bag and items.
idea_5: This feature offers a 30-second quiz about allowed items and common issues on your route. Completing it before arrival unlocks notifications and water coupons.
idea_6: This feature lets users enroll in a program that verifies identity, provides ongoing training, reduces security procedures, applies tiered discounts, and automatically ends privileges.
idea_7: This feature allows users to select a lane type—quiet, family, mobility, or tech-focused—and guides them to the corresponding security checkpoint. Family mode provides an animated kids guide without tracking behavior.
idea_8: This feature allows you to approve a one-time digital key from your phone to unlock flagged bags and provides live status updates, photos, and a chain-of-custody log.
idea_9: This feature updates security rules for airports, airlines, and destinations, including liquid limits and banned items, and allows offline access to guidance when roaming is off.
idea_10: This feature shows live queue times, your assigned lane, and a timed checklist on your watch, with vibrations and easy access to IDs and boarding passes.

idea_1: This feature uses the phone camera to identify items such as belts, liquids, and laptops that need to be removed before security, offering instructions in several languages with accessibility options.
idea_2: This feature generates a time-stamped QR code and gives directions to a security lane based on boarding time and group size, helping manage traffic flow.
idea_3: This feature tracks each bin’s location, notifies when it leaves the X-ray area, and directs users to the appropriate reclaim area to help manage crowd movement.
idea_4: This feature lets users deposit legal but restricted items, choose mail-back or pickup, get a digital receipt, and track custody and tampering through the app.
idea_5: This feature places you in the secondary screening queue, displays nearby waiting areas, and sends a vibration alert when it is your turn.
idea_6: This feature lets passengers see how their biometric data is used, decide to participate at each checkpoint, request data deletion, and switch to non-biometric options immediately.
idea_7: This feature shows CT/X-ray images with AI highlights and checklists on a secure tablet to assist inspections, handoffs, and reviews without storing passenger personal information.
idea_8: This feature takes a photo of your open tray and bag arrangement before screening and offers a checklist to help you restore items and confirm you have your keys, wallet, and devices.
idea_9: This feature offers sensory-friendly signals, clear timers, live translation, easy assistance requests, pre-booked quiet lane access, and discreet staff notifications to coordinate support.
idea_10: This feature shows staff availability and demand forecasts on mobile devices, enables quick changes to lane modes, and updates signs and passenger notifications instantly.

idea_1: This feature offers step-by-step instructions for cooking and laundry using smart oven signals and camera input, monitors progress, and recommends brief practice activities.
idea_2: This feature detects sounds such as doorbells, alarms, and baby cries, then sends alerts via vibration, captions, or amplified audio to your phone, TV, or LG earbuds.
idea_3: This feature allows users to share and access routines called playbooks, which friends can import easily, and displays which playbooks trusted contacts use each week.
idea_4: This feature allows users to combine appliance functions into custom cycles, save them as one-tap buttons, and let household members view and change the settings.
idea_5: This feature tracks your progress in energy and care challenges, awards points based on your activity, and allows you to redeem or donate those points.
idea_6: This feature allows you to rate a setting after each use and uses the feedback to adjust recommended cycles and presets based on your preferences.
idea_7: This feature evaluates your space, utilities, habits, and devices to recommend compatible LG products and accessories, and uses AR to verify clearances and installation needs.
idea_8: This feature uses weather and air quality information to automatically adjust home devices like dryers, air conditioners, and purifiers, and sets up the home for trips based on the destination.
idea_9: This feature stores manuals, receipts, and guides, extracts text automatically, monitors warranty periods, and creates service tickets using photos of receipts or labels.
idea_10: This feature allows users to browse, install, and share automation packs, sound themes, lighting scenes, and cleaning patterns for appliances with a single click.

idea_1: This feature schedules the washer, dryer, dishwasher, and HVAC to finish by a set time, adjusting operations based on energy costs, carbon levels, quiet hours, and circuit limits.
idea_2: This feature uses a camera and AI to monitor fridge items, estimate their freshness, suggest recipes, identify recalls and allergies, and create a shared shopping list automatically.
idea_3: This feature uses your phone to display 3D guides for repair and maintenance, checks power and water status, identifies parts, orders replacements, and allows remote support with live views.
idea_4: This feature provides temporary guest access to appliances with restricted controls, automatic expiration, activity monitoring, and options to set safety locks and usage limits for each appliance.
idea_5: This feature connects the oven, microwave, cooktop, hood, and air fryer to adjust cooking times using food probes and cameras, so dishes finish cooking simultaneously.
idea_6: This feature scans laundry labels to identify garment information, creates washing cycles, tracks wear and wash history, alerts about risks, and recommends appropriate load combinations.
idea_7: This feature monitors outdoor air quality and indoor sensors to adjust HVAC, purifiers, dehumidifiers, and window alerts before arrival and during nighttime.
idea_8: This feature prepares appliances before severe weather by adjusting settings, reducing power use during outages, and displaying safe storage times for food and water.
idea_9: This feature creates a list of appliance tasks with assignments and reminders, and syncs alerts with family calendars to show tasks when members are available.
idea_10: This feature creates personalized automations using on-device learning, keeps data local without sending images or audio to the cloud, allows one-tap data deletion, and shows audit trails.

idea_1: This feature records jumps, flips, and obstacle streaks in games, applies multipliers for long chains, and enables racing against local ghost replays without needing internet.
idea_2: This feature saves the last 20 seconds of gameplay as a video or GIF in your gallery, lets you take photos with stats and stickers, and provides quick access buttons.
idea_3: This feature allows you to record sounds such as beats, melodies, or guitar and automatically replaces in-game sound effects with your recordings without requiring internet access.
idea_4: This feature allows you to press and hold a button to record voice notes after a game, converts them into text notes, and plays recorded messages before challenges.
idea_5: This feature organizes offline games into a playlist based on travel time, estimates battery and playtime, preloads games, and lets you reserve games for certain stops.
idea_6: This feature allows you to create an avatar that appears in mini-games, collect parts to upgrade a home, unlock decorations and mini-quests, and design a personal crest.
idea_7: This feature offers short interactive game previews, enables creating sequences of mini-games for continuous play, and recommends games according to the player's skill level.
idea_8: This feature tracks storage and battery usage for game packs, estimates playtime per battery percent, and lets users remove least-played packs with one tap without losing progress.
idea_9: This Feature offers snap-to guides, haptic adjustments, and calibration for some games, includes a sandbox for creating and sharing placement puzzles with QR codes, and provides daily steady-hand challenges.
idea_10: This feature allows users to earn tokens to unlock cosmetic items, temporarily remove ads, join offline giveaways, view trial information in a pass center, and share content offline within families.

idea_1: This feature allows you to earn stamps that unlock themes, avatars, and boosts for more than 100 offline games, with progress transferable between devices via QR code.
idea_2: This feature lets players connect and play together using Bluetooth, Wi-Fi Direct, or on the same device with hot-seat or split-screen, without needing internet.
idea_3: This feature lets users share levels, puzzle seeds, or custom challenges using short codes, QR codes, or ultrasonic signals to recreate the same scenario on another device.
idea_4: This feature compresses games that are played less often to save space, keeps small files for quick reinstall, and prepares game data during charging for faster offline access.
idea_5: This feature lets users change game settings such as frame rate and effects, enable battery saver mode when power is low, and monitor device temperature while playing.
idea_6: This feature allows users to apply accessibility settings such as color-blind palettes, dyslexia-friendly fonts, subtitles, audio cues, haptics, and one-hand controls to all games from a single panel.
idea_7: This feature allows you to play short sections of games without installation and lets you download the full game later while saving your progress.
idea_8: This feature suggests games based on playtime, skill level, and battery status without internet. It also adjusts difficulty and changes game types accordingly.
idea_9: This feature allows users to create a travel pack by choosing trip length and storage limits, providing offline games designed for low battery use, with an optional calm pack.
idea_10: This feature allows users to create pass-and-play playlists with timers, lives, and scoring for several games, and share results using QR codes or short codes without internet access.

idea_1: This feature allows you to build a safehouse by placing themed rooms with collected items. Matching sets give stealth bonuses, and an auction board offers rotating rare items.
idea_2: This feature lets players equip various disguises and accessories that affect how suspicion is noticed and unlock new actions based on the situation.
idea_3: This feature allows players to select from a set of randomly generated heists with adjustable settings and random equipment. Content is earned, with optional offline boosters and downloads.
idea_4: This feature lets players customize outfit skins with layers, dyes, weapon wraps, and finishers, and unlock different styles using emotes for replays and PvP.
idea_5: This feature allows players to unlock doors and vaults by solving timed word-and-symbol puzzles with limited attempts, using environmental clues. Higher levels include scrambled alphabets or maze circuits.
idea_6: This feature offers daily exercises that help improve memory, route planning, and sound detection, which affect enemy awareness and aiming stability during missions.
idea_7: This feature allows you to build compounds with tiles, guards, traps, and patrol routes, share them for others to infiltrate, and watch replays of their attempts.
idea_8: This feature lets users create and share missions using a tile-based editor with lighting and gadget options, along with tools for remixing and viewing leaderboards.
idea_9: This feature allows players to control remote drones for scouting, distracting enemies, unlocking doors, using camera views and commands, performing physics-based movements, and maintaining the devices.
idea_10: This feature provides an Assassin’s Elite membership that includes an in-game lounge, exclusive contracts, VIP badge, extra stash slots, cosmetic items, privacy settings, and optional region-themed events.

idea_1: This feature allows players to control lighting by turning off power, using blackout shuriken, or placing lanterns. A shadow meter displays concealment and adjusts guard vision areas.
idea_2: This feature lets you take uniforms and follow set paths to get through checkpoints while a suspicion meter rises if you act differently near some patrols.
idea_3: This feature allows users to create missions by arranging rooms, paths, and traps with drag-and-drop, share mission codes, and view community ratings and rewards.
idea_4: This feature offers daily heists with the same layouts, gadget limits, and modifiers for all players. It also shows global leaderboards for various completion rankings.
idea_5: This feature allows you to create a list of elite guards who learn your tactics, change their strategies, and give rewards when defeated.
idea_6: This feature changes detection from instant failure to an escape phase that opens new paths. It also includes optional tasks to remove evidence and keep your rank.
idea_7: This feature lets players spend intel before missions to purchase bribes, keycards, or camera hacks, which may cause additional patrols and higher rewards.
idea_8: This feature lets players combine two gadgets into a new tool. Players unlock blueprints for these combinations by completing challenges.
idea_9: This feature allows you to record your route and share it with a friend, who can follow it using limited signals. Both players receive bonuses if they remain undetected.
idea_10: This feature lets environmental objects cause chain reactions, like sprinklers turning off lasers or falling items causing damage, and gives score multipliers for non-lethal or staged takedowns.

idea_1: This feature offers practice conversations and date scenarios, giving feedback on tone, timing, and openers, along with weekly exercises to help improve communication skills.
idea_2: This feature allows friends to privately review your profile and add 10-second video vouches that show as tap-to-play badges. Their invite links offer short premium trials and temporary match boosts.
idea_3: This feature shows hourly local weather for both users, suggests indoor or outdoor activities, prompts rescheduling for bad weather, and enables booking or ordering at partner locations.
idea_4: This feature shows live captions for voice notes and video calls, reduces background noise, increases speaker volume, and saves searchable transcripts of voice messages.
idea_5: This feature offers icebreakers like sound stickers, emoji karaoke, and mini-games to support conversations, and lets users create and save a shared playlist for offline use.
idea_6: This feature links apps like Spotify, Goodreads, and Strava to display audio, images, and statistics on profile cards in a clear and organized way.
idea_7: This feature lets users share public date plans, receive comments and RSVPs from matches, show popular ideas by location, and provide feedback on venues.
idea_8: This feature lets users make short video introductions with captions and prompts, and allows matches to watch video clips together during their chat.
idea_9: This feature lets you create filters that turn on by time or location, share them with QR codes, and browse profiles offline with later syncing.
idea_10: This feature gives users a temporary phone number for calls and texts that can be disabled at any time, and allows saving and exporting chat history and milestones.

idea_1: This feature allows matched users to choose how often they message, select topics to avoid, and set preferences for video or phone calls, with reminders and consent prompts in the chat.
idea_2: This feature provides three personalized first message options for women, lets them adjust the tone, and allows scheduling the message to be sent at a chosen time.
idea_3: This feature suggests a few shared times and nearby locations based on mutual interests and budget, allows easy confirmation, and includes simple tasks to support first-date comfort.
idea_4: This feature lets users share live check-ins, routes, and a safe word with a trusted contact, send alerts if the safe word is used, and check in at venues using NFC without sharing exact locations.
idea_5: This feature lets users send short messages to end conversations, provides a reminder before chats expire, and allows both users to pause the conversation temporarily.
idea_6: This feature allows two matched users to invite one friend each to a temporary four-person chat, suggests places to meet, and offers options for splitting the bill.
idea_7: This feature displays reasons for each match based on shared routines, pace, and values, and lets users adjust settings to prioritize these factors in future matches.
idea_8: This feature lets users create temporary status messages that last 24 to 72 hours and can be used to adjust filters and start conversations.
idea_9: This feature lets two users record a 20-second audio introduction together with captions and noise reduction, available only if both users agree to participate.
idea_10: This feature detects negative or harsh language in chats, offers softer alternative phrases, and can translate messages while maintaining the original tone.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons and exercises to help users recognize aircraft types, callsigns, approach patterns, and weather effects, while tracking their progress through challenges.
idea_2: This feature lets multiple users track the same flight at the same time with synchronized timelines, chat, reactions, shared reminders, and co-hosting for group tracking.
idea_3: This feature gives audio and vibration notifications for flight events and includes a small control banner that works without opening the map.
idea_4: This feature combines flight data with user-submitted information to provide verified summaries about delays, spotting times, and runway usage for routes, airlines, and airports.
idea_5: This feature allows you to set alerts based on conditions such as aircraft type, altitude, route, speed, and distance, and choose how to receive and share notifications.
idea_6: This feature lets users download airport diagrams, aircraft models, and flight replays for selected areas or flights to view and search them offline.
idea_7: This feature gives points for spotting new aircraft types, special liveries, rare flights, or hosting an ADS-B receiver. Points can be exchanged for rewards or donations.
idea_8: This feature shows confirmed check-ins at popular viewing spots and lets users create temporary groups for large flight arrivals, with distance limits and identity verification options.
idea_9: This feature lets users enter flight or tail numbers by scanning, speaking, or typing partial information, and offers autocomplete to set alerts and add flights to watchlists.
idea_10: This feature predicts severe weather for saved flights and provides notifications with a timeline, weather overlay, suggested watch times, and information on runway impacts.

idea_1: This feature shows estimated times for pushback, takeoff, and gate arrival by analyzing runway conditions, surface traffic, and past taxi times, and notifies about delays.
idea_2: This feature shows real-time turbulence levels and altitude suggestions based on EDR nowcasts, pilot reports, and ride reports along the planned flight route.
idea_3: This feature links your incoming flight to your next booking or watchlist, calculates transfer time and gate changes, and provides alerts about connection status and alternate flights.
idea_4: This feature offers indoor navigation at major airports, directing users to gates, lounges, or baggage claims, and shows live or crowd-sourced security wait and travel times.
idea_5: This feature shows users optimal times and locations to view specific aircraft by analyzing runway use, schedules, sun position, and weather, with an AR overlay indicating viewing directions.
idea_6: This feature sends alerts about special liveries, retro jets, test flights, or rare aircraft near selected airports based on user photos and recent sightings.
idea_7: This feature forecasts airport and route disruptions like cancellations and diversions 6–24 hours in advance using weather, traffic data, and historical patterns, showing affected flights.
idea_8: This feature shows flight-related NOTAM, METAR, and ATIS information in plain language, providing important updates that affect flights with near real-time data.
idea_9: This feature uses phone accelerometers in airplane mode to collect anonymous ride-quality data, which helps improve turbulence maps and seatbelt-on predictions for less-reported routes.
idea_10: This feature displays where the tracked flight may produce contrails and estimates CO2 emissions per passenger for the current route and alternative routes or altitudes.

idea_1: This feature checks quiz drafts for clarity, difficulty, and bias, offers suggestions to improve questions and visuals, and provides practice exercises with a confidence score.
idea_2: This feature offers short, single-player quiz rounds on selected topics or trends, where you can earn experience points and unlock cosmetic items between sessions.
idea_3: This feature allows players to rate questions on clarity, fairness, and fun, add comments, suggest edits, and gives creators a summary of feedback on question issues.
idea_4: This feature reads questions and answers aloud, lets users respond using large buttons or voice, and provides downloadable playlists for offline access.
idea_5: This feature displays a live heatmap of player performance and can suggest pauses, hints, or changes to timers and points for upcoming questions.
idea_6: This feature calculates study time, generates a weekly quiz schedule, sends test reminders, and updates the plan according to progress after each session.
idea_7: This feature lets hosts download kahoots with media for offline use and provides tools to trim, loop, and adjust audio clips within the app.
idea_8: This feature allows users to search quizzes with filters such as age, duration, language, and rating, save search settings, share links, and create or shuffle quiz playlists.
idea_9: This feature displays nearby public quiz sessions, shows local leaderboards, allows inviting friends, includes safety settings, and lets hosts give rewards based on participation and results.
idea_10: This feature allows teams to play several sessions against an AI boss that changes over time. Correct answers strengthen defenses, while mistakes make the boss stronger.

idea_1: This feature changes questions for each player during the game based on their accuracy and speed, letting hosts set goals and offer different challenges or help.
idea_2: This feature allows players to select a wager before answering questions. Points gained or lost depend on the wager amount and whether the answer is correct.
idea_3: This feature lets teams collaborate in real-time to create ranked lists, label diagrams, or build multi-step answers, awarding partial credit for correct parts.
idea_4: This feature identifies common student errors during quizzes and offers follow-up questions or explanations to help teachers address mistakes and manage the game pace.
idea_5: This feature allows users to create scavenger-hunt questions where players use their camera to find and capture real-world items, which the app then verifies.
idea_6: This feature lets users record spoken answers, which the app then evaluates by scoring pronunciation, important words, and fluency for different types of assessments.
idea_7: This feature lets users add interactive simulations to questions, save chosen settings, and ask about the outcomes to assess understanding.
idea_8: This feature generates a brief practice session after a game, using questions each player answered incorrectly, with different formats and timed repetition to aid learning.
idea_9: This feature lets each player choose a language and see questions, answers, and explanations translated instantly during the game.
idea_10: This feature provides seasonal leagues and ELO-style topic ratings with class, school, and district brackets, along with leaderboards that show improvement streaks and mastery badges.

idea_1: This feature lets players perform quick movement combos with marches to build Momentum, which grants short buffs. Moving around terrain obstacles increases Momentum in open-field battles.
idea_2: This feature lets leaders record 15–60 second voice notes tied to rallies, markers, or tiles, which are transcribed, translated, played on the map, and saved for later use.
idea_3: This feature records battles and rallies as short replays, marks key moments, allows adding voice-over, and lets users share them in alliance chat or the kingdom Episodes feed.
idea_4: This feature lets alliances reserve neutral caravan transports from regional depots to move resources or siege gear, showing availability and allowing route selection and payment.
idea_5: This feature simulates commander talents, relics, and gear to estimate performance and resource requirements, and allows 24-hour trial use of unowned commanders without affecting rewards or costs.
idea_6: This feature enables placing cities and structures using grid alignment and overlays, supports alliance blueprint placement, measures distances and areas, calculates march times and ranges, and exports plans as pins.
idea_7: This feature allows leaders to create digital coupons from alliance achievements for members to use automatically, while regional merchants provide limited-time deals unlocked by group objectives.
idea_8: This feature lets alliances create layered emblems, customize governor avatars and city skins with decals and gradients, view them in 3D, and participate in seasonal design contests.
idea_9: This feature allows players to collect tactical cards, create a pre-battle deck with cooldowns and counters, level up cards through use, and manage deck size and energy limits in battles.
idea_10: This feature lets players connect two commanders through quests to unlock shared abilities, join events for temporary alliance buffs, and earn rewards by completing joint trials.

idea_1: This feature lets leaders create multi-step plans with map drawings, schedule rally waves, send alerts, assign roles, provide checklists, and share post-battle participation reports.
idea_2: This feature lets alliances create temporary supply depots and send escorted convoys that boost troop stamina and march speed nearby. Enemies can intercept convoys to reduce supplies and cause local debuffs.
idea_3: This feature adds changing weather and seasons that impact visibility, movement speed, and stamina. Players can build an observatory to get weather forecasts and small advantages.
idea_4: This feature lets players send spies into enemy alliances to collect information about rally plans, troop positions, and timers, with a chance of being detected.
idea_5: This feature offers a temporary commander draft mode with random skills, limited combinations, and fixed gear, enabling players to create commanders usable only during the event.
idea_6: This feature lets users view and share battle replays showing unit movements, attack focus, and heatmaps on a timeline, with options to add notes, drawings, and voice comments.
idea_7: This feature links experienced players with new players for guided quests and cooperative tasks, enabling both to complete activities and earn rewards together.
idea_8: This feature lets leaders specify troop types, commander combinations, and gear needed for rallies, checks participants automatically, suggests replacements, and confirms readiness before starting.
idea_9: This feature lets players build temporary field structures such as palisades, trenches, and signal towers that offer small benefits, provide visibility, and disappear after a limited time.
idea_10: This feature enables real-time voice chat connected to the map with push-to-talk, auto-translated captions, quick commands linked to pings, and records audio with the battle timeline.

app_name: Simple Radio: Live AM FM Radio
idea_1: This feature identifies radio stations along your route, preloads local content and weather updates, switches to stronger signals while driving, and saves stations for offline listening.
idea_2: This feature detects your location for weather and civil alerts, automatically plays the nearest emergency broadcast, and allows background listening with a radar view.
idea_3: This feature lets you pause, rewind, and replay up to 60 minutes of live radio using a temporary buffer stored on your device.
idea_4: This feature offers a child-safe area with selected stations, large controls, voice play/pause, a car-ride timer, and options to pin favorites and block stations.
idea_5: This feature improves audio by enhancing speech, reducing noise, balancing loudness and stereo sound, and includes hearing calibration and a volume limiter to control sudden spikes.
idea_6: This feature recognizes songs on live radio, saves them to your library, connects to music services for full tracks and lyrics, sends alerts for chosen artists or shows, and offers alternative streams if access is restricted.
idea_7: This feature offers one-tap buttons to call, text, or email radio stations, supports tipping and donations, formats phone numbers, and protects user privacy.
idea_8: This feature lets users search radio stations by mood, tempo, talk-to-music ratio, language, ad density, live or recorded status, and apply saved filters with verified badges.
idea_9: This feature allows users to listen to live radio together, chat temporarily with others, send emoji reactions, and access location-based public rooms with short, time-limited reviews.
idea_10: This feature identifies live sports broadcasts and displays scores, drive charts, and win probabilities, while providing access to team stations and optional pick’em games.

app_name: Simple Radio: Live AM FM Radio
idea_1: This feature allows listeners to rewind up to 60 minutes, skip back 15 seconds, return to live broadcast with one tap, and start a show from the beginning if tuning in late.
idea_2: This feature displays live transcripts of talk radio, enables tap-to-translate in various languages, highlights speaker changes, and allows searching and jumping to specific lines.
idea_3: This feature uses AI to split talk shows into sections based on topics, callers, and guests, and provides 30-second summaries for each section to assist navigation.
idea_4: This feature preloads radio stations over Wi-Fi, plays them without an internet connection, and resumes live playback by speeding up to catch up with the current broadcast.
idea_5: This feature allows you to swipe through short 8–12 second clips from live stations, create a playlist of stations, and smoothly transition between them.
idea_6: This feature identifies when the same song is playing on different stations and automatically switches between them with a crossfade when the current station changes to talk or news. A slider controls the switching frequency.
idea_7: This feature allows you to search live radio by topic, find stations discussing it, jump to the current segment, and receive notifications for selected keywords.
idea_8: This feature allows you to choose Music-Only or Talk-Only modes and automatically switches to preset stations when the current station changes formats, with adjustable tolerance for brief segments.
idea_9: This feature shows a radio guide with showtimes, hosts, and topics, lets users set reminders, and provides catch-up highlights for missed shows when available.
idea_10: This feature automatically switches to local emergency stations during severe weather or alerts, shows live transcripts and map overlays, and offers a battery-saving audio mode with optional quiet-hours override.

idea_1: This feature adds special tiles that let paths jump over blockers or wrap around edges, and includes cells that affect combo multipliers with varying risk and reward.
idea_2: This feature automatically saves replays of your last 100 moves with optional voice notes. Shared replays show previous moves as ghosts, and a path calculator displays move details frame by frame.
idea_3: This feature adds daily coupon tiles that offer discounts or cash-back on boosters. A Deals screen allows users to select limited-time offers applied automatically at checkout.
idea_4: This Feature syncs tile appearances to music beats, gives combo rewards for matching tiles on beat, and supports importing songs or using preset tracks for challenges.
idea_5: This feature provides optional 3D glass visuals with smooth transitions and highlights the next spawn direction. Subscribers get monthly cosmetics and an item revealing two spawns per column.
idea_6: This Feature evaluates your skill with a short puzzle, guides you to appropriate game modes, explains rules and odds, and handles booster purchases with trial reminders.
idea_7: This Feature lets you use a premium power by spending tickets and set two boosts to be available at the beginning of your next game.
idea_8: This feature offers optional session timers, move limits, rest reminders, simplified visuals without ads, and short motion exercises between levels to support finger control.
idea_9: This feature allows users to create custom emblems from modular shapes for profiles, clubs, and tournaments, export them as PNG files, and participate in seasonal logo contests and team competitions.
idea_10: This feature allows you to create up to five power tiles and use them to play against Titans on various board sizes with different rules and obstacles.

idea_1: This feature allows you to select two random rule changes at the beginning of each game. Leaderboards are sorted according to the chosen rule combinations.
idea_2: This feature adds pairs of portal cells or wrap-around edges that let chains move across the grid by jumping between connected points.
idea_3: This feature allows you to long-press a start tile to view possible move sequences with predicted board states and scores. Previews are limited in ranked mode and unlimited in practice mode.
idea_4: This feature adds timed ice, bomb, and vine tiles that spread or lock cells if not merged. Clearing them gives wildcards, extra points, or additional previews.
idea_5: This Feature lets two players take turns on the same game board at different times, share power-ups, and work together to reach a combined high score.
idea_6: This feature allows users to create custom game boards with set blockers, rules, and goals, share them using short codes, and compete on a common leaderboard.
idea_7: This feature offers brief lessons on ladder building, parity fixes, and dead-end rescues, giving immediate feedback to help identify higher value chains.
idea_8: This feature allows you to collect tokens during long combos to save a tile’s value, which can be used later to continue or extend chains in the game.
idea_9: This feature switches game modes regularly, including Hex Grid, Gravity Shift with spawn directions changing every 10 moves, and Fog of War where tiles are revealed during chains.
idea_10: This feature displays a short replay of important moves, missed scoring chances, and a heatmap of rarely used cells. It also enables a one-tap rematch with the same seed.

idea_1: This feature adds a Stunt Combo Mode with arenas that include ramps and props for performing flips, rolls, drifts, and near-misses, along with timed Cliff Run challenges and scoring multipliers.
idea_2: This feature offers a mode adjusted for age and skill, with a simplified HUD, easier physics, mini-drills, session timers, and cosmetic badges for progress tracking.
idea_3: This feature provides a monthly subscription that unlocks 3D paint, visual effects, global events, giveaways, and enables family sharing of cosmetic items.
idea_4: This feature lets players plan routes with several stops, get step-by-step directions, visit suggested scenic locations, and rent special vehicles to return at set hubs.
idea_5: This feature allows users to measure driving distances, lap lengths, and custom course areas on the map, and shows parking lots, cafes, and shops as points of interest.
idea_6: This feature allows players to view cars, explore financing options, compare monthly payments, create a purchase checklist, and apply dealer coupons for test drives and purchases.
idea_7: This feature records your recent driving, lets you add voice notes and markers, and allows you to share clips with overlays for others to view and use.
idea_8: This feature allows players to collect and use decks of driving perks with limited-use cards during races, managing cooldowns and counter-perks across different modes and arenas.
idea_9: This feature lets users design team liveries and logos using vector layers, mascot packs, and pixel-art images, with options for precise placement and exporting decals.
idea_10: This feature lets players download missions, time trials, and challenges to play offline, and automatically syncs their progress when an internet connection is available.

idea_1: This feature creates roadside events such as stalled cars, meetings, emergency calls, and maintenance based on your actions, influencing traffic, shop prices, and police activity.
idea_2: This feature lets players join convoys to manage cargo, escort each other, handle breakdowns, use hand signals, and complete timed multi-stop routes together.
