idea_3: This feature lets players browse and install blueprints for tunes, liveries, and HUD presets, displays performance changes, and reverts settings if lap times decrease.
idea_4: This feature uses AI to analyze driving data, provides guidance on braking, throttle, and steering, includes practice with ghost cars, and tracks weekly progress.
idea_5: This feature adds moving weather fronts that produce rain, fog, and wind. Puddles form and change with sunlight and traffic. A radar mini-map displays current weather for route planning.
idea_6: This feature includes different road surfaces with varying grip, sounds, and vibrations. Players monitor suspension and tire temperature, and community projects work on road improvements.
idea_7: This feature displays crash replays with information on speed, impact angle, g-forces, and damage. It also records insurance costs based on driving and repair decisions.
idea_8: This feature lets players deliver materials, vote on projects, unlock new areas and facilities, track progress across the server, and recognize top contributors.
idea_9: This feature lets players evaluate used cars by checking condition, service history, and faults, perform diagnostics, test-drive, negotiate prices, and repair cars using mini-games.
idea_10: This feature lets players create routes with set weather and traffic, assign rewards, and allow others to race against their recorded runs under consistent conditions.

idea_1: This feature allows a scout hero to move across rooftops and cliffs, performing vaults and grapples to earn bonuses, reveal map details, or gain temporary buffs.
idea_2: This feature allows users to record 10–30 second voice messages tied to map locations, transcribes them, supports threaded replies, and syncs offline recordings when online.
idea_3: This feature lets users schedule shared APCs, fuel trucks, or drones in an alliance convoy calendar with arrival times and route previews. Vehicles automatically queue for decontamination and refueling between uses.
idea_4: This feature allows you to launch a glider-drone for a short 3D flyover that shows faint markers of hidden stashes, traps, or horde movements. Free daily flights are included.
idea_5: This feature lets players start large upgrades using Project Layaway, repay resources gradually with optional help from allies, and monitor progress through a milestone timeline.
idea_6: This feature allows users to measure distance and area, view turret and trap coverage maps, simulate horde paths, and convert measurements into march or defense commands.
idea_7: This feature enables building using a magnetized grid and wall snapping, saving and loading settlement layouts, and previewing night raids with simulated fire lines and paths.
idea_8: This feature provides daily encrypted radio messages as puzzles. Solving them reveals stash locations or story information. Players can use hints or collaborate with others.
idea_9: This feature lets players collect and use tactic cards during battles, which work together with hero abilities to influence the outcome of fights.
idea_10: This feature allows you to assign Shadow Ops tasks such as scavenging, rescues, or research to run while offline and provides optional offline tower-defense missions to play.

idea_1: This feature allows players to use sound beacons and controlled fires to guide moving zombie herds, creating safe routes or directing herds toward other groups.
idea_2: This feature uses your phone’s gyroscope to detect movement. Keeping the device steady prevents alerts, enabling you to collect map information and crafting materials.
idea_3: This feature lets alliance members link bases with elevated tracks to move troops and resources. Tracks in contested areas can be scouted, damaged, or defended.
idea_4: This feature enables 15-minute bunker expeditions with chosen heroes and temporary mutations, granting small, permanent ability changes to heroes in the main game via mutation chips.
idea_5: This feature lets players record and replay sequences of base tasks such as collecting, crafting, and requesting help, with a small energy cost. Routines can be shared with alliance members.
idea_6: This feature lets players make agreements with rules such as ceasefires, safe zones, and shared goals. Following or breaking rules changes reputation and causes penalties or advantages.
idea_7: This feature lets players place temporary barricades, spike strips, trenches, and decoy bonfires on the map that influence enemy movement and disappear over time.
idea_8: This feature shows multi-day refugee caravans and allows players to choose to shelter, escort, trade with, or exploit survivors, affecting NPCs, morale, and future events.
idea_9: This feature sends fake SOS signals and blocks enemy communications to show incorrect resource locations and troop movements, lowering enemy morale and visibility in those areas.
idea_10: This feature adds changing weather and hazard zones that impact combat and movement. Players create equipment and vote weekly on weather changes to adapt their strategies.

idea_1: This feature lets players sprint, vault, and use ziplines to move through obstacles while performing ricochet and aerial shots to earn combo points and appear on leaderboards.
idea_2: This feature offers short, timed practice sessions with a metronome to help improve aiming and motor skills, and includes optional posture reminders, eye breaks, and screen-time limits.
idea_3: This feature provides a practice mode with a rangefinder displaying distance, wind drift, and arrow trajectory, plus destructible targets and ragdoll dummies to see shot impact.
idea_4: This feature offers an optional pass that includes arrow trail effects, 3D victory emotes, early access to new arenas, monthly giveaways, and shared cosmetics for up to five accounts.
idea_5: This feature displays the coins and time required to upgrade bows, enables applying armory coupons during checkout, and allows renting rare bows for limited sessions.
idea_6: This feature allows players to sync contacts to find teammates, view match history and missed invites, use filtered voice and text chat, reserve private range times, and create team emblems.
idea_7: This feature records replays from different angles, showing speed, drop, and wind data for each shot. It also supports voice notes, voice effects, and annotations.
idea_8: This feature offers offline solo missions with different target challenges, a free-shoot range, and syncs earned rewards when the player reconnects to the internet.
idea_9: This feature displays a live countdown during trials, sends billing reminders, enables one-tap cancellation with receipt history, and includes child-safe purchase locks requiring a PIN or aim challenge.
idea_10: This feature introduces a deck system where players use shot-mod cards with cooldowns and energy limits to affect duels and plan their actions.

idea_1: This feature displays animated wind and air movements, provides a 1–2 second wind forecast, and lets players unlock longer forecasts with extra HUD details.
idea_2: This feature lets players change bow settings such as draw length, brace height, and string tension, affecting stability, noise, and arrow speed, with haptic feedback for calibration.
idea_3: This feature places life-size targets in real environments using AR, letting users draw, aim, and shoot with device motion. Progress and rewards sync with the main game.
idea_4: This feature lets one player shoot while the other manages shields, wind fans, and traps with cooldowns. Players alternate roles each round.
idea_5: This feature lets four players work together to fight bosses with multiple phases, moving weak points, breakable armor, and elemental arrowheads that trigger team effects.
idea_6: This feature shows a translucent outline of a top-ranked shot, including aim movement, draw duration, and release timing, while practice modes use the same wind conditions.
idea_7: This feature connects to a smartwatch to monitor heart rate, adjusts aim sway according to pulse, and includes a breathing mini-game that temporarily reduces the sway.
idea_8: This feature lets players build bows and arrows from material blueprints that influence weight, torsion, noise, and durability, with the option to repair them quickly during matches.
idea_9: This feature allows players to design trick-shot courses with drag-and-drop tools, share them using codes, rate courses created by others, and access weekly featured playlists.
idea_10: This feature tracks your shot timing, drift, and wind adjustments, gives practice and gear suggestions, and provides weekly progress reports with matchmaking advice.

idea_1: This feature helps users add tags for flavors, texture, service, and ambience by providing prompts and lessons, and suggests review sections and vocabulary based on previous reviews.
idea_2: This Feature shows menu items with dietary information, suggests alternative options, enables one-tap ordering, supports contactless pickup, and applies available discounts automatically.
idea_3: This feature lets users complete daily tasks such as trying new foods, adding photos, and confirming business hours to earn coins and maintain streaks.
idea_4: This feature allows users to turn on map layers that display quiet work spots, kid-friendly areas, dog-friendly places, wheelchair access, parking, outdoor heaters, and live noise levels.
idea_5: This feature displays a Health & Allergen Verification badge with inspection scores, staff certifications, and allergen protocols. Users can filter for verified kitchens and view recent updates.
idea_6: This feature displays a Reliability Score for each business based on hours accuracy, reservation accuracy, delivery readiness, and menu correctness, including trendlines and future predictions.
idea_7: This feature allows users to adjust sliders for spice, richness, sweetness, price, noise, and lighting to reorder search results and save multiple presets for later use.
idea_8: This feature connects email and card receipts to create a private timeline of visits, pickups, and deliveries, offers review reminders, tracks spending by cuisine, and displays reorder options.
idea_9: This feature lets users download city information like maps, hours, menus, photos, and saved lists for offline access, with notes syncing and updates when online.
idea_10: This feature recommends dining options based on local weather, adjusts notifications according to the time, and displays only open-late or delivery choices during after-hours.

idea_1: This feature records your order choices and ratings, ranks restaurants based on similar users’ preferences, and offers new recommendations for variety.
idea_2: This feature displays menu item availability based on POS data or staff updates and provides nearby similar dishes along with their current delivery times.
idea_3: This feature displays a life-size 3D image of a dish on your table, allowing you to view its portion size, presentation, and additional items before ordering.
idea_4: This Feature identifies allergy and diet information for dishes by analyzing menus and reviews, suggests alternative options, and provides access to saved dietary notes.
idea_5: This feature provides ratings based on noise levels, seating availability, and reviews, helping you find the nearest venue suitable for various activities.
idea_6: This feature allows users to order food from multiple nearby restaurants in one delivery, coordinates arrival times, and automatically splits the bill by items, taxes, and fees.
idea_7: This feature displays chefs and their dishes at different restaurants and pop-ups, lets you follow chefs, and sends notifications when a signature dish appears in a new place.
idea_8: This feature displays discounted food bundles and surplus items nearby, allowing users to reserve and pick them up quickly to reduce food waste.
idea_9: This Feature tracks waitlists at nearby places, books the closest available spot, cancels other reservations automatically, and sends updates to your group.
idea_10: This Feature allows you to ask questions about food and delivery, provides short answers from recent reviews and menus, and supports follow-up questions without starting over.

idea_1: This feature shows a map of letter and sound skills, identifies areas with less progress, and sends parents brief practice prompts targeting those skills.
idea_2: This feature allows children to trace letters and practice phonics while collecting fish, plants, and alphabet stones to add to a customizable aquarium.
idea_3: This feature offers offline phonics songs and call-and-response games with large controls, enabling several children to take turns without exiting the screen.
idea_4: This feature downloads lessons ahead of time, sets a schedule for travel days, and adjusts session length according to time zones and internet connection.
idea_5: This feature lets the child record a 10-second voice note or emoji after sessions, summarizes their mood and challenges, and changes the next lesson accordingly.
idea_6: This feature offers regional English accents and themed decodable audiobooks that can be downloaded for offline listening and practice.
idea_7: This feature lets adults choose letter pairs, stroke counts, or phonics standards and share custom practice sets through QR codes or links.
idea_8: This feature lets users share word collections with codes and enables children to complete sticker challenges together without needing chats or personal profiles.
idea_9: This feature helps users practice tracing letters, blending sounds, spelling, and basic reading, tracks their progress, and offers printable certificates.
idea_10: This feature offers activities where children practice letter blends and sounds. Completing these activities unlocks new creatures to add to their alphabet collection.

idea_1: This feature uses the front camera to display lip and tongue movements as children pronounce sounds and gives real-time feedback without storing any data.
idea_2: This feature changes each correctly traced letter into a stamp or brush to create pictures, unlocking new colors as children complete different tracing tasks.
idea_3: This feature displays letter-sound bubbles on real objects using augmented reality. Children say the sound, trace the letter, and gather the bubbles.
idea_4: This feature lets a helper draw guide lines for a child tracing letters or connects two devices so users can trace and build words together remotely.
idea_5: This feature allows children to tap beats while hearing words broken into syllables and sounds, with the speed changing according to their accuracy.
idea_6: This feature monitors how a child traces letters, gives vibrations and arrows for guidance, and displays a heatmap to indicate areas that need more practice.
idea_7: This feature animates letters after tracing by turning them into parts of the related object and plays the word’s pronunciation aloud.
idea_8: This feature detects quiet speech and slow tracing, then shows calming visuals and plays gentle sounds to help maintain a quiet environment.
idea_9: This feature generates short stories using the child’s practiced letters and chosen names, pets, and places, with highlighted words to assist with reading aloud and sound practice.
idea_10: This feature uses the camera to detect arm movements as children trace letters in the air or on a surface before tracing them on the screen.

idea_1: This feature offers brief practice sessions in writing, coding, drawing, and speaking, gives feedback, tracks progress and confidence, and awards credits and badges.
idea_2: This feature allows users to share answers as interactive Chat Cards that others can tap to add their input. It also enables collaborative writing with tracked contributions.
idea_3: This feature listens to nearby speech through your phone microphone and earbuds, transcribes it, summarizes key points, highlights important details, and offers follow-up options.
idea_4: This feature allows you to swipe through different Nova personas, see their skills and sources, explore popular choices, and merge two personas into a custom hybrid.
idea_5: This feature identifies phone numbers and tracking codes from pasted text, voice input, or screenshots, then automatically fills forms and updates profiles for donations and subscriptions.
idea_6: This feature turns natural language into step-by-step actions for tasks such as ordering food or booking rides, applies discounts, suggests extras, and gives one confirmation at checkout.
idea_7: This feature lets users interact with a voice-controlled character for stories, songs, and games. Parents can set filters, activity settings, time limits, and view progress updates.
idea_8: This feature provides weather forecasts for your travel route and schedule, offering packing tips, timing recommendations, indoor activity options, and safety alerts.
idea_9: This feature lets you download topic modules to use offline, get quick answers without internet, queue skill sets for later, and sync automatically when connected.
idea_10: This feature reads and summarizes documents, edits content, preserves layout, translates text, adds annotations, and creates slide decks or study sheets from various file types.

idea_1: This feature allows users to adjust sliders to mix different personas, and Nova updates its tone, tools, and responses immediately based on the selected combination.
idea_2: This feature displays a floating bubble that recognizes your current app, suggests actions, drafts replies, extracts data, autofills forms, and offers shortcuts without switching apps.
idea_3: This feature listens to calls and voice notes, transcribes and summarizes them, then creates tasks, follow-ups, calendar events, and contact notes after the call.
idea_4: This feature uses the camera to show step-by-step AR instructions for tasks, linking guidance to objects and providing tappable checklists.
idea_5: This feature shows a list of what Nova remembers and lets users edit, freeze, or delete items such as time limits, categories, and usage reasons.
idea_6: This feature lets Nova create automated workflows by dragging and dropping triggers such as messages, screenshots, or locations to perform tasks across different apps.
idea_7: This feature lets users create multiple conversation paths at the same time, view them side by side, and get a recommendation based on chosen criteria.
idea_8: This feature allows setting small goals, starts a five-minute timer, gives voice or vibration alerts, tracks daily streaks, blocks distractions, and summarizes progress.
idea_9: This feature generates quizzes from your chats, PDFs, and bookmarks, reads questions aloud, accepts spoken answers, and schedules reminders for review using spaced repetition.
idea_10: This feature performs translation, OCR, and summaries on the device without internet, then syncs data and updates when the device connects online.

idea_1: This Feature adds a Parkour board with bounce tiles and obstacles where players can plan movement combos, earn multipliers, and take part in rotating cliff challenges.
idea_2: This feature shows current events, your qualification status, an entry checklist, recommended loadouts, and lets you reserve match times.
idea_3: This feature allows you to collect and save coupons for boosters, entries, and cosmetics, apply discounts automatically, and share some coupons with your club members.
idea_4: This feature lets users use premium boosters or passes for a limited number of matches, showing a countdown, allowing one-tap cancellation, and providing billing notifications.
idea_5: This feature records important turns and full matches, lets users trim videos and add voice notes, and allows sharing highlights within clubs or exporting them for social media.
idea_6: This feature displays potential cascades and affected areas during training, enables recording and replaying move sequences, and allows branching from any move to compare outcomes.
idea_7: This feature lets you borrow rare boosters from a changing selection or your club’s shared collection for a limited number of matches, with options to reserve and get reminders.
idea_8: This feature provides optional 3D glow arenas, glittering tile skins, animated effects, early previews and cosmetic items for subscribers, and a performance toggle for older devices.
idea_9: This feature allows users to create avatars and club crests with stickers, mascots, and effects, apply them to banners, frames, and emotes, and save images as PNG files.
idea_10: This feature allows you to create and save multiple booster decks, switch between them, play in different format arenas, and see win rates for each deck.

idea_1: This feature allows both players to ban one booster and select from a changing pool before each PvP match, resulting in partially similar loadouts.
idea_2: This feature matches players in a ranked queue with the same board layout and drop sequence, so the game outcome depends on skill and strategy.
idea_3: This feature introduces small tasks during matches that require clearing specific items within a limited number of turns and provide minor bonuses when completed.
idea_4: This feature lets teams join asynchronous boss raids where matches damage a multi-phase boss that reacts to cleared colors. Reaching milestones unlocks team perks, cosmetics, and boosters.
idea_5: This feature provides a post-match Ghost Replay that allows you to rewind key turns on the same seed to try different moves against a recorded opponent and earn small rewards for improvement.
idea_6: This feature lets team members share boosters that have lower power and limited uses, allowing more players to use them and promoting teamwork.
idea_7: This feature lets players convert duplicate stickers into craft tokens, which can be used to get missing stickers or to change album bonuses.
idea_8: This feature lets players or teams create rooms with custom rules such as gravity flip, color lock, fog-of-board, and timed turns, and set ticketed prizes.
idea_9: This feature provides each player with one optional Focus token per match that either displays the expected cascade path for a swap or adds a 1-second slow-motion aim assist.
idea_10: This feature begins a timed best-of series with growing rewards and retains rival badges when two players compete in multiple rematches.

idea_1: This feature offers short exercises on composition, color, and lighting with instant A/B image comparisons, provides prompt suggestions, and tracks your progress.
idea_2: This feature lets users adjust detail, edge sharpness, noise, and contrast using sliders with live previews, and automatically detects and corrects blur after image generation.
idea_3: This feature lets users request feedback from others who can mark issues or add notes, then apply selected changes with one tap to update the image.
idea_4: This feature allows you to download style or model packs for offline use, organize prompts into playlists, and sync results when you are back online.
idea_5: This feature allows users to swipe through styles and nearby creators, start prompt duets, and optionally view verified local collaborations and meetups within a set location radius.
idea_6: This feature lets users share a short numeric code with the prompt, seed, settings, and effects, which can be entered to recreate or change the image quickly.
idea_7: This feature generates scene prompts based on current or forecasted weather and adds effects such as stormy skies and rain during severe weather alerts.
idea_8: This feature provides a kid-safe mode with specific kawaii styles, voice prompts, large buttons, offline functionality, topic limits, and exports images as stickers for chat apps.
idea_9: This feature provides daily challenges and mini-games where users earn credits through variations, streaks, and community votes. Credits can be used for pro minutes, print discounts, or donations.
idea_10: This feature lets users add and connect community-created modules such as samplers and filters, manage versions with rollback options, and access updated artist collections.

idea_1: This feature uses your camera to capture simple shapes on real surfaces and generates photorealistic objects and backgrounds, which can be saved as 2D images or AR overlays.
idea_2: This feature captures an HDR light profile from a photo or room and applies it to images to maintain consistent shadows, highlights, and color tones.
idea_3: This feature creates a private mini-profile from 3–10 images to capture a face, mascot, or product, enabling trait adjustments and reuse in various prompts.
idea_4: This feature offers sliders for lens, lighting, composition, and mood with instant previews. Users can tap to add tokens and adjust negative prompts automatically.
idea_5: This feature generates 6 to 12 images of the same scene from different angles, focal lengths, and times of day for use in various visual formats.
idea_6: This feature extends the edges of an image while maintaining perspective and horizon lines, allowing creation of wider or taller visuals and continuous zoom effects.
idea_7: This feature allows you to select areas such as water, fire, hair, or fabric in a still image and create animated loops that can be saved as Live Photo, GIF, or MP4.
idea_8: This feature allows you to mix up to three reference styles using a triangle mixer, view live previews during adjustments, and save or share style presets.
idea_9: This feature converts flat or poster-style images into layered SVG or PDF files with color grouping and curve smoothing, enabling direct export to printers, Cricut, or Procreate.
idea_10: This feature generates a depth map for images to enable tilt-parallax, adjustable bokeh, relighting effects, and allows exporting in 3D photo formats and live wallpapers.

idea_1: This feature records your voice, analyzes pace, clarity, filler words, pitch, and breathing, and offers exercises with comparisons before and after practice.
idea_2: This feature sends microphone audio to your earbuds with noise reduction and speech focus, lets you record if you choose, and sets volume limits for safe listening.
idea_3: This feature allows users to share a secure link for time-stamped reviews, enabling others to add comments at specific points and receive a summary of the feedback.
idea_4: This feature organizes recordings by tags, speakers, or projects, plays them offline in a chosen order without gaps, and performs integrity checks with backups and optional security.
idea_5: This feature monitors ambient noise, weather, and events to estimate quiet times, displays a quietness index, sends alerts for changes, and can pause or resume recordings automatically.
idea_6: This feature links nearby phones within a set distance to record the same session, synchronizes the recordings, and merges them into one or multiple audio tracks.
idea_7: This feature allows kids to record stories with prompts, voice stickers, and background sounds, works offline, enables family sharing, and includes a parent dashboard for privacy and time controls.
idea_8: This feature allows you to browse preset effect chains and microphone emulations, apply them with one tap, and share or edit presets for others.
idea_9: This feature identifies phone numbers, dates, addresses, and tasks in recordings and creates clickable actions. It also provides filters to separate speakers, reduce background noise, or highlight keywords.
idea_10: This feature exports audio clips as videos with captions and customizable waveforms, colors, and branding, and provides a player with AB-loop, silence skip, and speed control.

idea_1: This feature continuously records audio using a rolling buffer, enabling you to save the last N minutes and the following M minutes when you decide to save.
idea_2: This feature allows you to add a timestamped marker by double-tapping the phone or saying "bookmark," saving the previous five seconds and giving a vibration confirmation.
idea_3: This feature identifies important moments during recording and allows you to create tasks with due dates and assignees, syncing them to your calendar or project tool.
idea_4: This feature identifies personal information such as names, phone numbers, and addresses in recordings and transcripts, then removes or masks these details to protect privacy.
idea_5: This feature automatically translates and dubs recordings into another language using your voice and allows searching for specific moments across different languages.
idea_6: This feature displays a timeline highlighting emotions and energy levels, marking moments such as excitement, hesitation, laughter, and tension for easy navigation.
idea_7: This feature separates speakers into individual tracks that can be soloed, muted, or adjusted, reduces cross-talk, applies auto-leveling, and allows exporting mixed or separate audio files.
idea_8: This feature plays location-based prompts to obtain verbal consent, records and adds the consent clip at the beginning, logs time, location, participants, and notifies if consent is missing.
idea_9: This feature allows you to ask questions about your recordings and gives exact quotes with timestamps. It works directly on your device without internet access.
idea_10: This feature adds a watermark and records edit history to track when, where, and how a recording was made and modified, enabling verification with a certificate.

idea_1: This feature offers brief lessons and weekly tasks about VPN settings, monitors privacy confidence with a score, and enables private sharing with family or groups.
idea_2: This feature lets users create, save, and manage custom VPN settings by selecting server hops, protocols, ports, DNS, filtering, and app routes, with import and export options.
idea_3: This feature initiates a 60-minute VPN session using temporary credentials without needing an account or payment. It deletes data on exit and has a default kill switch.
idea_4: This feature detects calls and switches to a low-latency connection with error correction and buffering, alerts users about quality changes, and reconnects to the best nearby server.
idea_5: This Feature lets you select a goal and set a distance to find servers that meet these criteria, displaying their load, risk level, and compatibility.
idea_6: This feature shows user reports on connection status, speeds, and issues by country and service, lets staff mark verified information, and can automatically reroute connections using trusted data.
idea_7: This Feature displays hourly network latency, load, and censorship status by region, sends travel alerts, and preloads settings for trips with offline sign-in capability.
idea_8: This feature records points from learning activities and verified reports, enables using points for subscription credit or donations, and allows sending gift cards and managing family sharing.
idea_9: This feature lets users add a new device by entering a 6-digit code or scanning a QR code from a signed-in device, with codes that expire after a set time.
idea_10: This feature saves an encrypted record of your VPN session details on your device, enabling you to view and export specific information without automatic data sharing.

idea_1: This feature assesses network conditions and automatically connects Proton VPN using the best protocol and exit location, updating settings as the network changes.
idea_2: This feature lets users change the app icon and name, use generic notifications, and access a PIN-protected decoy interface to hide the VPN app.
idea_3: This feature lets you assign specific exit locations or IP addresses to individual apps, change them automatically on a schedule, and block data if the connection is lost.
idea_4: This feature identifies network threats such as ARP spoofing, rogue DNS, TLS stripping, and malicious captive portals, then modifies settings or pauses traffic to protect the connection.
idea_5: This feature lets you connect to 2–3 VPN servers in different countries, see current speed and delay information, and save your preferred connection settings.
idea_6: This feature shows the protection status, battery level, and connection information of family devices, detects unsafe networks, and lets users manage device traffic and connection settings.
idea_7: This feature chooses exit points that reduce abuse and captchas for banking and shopping, keeps IP addresses shared for privacy, and allows using a dedicated IP if needed.
idea_8: This feature protects session keys using hybrid post-quantum cryptography, allows enabling or disabling per profile, and automatically switches to older methods on limited networks.
idea_9: This feature lets different app groups connect through separate countries simultaneously, with automatic switching and individual kill switches for each group.
idea_10: This feature establishes a temporary, encrypted local network between invited devices using Proton’s network, enabling file sharing, gaming, or remote assistance within the group.

idea_1: This feature allows players to advance on a board by answering questions correctly, use streaks to bypass obstacles, and move to lower paths after incorrect answers.
idea_2: This feature automatically uses the best discount on power-ups, lives, and season passes earned from daily streaks and team milestones. Users can also gift or trade coupons with friends.
idea_3: This feature allows you to build an aquarium that grows as you play, unlocking themed fish for each category and enabling idle tasks during waiting periods.
idea_4: This feature allows users to record a question idea by holding a button, transcribes it, suggests answer options, checks facts, and enables publishing as text or audio.
idea_5: This feature offers short practice drills targeting your weaker subtopics and changes difficulty and hints according to your performance after each match.
idea_6: This feature plays environmental, language, and music sound clips with optional effects such as reverb, glitch, and speed changes. Players can upload sounds with noise reduction and trimming.
idea_7: This feature compresses game assets to use less data, offers offline question packs, and lets you continue the same match on different devices or web sessions.
idea_8: This feature allows teams to cooperate in defeating bosses with shields that drop after winning category streaks; each phase introduces new challenges, and defeats grant relics for future games.
idea_9: This feature allows you to scan objects such as book covers, dishes, plants, or landmarks to generate trivia questions with answer choices that you can edit and share.
idea_10: This feature allows you to create and share playlists of question sets that can be shuffled, repeated, or queued, with friends able to add packs that update the playlist in real time.

idea_1: This feature allows you to select three categories and answer questions that match your skill level. You can set a risk multiplier before each turn to change potential rewards.
idea_2: This feature allows players to team up in groups of 3–5 to answer trivia questions against a boss with shared health and time limits. Correct answers lower the boss's health, while incorrect answers trigger boss effects like faster questions or category changes.
idea_3: This feature shows a 10-second explanation with a source and mnemonic when you tap "Why?" after a question. Missed questions are added to a review stack.
idea_4: This feature allows users to create questions with AI-generated wrong answers, verify sources, assign difficulty levels, test questions with a sample group, and receive rewards based on quality.
idea_5: This feature uses your camera to identify nearby landmarks and provides trivia questions related to those locations, allowing you to answer and earn badges connected to them.
idea_6: This feature lets multiple players join a live game using a room code or QR code, showing a leaderboard and allowing audience votes during eliminations.
idea_7: This feature lets both players choose categories and two modifiers before spinning the wheel, which changes the question types and rules during the game.
idea_8: This feature offers daily questions about current events and predictions. Users answer and receive streak multipliers when outcomes are confirmed, with no real money involved.
idea_9: This feature allows users to explore a knowledge map with subtopics, monitor their progress, choose specialization paths to earn titles, and create or share practice drills.
idea_10: This feature displays a 30-second replay after each duel, showing your timing, guess changes, and key moments, then generates a 5-question drill targeting your main weak area.

idea_1: This feature provides daily short exercises for breathing, labor positions, and newborn care, including timers, partner prompts, and tools to track practice progress.
idea_2: This feature offers a review hub where parents can rate OBs, hospitals, classes, and baby products, with filters for location, insurance, and pregnancy stage, plus verified user questions and answers.
idea_3: This feature tracks healthy habits and lessons, awards points for completing them, offers weekly challenges and multipliers, and lets users redeem points for partner perks and gift cards.
idea_4: This feature offers a daily planner that suggests activity times based on weather and provides hydration advice and travel information related to pregnancy stages.
idea_5: This feature provides songs, stories, and games that teach toddlers about the baby and doctor visits, including offline playlists and sticker rewards for daily activities.
idea_6: This feature lets you create private groups where invited members can view updates, complete tasks, and join using a QR code or access code.
idea_7: This feature generates a hospital bag list based on birth plan and season, tracks owned items, syncs with partner lists, and supports ordering or pickup options.
idea_8: This feature provides an add-on marketplace where users can access optional toolkits for gestational diabetes tracking, VBAC preparation, military family planning, cultural postpartum practices, and language packs.
idea_9: This feature offers severe weather alerts, live radar, hospital route options, backup contacts, early notifications, rerouting, and a one-tap message to inform your contacts while traveling.
idea_10: This feature lets users find nearby expecting parents, set distance preferences, choose anonymity, and join group chats with local event information.

idea_1: This feature provides weekly meal plans tailored to pregnancy stage, symptoms, and diet, analyzes nutrients from meal photos, and creates a grocery shopping list.
idea_2: This feature generates a customized agenda and question list based on your symptoms, pregnancy stage, and screenings. It also imports or scans lab results for review.
idea_3: This feature allows you to scan medication labels or barcodes to check safety during pregnancy, ingredient interactions, dosage timing, and provides region-specific information with a summary you can share.
idea_4: This feature monitors your baby’s regular movement patterns, offers guided counting sessions, and sends notifications if movements change from the usual baseline.
idea_5: This feature lets partners and support groups share checklists, meal plans, and calendar tasks linked to pregnancy milestones, with weekly reminders and short informational messages.
idea_6: This feature lets you create a birth plan based on your preferences and hospital guidelines, provides practice audio for positions and breathing, and exports a summary for your team.
idea_7: This feature shows local alerts for air quality, heat, pollen, and outbreaks, gives activity advice by trimester, and tracks exposure information during pregnancy.
idea_8: This feature uses your phone’s sensors to guide pelvic floor and core exercises, updates weekly, and offers postpartum recovery support with functional checks and reminders.
idea_9: This feature creates a 3D and AR model of your baby’s size and position using ultrasound measurements, which you can view and share within the app.
idea_10: This feature provides information on local maternity and paternity policies, insurance, and hospital billing, auto-fills forms, tracks deadlines, and helps plan baby expenses with registry suggestions.

idea_1: This feature analyzes your text messages for tone and allows you to practice calls with simulated scenarios, giving instant feedback on clarity, pacing, and confidence.
idea_2: This feature allows you to create call menus, set call routing based on time, and assign voicemail for contacts using a drag-and-drop builder with customizable blocks.
idea_3: This feature allows you to send an invite link so calls from that person bypass screening and ring directly, and both users receive credits after their first connection.
idea_4: This feature allows users to earn credits by completing tasks, games, or surveys, which can be used for call minutes, add-ons, temporary numbers, or donations.
idea_5: This feature provides optional ID verification and a trust badge, shows spam warnings for callers, and suggests local area codes based on your contacts.
idea_6: This feature allows users to add voicemail transcription in multiple languages, record calls with consent tones, integrate with CRM/helpdesk systems, and send different document types.
idea_7: This feature reads incoming texts aloud, lets you reply by voice, offers large controls for easier use while driving, and allows parents to set a separate number with contact and time limits.
idea_8: This feature allows you to set automatic actions based on triggers like first-time or missed calls, including replies, delays, labels, forwarding, and sharing settings with others.
idea_9: This feature shows live captions during calls, allows sound adjustments, supports hearing aids, offers large-text and high-contrast display, and lets users send voice and text messages together.
idea_10: This feature adjusts your hours for different time zones, allows setting a trip voicemail, schedules SMS messages by local time, and provides a temporary local number that expires automatically.

idea_1: This feature changes your call and message settings automatically based on time, location, or contact, adjusting voicemail, text signatures, and do-not-disturb options.
idea_2: This feature creates temporary extensions for your second number with labels and automatic expiration, enabling custom auto-replies and pinned information for messages.
idea_3: This feature asks unknown callers to state their name and reason for calling, shows a live transcript, identifies synthetic voices and spam, and provides quick reply options.
idea_4: This feature allows multiple users to share one phone number, manage calls and messages, add private notes, set business hours, and track responses together.
idea_5: This feature asks unknown senders to verify with a small refundable deposit or invite code before contacting you. Approved contacts do not need to verify.
idea_6: This feature adds a verified badge connected to your email or domain and an optional short link that displays your availability, contact methods, and scheduling for calls or texts.
idea_7: This feature offers two-way SMS translation, live captions during calls, and type-to-speech replies, with the option to set default languages for each contact.
idea_8: This feature monitors your number for delivery and spam risks, controls message sending speed, rotates message templates, and offers suggestions to help maintain trust.
idea_9: This feature creates a temporary web link for others to send messages from a browser without showing your number, includes pre-screen questions, and saves the session when finished.
idea_10: This feature creates automatic summaries of calls and messages, highlights important details, and lets you turn them into reminders or calendar events with one tap.

idea_1: This feature offers daily short lessons on retouching, composition, color grading, and prompt creation, including interactive exercises, progress tracking, and personalized practice drills.
idea_2: This feature lets multiple users edit the same photo or AI canvas at the same time, share voice or emoji reactions, export a collaborative time-lapse, and keep separate layers for undoing changes.
idea_3: This feature reduces blur and enhances details in photos, improving clarity for low-light, distant, or unclear images using deblurring, super-resolution, and face or text enhancement.
idea_4: This feature allows users to install style models, brushes, overlays, LUTs, and stickers with one tap, and offers a space to create and share workflow add-ons.
idea_5: This feature recommends photo edits according to current or predicted weather and lets users download related assets for offline use.
idea_6: This feature lets users add tags indicating AI use in portraits, verify creators, and find nearby collaborators with messaging for photographers and models.
idea_7: This feature records user activity and feedback to accumulate credits that can be redeemed for premium assets, prints, or gift cards during specific events and offers.
idea_8: This feature shows severe weather alerts with a radar overlay in the camera, suggests indoor shooting options, and saves unsynced edits automatically if power is lost.
idea_9: This feature lets users create cloud projects with shareable links, track version history, compare images side-by-side, add comments with markup, import PDFs, and export layered PSD or RAW files.
idea_10: This feature lets users download filters, fonts, and AI style playlists to use and apply to multiple photos without needing an internet connection.

idea_1: This feature allows you to select an area with a brush and describe changes, while anchor points preserve edges or textures as AI edits the selected region.
idea_2: This feature analyzes your previous edits and favorites to create a style, then applies it to new photos by adjusting color, contrast, grain, and framing.
idea_3: This feature generates multiple images of a character from one selfie or pet photo, creating different scenes, outfits, and poses while keeping consistent identity and lighting.
idea_4: This feature changes the lighting in photos by analyzing depth and angles, adding shadows, highlights, and reflections, and copying lighting from another image.
idea_5: This feature allows you to add motion to still images by drawing paths, creating looping effects, and exporting seamless loops for Reels and Live Photos.
idea_6: This feature allows you to choose a pose from a library or image, then the AI changes the subject’s pose while maintaining proportions and clothing, with a 3D skeleton slider for adjustments.
idea_7: This feature allows you to insert AI-generated objects such as plants, furniture, and signs into your image, automatically adjusting size, perspective, and shadows while maintaining editable layers.
idea_8: This feature removes glare, folds, and paper texture from scanned photos, restores missing edges and colors, and lets you adjust film grain to maintain the original appearance.
idea_9: This feature adds text that wraps around subjects, changes with perspective, matches the scene’s lighting, and blends with objects using different styles like neon or chrome.
idea_10: This feature lets users share editable links of their photo edits, allowing others to copy, compare, and combine changes while keeping track of each step and prompt.

idea_1: This feature offers short 2–5 minute exercises in art, writing, and math, gives immediate feedback, allows peer recognition, and lets teachers assign tasks and monitor progress.

idea_7: This feature lets users download assignments, instructions, and read-alouds for offline access, syncs data when online, and includes an audio recorder for offline submissions.
idea_8: This feature allows teachers to create choiceboards with tasks and extensions, enabling students to select options while tracking time and standards progress.

idea_10: This feature connects verified classrooms nearby or with similar interests for pen-pal projects and showcases, including translation, moderation, and controls for safety and timing.

idea_1: This feature allows daily social-emotional check-ins with emojis or sliders, offers short activities for teachers, and displays anonymous class trends while protecting individual responses.

idea_6: This feature lets classes record points, attendance, and portfolios offline using Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct, then syncs the data to the cloud with conflict resolution when online.

idea_8: This feature uses the camera to capture student work, crops and enhances the image, tags related skills, tracks progress, and adds student voice explanations.

idea_10: This feature sends private reminders to assigned staff during activities and automatically tracks progress on goals for meetings and reports.

idea_1: This feature lets users complete short exercises on conversation topics such as openers, consent, boundaries, and empathy, with AI offering feedback and optional progress badges.

idea_8: This feature lets users translate profiles and messages instantly and reply to match questions using text, short video, or audio.
idea_9: This feature allows users to select interest packs that include prompts, badges, and short discussion threads focused on specific topics or hobbies.
idea_10: This feature lets users share contact information securely with temporary phone numbers and QR codes, request verification, and exchange full contact details after matching.

idea_1: This feature initiates a 2-minute live session where matched users answer “What would you do if...?” questions and then provides a suggested opener and first-date idea.

idea_6: This feature lets users submit, vote on, and tag matching questions, access seasonal question packs, earn credit for creating questions, and filter to prioritize community questions.
idea_7: This feature lets users share date details with trusted contacts, set timed check-ins, send a discreet alert using a safe word, and give feedback on venues after dates.

idea_9: This feature arranges local meetups for users with shared interests within 2–5 km, allowing them to RSVP, check in via the app, and attend with moderation.
idea_10: This feature lets new matches create a shared list of three activities to do together. Completing each activity unlocks new questions and rewards.

idea_1: This feature helps you create listings by reviewing photos, descriptions, and prices, suggesting lighting adjustments, removing backgrounds, identifying trademark issues, and offering templates.
idea_2: This feature lets buyers add brief reviews with fit information and condition photos after delivery. The data is grouped by brand and size to offer fit details on future listings.

idea_6: This feature allows users to create a size profile, filter searches by location, and see which sellers have verified identification badges.

idea_8: This feature lets sellers post short updates, polls, style tips, and 30-second try-on videos connected to listings, with a feed displaying related content on brand and category pages.
idea_9: This feature lets buyers add multiple items to a base product to create bundles with updated savings and shipping weight, while sellers can set combo options and automatic offers.
idea_10: This feature offers live shows with captions and transcripts, lets sellers create listings using voice, and includes accessibility options such as larger text and high-contrast modes.

idea_1: This feature creates a size profile from a phone scan and past purchases, displays fit confidence on listings, and filters search results to show items likely to fit.

idea_10: This feature analyzes photos to identify brand details, stitching, wear, and stains, suggests condition grades, detects possible counterfeits, and sends high-risk items for authentication.

idea_1: This feature helps users find teammates by skills, interests, or timezone. Users can filter by role, project tags, or location, then start a huddle or send an introduction.

idea_1: This feature allows you to write private messages in a channel, preview notifications and guest views, test slash commands, and publish, schedule, or split messages into threads.
idea_2: This feature creates a summary of a direct message or small-group chat, obtains participant consent, and posts it as a channel message with participant attribution.
idea_3: This feature turns channels into live boards where threads function as cards with owners, status, and due dates. Resolved threads archive automatically, and overdue threads send summary notifications to owners.
idea_4: This feature schedules messages to send during recipients’ work hours, organizes replies into a single thread, supports time-zone mentions, and lets users send urgent messages immediately.
idea_5: This feature allows users to mark messages that require acknowledgment by a deadline. Recipients can acknowledge or defer, and a dashboard monitors and escalates pending responses.

idea_7: This feature identifies sensitive information in messages before sending, allows quick redaction, displays masked previews to external recipients, and records any policy exceptions.

idea_9: This feature allows you to set focus modes that restrict notifications from selected channels, people, and keywords for a specific time, update your status, and give a summary afterward.

idea_1: This feature lets players perform rooftop parkour moves such as vaults, slides, and jumps to complete heists, earn multipliers, and compete on time and combo leaderboards.

idea_10: This feature adds marriages, homes, and pets that offer social benefits, create allies, or lower enemy attention, with choices affecting storylines and city factions.

idea_1: This Feature displays a heat map of crimes by district and time, influences police patrol routes, and allows players to send tips or bribes to change patrols.

idea_1: This feature provides short practice drills that use device sensors to give real-time feedback, ending with a confidence score and a recommended next skill to try.

idea_1: This feature changes pace, power, and interval goals during workouts based on heart rate, effort, terrain, temperature, and wind, and updates your session and weekly plan.
idea_2: This feature creates fueling and hydration plans based on sweat rate, weather, and workout duration, sends timers to the watch, and updates intake data after the activity.
idea_3: This feature analyzes route segments for lighting, traffic speed, sidewalks, air quality, and shade, suggests alternative routes, and shares your chosen route with LiveTrack contacts.
idea_4: This feature allows you to race against a previous activity or personal record with real-time pacing, terrain adjustments, and split predictions for running, cycling, and team relays.
idea_5: This feature tracks shoe cushioning and bike chain condition using movement and usage data, estimates remaining life, schedules maintenance, and sends alerts for sudden changes.
idea_6: This feature uses your calendar’s flight and timezone details to adjust workout times and intensity, create sleep and light plans, and provide in-flight mobility exercises.
idea_7: This feature tracks changes in resting heart rate, heart rate variability, respiration, skin temperature, and gait symmetry, assigns a risk level, prompts symptom check-ins, and updates your plan.
idea_8: This feature lets you create and edit routes offline with topo maps and trail snapping, sync map tiles to your watch, and receive hazard alerts and bailout point suggestions.
idea_9: This feature adds 3–8 minute skill drills to warm-ups based on your data, shows form cues on the watch, and tracks progress to unlock the next drills automatically.
idea_10: This feature uses weather, UV and pollen levels, calendar events, and body data to recommend training times and adjust your route during activities.

idea_1: This feature allows you to add layers with blend modes, opacity, and masks to modify effects. You can save and share these layer stacks for later use.
idea_2: This feature allows you to play physics-based mini-games by bouncing mushrooms on trampolines, bubble tubes, and swings to adjust ingredient charge or rarity before mixing.
idea_3: This feature lets users create themed habitat rooms that give small trait or effect bonuses and share blueprints with others to earn craft tokens.
idea_4: This feature uses the camera to capture textures and colors, then applies them as patterns to potions or creatures. All processing is done on the device.
idea_5: This feature allows you to assign creations to tasks and upgrade workshops so they gather ingredients, lore pages, or rare modifiers over time.
idea_6: This feature allows users to complete daily rune-letter puzzles to access special items or temporary mix effects. Friends can send emoji clues without chatting.
idea_7: This feature enables 1v1 and 3v3 matches where teams have 90 seconds to create brews using shared ingredients. Seasonal ladders offer cosmetic rewards.
idea_8: This feature allows you to change creatures’ outfits, hairstyles, and accessories, create cauldron and wand skins from materials, and add visual auras and emotes using set bonuses.
idea_9: This feature lets users set and change heat and stirring levels, track progress via a widget or wearable, get optional alerts, and schedule sessions with automatic cooldowns.
idea_10: This feature provides simplified controls, disables spending, sets session timers, and includes tools to manage shared designs, moderate comments, and handle profiles with optional parent approval.

idea_1: This feature allows you to grow a garden where weather and celestial events affect plant growth and mutations. You can also cross-pollinate plants to produce new ingredients.
idea_2: This feature lets 3–5 players take turns adding ingredients or techniques at different times, influencing the result and producing unique creatures with shared rewards.
idea_3: This feature allows users to draw runes in the air or scan nearby colors and textures to create reagents. Specific rune patterns unlock recipe tags.
idea_4: This feature lets users create and share recipe templates with adjustable settings, trade them in a marketplace, and earn cosmetic items, currency, and reputation.
idea_5: This feature lets users adjust heat, stirring speed and direction, and rhythm taps during rituals to apply trait modifiers automatically.
idea_6: This feature lets users link cauldrons in order so the output from one goes into the next, adjusting settings based on set conditions to produce specific traits.
idea_7: This feature allows users to place familiars in habitats where they generate reagents and buffs over time. Combining specific species activates habitat abilities and speeds up production.
idea_8: This feature offers spirit contracts that apply specific restrictions, like no heat or no lunar herbs, for a limited time to modify certain results.
idea_9: This feature runs constellation crafting seasons where star shards from brews activate puzzle nodes. Completing constellations unlocks a seasonal mythical variant and community milestones.
idea_10: This feature analyzes brewing attempts to display trait probabilities, identify missing rune types, and indicate heat or timing sensitivity after failures.

idea_1: This feature allows players to jump on rhythm-activated pads and rails to perform midair tricks that increase combo multipliers and unlock trick-related cosmetics by taking different paths.
idea_2: This feature allows users to collect daily Beat Coupons from chests or events, which are automatically applied at checkout and can be shared for group discounts during sales.
idea_3: This feature allows you to play short one-thumb sessions to earn small rewards and try new tracks, with an optional idle mode that automatically gains experience points.
idea_4: This feature allows you to record a 5–15 second rhythm by humming or beatboxing and generates a playable level from the recording. You can share the level with others.
idea_5: This feature lets users choose style packs and accessibility options like high contrast, color-blind modes, reduced motion, and dyslexia-friendly fonts without changing gameplay.
idea_6: This feature lets you import audio files and play them offline with beat mapping, an equalizer, and a visualizer that changes according to each track.
idea_7: This feature automatically records important moments as vertical clips with beat-synced edits, lets users add a selfie overlay with frames and stickers, and supports easy sharing.
idea_8: This feature adjusts the music according to your performance, increasing brightness with correct notes and adding effects such as glitches when notes are missed.
idea_9: This feature allows you to schedule timed gigs at city venues, displays their difficulty, rewards, and modifiers, and recommends an efficient route based on your goals and available time.
idea_10: This feature shows the price clearly, includes a countdown timer, sends two reminders before charging, and lets users cancel or change subscription tiers with visible pro-rating.

idea_1: This feature generates a beatmap from a selected song, adjusts the start and end to fit patterns, and allows users to change note density, obstacle difficulty, and tempo without altering pitch.
idea_2: This feature lets two players play simultaneously, coordinating actions to open gates, unlock paths, and share a lifebar and combo system.
idea_3: This feature changes chart density, effects, and lane speed during gameplay based on player accuracy and optional heart-rate data, adjusting difficulty without pausing the game.
idea_4: This feature offers a touch-based studio with snap, phrase detection, and gap filling, plus a moderated marketplace where creators earn tips and XP, and players add verified charts to playlists.
idea_5: This feature provides weekly boss remix battles that change songs with key shifts, stutter edits, and tempo changes, displaying mechanics visually. Winning unlocks effects and trails.
idea_6: This feature assigns distinct vibrations and 3D audio locations to kicks, snares, and leads, allowing users to recognize sounds and track timing without looking.
idea_7: This feature displays a virtual highway on a flat surface and lets you steer by moving your phone. It also enables multiple users to race together in shared augmented reality spaces.
idea_8: This feature connects smart lights on the local network to change colors and timing based on lane colors and drop moments, using album art and adjusting brightness at night.
idea_9: This feature saves runs, shows heatmaps of missed areas, creates short practice loops, and allows users to compete against their previous runs to track accuracy and scores.
idea_10: This feature allows you to build districts on a city grid that provide passive bonuses and genre-based quests. Connected friends’ cities enable cooperative challenges and shared benefits.

idea_1: This Feature lets the player use trampolines, wall-runs, and obstacles to perform jumps, swings, and flips, which increase scores and unlock finishers and cosmetics.
idea_2: This feature lets users choose and apply coupons before missions, which are automatically used at checkout for discounts, extra retries, gadget rentals, and daily deals.
idea_3: This feature lets users record 10-second voice memos that are transcribed into captions and shared as hints on levels. Users can also follow popular memo routes.
idea_4: This feature offers a sandbox mode with audio and haptic feedback, no timers or enemies, optional eye-care reminders, and a Kids Mode with simplified physics for motor skill practice.
idea_5: This feature lets users record the last 15–30 seconds of gameplay with voice, trim the clip, export it as a GIF or video, and add stickers, filters, and overlays.
idea_6: This feature lets users pick missions from a city map, see related hazards and rewards, select equipment beforehand, and plan routes to reduce travel time and trigger bonus encounters.
idea_7: This feature provides 24-hour free trials with countdown timers and cancellation options, challenge checklists for qualification, and suit upgrades unlocked by milestone payments using hero credits.
idea_8: This feature lets users turn on overlays showing swing distances, anchor angles, and capture radii, and displays path heatmaps along with suggested anchor points.
idea_9: This feature synchronizes swings and attacks with music from local MP3/AAC files, enables quick loop recording, and creates combo tiers by maintaining timing with the beat.
idea_10: This feature allows players to connect letters on an 11×11 grid to form words, which unlock access and provide bonuses for the next combat phase.

idea_1: This feature lets players create webs by connecting two or three points to form lines, nets, or trampolines, and adjust launch power using multi-touch controls.
idea_2: This feature adds a meter that tracks performed tricks, granting speed boosts and score multipliers, which reset when a trick fails or the player hits a hazard.
idea_3: This feature introduces a free-swing mode with random events like robberies, fires, and drone chases. Players can connect events and participate in time-based leaderboards.
idea_4: This feature lets players create cartridges with various modifiers, equip a three-slot loadout, and complete optional level objectives related to each web type.
idea_5: This feature enables asynchronous races against friends and global players, offers instant replays and heatmaps, and displays a translucent route overlay after several attempts to show optimal paths.
idea_6: This feature allows users to create levels using touch controls with movable elements, hazards, platforms, and win conditions, share levels via short codes, and access a weekly playlist.
idea_7: This feature lets users set up rescue challenges by placing support webs to stabilize structures or crowds within a time limit, with scoring based on tension, anchors, and casualties.
idea_8: This feature enables creating multi-phase bosses that require attaching tethers to specific limbs and using yank, swing-throw, and web actions to break shields and complete phases.
idea_9: This feature offers controls and accessibility options such as one-hand mode, aim assist, long-press reel-in, tap-to-detach, haptic feedback, colorblind-safe highlights, and adjustable motion intensity.
idea_10: This feature adds puzzles where conductive webs connect power nodes to open gates, and insulating foam webs block currents. Levels support multiple solutions.

idea_1: This feature allows users to tap tiles in a pattern to combine colors, textures, and patterns for a room, displaying selected options in AR and providing rewards.
idea_2: This feature stores order details such as receipts, manuals, warranty cards, videos, and service logs. Users can search by room, material, or size and export receipts.
idea_3: This feature lets users sell or trade in eligible past purchases by providing instant price estimates, prepaid pickup labels, and payment through Wayfair Credit or bank transfer.
idea_4: This feature lets users create a shared gift wallet where multiple people add funds, which are converted into store credit for use during checkout.
idea_5: This feature offers Ultra-HD product videos with adjustable quality and preloading, plus an AR tool to change lighting, shadows, and texture for room visualization.
idea_6: This feature analyzes floor plans or room photos to create layouts, generate shopping lists and budgets, estimate assembly time, schedule installers, and manage receipts and returns.
idea_7: This feature lets users share rooms and wishlists, create polls, and shop together with synchronized carts during live calls, while managing privacy and content settings.
idea_8: This feature allows you to scan a photo or QR code to filter the catalog by color, material, shape, and brand, and save these filter settings for future use.
idea_9: This feature displays a map of nearby showrooms, pickup spots, and service professionals with availability and ratings. Users can book appointments, get directions, or select contactless pickup.
idea_10: This feature allows users to create a room bundle by choosing a base style and adding items such as lighting, rugs, art, and storage, with price and delivery updates.

idea_1: This feature uses a video scan to measure doorways, elevators, stairs, and turns, verifies if items can pass through, and provides alternative options or delivery methods when necessary.
idea_2: This feature displays nearby open-box and gently used items with photos and updated prices, offering options for same-day pickup or delivery. Filters include style and home measurements.
idea_3: This feature shows part placement using AR, identifies screws by shape, highlights orientation mistakes, connects to Bluetooth tools for step progress, and estimates remaining time.
idea_4: This feature allows users to upload a photo or enter a past order to find exact spare parts and provides 3D-printed replacements with next-day shipping for certain items.
idea_5: This feature shows trade-in values for eligible items, lets users schedule pickups, and provides Wayfair credit based on item condition and local demand.
idea_6: This feature lets users create shared boards with voting, set room budgets, suggest compromise options, track payments, and split costs during checkout.
idea_7: This feature scans a room to create a scaled model and offers multiple furniture layout options with grouped items, updating bundle prices when pieces are changed.
idea_8: This feature uses supplier data and seasonality to predict price changes, restocks, and shipping delays, offers optional price locks, and suggests similar available items when risks increase.
idea_9: This feature allows you to use your camera to see fabrics and finishes in your home’s lighting and wall colors, including how materials might change over time.
idea_10: This feature sends cleaning and maintenance reminders by material, enables reordering of care kits and parts, stores receipts and warranties, and provides safety or recall alerts.

idea_1: This feature offers daily challenges for users to complete together, tracks their progress with streaks, and shows animations with motion and break reminders on a shared widget.
idea_2: This feature allows users to record voice notes on the Lock Screen, automatically transcribes them, shows emoji summaries, and provides controls to pause, resume, and reply within the widget.
idea_3: This feature records short ambient sounds with noise reduction, sends them as looping clips on the widget until both users respond, and can create a monthly sound diary.
idea_4: This feature displays nearby coupons selected by both users, provides access to checkout links, tracks monthly savings, and offers suggestions for sharing costs.
idea_5: This feature allows two users to record and combine sounds into a 10-second loop on the widget, which can be exported as a ringtone or shared to stories.
idea_6: This feature offers a shared virtual aquarium for two users to maintain together, unlocking decorations and effects as both check in, with idle progress and sound effects.
idea_7: This feature allows users to take selfies remotely at the same time, merge them into split images with matching effects, and create custom stickers from templates.
idea_8: This feature creates checklists for events with progress bars on the widget and provides shared budgets with monthly target suggestions to help manage expenses.
idea_9: This feature finds the midpoint between two locations, displays travel times and nearby places, and lets users send directions to both with a single tap.
idea_10: This feature shows subscription information such as trial period, next payment date, and cancellation options, displays partner sharing status, and provides occasional stickers and seasonal bundles.

idea_1: This feature allows two users to choose a color and brightness that updates both home screen bubbles instantly. An optional mode changes colors based on recent activity.
idea_2: This feature allows users to upload a photo, note, or gift card that is gradually uncovered through tiles over time or by completing shared mini-tasks.
idea_3: This feature allows two users to create shared tasks, monitor progress with checkmarks and a countdown timer, and unlock animations and badges upon completion.
idea_4: This feature shows shared locations on a map, sends notifications when users are nearby, and lets users send virtual postcards for others to view later.
idea_5: This feature displays the next three overlapping time periods from both calendars and sleep preferences, enabling users to propose or accept calls with one tap and receive automatic reminders.
idea_6: This feature connects 1–3 small habits (water, steps, reading) between two or three users, showing streaks side-by-side and a meter to track balance.
idea_7: This feature tracks shared contributions and extra amounts toward a date or trip goal, shows progress and estimated completion, and offers planning checklists at important points.
idea_8: This feature allows a user to tap “need space” to start a timer, show a breathing guide, display a personalized checklist, and prompt sending a repair message or voice note.
idea_9: This feature allows users to share their battery and network status with each other (opt-in) and recommends low-power chat options when battery or signal is low.
idea_10: This feature displays a meter that fills as users are physically closer or have overlapping awake and free times, with optional notifications.

idea_1: This Feature allows you to use gestures to perform dips, spins, and flips, combine moves, avoid obstacles, and increase crackle effects by keeping streaks going.
idea_2: This feature displays time-limited discounts on ingredient packs, skins, and sound sets, applies them automatically at checkout, and allows users to earn extra coupons by completing daily tasks.
idea_3: This feature allows you to record whisper notes or role-play intros, combine them with crunch sounds, and export the mixed audio as a short ASMR clip.
idea_4: This feature measures microphone levels, background noise, and sugar timing before a session, offers adjustment suggestions, and calculates an estimated crunch score.
idea_5: This feature allows you to schedule travel-cart sessions to virtual festivals with different fruits, sounds, and challenges, and book routes on a calendar to earn rewards.
idea_6: This feature displays a meter that measures glaze thickness and spacing on the skewer, predicts cracking, and provides an overlay guide to help keep spacing even.
idea_7: This feature records clear audio with external microphones, reduces background noise, provides a quick-record option, and lets you record while using other parts of the app.
idea_8: This feature allows users to create repeating sound loops from drips, snaps, and crunches, add whisper or tapping layers, and share their mixes as templates.
idea_9: This Feature lets you place fruits and toppings accurately with snap-to-surface controls, shows a balance meter for stability, and records slow-motion drizzle videos with macro filters.
idea_10: This feature allows you to collect flavor and topping cards, create sound decks, and join timed board challenges where card combinations alter taste descriptions and sounds.

idea_1: This feature allows users to adjust sound settings such as EQ, sharpness, and vibrations through hearing calibration and save multiple profiles for different devices and times.
idea_2: This feature uses the microphone to detect blowing, humming, and tongue-clicking sounds to control sugar physics and interact with the game without menus.
idea_3: This feature adds an AR vendor mode that shows a virtual cart with characters ordering combos you make, letting you record and share mixed-reality mukbang videos.
idea_4: This feature connects sugar cracking stages to local temperature and humidity, adjusts difficulty accordingly, and provides optional timing suggestions for use in humid conditions.
idea_5: This feature lets two players join a co-op session where one prepares the mukbang and the other eats it together in real-time with safety controls.
idea_6: This feature converts sounds such as snap, crackle, and chew into vibration patterns and offers optional on-screen captions for users to follow along.
idea_7: This feature allows players to create fruit stack recipes, flavored glazes, and layered sounds, share them as remixable packs, and earn coins from downloads and challenges.
idea_8: This feature generates moving crystal patterns based on bite sounds and lets users save them as stickers, wallpapers, or social media posts.
idea_9: This feature uses the device's gyroscope to control skewer movements, enabling users to twirl, tilt, and manage dripping with corresponding visual and sound effects.
idea_10: This feature allows users to take three photos of fruit to create a basic 3D model and estimate its crispness for recipes, AR scenes, and co-op sessions.

idea_1: This feature allows players to mark consecutive calls quickly to increase a multiplier for all active cards, with options to skip calls and use power-ups to maintain the multiplier.
idea_2: This feature displays a Zen Aquarium between rounds where players can tap fish and decorate the tank to earn small rewards and collect items for cosmetic frames.
idea_3: This feature allows players to collect and save digital coupons that grant bonuses such as extra coins or double experience, which are applied automatically during purchases or game rounds.
idea_4: This feature records a 10-second video when you call Bingo and lets you add a voice reaction or selfie before saving or sharing the clip.
idea_5: This feature lets clubs join rooms to complete bingo patterns that break bosses' shields, activate effects, and unlock power-ups and trophies.
idea_6: This feature displays live odds and coverage for the target pattern on your cards, highlights key areas, and allows you to simulate power-up use before choosing.
idea_7: This feature lets players send voice notes and use audio chat with transcription and translation. Messages pause during number calls and resume playback afterward.
idea_8: This feature links bingo rooms with various themes and rules, lets players collect souvenirs, see upcoming rooms, and reserve seats in rooms with limited availability.
idea_9: This feature occasionally unlocks 3D scenes on bingo cards where marking certain numbers reveals interactive elements and stories. Completing sets grants lobby items and daub trails.
idea_10: This feature includes session timers, break reminders with small rewards, a monthly budget tracker with optional limits and alerts, and a Guardian profile for parental controls.

idea_1: This feature allows players to join 10-person rounds where they play bingo against a shared boss by marking called numbers to lower its health and use team abilities.
idea_2: This feature allows players to make predictions before each round. Correct guesses reward chips, boosts, or jackpot entries without changing the game’s base odds.
idea_3: This feature lets you use earned pips to lock up to two numbers or affect one column in the next game, with restrictions to ensure fairness.
