idea_6: This feature merges sections from different songs by matching key and tempo, creates seamless transitions, adjusts difficulty levels, and enables playing and exporting the combined track.
idea_7: This feature lets 2–4 players join a room to play different parts of a song together, sharing a life bar and rotating roles during the game.
idea_8: This feature lets users slide fingers for glissando, hold notes to sustain them, and use phone tilt or a thumb pedal to apply damper effects during play.
idea_9: This feature sometimes mutes tiles and asks you to select or sing the correct pitch or interval to continue. It can be turned on at any difficulty level.
idea_10: This feature generates short loops of sections you missed, schedules them for repeated practice with gradually increasing speed, and shows a heatmap of your confidence across the song.

idea_1: This feature offers step-by-step lessons, short exercises, and AI feedback to help users practice design skills and unlock tools by earning badges.
idea_2: This feature lets users share watch face suggestions, see what their contacts are wearing, join playlists automatically, and earn credits by referring others.
idea_3: This feature allows users to create watch face playlists that change automatically based on time, location, or mood, with offline storage and tap controls to skip, like, or block faces.
idea_4: This feature detects when you are traveling and automatically changes the watch face to show flight details, boarding pass QR code, local time, weather forecasts, and severe weather alerts.
idea_5: This feature displays ambient noise levels in decibels, provides vibration alerts for high noise, and includes quick controls for phone hearing assist and earbud transparency settings.
idea_6: This feature records activities such as wearing watch faces, submitting feedback, and publishing designs to accumulate points that can be redeemed for premium packs or gift cards. Seasonal challenges and streaks provide additional points.
idea_7: This feature shows a local feed of popular watch faces nearby and allows users to connect with creators in their area. It also displays verification badges.
idea_8: This feature allows users to filter watch faces by readability, battery use, complication count, style, and color, preview changes live, customize complications by dragging, and share or install faces with QR codes.
idea_9: This feature imports SVG, PSD, PNG, Lottie JSON, and GIF files, converts them into watch-compatible vectors and frames, and exports them in formats for Wear OS and Apple Watch.
idea_10: This feature adds small interactive elements and virtual pets to some watch faces, which use little power and enable unlocking themes or making coin donations.

idea_1: This feature changes the watch face layout and information automatically based on activities like commuting, meetings, workouts, or sleep using calendar, location, and motion data.
idea_2: This feature allows users to blend two watch faces by moving a slider that mixes their layouts, colors, and complications instantly. Creators can activate this option.
idea_3: This feature lets you create vibration patterns for watch face events, adjust vibration strength, and set specific times when notifications are silenced.
idea_4: This feature adds a scrollable stack of small widgets to the watch face, enabling navigation by crown or swipe and showing information related to time and user activity.
idea_5: This feature changes animations, refresh rates, and brightness to extend battery life until a chosen time and displays an estimated battery usage preview.
idea_6: This feature lets you take a photo to create a watch face using its colors and textures, and enables daily switching between saved designs with one tap.
idea_7: This feature lets multiple designers edit a watch face simultaneously with version control and comments, and provides usage data such as retention, tap heatmaps, and battery impact.
idea_8: This feature allows users to activate phone automations such as Shortcuts, Tasker, or IFTTT by tapping, double-tapping, or pressing the crown on watch face elements.
idea_9: This feature connects watch faces to services like Notion and Strava without coding, displaying data on the watch while managing information access through permission settings.
idea_10: This feature changes the watch face based on calendar events or location, displaying related information for concerts, flights, or games, then returns to the previous watch face.

idea_1: This feature allows users to watch live sports games as they happen, providing real-time access to ongoing events on the FOX Sports platform.
idea_2: This feature allows users to rate commentators, camera packages, and other elements after each stream, write brief reviews, and see top-rated options in a public review section.
idea_3: This feature lets users add and control overlays like stats, player trackers, and commentary during live games, and save their settings for future use.
idea_4: This feature allows you to watch live games, earn points through predictions and mini-games, and use those points for rewards or donations during events.
idea_5: This feature allows you to select video feeds, audio options, and data layers to create and save custom streams that can be used for any live game.
idea_6: This feature lets you watch live games, download condensed games, highlights, and podcasts for offline use, and saves key moments to continue if the stream stops.
idea_7: This feature provides official review results, rule explanations, and game updates. Users can receive alerts for selected teams or specific events such as challenges or penalties.
idea_8: This feature allows users to adjust audio settings, use hearing-aid presets, and view live captions with speaker labels, larger fonts, and high-contrast display options.
idea_9: This feature allows you to find nearby watch parties with verified hosts using distance filters. You can join parties with a code or link and access location-based trivia and rewards.
idea_10: This feature sends alerts about rain delays, lightning holds, air quality, travel impacts, safety notices, schedule changes, and viewing options for your teams and venues.

idea_1: This feature allows you to start watching a live game late by viewing a brief sequence of key plays to catch up, with the option to expand any part without losing your place.
idea_2: This feature hides scores, images, and notifications until you choose to view them and lets you share links that reflect each viewer’s settings.
idea_3: This feature displays live player data such as speeds, heatmaps, and win probability on your phone during a game, with options to pin player cards and use split view.
idea_4: This feature allows you to listen to different audio options such as home and away radio, TV commentary, and crowd noise, switch languages easily, and see live captions.
idea_5: This feature allows users to watch live games together by syncing streams, showing viewers, enabling emojis and polls, and delaying reactions to prevent spoilers.
idea_6: This feature allows users to make predictions during live games, earn points and badges, view team leaderboards, and access extra camera angles or fewer ads.
idea_7: This Feature shows a vertical video of live games that automatically focuses on the ball and main action, includes vibration alerts for key plays, and supports pinch-to-zoom.
idea_8: This feature provides short video highlights of chosen teams, players, and important moments, with an optional coach’s analysis overlay, available for viewing and sharing.
idea_9: This Feature allows users to watch sports games live on their devices as the events occur in real time.
idea_10: This feature allows you to control a live game on your phone while casting, including changing cameras, adjusting audio, viewing statistics, and switching between games.

idea_1: This feature allows you to practice making burgers, wraps, and drinks with step-by-step instructions, earn badges for progress, and order your saved creations with bonus points.
idea_2: This feature offers music, mini games, and AR stickers for children to use during car rides or drive-thru waits, while earning Rewards points and unlocking designs.
idea_3: This Feature lets friends add customized items to a shared order from different locations, with options for splitting payment and receiving referral rewards after pickup.
idea_4: This feature allows users to rate their order with emojis and short notes, sends reported issues to the correct restaurant, and displays common feedback to nearby customers.
idea_5: This feature is a tap game where users interact with Frosty swirls and nugget dunking to earn points or sweepstakes tickets, which can be donated to local causes.
idea_6: This Feature saves menus, deals, and frequent orders for offline use, queues orders without a connection, submits them when online, and applies compensation if checkout fails.
idea_7: This feature lets users place and modify orders with voice commands, translates languages in real time, and verifies allergens and customizations before payment.
idea_8: This feature allows users to raise spice levels over time, unlock sauces and badges, and share progress or invite a friend for a two-person challenge with rewards.
idea_9: This Feature tracks your flavor and dietary preferences, then suggests nearby limited items and alternatives. It filters options by spice, protein, calories, and price, adjusting suggestions based on time and weather.
idea_10: This feature links your order to a QR code and optional license plate recognition to help staff identify and complete your drive-thru or curbside pickup.

idea_1: This feature changes food preparation time based on your arrival, updates with traffic conditions, and lets you start your order quickly with one tap.
idea_2: This feature detects your license plate or Bluetooth to recognize your mobile order at the drive-thru and automatically completes the payment for faster processing.
idea_3: This feature shows Wendy’s locations on your route and changes your order to a different store if needed, while keeping your customizations and rewards.
idea_4: This feature displays the current kitchen queue, your place in line, estimated pickup times, and allows you to choose between Rush, Standard, or Extra-Hot freshness options.
idea_5: This feature displays the current availability and age of Frosty and fries, lets users request a fresh batch, and shows an estimated wait time.
idea_6: This feature lets several users add items to one order, splits the payment automatically, and arranges labeled bags for curbside or drive-thru pickup.
idea_7: This feature allows users to select allergens, spice preferences, and disliked ingredients. It hides unsafe menu items, suggests alternatives, and provides cross-contact information before checkout.
idea_8: This feature generates kitchen instructions from custom orders, calculates price and nutrition, enables saving and sharing orders, and can highlight popular items for a limited time.
idea_9: This feature records utensil and napkin choices, shows estimated packaging impact for each order, gives points for low-waste options, and requests no extra bags.
idea_10: This feature offers fixed-price options for breakfast coffee, weekly fries, or kid’s meal bundles, and includes streak challenges that unlock surprise upgrades.

idea_1: This feature adds coastline parkour and cliff-diving courses with trick combos and momentum scores, plus seasonal leaderboards and community ghost runs for challenges.
idea_2: This feature allows you to record voice memos that are transcribed and saved in your survival journal, linked to map locations or objects, with sharing or privacy options.
idea_3: This feature adds vehicle traders and rental depots for buggies and boats, provides financing and lease options, and includes a navigator showing nearby availability and upgrade listings.
idea_4: This feature displays distance and area on the map with terrain details, outlines bases, farms, and docks, and calculates materials, work time, and weight for routes and ferries.
idea_5: This feature lets users place objects precisely using snap-to-surface, grid, angle settings, edge alignment, fine adjustments, multi-select move and rotate, and save placement presets.
idea_6: This feature lets you place and view buildings and furniture without using resources, confirm placement with one tap, and recover materials if items are removed shortly after.
idea_7: This feature lets players publish, rate, and import structures and vehicles with resource lists, and share blueprints across devices and co-op worlds using a crew system.
idea_8: This feature allows players to collect stone letter tiles near ruins to complete crossword puzzles that unlock map locations, story information, and recipes. It works in solo and co-op modes.
idea_9: This feature allows you to design custom flags, sails, and signs using layered tools and export decals to apply on boats, gates, crates, and boards.
idea_10: This feature lets players craft a hang-glider or wingsuit, glide using thermal updrafts, and use luminous paints and glass beacons for navigation in dark areas.

idea_1: This feature adds changing tides and currents that affect roads and beaches. Players use tide charts to plan deliveries and operate a ferry carrying NPCs and vehicles.
idea_2: This feature allows players to own and manage shops like cafes, bait stores, or repair garages, including setting prices, handling stock, serving customers, and managing staff.
idea_3: This feature tracks an island Eco Index based on activities such as fishing, driving, littering, and construction. Players complete tasks to earn permits, tax breaks, and grants.
idea_4: This feature gives storm forecasts via radio updates and a live hurricane tracker. Players prepare buildings before storms and perform repairs, cleanup, and relief tasks afterward.
idea_5: This feature lets players pursue a diving career by earning certifications to explore deeper areas, take photos, collect items, harvest pearls, and upgrade equipment safely.
idea_6: This feature lets players build and customize homes with plumbing and power, add solar or wind energy, manage bills, and rent rooms or properties to NPCs.
idea_7: This feature lets players contribute materials or money and vote on community projects like road repairs, clinic upgrades, and pier expansions to improve island services.
idea_8: This feature manages a seasonal calendar with events such as regattas, surf contests, night markets, and harvest fairs, including mini-games, recipes, cosmetics, economy changes, and visitor patterns.
idea_9: This feature lets players modify vehicles and boats by changing engines, prop pitch, suspension, and tires, and handle maintenance, emissions, and roadside assistance.
idea_10: This feature lets players share building designs, shop layouts, and photo spots with codes, receive items and feedback from friends, and join weekly design challenges.

idea_1: This feature reviews your parking history and local rules to suggest affordable zones, optimal parking times, reminders for restrictions, and alerts about monthly permit options.
idea_2: This feature sends alerts through hearing aids, car audio, visual timers, vibrations, and smart devices to notify users when their parking time is about to expire or has expired.
idea_3: This feature automatically extends parking sessions when time expires and allows one overstay forgiveness per month. It includes a 30-day free trial before subscription.
idea_4: This feature allows you to start or extend parking without a signal by using saved zone maps and payment details, then provides a QR receipt and syncs when online.
idea_5: This feature lets users share vehicles, set spending limits, create teen sub-accounts with location approvals, send notifications, and allow teens to request parking extensions.
idea_6: This feature lets users rate parking zones on sign clarity, safety, and enforcement, upload photos of signs, and get warnings based on machine-read parking restrictions.
idea_7: This feature suggests covered parking during rain or heat, avoids snow-emergency routes, recommends longer sessions in storms, and shows temporary closures and event-related parking changes.
idea_8: This feature uses your camera to capture zone numbers and license plates, allows voice input, and provides suggestions based on GPS, recent activity, and nearby signs.
idea_9: This feature allows users to earn points by keeping parking streaks, referring others, and reporting issues, which can be exchanged for parking credit, transit passes, or donations.
idea_10: This feature lets users add services such as EV charging, car wash, or valet pickup to their parking session, managing payment and scheduling in one process.

idea_1: This feature ends your parking session when the app detects your car has left using phone sensors or Bluetooth and refunds or credits any unused time if possible.
idea_2: This feature uses your camera to read curb signs, displays current parking rules and allowed times, and shows nearby legal parking spots with augmented reality overlays.
idea_3: This feature shows current parking availability and ticket risk for each block, and offers suggestions based on price, availability, and walking distance.
idea_4: This feature allows you to locate and reserve EV chargers, pay for charging and parking in one transaction, switch to idle-fee pricing when chargers are full, and get notifications about spot availability.
idea_5: This feature sends alerts when your street changes to restricted parking and allows you to move your parking to a nearby legal spot with one tap.
idea_6: This feature helps you find a parking spot by showing availability, price, walking time, and the total time and cost for your trip.
idea_7: This feature lets users transfer unused paid parking time to nearby drivers in the same zone or convert it into wallet credit, where permitted by policy.
idea_8: This feature locates accessible parking bays, curb ramps, and sidewalks, offers voice guidance and high-contrast controls, and applies Blue Badge exemptions automatically when eligible.
idea_9: This feature allows you to scan a parking ticket to locate it in your session history, pay or contest it with pre-filled forms, and monitor case status with reminders.
idea_10: This feature detects your parking zone and stall using location or car signals, fills parking time from your calendar, and lets you verify payment without internet.

idea_1: This feature creates practice sessions from episodes with prompts, quizzes, and note-to-flashcard tools, tracks progress, and sends reminders to practice.
idea_2: This feature connects to your calendar or route, creates an offline playlist based on travel time, includes shows related to your destination, and adjusts notifications to the local time zone.
idea_3: This feature sends alerts for news topics you follow, offers a short audio summary, and provides an updated list of related episodes you can pause or prioritize.
idea_4: This feature quickly analyzes and adjusts audio by enhancing dialogue, equalizing sound, and compressing volume to improve voice clarity on earbuds.
idea_5: This feature offers a kid-safe mode with large controls, selected shows, voice commands, autoplay for car rides, parental time limits, and individual profiles for siblings.
idea_6: This feature offers a plugin marketplace where users can install and remove themes, playback effects, chapters, dubbing, and automation with defined permission settings.
idea_7: This feature lets listeners add time-stamped comments and highlights, and the player can automatically jump to popular parts or skip sections with low ratings.
idea_8: This feature lets you filter transcripts by speakers, topics, keywords, and durations, create playlists from these filters, and share them via links or QR codes.
idea_9: This feature allows users to subscribe, use playlists, or access member feeds by entering numeric or QR codes, functioning offline and supporting voice input while driving.
idea_10: This feature allows users to try premium episodes from various publishers for a limited time with one account, centralized billing, and an easy cancellation option.

idea_1: This feature shows a topic map with people, places, and themes along the episode timeline. Users can tap to jump to points or long-press for chapter markers and related segments.
idea_2: This feature lets you ask questions about episodes or your library, gives time-stamped answers with short audio clips, and allows bookmarking and creating flashcards.
idea_3: This feature shortens episodes by skipping less important parts and changing playback speed to fit your available time, with an option to restore the full episode later.
idea_4: This feature lets users share their listening progress, add time-stamped comments, reactions, and polls, and allows hosts to hold live Q&A sessions with pinned answers.
idea_5: This feature identifies sponsor messages in podcasts and lets you skip, shorten, or save them. It shows detection accuracy and allows user corrections.
idea_6: This feature translates and plays AI-dubbed audio in your language, keeps the speaker’s voice, and shows a dual-language transcript with an optional bilingual mode.
idea_7: This feature lets you clip parts of podcasts and automatically finds related items, such as books, guest profiles, maps, or reminders connected to that clip.
idea_8: This feature connects topics, guests, and references from podcasts, finds missing content, suggests related segments, and creates a combined reel of relevant moments for review.
idea_9: This feature identifies repeated intros, outros, and recap segments in episodes and automatically skips them, allowing you to tap and restore the skipped sections if desired.
idea_10: This feature organizes podcast segments into courses with goals, quizzes based on transcripts, review reminders, and syncs progress and notifications to your calendar.

idea_1: This feature offers a daily puzzle where players choose gear, brake point, and entry speed for a corner, then receive color feedback and rewards based on accuracy.
idea_2: This feature lets players download event packs for offline use, including a street circuit, challenges, and temporary access to premium cars for testing.
idea_3: This feature lets users create car designs by generating liveries from images or pixel art, apply effects, use a painting tool, and share style presets.
idea_4: This feature adds crowds, a DJ, and rival voices that respond to driving, offer temporary boosts, and enable dialogue choices affecting reputation and event access.
idea_5: This feature records the last 30 seconds of gameplay from multiple camera angles with voiceover, syncs the footage to music, and adds overlays and audio notes after the race.
idea_6: This feature lets players adjust engine warm-up, revving, nitrous purging, tire pressure, lights, and horn from the lobby, influencing launch grip and turbo lag.
idea_7: This feature offers short exercises to improve reaction time, memory of racing lines, and gear selection, while tracking progress and unlocking practice drills and small race rewards.
idea_8: This feature lets players build a garage with themed decorations and animated items that slightly increase repair speed. Friends can visit, like, tip, and bid on decorations.
idea_9: This feature provides a Sprint mode on city tracks with moving barriers, jump pads, and slide gates, enabling players to perform drifts, jumps, and wall-taps to earn points.
idea_10: This feature allows players to schedule race challenges with others, sends notifications, organizes race lineups, applies bonus multipliers for on-time starts, and tracks progress in ranked arenas.

idea_1: This feature lets players take control of rival crew territories by winning district raids, unlocking local advantages, while rival crews can launch ambushes that alter map conditions.
idea_2: This feature monitors police awareness of your car’s plates, wraps, and damage after races. You can change plates, apply kits, or switch cars at safehouses to reduce detection.
idea_3: This feature lets players create street race contracts by selecting templates and setting options such as route, time limit, damage limit, rewards, and visibility.
idea_4: This feature lets a friend control map actions such as flipping lights, jamming police, and opening shortcuts, with limited uses and cooldown times.
idea_5: This feature adds random city events such as burst hydrants, parades, roadworks, and stalled buses that create obstacles and shortcuts, with a live ticker displaying upcoming events.
idea_6: This feature adds optional tasks during races, like collecting items or driving through certain zones, which grant rewards but also raise police alert levels.
idea_7: This feature lets teammates race near each other to fill a shared meter by drafting, swapping leads, and chaining drifts, which triggers a team boost when maintained.
idea_8: This feature generates AI opponents using your best runs that appear in other players’ cities, replicating your driving patterns. Defeating them updates a leaderboard and sends a message.
idea_9: This feature allows spectators to control drone cameras that show shortcuts, mark traffic hazards, and trigger photo moments, enabling drivers to earn fan experience through interaction.
idea_10: This feature automatically generates 10–20 second highlight videos and recommends better racing lines after each event. Players can follow these lines as ghost routes and credit the original driver.

idea_1: This feature provides idle tap-toy scenes with click loops, particle effects, and customizable aquariums or gardens, including soft haptics and ASMR sounds for use between game levels.
idea_2: This feature offers daily short lessons and practice drills in art, level design, and logic blocks. Users complete 5-minute challenges, get tips, and earn badges.
idea_3: This feature lets players earn and use Creator Coupons to get discounts on asset packs, publish boosts, or templates during jams, and creators can give coupons to testers.
idea_4: This feature offers a Trend Radar that predicts best release times and potential players, sends alerts for increasing game activity, shows hourly regional forecasts, and suggests ways to improve retention.
idea_5: This feature adds a Kids Playlist Mode that includes themed collections, large controls, auto-play, content filters, and the ability to pre-download playlists for offline use.
idea_6: This feature shows in-game review cards with emoji ratings and optional voice notes for fun, difficulty, and bugs, then summarizes feedback and action items for creators.
idea_7: This feature offers downloadable bundles of games, tutorials, and assets for offline use. Users can manage storage, prioritize favorites, and access content without internet connection.
idea_8: This feature allows users to save game filters, share them via QR codes or links, and automatically generate a rotating Daily Mix playlist.
idea_9: This feature allows users to record or import audio, add preset sound effects, combine multiple tracks, listen to sounds in scenes, and save them to their library.
idea_10: This feature creates AI enemy groups that vary by level, adjust difficulty, and coordinate actions. It includes boss templates, wave editors, and progression settings.

idea_1: This feature lets multiple users build together in real time with shared cursors and voice chat, includes object locks, and offers time-lapse replays and object history.
idea_2: This feature displays a visual history of remixes with automatic credit, allowing users to compare versions and choose specific changes to include in their own copy.
idea_3: This feature runs timed playtests that track heatmaps, deaths, quit points, and session replays, showing where problems occur and linking to related objects.
idea_4: This feature allows you to request game elements using simple language and provides matching blocks, assets, wiring, annotations, and brief lessons during the building process.
idea_5: This feature lets users place portals that connect to other creators’ worlds using shared tokens. It supports quests and leaderboards across linked worlds.
idea_6: This feature places a game world on a table using AR, allows nearby players to join synced sessions, supports device tilt and hand-tracking, and records mixed-reality clips.
idea_7: This feature lets users create cutscenes by arranging cameras, dialogue, particles, and triggers on a timeline. It also adds captions to voice lines and allows narration speed adjustment.
idea_8: This feature allows users to add generator blocks such as maze, cave, city, and platformer layouts with seeds and rules, then create different versions by tapping Remix.
idea_9: This feature allows users to pause the game by long-pressing an object to edit it, then resume play. It also displays an overlay explaining triggers and variables.
idea_10: This feature turns sketches or photos into sprites and tiles by removing backgrounds, matching colors, adding animation cues, and generating themed asset packs with source information.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons and AR-guided exercises for driving, home shutoff, and claims, tracks user progress, and provides personalized risk-reduction suggestions.
idea_2: This Feature allows users to invite friends to activate their policy or telematics and share checklists and tips to help new users understand the benefits and processes.
idea_3: This feature allows users to choose coverages, set limits and deductibles, see updated prices, and complete their purchase using e-signatures and digital cards.
idea_4: This feature allows users to read, rate, and submit feedback on body shops, contractors, rental partners, and agents connected to verified claims or service visits.
idea_5: This feature offers live captions for support calls, adjustable voice clarity, haptic alerts, and optional on-device detection of sirens and horns without sending audio to servers.
idea_6: This feature provides daily safety challenges, short quizzes, and optional driving streaks to earn points that can be donated, redeemed for gift cards, or applied as premium credits.
idea_7: This Feature offers local hazard forecasts and trip alerts with checklists and options to schedule repairs, request roadside assistance, or update garaging reminders before storms.
idea_8: This Feature provides a 30-day telematics trial to estimate discounts, a policy simulator to explore coverage options, and a limited Roadside Pass trial for new users annually.
idea_9: This feature allows users to locate nearby agents, repair shops, or contractors by distance, availability, and ratings, and enables secure chat and scheduling after both parties agree.
idea_10: This Feature offers a secure place to store photos, videos, receipts, and documents, uses OCR to identify and tag items, and extracts data to fill forms automatically.

idea_1: This feature uses AR to capture damage photos and videos, evaluates their quality and severity, and automatically schedules the earliest repair with confirmed parts.
idea_2: This feature uses an AR walkthrough to identify home items, estimate their values, link email receipts, and pre-fill ownership and depreciation information for claims.
idea_3: This feature connects your addresses and vehicles to local hail, flood, wildfire, and recall information, provides checklists, and enables supply pre-reservation and quick claim access.
idea_4: This Feature detects crashes using phone sensors, guides users with a voice checklist, offers an optional 911 call, creates a sharable QR code, and uploads crash information.
idea_5: This Feature connects to your electric vehicle or charger to show battery status, charging times, nearby repair centers, home charger coverage, and arranges flatbed towing.
idea_6: This Feature uses weather, satellite, and sensor data to assess losses after major events, provides payout estimates for simple claims, and issues funds through a virtual card.
idea_7: This Feature monitors teen driving locations and trip details, gives short lessons after risky events, and tracks safe miles that can be redeemed for rewards.
idea_8: This Feature offers a contractor marketplace showing real-time availability and lead times, enables immediate booking, in-app change order approvals, milestone photo tracking, and escrow payment until completion.
idea_9: This Feature allows you to simulate life events such as remodeling, adding a baby, or buying an EV to see coverage changes, price updates, and recommended options with set start dates.
idea_10: This Feature imports policies and warranties from other providers, detects overlaps and gaps, suggests bundle options, pre-fills cancellation and transfer forms, and sets renewal and appraisal reminders.

idea_1: This feature sends occasional simulated login prompts with unusual details, gives brief tips after each response, and privately records user confidence levels.
idea_2: This feature displays the distance to the requesting device using Bluetooth or UWB and lets admins block approvals from devices that are farther than a specified range.
idea_3: This feature offers alert tones for high-risk events, stronger vibrations, large-number matching, audio readouts of the app and location, and a mode that enhances headphone sound clarity.
idea_4: This feature lets users try passkeys, number matching, or biometric-only authentication in a separate environment that resets automatically after a set period.
idea_5: This feature lets new laptops or kiosks enroll by scanning a QR code and using a short-range wireless connection to transfer a temporary device token with limited internet.
idea_6: This feature allows users to see details such as location, device status, app icon, network, and risk score in approval prompts and supports lock-screen double-tap and smartwatch shortcuts.
idea_7: This feature detects travel or location changes, generates offline codes, adjusts time settings, and notifies users about additional security checks on new networks.
idea_8: This feature scans documents to locate backup codes, converts them into standard formats, securely stores them with biometric protection on the device, and autofills codes when offline.
idea_9: This feature shows a timeline of approval and denial events, allows searching and tagging events, offers export options, and collects feedback to help improve risk detection.
idea_10: This feature notifies you of ongoing phishing or credential-stuffing attacks in your organization or area and can temporarily apply stricter verification requirements.

idea_1: This feature uses Bluetooth or UWB to detect the phone’s proximity to the login device, displays the distance, and automatically adjusts approval based on that distance.
idea_2: This feature displays information about each prompt, such as app, URL, device name, browser, and location, uses colors to identify devices, and enables quick reporting of suspicious activity.
idea_3: This feature lets users scan a QR code, approve the sign-in on their device, and send a code or QR back to complete login without using a network or SMS.
idea_4: This feature creates a temporary trusted session for selected apps after verification, displays a countdown timer, allows access to be revoked, and limits repeated notification prompts.
idea_5: This feature detects when a user is traveling or in a new country, adjusts security settings by increasing challenges, hiding sensitive information, disabling weaker factors, and allows quick toggling for planned trips.
idea_6: This feature lets users recover Okta Verify by combining multiple secret parts from devices or contacts without requiring helpdesk support.
idea_7: This feature lets users pause approvals and remove device access from the lock screen or wearable, then helps users and admins complete the recovery steps.
idea_8: This feature shows transaction details such as amount, resource, and scope, and connects the user’s approval to this information for transaction verification.
idea_9: This feature automatically approves low-risk events when a trusted phone or watch is unlocked and near the workstation, and requires full verification when the device is locked or away.
idea_10: This feature performs small verification actions such as hold-to-approve, simple gestures, or quick on-device checks during higher risk situations, working offline and offering accessible options.

idea_1: This feature offers daily short writing exercises, prompt collections, and AI feedback on elements like hooks, clarity, and pacing, with optional friend challenges to monitor progress.
idea_2: This feature lets you share an article or playlist without paywalls for 48 hours and discuss it in a private room with synchronized highlights.
idea_3: This feature provides rubric-based feedback on argument, sources, and tone, includes inline suggestions, allows blind or credited reviews, and assigns reputation badges on profiles.
idea_4: This feature lets you download playlists to listen offline with text-to-speech, chapter markers, and uninterrupted continuous playback.
idea_5: This feature matches readers and writers by topic and content length, offers optional location-based meetups, and requires basic verification for messaging or collaboration.
idea_6: This feature lets you filter your feed by mood, reading time, source credibility, and publish date, and generate a QR code to share the filtered content.
idea_7: This feature monitors sudden increases in topics you follow and nearby areas, sending alerts with verified summaries, key sources, and ongoing updates during major events.
idea_8: This feature offers text-to-speech with adjustable speed, voice equalization, and noise compensation, plus reading modes with dyslexia-friendly fonts, focus ruler, and high-contrast themes.
idea_9: This feature lets users import and export files in docx, pdf, md, gdoc, and html formats, keeping citations, footnotes, images, change tracking, and review history.
idea_10: This feature allows users to set daily reading and writing goals, complete challenges to earn credits, and use those credits to tip authors, support bounties, or access rewards.

idea_1: This feature allows you to choose a 3, 5, or 10-minute summary of an article with key points, quotes, and links, and lets you expand sections or view the full text.
idea_2: This feature allows multiple users to read the same article together by syncing scrolling, sharing highlights, chatting on the page, and generating a summary of key points.
idea_3: This feature uses a brief voice sample from the author to generate AI narration in their voice, enabling users to switch between reading and listening without losing their place.
idea_4: This feature allows users to answer short questions to personalize the article’s content and provides authors with information on how different options perform.
idea_5: This feature allows users to record short voice comments tied to specific sentences, transcribes and organizes them, enables authors to respond by voice, and offers an audio summary.
idea_6: This feature creates flashcards from your highlights, schedules review reminders using spaced repetition, and connects each flashcard to the original sentence for easy reference.
idea_7: This feature allows users to save quotes, images, and charts as movable blocks with source citations and drag them into drafts where references are generated automatically.
idea_8: This feature lets you tap a paragraph to see a simplified version, definitions of terms, bilingual translations with audio, and adjust the reading level immediately.
idea_9: This feature lets users swipe between paired essays organized by sections, displaying author-linked responses next to matching paragraphs and a summary of agreements and disagreements.
idea_10: This feature lets readers send small payments to selected sentences. Authors can see which sentences were tipped and view their total earnings.

idea_1: This feature offers brief lessons on posture, cadence, foot strike, and breathing, along with practice exercises and real-time audio or vibration feedback using phone sensors during walks.
idea_2: This feature tracks steps, streaks, and completed plans to accumulate points that can be redeemed for digital gift cards or partner discounts. Milestones unlock extra rewards.
idea_3: This feature lets you create walking sessions with warmups, intervals, hills, recovery, and cooldowns, save session templates, and schedule them according to your calendar and pace.
idea_4: This feature lets users form friend groups with links or codes, set start times, join weekly challenges, and connect with nearby partners using safety check-ins.
idea_5: This feature offers audio walking quests with mini-games that give virtual rewards based on walking time and prompts, and includes a family mode with content suitable for children.
idea_6: This feature lets users rate routes, workouts, and gear, add notes, view tips, filter options by different criteria, and give feedback to update future plans.
idea_7: This feature recommends walk times and clothing based on weather, modifies routes for conditions like rain or heat, and sends alerts with alternative options during severe weather.
idea_8: This feature downloads audio content and map data for offline use, adjusts music speed to match your walking pace, and preloads upcoming sessions.
idea_9: This feature uses vibrations, sounds, visual signals, and voice prompts to indicate walking intervals, turns, and crossings.
idea_10: This feature generates weekly and yearly health reports with progress, body data, and route information, allows exporting in PDF, CSV, or XLSX formats, and imports data from Apple Health, Google Fit, and wearables.

idea_1: This feature monitors meal times, sleep, and energy levels to send walk reminders during times of increased fat-burning, updating the schedule weekly based on weight and activity.
idea_2: This feature offers walking routes that change in real time according to weather factors such as shade, wind, temperature, pollen, and UV levels to keep effort and comfort steady.
idea_3: This feature plays or speeds up audio content when you reach a set walking pace and shows a progress ring indicating how close you are to that pace.
idea_4: This feature allows you to walk a friend’s route, compares your pace and time difference, provides shared replays, and tracks earned badges.
idea_5: This feature records the distance walked with each shoe, monitors cushioning changes using phone or earbud sensors, and sends reminders for shoe rotation and surface use.
idea_6: This feature provides 7–10 minute walks near selected locations with a brief audio guide and records craving changes after the walk to modify future prompts.
idea_7: This feature records your mood before and after walks, tracks routes, times, and pace, and recommends walking routes based on your mood data.
idea_8: This feature generates walking routes based on your errands, tracks trips not taken by car, and calculates weekly CO2 emissions and money saved.
idea_9: This feature analyzes land and noise data to identify greenery, water, and quiet areas along your walking route and recommends minor route adjustments to increase these elements without extending the distance.
idea_10: This feature provides real-time feedback to monitor step length and walking pace, tracking joint impact and calorie use during walks over time.

idea_1: This feature connects you with AI coaches for art, writing, language, and public speaking practice using short exercises, tracks your progress, and provides customizable feedback.
idea_2: This feature allows you to share a live Co-Chat link so others can watch or join your session in the app or online, with trial access, referral credits, and optional SMS verification.
idea_3: This feature offers text-to-speech designed for earbuds, adjustable speaking speed, keyword emphasis, haptic alerts for important replies, and noise-filtered voice input.
idea_4: This feature lets users download story packs and adventures to use offline. A local model handles conversations and syncs progress when the device reconnects to the internet.
idea_5: This feature offers child-friendly characters with simple language, voice narration, and mini-games, while letting parents set content filters, time limits, and access session summaries.
idea_6: This feature adds live weather, transit, and event information to trip chats based on location and sends alerts about severe weather during the trip.
idea_7: This feature lets users rate individual messages and gives creators feedback using structured rubrics, enabling A/B testing and monitoring of changes over time.
idea_8: This feature enables bots to complete tasks like ordering food, booking tickets, or making donations within the chat, including confirmation and secure one-tap payment.
idea_9: This feature displays nearby AI personas and public chatrooms based on approximate location and allows creators to add abilities that activate when users are nearby.
idea_10: This feature ranks AI characters according to your conversation style and mood, shows genre charts for browsing, and uses labels and controls to distinguish AI from real users in role-play.

idea_1: This feature lets users create scenes with several AI characters following shared rules, edit instructions live, and save scenes as templates for others to use.
idea_2: This feature combines two or three existing characters into a hybrid with adjustable traits. Users can use these mixes temporarily or save them as new characters.
idea_3: This feature allows you to create different versions of a message, view a visual map of conversation paths, and merge a selected branch into the main chat.
idea_4: This feature lets users pin, edit, and set time limits on character memories, use private turns, and move or transfer memories between chats and characters.
idea_5: This feature creates a character using 3–5 images and descriptive words to set tone, slang, and style, then produces voice and style variations for sharing.
idea_6: This feature allows you to invite a character to watch videos or podcasts together, synchronizing their reactions and comments with the media timeline.
idea_7: This feature sends hidden instructions to the AI for guidance without displaying or saving them, and allows these instructions to expire after a specified number of turns.
idea_8: This feature allows users to set or create boundary rules that the AI follows, use safe words to pause and explain issues, and review or adjust triggers.
idea_9: This feature lets multiple users create and edit characters with version control, manage permissions and revenue sharing, and provides tools for testing and analyzing user engagement.
idea_10: This feature lets users change message styles and apply temporary tone settings that automatically end after a few exchanges.

idea_1: This feature provides short practice exercises for paneling, anatomy, perspective, and lettering, gives AI feedback on sketches, tracks progress, and includes weekly group challenges.
idea_2: This feature allows users to invite friends with a referral link to form reading groups, share brief reviews and emoji tags for episodes, and view ranked recommendations based on group feedback.
idea_3: This feature enlarges or colors sound effects, adds optional vibration for impact moments, displays text captions for background audio, and lets users adjust dialog clarity with a slider.
idea_4: This feature allows you to create reading playlists that automatically download new episodes, delete finished ones, save content for offline use, and sync progress across devices.
idea_5: This feature predicts when new chapters will be released based on creator history and shows popular micro-genres and local trending titles for organizing your reading list.
idea_6: This feature lets users filter comics by art style, pacing, update frequency, content warnings, and cliffhanger risk, share filter settings, and blur or hide spoilers according to reading progress.
idea_7: This feature lets users apply reader skins that change fonts, gutters, textures, and gestures, and allows creators to add official ambiance packs for each series.
idea_8: This feature allows users to create collections by combining chapters from various series, share these collections with others, and get recommendations for similar content.
idea_9: This feature allows users to earn coins by reading, playing mini-games, and completing tasks, which can be exchanged for ad-free time, tips, gift cards, or group rewards.
idea_10: This feature displays nearby readers, meetups, and events, offers chat groups by location, genre, and reading speed, verifies users by phone, and supports platonic-only settings.

idea_1: This feature highlights speech bubbles one by one, scrolling and moving panels smoothly. Users can tap to advance or let it progress automatically based on bubble count.
idea_2: This feature allows users to react to individual panels and create short captioned clips of 2–3 panels without watermarks. Reactions are combined into a highlights reel.
idea_3: This feature automatically summarizes episodes, tracks characters’ first appearances, relationships, and last-seen panels, and enables quick access to related previous scenes with one tap.
idea_4: This feature displays comments only up to your current reading point and blurs images or keywords in replies until you reach that section of the comic.
idea_5: This feature allows a host to control scrolling in a shared reading room while friends use emotes or voice chat, and it saves a highlights reel without spoilers.
idea_6: This feature offers tap-to-translate bubbles, dual-language overlays, automatic vocabulary lists for episodes, and optional quizzes using spaced repetition based on comic lines.
idea_7: This feature uses on-device OCR to show bubble text in dyslexia-friendly fonts, offers contrast and colorblind filters, provides text-to-speech, and allows text enlargement.
idea_8: This feature plays background sounds that change with the scene as you scroll and offers optional vibration feedback during key moments.
idea_9: This feature downloads upcoming chapters for offline reading, shows lower-quality images first while loading higher-quality versions, and manages storage by keeping favorites and deleting finished downloads.
idea_10: This feature displays story arcs, character connections, and reading order for main and side stories. It updates automatically and recommends the next episode to read.

idea_1: This feature allows you to flick a cube across tiles and trampoline pads, displaying the angle and distance before moving to help navigate obstacles and perform combos.
idea_2: This feature allows you to tap and hold to record a 10-second voice memo for a step, automatically transcribes it, and lets you share or keep it private.
idea_3: This feature allows users to collect daily “Brain Coupons” from a rotating selection and use one coupon during a level to gain different in-game effects.
idea_4: This feature allows you to download small quest packs for offline play with optional timers and automatically syncs your progress and streaks when connected to Wi-Fi.
idea_5: This feature records your solution as a finger-path replay, lets you trim it, export as GIF or MP4, add voice or selfie, and share on the in-game feed.
idea_6: This feature offers a Quest Navigator with checklists and short practice tasks to learn new mechanics before unlocking chapters, and includes monthly progress goals.
idea_7: This feature allows users to schedule puzzles in different themes, book spots in timed events, and use single-use tools such as Time Freeze or Path Highlighter temporarily.
idea_8: This feature allows you to solve puzzles by using your device’s camera to capture colors, shapes, or letters, then detects matches and adds stickers to photos.
idea_9: This feature allows you to solve sound puzzles by tapping rhythms or humming melodies, replay sounds quickly, and save melody notes during the quest.
idea_10: This feature allows you to play an 11x11 word grid where forming words changes tiles and rows and earns combo points, with solo, timed, and rush modes.

idea_1: This feature lets players change puzzle settings, adjust difficulty levels, use an auto-solver to verify solutions, and share puzzles along with information on common errors.
idea_2: This feature gives hints that point out common thinking mistakes and provides a short explanation of the related cognitive bias after completing the puzzle.
idea_3: This feature uses augmented reality to display puzzles with hidden clues in angles, shadows, and reflections. Users can move or adjust settings to locate these clues. All processing is done on the device.
idea_4: This feature provides a shadow version of a puzzle with one altered rule and subtle hints. Players can earn extra rewards by identifying the change before playing.
idea_5: This feature lets you compete against a replay of an opponent’s last three moves using decoys and allows you to bet soft currency or badges to raise the stakes.
idea_6: This feature uses sensors such as microphone, proximity, and orientation to create puzzles and allows replacing sensor actions with on-screen controls for accessibility.
idea_7: This feature records and shows heatmaps of taps, pauses, and bait activations, indicating areas of misdirection, and lets users share clips comparing actual and optimal paths.
idea_8: This feature offers an AI companion that gives hints, which can be true or false, adjusts to your weaknesses, and includes a mode with only truthful hints.
idea_9: This feature updates the game rules daily for all players, adds score multipliers for early correct answers, and allows players to vote on the next day’s rule.
idea_10: This feature links two phones via Bluetooth or ultrasound to share items and clues, enabling turn-based gameplay with controls to prevent cheating on a single device.

idea_1: This feature adds trampolines, one-way chutes, and bumpers between tubes, requiring players to pour balls carefully to pass obstacles and earn combo multipliers and extra stars.
idea_2: This feature allows you to record short voice notes during a level, converts them to text linked to specific moves, and lets you share or attach them to community solutions.
idea_3: This feature matches pouring actions to a beat, enables streaks and brief auto-sorts when on-beat, increases friction off-beat, and allows tempo setting by importing songs or humming.
idea_4: This feature tracks your wins and move efficiency to recommend the next puzzle pack and unlocks new paths on a world map by completing checklists.
idea_5: This feature lets players collect and use up to three power cards per level, which become stronger with use and have limited availability in each game session.
idea_6: This feature connects puzzles to short stories, unlocking themed balls and tubes as milestones are completed. Player choices affect cosmetic rewards and extra tasks.
idea_7: This feature lets you review moves with a timeline slider, add bookmarks, test different moves without restarting, and export short replay clips or GIFs.
idea_8: This feature displays the estimated minimum moves during play, shows a suggested solution after clearing, and highlights possible dead-end tubes in advanced mode before a move.
idea_9: This feature lets users create custom tube decals and ball patterns with different logos and styles, share their designs via codes, and see weekly selected skins.
idea_10: This feature allows you to collect fish and glassware by completing levels, build an aquarium that saves between sessions, and unlock new fish behaviors by sorting rare sets.

idea_1: This feature changes the puzzle difficulty according to your solve speed and errors, organizing levels by challenge type to support targeted practice.
idea_2: This feature displays a visual history of moves, allows navigation through them, lets you create branches, bookmark positions, and export a shareable game seed.
idea_3: This feature allows you to long-press a tube to view the next two moves as animations and test a complete sequence without making permanent changes.
idea_4: This feature lets players partially pour balls and swap the top balls using two fingers, allowing more precise ball movement and giving extra points for efficient actions.
idea_5: This feature adds one-way valves and sliding lids that open after completing a color set, enabling tilt control to change gravity and rearrange the stacks.
idea_6: This feature provides flasks that can mix, bleach, or split the top ball’s color, with each function introduced gradually through step-by-step tutorials.
idea_7: This feature lets teammates alternate turns, each making three moves on the same puzzle, sharing a limited number of undos, with replays highlighting important moves.
idea_8: This feature lets users create puzzles with custom rules, estimates their difficulty, solves the puzzles, and enables sharing through short codes and leaderboards.
idea_9: This feature generates game levels by selecting main colors from a photo and enables users to share these color-based puzzles with others.
idea_10: This feature adds high-contrast patterns and shapes on balls, optional audio tones for colors, subtle vibration when pouring, and a quick overlay that shows color labels.

idea_1: This feature allows you to schedule shows to create a continuous channel, get AI-based pacing and variety suggestions, add a logo or intro, and share the channel with others.
idea_2: This feature shows what friends are watching and reviewing, allows sharing referrals, enables synced watch parties, and provides emojis, chat, and badges during viewing.
idea_3: This feature updates program suggestions based on local weather, shows severe-weather alerts with access to live news and radar, and lets users add travel locations for weather updates.
idea_4: This feature shows live sports stats, pick’em questions, and mini leaderboards with friends, letting users earn bonuses while watching without leaving the stream.
idea_5: This feature lets users download select episodes or compilations with ads for offline viewing. Downloads are small, expire after a set time, and have limited skip options.
idea_6: This feature offers a large-button interface with a mascot theme, lets parents approve content and set timers, supports kid voice commands, and includes sing-along and cartoon channels.
idea_7: This feature separates dialogue, balances audio levels, and streams synchronized sound to each viewer’s device with individual hearing settings and adjustable captions.
idea_8: This feature allows users to earn points by watching content, referring others, and submitting reviews, which can be redeemed for gift cards or partner rewards. Seasonal hunts provide additional points.
idea_9: This feature allows you to order food from local providers and see delivery updates on screen while watching games or movies without pausing the stream.
idea_10: This feature shows timed comments, upvotes, and creator Q&As for each title, hides spoilers automatically, lets users filter by mood and topics, and share filter settings with QR codes.

idea_1: This feature shows a 20–40 second AI summary of a live program, then starts the live stream and provides thumbnails to jump to important moments.
idea_2: This feature allows you to follow teams, actors, topics, or shows and sends alerts when they are live or available, with options to watch or schedule.
idea_3: This feature allows you to swipe up or down to preview live channels with captions and switch to them, and long-press to save channels.
idea_4: This feature allows you to watch two live channels at the same time using split-view or picture-in-picture and adjust audio levels with a crossfade slider. You can save channel pairs as presets.
idea_5: This feature allows users to create a shared viewing room with a QR code or link for synchronized playback, emoji reactions, chat, polls, and group rewinds without needing accounts.
idea_6: This feature allows you to save coupons, earn skip tokens by watching ads, claim weekly rewards, and view all collected items in a Perks tab.
idea_7: This feature allows your phone to recognize cast, songs, products, and stats in real time so you can view details or save items without pausing the TV.
idea_8: This feature allows you to watch shows from the past 72 hours on most channels, use scene chapters, view highlight reels, and jump to key moments.
idea_9: This feature provides a continuous stream of shows, clips, and live content with ads, and lets you share or schedule your lineup for specific times.
idea_10: This feature allows switching to audio-only mode with lock-screen controls and a sleep timer, reduces data use on cellular networks, and preloads content on Wi-Fi.

idea_1: This feature offers short, model-specific lessons on car functions using videos or AR overlays and includes an optional photo check-in to assist first-time renters.
idea_2: This feature lets guests choose and customize rental extras with real-time pricing, select preset bundles, and easily rebook previous extras for their trips.
idea_3: This feature allows users to invite friends to vote on cars, split rental costs, share pickup details, and earn credits when invited friends complete their first trip.
idea_4: This feature allows users to leave reviews with tags and optional short videos. Hosts receive private AI-generated suggestions, and profiles show rating trends over time.
idea_5: This feature offers captioned instructions, high-contrast visuals, transcript controls, haptic and visual cues instead of audio, and a voice amplification toggle for calls.
idea_6: This feature monitors actions such as on-time returns and photo checklists, awards points for consistent behavior and challenges, and lets users redeem points for trip credits, perks, or carbon offsets.
idea_7: This Feature displays a swipeable list of cars filtered by type, distance, and availability, identifies verified hosts, and allows masked messaging for pre-booking questions.
idea_8: This feature lets users rent cars for 1–3 hours to compare models, applies fees for longer rentals, and provides a 14-day membership trial with lower fees and support.
idea_9: This feature stores documents, instructions, photos, and damage notes for check-in and check-out without internet, offers offline navigation to pickup locations, and syncs data when online.
idea_10: This feature displays weather forecasts and road alerts for your route, suggests additional items, allows flexible pickup times, and shows alternative options and host policies during severe conditions.

idea_1: This feature links flight numbers to bookings to monitor arrival times, adjust pickup windows, update host instructions, waive delay penalties, and recalculate parking and meetup fees automatically.
idea_2: This feature enables one-way car rentals by coordinating approved users to return or move vehicles. Hosts set routes and prices, while the app handles handoffs and payments.
idea_3: This feature uses the phone camera to take a 360-degree video during check-in and check-out, recording damage, cleanliness, tire condition, and windshield chips with timestamps.
idea_4: This feature provides electric vehicle route planning with real-time battery status, charger availability, automatic charging payments, pre-approved guest credits, and automatic host reimbursement.
idea_5: This feature lets hosts arrange cleaning, fueling, tire changes, and minor maintenance after trips, with service providers using temporary digital keys. Hosts track costs and service times.
idea_6: This feature lets drivers share driving data to get a SafeDrive score, which can affect deposit amounts, fees, and eligibility for Instant Book based on host criteria.
idea_7: This feature shows weather and terrain alerts, identifies vehicles with AWD or snow tires, recommends add-ons, and allows changes to return times or drop-off locations in severe conditions.
idea_8: This feature provides temporary digital car keys for Apple or Google Wallet with an offline PIN option and time-limited access, using geofences to manage trip actions.
idea_9: This feature links virtual fuel and toll accounts to bookings, automatically tracking fuel use, toll charges, and tickets in a detailed ledger without manual input.
idea_10: This feature automatically books a similar car at the same or lower price if a host cancels or the vehicle is unavailable, transferring coverage and applying loyalty credit.

idea_1: This feature allows you to record short voice notes at checkpoints that play automatically when you or friends return. You can label, share, or keep them private.
idea_2: This feature lets players use the microphone to clap, hum, or whisper to interact with the game, with settings for sensitivity and quick muting.
idea_3: This feature allows players to collect jungle coupons for power-ups and skins, automatically using them before runs. Streaks and events unlock additional coupons to store.
idea_4: This feature checks the level, your inventory, and recent performance before a run, then provides a checklist with recommended routes, equipment, and practice drills if necessary.
idea_5: This feature allows players to reserve mounts and gadgets such as rhino rams, vine grapples, and cloud boots from map outposts for one run. Items return afterward.
idea_6: This feature downloads small offline challenge packs with increasing difficulty, lets you resume instantly, and automatically syncs your progress when the device reconnects to the internet.
idea_7: This feature allows you to adjust audio using an equalizer, add local music tracks, sync game elements to the music, and save sound settings for each level.
idea_8: This feature saves the last 15 seconds of gameplay for replay, allows optional voice recording, and includes a selfie mode with character poses, stickers, and boss images.
idea_9: This feature displays jump paths, gap sizes, enemy zones, and speed areas in sandbox mode, allowing users to toggle elements and create custom practice drills.
idea_10: This feature allows players to collect power-up cards, build a deck, draw cards before each run, and use them during levels with cooldown periods.

idea_1: This feature lets players use seeds and stamina to grow vines that form temporary platforms, bridges, or lassos, which disappear after a limited time.
idea_2: This feature changes weather conditions in the game, affecting water levels, platforms, and movement. It also provides daily forecasts to inform players about upcoming weather.
idea_3: This feature adds jungle animals that players can tame and use. Players can improve their abilities at camp, and actions have cooldown times before reuse.
idea_4: This feature lets a friend’s recorded run affect your game by triggering switches, moving platforms, or distracting enemies, and both players earn rewards after finishing.
idea_5: This feature allows players to place rhythm totems that respond to tap patterns, altering jungle layers. Patterns adapt to skill level and provide visual indicators.
idea_6: This feature allows you to build and expand a base camp by rescuing explorers and creatures, unlocking new buildings for crafting, quests, training, and fast travel.
idea_7: This Feature adds “time seeds” that let players rewind the last three seconds or return to their last safe position in mid-air. Seeds are limited and recharge through combos.
idea_8: This feature allows players to build short vertical climbing levels using a set number of blocks and hazards, with in-game selection, ghost leaderboards, and seasonal updates.
idea_9: This feature tracks consecutive parkour moves such as bounces, slides, wall-runs, and enemy hits, providing speed boosts and extra coins while monitoring energy during combos.
idea_10: This feature provides a tap-only mode with automatic running and longer jump timing, along with haptic or visual cues, colorblind-safe colors, and high-contrast outlines for visibility.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons and practice activities on budgeting, credit, and investing, includes an audio option for kids, and allows inviting friends for challenges.
idea_2: This feature allows users to earn points by paying bills, making savings deposits, and completing quizzes. Points can be redeemed for fee credits, sweepstakes entries, or donations.
idea_3: This feature allows users to set up automated money transfers by selecting options and arranging them with drag-and-drop tools, with previews before activation.
idea_4: This feature allows users to invite others, track their enrollment status, earn rewards after setup, and securely assist them through a shared screen with hidden sensitive data.
idea_5: This feature displays card, loan, and savings options based on your verified information, provides details and comparisons, and lets you accept offers or schedule a call.
idea_6: This feature collects and organizes e-receipts, links them to transactions, imports QR codes, tracks warranties and return periods, and lets you search by item, merchant, or serial number.
idea_7: This feature mutes non-urgent alerts overnight and shows them in the morning, sends critical fraud alerts immediately, and allows users to pause recurring payments temporarily with notifications.
idea_8: This feature allows users to explore loan or card options by showing impacts on cash flow, payoff time, and credit use with a soft inquiry before applying.
idea_9: This feature scans documents to capture routing and account numbers, verifies their accuracy, formats them, detects clipboard data, and assists in matching contacts for quicker payee setup.
idea_10: This feature saves recent balances, cards, and digital ID for offline use, queues actions to complete later, sends weather alerts, and shows nearby ATMs and branches.

idea_1: This feature selects a payment method and time for bills, finds autopay discounts, and displays their impact before you approve the payment.
idea_2: This feature helps you save money for bills, shows your available balance, notifies you about risky purchases, and provides ways to prevent overdrafts.
idea_3: This feature allows you to create virtual cards for specific merchants to manage subscriptions by pausing, canceling, or adjusting them automatically according to your settings.
idea_4: This feature generates temporary virtual cards for purchases with set limits on time, amount, merchant, and location, and automatically adds receipts and tracks warranties.
idea_5: This feature holds payment funds until delivery is confirmed by scan, QR code, or receipt, and allows ID checks, dispute submissions, and photo uploads for transactions.
idea_6: This feature keeps a set spending amount on your device for use during outages. It activates by location or user choice and updates transactions when online.
idea_7: This feature identifies deductible transactions, tracks 1099 income, estimates quarterly taxes, saves money in a tax bucket, and schedules payments or exports data to tax software.
idea_8: This feature allows you to grant trusted contacts permission to view account activity, receive spending alerts, approve large transfers, and verify suspicious transactions.
idea_9: This feature identifies the U.S. Bank card with the best rewards or protections for a purchase, enables one-tap card switching, and applies active offers and discounts automatically.
idea_10: This feature allows you to pay rent using ACH, card, or mailed check, split payments, set payment reminders, and send on-time payment information to credit bureaus.

idea_1: This feature allows users to complete swipe-and-find tasks, like switching categories or matching brands, to create discount combinations applied during checkout.
idea_2: This feature automatically applies available coupons and store promotions while you browse, displaying a live savings meter for each item added to your cart.
idea_3: This feature lets users download chosen categories, images, and videos for offline access, manage their wishlist and cart, and refresh prices when online again.
idea_4: This feature allows users to press and hold to record voice notes, converts the speech into tags connected to products or lists, and enables sharing memos with others.
idea_5: This feature allows you to record short video or audio clips for returns or warranties, attaches them to your order with a timestamp, and stores the files securely.
idea_6: This feature turns your photos into pixel or swatch patterns, allows you to preview them on products, adjust colors and grid size, and place an order.
idea_7: This feature uses your camera to measure doorways and rooms, calculates delivery times and costs, suggests pickup locations, and detects obstacles before checkout.
idea_8: This feature displays monthly payment estimates and financing or BNPL options without impacting credit, updates availability by region and inventory, and offers a checklist of required documents.
idea_9: This feature allows users to create registries with checklists and countdowns, lets guests RSVP and buy items, updates inventory in real time, and tracks thank-you notes.
idea_10: This feature allows users to make themed product lists, shuffle items, let collaborators add and vote on products, and automatically replace out-of-stock items.

idea_1: This feature allows you to add photos, links, or moods to a Dreamboard and generates a shopping set that matches colors, textures, and prices from the catalog.
idea_2: This feature scans your room or body to show products at real size, provides sizing and fit details, detects conflicts, and generates a shareable preview.
idea_3: This feature shows price and stock predictions, allows setting a target purchase price, and automatically completes checkout using saved payment and shipping information when conditions are met.
idea_4: This feature allows you to set a goal, then generates a personalized bundle with options to adjust items, view savings, check compatibility, and swap products easily.
idea_5: This feature creates a digital record for each purchase with care instructions, spare parts information, warranty details, and options to sell or trade-in using video condition grading.
idea_6: This feature allows users to customize products in 3D by selecting colors, materials, monograms, and components, view cost and delivery estimates, and share designs for voting.
idea_7: This feature allows friends to add items to a shared cart, split payments, select different shipping addresses, access group discounts, and use polls for decisions in the chat.
idea_8: This feature lets users rent certain items or try sample kits for a limited time, applies fees to purchases, and supports returns with reusable packaging.
idea_9: This feature displays an impact score for items, suggests alternative products, lets users choose delivery times, combines shipments, and enables donation of returns from home.
idea_10: This feature readies your order for pickup when you arrive, enables returns without waiting, and lets you scan items, pay, and get a digital receipt on your phone.

idea_1: This feature schedules short practice drills, compares your strokes to examples, tracks your progress, identifies areas needing improvement, and suggests brushes and lessons for practice.
idea_2: This feature exports images with comments linked to specific strokes as editable notes, lets users toggle annotations by layer and version, and enables requesting and rating feedback.
idea_3: This feature tracks points earned by completing practice drills, giving critiques, and keeping daily creation streaks. Points can be exchanged for Asset coupons, tutorials, or sent to others.
idea_4: This feature allows users to adjust audio and vibration alerts for pressure levels, snapping, selections, and export completion, and includes speech captions and noise reduction for tutorials.
idea_5: This feature lets users draw together on a shared canvas via a temporary link, with separate brush controls, chat functions, and the ability to record the session.
idea_6: This feature allows you to choose a location, date, and time to display sun position, sky conditions, and color temperature, generating corresponding light and shadow effects on the canvas.
idea_7: This feature groups brushes, colors, references, tutorials, macros, and scripts into downloadable sets that work offline, can be switched by project, and shared using QR codes.
idea_8: This feature connects users in a chosen area to organize drawing events, offers privacy options such as location masking, and links event discussions to shared canvases.
idea_9: This feature analyzes portfolios on your device to suggest collaborators with similar styles or goals and verifies portfolios using content hashing and provenance badges.
idea_10: This feature changes autosave timing based on battery, memory, and network conditions, creates local and cloud backups, recovers files after crashes, and displays sync and alert notifications.

idea_1: This feature creates character profiles that track colors, proportions, and shapes across pages, identifies inconsistencies, suggests corrections, and synchronizes profiles throughout a project.
idea_2: This feature allows you to create a bounding box inside a perspective ruler, choose a prop category, and generate editable line art or 3D shapes with style options.
idea_3: This feature provides vibration feedback on mobile devices that varies with texture, pressure, and stroke speed, and gives small taps for ruler snaps, edges, and selections.
idea_4: This feature enables multiple users to draw together in real time with layer permissions, masked areas, viewport syncing, automatic timelapse recording, comments, and mobile network optimization.
idea_5: This feature imports a script and creates speech balloons and captions arranged by reading order, panel boundaries, and character roles, allowing adjustment of tail placement and layout.
idea_6: This feature allows you to create and save lighting setups, apply them to multiple pages or animation frames, preview different lighting effects, and maintain consistent character colors.
idea_7: This feature uses the phone camera to capture full-body poses or short motions in AR, places mannequins with floor detection and occlusion, records keyframes, and exports reference images or animation guides.
idea_8: This feature allows you to create brushes using nodes to adjust texture, wetness, particles, and pressure, with live stroke preview and options to share and simplify settings.
idea_9: This feature records automation macros and allows assigning them to radial menus, pen-button combinations, or gestures. Macros can be customized by tool or layer and used on multiple pages.
idea_10: This feature shows real-time previews of color profiles, moiré effects, color-vision simulations, compression artifacts, safe zones, webtoon slices, and export preflight checks.

idea_1: This feature simulates deliveries, pets, and night motion to help you adjust zones, sensitivity, and talkback. It provides a score and suggests angle or lighting changes.
idea_2: This feature streams audio with low delay to earbuds, reduces background noise, highlights important sounds like alarms and baby cries, and warns if volume is too loud.
