idea_3: This feature lets you invite a trusted friend to access certain camera functions for a limited time and provides rewards for successful referrals.
idea_4: This feature temporarily activates premium options such as cloud storage, AI packs, and continuous recording, and shows a timeline comparing their impact on recent events.
idea_5: This Feature detects visitors or vehicles in a designated area, recognizes repeated patterns using nearby signals, and processes data on the device to manage privacy and sharing.
idea_6: This feature monitors Wi-Fi quality, temperature, IR usage, and storage wear, and can automatically schedule reboots, updates, or backups to help maintain device operation.
idea_7: This feature lets users add detection modules like package events, license plates, pets, or safety gear, which operate on the camera or phone and can be scheduled per camera with resource monitoring.
idea_8: This feature allows users to give feedback on alerts, create and adjust activity and time filters, account for weather conditions, and share filters with others.
idea_9: This feature triggers actions like playing messages, flashing lights, locking doors, notifying contacts, or calling preset numbers, and includes a contactless delivery mode with instructions and confirmation recording.
idea_10: This feature generates a timeline of chosen events with images, transcribed audio, and a map, allowing export as PDF, MP4, or ZIP, and offline access to the last 48 hours.

idea_1: This feature monitors a person or vehicle across multiple YI cameras, combines the information into one timeline and path map, and sends a single alert with links to each camera view.
idea_2: This feature automatically merges video clips from before, during, and after an alert into one timeline, showing detected objects, timestamps, and a 30–60 second summary.
idea_3: This feature lets you search your video history using natural language and displays results with highlighted frames and filters for people, pets, vehicles, or sounds.
idea_4: This feature automatically arms or disarms the system and adjusts alert sensitivity by using your phone’s location, Wi-Fi connection, sleep schedule, and calendar events.
idea_5: This feature generates temporary viewing links or QR codes for guests and couriers, allows optional two-way talk, hides specified privacy areas, and can revoke access automatically or manually.
idea_6: This feature automatically blurs faces, license plates, or screens before uploading or sharing, stores the original encrypted file locally, and tracks copies that are shared.
idea_7: This feature enables the app to connect via LAN, Direct Wi-Fi, or BLE for live view and clip access when the internet is weak or unavailable, beginning with AI metadata and then streaming higher-quality video.
idea_8: This feature uses your phone’s camera to display each camera’s view in AR, highlights blind spots and glare, and provides placement, motion zone, and privacy mask suggestions.
idea_9: This feature lets users create simple "if this, then that" rules for YI devices and supported platforms, and share or import rules made by others.
idea_10: This feature upgrades alerts from push notifications to verified calls and optional professional dispatch, while generating a timestamped evidence pack with key clips, device information, and a secure live link.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons for each exercise, includes optional on-device pose guidance, and tracks brief practice streaks to support user progress.
idea_2: This feature lets users add post-workout reviews and short voice notes, organizing workouts by goal, mood, and duration for easy reference.
idea_3: This feature allows users to create small groups called Couch Crews, join weekly micro-challenges, and share basic information like streaks or emojis with group members.
idea_4: This feature shows energy and weather forecasts to suggest short indoor workouts, automatically adjusting plans based on weather, calendar events, and user activity patterns.
idea_5: This feature provides offline audio workout playlists and a zero-screen mode that plays short sessions continuously, adjusts voice clarity for various environments, and mixes with downloaded music.
idea_6: This feature allows users to earn points by completing short workouts, which can be redeemed for premium access, partner offers, donations, or gift cards, with additional weekly bonuses.
idea_7: This feature allows users to filter workouts by position, joint sensitivity, noise, space, and time, save these filters as presets, and share presets via QR codes.
idea_8: This feature adjusts workout difficulty based on weekly check-ins and updates short workout plans every three months to support ongoing fitness.
idea_9: This feature sends alerts after long periods of sitting or during bad weather and provides a short exercise routine with customizable reminder settings.
idea_10: This feature allows users to create workout sessions by choosing a starting position, target areas, and intensity or duration, then generates and saves the routine for later use.

idea_1: This feature pauses extended scrolling to show a 20–30 second exercise as a Live Activity, uses sensors to count reps, and grants a shield that stops prompts for an hour.
idea_2: This feature allows starting 20–60 second exercises from the lock screen or watch widgets with one tap, uses a haptic metronome, displays large counters, and automatically logs reps using the accelerometer.
idea_3: This feature scans your surroundings in two seconds to identify exercises that fit your location and adjusts choices based on your clothing and footwear. All processing is done on-device.
idea_4: This feature connects workouts to daily activities such as turning off alarms or waiting for rides. You confirm with a swipe, and it updates reminders accordingly.
idea_5: This feature lets users complete 60-second workout challenges at different times, uses AI to count reps, offers quick rematches, and tracks weekly rankings.
idea_6: This feature offers a brief isometric or breathing exercise when you tap skip, helping you keep your streak and earn credits for future rest days.
idea_7: This feature shows brief exercise prompts during TV show pauses, allows input via remote or phone, and automatically resumes the show after the exercises are done.
idea_8: This feature plays audio cues over music or podcasts, adjusts volume automatically, adapts workout pace, and counts repetitions using motion sensors in earbuds and phone.
idea_9: This feature offers a set of isometric, mobility, and breathwork exercises without equipment or jumping, using haptic timing and presets for short sessions that monitor small movements.
idea_10: This feature plans 4–6 short workouts each day using your calendar, location, sleep, and heart rate information, and merges any missed sessions into one evening workout.

idea_1: This feature helps users combine virtual fragrance notes, suggests mixing ratios, and enables creating mini kits or shareable recipes based on selected scent blends.
idea_2: This feature replaces star ratings with categories such as throw, longevity, mood, season, and skin type, lets users add photos and wear logs, and summarizes community feedback.
idea_3: This feature lets users invite friends to their shopping cart, vote on items, share gifts, leave reactions, and automatically apply referral rewards.
idea_4: This feature includes a bubble pop mini-game where users tap bubbles to earn points that can be exchanged for samples, early product access, or virtual avatar items.
idea_5: This feature lets users select items from various categories and scents to create custom sets, preview their selections, reorder them, and choose contactless pickup with substitutions.
idea_6: This feature suggests products based on local weather and sends reminders to restock before events such as cold snaps, heat waves, or extended weekends.
idea_7: This feature saves your ingredient preferences, allergens, and sensitivity levels, alerts you to possible triggers while browsing, and records batch numbers for recall notifications and claims.
idea_8: This feature creates a scent profile from quick selections, ranks fragrances by match and layering, and shows tester availability, aisle locations, and real-time stock at nearby stores.
idea_9: This feature lets users share layering recipes, room pairings, and seasonal routines as shoppable stories and earn credits or cash from sales via an in-app wallet.
idea_10: This feature plays aromatherapy audio, tracks candle burn time and usage, and can connect to smart plugs to automatically turn off warmers.

idea_1: This feature builds a scent profile from your purchases, likes, and swipes, then recommends related products and alerts you about limited releases with early access.
idea_2: This feature lets users drag and drop shower gel, lotion, mist, and perfume to see compatibility, wear time, application order, and save the combination as a bundle.
idea_3: This feature uses the camera to measure wick length and flame behavior, offers trimming and burn time advice, tracks usage, estimates remaining burn hours, and suggests reorder timing.
idea_4: This feature allows you to create a sample kit, schedule a pickup, scan QR codes at scent stations, rate samples, and get updated recommendations and coupons.
idea_5: This feature allows you to assign scents to rooms, track refill timing based on room size and use, schedule replacements, and manage refill orders for pickup or delivery.
idea_6: This feature offers daily routine recommendations based on weather, humidity, and your skin profile, choosing product textures and scent levels, with a weekly one-tap ordering option.
idea_7: This feature allows you to scan or browse products to see ingredient functions, allergen information, and scent details, filtering items and offering alternatives based on your saved sensitivities.
idea_8: This feature builds a scent profile from recipient details, recommends product bundles with various prices, includes a digital scent card, and enables scheduling delivery reminders.
idea_9: This feature allows users to browse scent combinations, track how long they wear them, save favorites, vote on scent returns, and join preorders for limited blends.
idea_10: This feature automatically applies available coupons, rewards, and bundles to your cart and suggests item changes to help you qualify for discounts or free shipping.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons on paneling, lettering, and story beats using a simple canvas, with AI feedback and friend challenges to monitor practice progress.
idea_2: This feature allows you to post short reviews with ratings and tags, invite friends to create lists together, and share links to add others to your group.
idea_3: This feature lets users send digital gift cards, earn tokens by reading and participating in events, and use tokens to unlock episodes, tip creators, or receive badges.
idea_4: This feature reads text aloud with adjustable voice, speed, and clarity, highlights words during reading, adds vibrations for action scenes, and displays captions for audio episodes.
idea_5: This feature allows you to organize series to read in order, automatically downloads new chapters for offline access, and removes completed episodes while keeping saved favorites.
idea_6: This feature shows a calendar of upcoming chapters for followed series in your timezone, estimates catch-up time, pre-downloads new episodes, and sends alerts when they are available.
idea_7: This feature lets readers respond to individual panels or paragraphs, write brief reviews, and view summaries and heatmaps to show feedback patterns.
idea_8: This feature provides age-appropriate content with easy controls and autoplay for children. Parents can approve creators and series, set time limits, and block downloads.
idea_9: This feature displays nearby reading groups, creator meetups, and signings based on your location. Event chats end automatically, and profiles show only first names and avatars.
idea_10: This feature allows users to swipe to match or skip comics and novels based on filters like tags, art style, tone, and episode length, and share QR codes with others.

idea_1: This feature automatically moves comic panels forward with motion and vibration effects, letting readers adjust the speed or choose a regular scrolling view.
idea_2: This feature shows summary cards of recent episodes, identifies main characters and locations, tracks unfinished storylines, and sends alerts when chosen characters reappear.
idea_3: This feature lets readers join discussions linked to specific panels after viewing them, with AI hiding spoilers. Reactions and notes show as optional overlays on the art.
idea_4: This feature lets users read content together live, send reactions, chat by voice or text, and allows hosts to schedule live premieres with question and answer sessions.
idea_5: This feature plays background sounds and optional vibrations that match scenes, lets creators add or assign audio, suggests moods automatically, and saves audio for offline use.
idea_6: This feature unlocks additional side stories and alternate endings when reader pledges meet goals, tracks progress and timelines, and lets readers change pledges before finalizing.
idea_7: This feature tracks where readers pause on each panel, provides episode retention alerts, and enables testing different covers, thumbnails, and panel orders with automatic updates.
idea_8: This feature lets creators request translations, enables translators to work in the app, manages revenue sharing automatically, and includes review steps for creators and the community.
idea_9: This feature allows users to choose a mood and available time, then generates a combined list of comics and novels. One tap saves the list for later.
idea_10: This feature offers dyslexia-friendly fonts, high-contrast themes, panel zoom, speech-bubble text-to-speech, and sound-effect text overlays, with settings saved for each series and shareable.

idea_1: This feature allows you to manage notifications, send quick replies, and adjust haptic settings using short exercises on your watch and phone.
idea_2: This feature lets you invite others to review your watch setup remotely, share or receive profiles quickly, and apply suggested settings with a single tap.
idea_3: This feature records Bluetooth connection time and user feedback, allowing users to earn points that can be exchanged for watch faces, rule packs, or donations.
idea_4: This feature displays feedback prompts after missed or delayed alerts, collects diagnostic data, suggests possible fixes, and provides a notification health score with stability tips.
idea_5: This feature detects sounds such as sirens, alarms, and doorbells on the phone and sends vibration alerts and flashes to the watch. It also lets you adjust volume from the watch.
idea_6: This feature adds tiles to your watch that let you start tasks such as ordering meals, requesting rides, or pickups, with confirmation on your phone and optional scheduling or location settings.
idea_7: This feature syncs weather forecasts for your calendar locations and travel destinations, sends packing reminders, and provides alerts with notifications and radar images for severe weather.
idea_8: This feature displays OTPs and phone numbers on the watch with large digits, enables copying codes to the phone, dialing from the watch, and automatically expires codes.
idea_9: This feature lets you create notification rules using app, keyword, time, location, caller, and urgency, and share, install, or browse these rules with QR codes.
idea_10: This feature lets users install and manage extra modules such as filters, quick replies, document summaries, music cards, and skins with simple installation and version tracking.

idea_1: This feature sends notifications according to your routines, time, location, and calendar, lets you prioritize contacts and apps, and provides scheduled summaries and urgent alerts.
idea_2: This feature lets users create and assign custom vibration patterns for specific apps or contacts, using an editor and options to share preset patterns.
idea_3: This feature provides on-watch smart replies that adapt to the conversation and language, allowing users to reply, set reminders, or make calls directly from the watch.
idea_4: This feature allows users to set routines triggered by their watch that perform phone actions such as sending messages, starting navigation, controlling smart lights, or playing music.
idea_5: This feature translates and summarizes long notifications before sending them to the watch, enabling users to switch views and apply app-specific rules or templates without an internet connection.
idea_6: This feature monitors the Bluetooth connection, notifies you of weak or lost signals, records the last location, and offers Lost Mode with vibration, message, and proximity meter.
idea_7: This feature allows users to change notification settings for different situations such as Work, Gym, or Travel, either manually or automatically, adjusting vibration, privacy, and app alerts.
idea_8: This feature shows a notification dashboard with information on interruptions, dismiss rates, and response times, and offers one-tap options to mute apps, convert notifications, or alert favorites.
idea_9: This feature changes vibration, screen brightness, and refresh rate based on battery level, delays less important alerts, and groups notifications when the battery is low.
idea_10: This feature detects OTP codes and displays them on the watch with large digits and auto-expiry, allows one-tap copying to the phone, and transfers short text and links with automatic deletion.

idea_1: This feature shows a Roku menu on your phone to help you learn navigation shortcuts, gestures, and voice commands, while monitoring your progress and offering quick actions.
idea_2: This feature allows private listening by adjusting volume, enhancing speech, focusing on dialogue, and customizing sound settings for earbuds or headphones.
idea_3: This feature allows you to send temporary remote control links to others for limited TV access and tracks referrals to unlock extra themes or macros.
idea_4: This feature adjusts the TV backlight and opens watchlists based on rain, shows live weather and news with one tap, and displays a mini-forecast on the screen.
idea_5: This feature pauses the TV, lowers the volume, displays weather alerts on screen, and then resumes playback. Users can set quiet hours, locations, and alert levels.
idea_6: This feature lets the remote control the TV without internet by using the local network, storing device details, and enabling offline search and shortcuts through on-TV pairing.
idea_7: This feature allows you to rearrange remote buttons, create multi-step macros with delays, save and use button layouts as profiles, and apply preset profiles with additional options.
idea_8: This feature detects 2FA or OTP codes from your clipboard or SMS and enters them on the TV. It also opens long URLs on your phone using QR codes.
idea_9: This feature lets users browse and install verified macros, themes, and gesture packs for popular apps with one tap and includes safety checks.
idea_10: This feature allows you to search installed channels using filters such as free or paid, subscriptions, video quality, ratings, runtime, and kids-safe content, then opens the chosen app.

idea_1: This feature displays shortcuts for opening channels, resuming titles, or starting Private Listening on the home screen, lock screen, and smartwatch based on user activity.
idea_2: This feature allows you to send a movie, show title, or URL from other apps and then opens the appropriate Roku channel or searches for the content automatically.
idea_3: This feature shows live captions of TV audio, lets you change dialog volume, and enables searching captions to find and replay specific parts.
idea_4: This feature allows you to create routines that open channels, change volume, turn on Private Listening, and control smart lights. Routines can start by voice, schedule, or location.
idea_5: This feature displays your Roku channel grid, lets you reorder channels by dragging or using key commands, and allows you to back up and restore channel layouts.
idea_6: This feature allows the host to share a remote session through a QR code, enabling multiple phones to control the TV and manage the play queue with host permissions.
idea_7: This feature monitors Wi-Fi, latency, and CDN performance during playback, shows a health score, allows restarting or lowering resolution, and provides Wi-Fi placement suggestions.
idea_8: This feature creates temporary remote profiles with PIN restrictions that display only selected channels and hide account shortcuts. Sessions end automatically after use.
idea_9: This feature lets you control the TV by tilting, flicking, pinching, and shaking your device to navigate, adjust volume, scrub, and mute, with customizable settings.
idea_10: This feature detects copied text and allows pasting it into Roku search or login fields, enabling autofill of credentials without storing them in the app.

idea_1: This feature offers a guided art studio where children can trace and draw Paw Patrol images with step-by-step hints, save their drawings, and share them with approved contacts.
idea_2: This feature allows users to clean the bay, rescue fish, and decorate with stones, shells, and gear, with accompanying sounds and gentle vibrations.
idea_3: This feature offers a car-friendly mode with offline songs, call-and-response stories, large buttons for easy use, and optional syncing between two devices for shared play.
idea_4: This feature allows children to record a short voice or sticker report after missions and gives parents progress updates, feedback options, and activity suggestions.
idea_5: This feature gives daily missions based on local weather, includes gear checks and safety tips, and allows choosing a city for severe-weather drills with alerts and radar.
idea_6: This feature lets parents filter content by age, skill goals, duration, and offline access, and scan QR codes on toys or printables to access related activities.
idea_7: This feature allows users to record their voice with effects, attach the audio to art or stories, and download the combined file for offline use.
idea_8: This feature tracks skill progress to upgrade the rescue HQ, tools, and vehicles, and adjusts difficulty based on player ability throughout multiple seasons.
idea_9: This feature tracks play activity to earn paw points and tickets, which can be exchanged for digital badges or donations. It also includes daily streaks and quizzes.
idea_10: This feature allows users to create missions by arranging terrains, obstacles, vehicles, and animals, adjust settings like weather and time, and share missions via invite or QR codes.

idea_1: This feature allows users to create rescue missions by choosing pups, goals, and challenge types, with difficulty levels adjusting automatically based on recent activity.
idea_2: This feature provides AR rescue walks with parent-set goals for indoor or outdoor areas. It works offline using preloaded scenes to guide movement around a space.
idea_3: This feature links missions to weather and seasons, offers safety lessons and checklists, and uses simulated forecasts if real weather data is not available.
idea_4: This feature lets two players play together on one or two nearby devices, choose different pup roles, and communicate using basic emotes and pings.
idea_5: This feature offers a calm area with guided breathing, emotion identification, and sensory-friendly mini-games. It unlocks after challenges or by a parent button and records calming streaks.
idea_6: This feature provides a dashboard for parents and teachers to monitor skills, set goals, access offline activities, print mission cards, and organize classroom rotations.
idea_7: This feature allows users to create mission storybooks by arranging characters and props, recording narration, and saving the resulting short episode on the device.
idea_8: This feature offers accessibility settings such as dyslexia-friendly fonts, high-contrast visuals, captions, alternative controls, motor sensitivity adjustments, sign language clips, and a visual schedule preview.
idea_9: This feature lets users change languages instantly, tap words to see translations, view vocabulary badges during missions, and allows parents to choose languages and set exposure time per session.
idea_10: This feature allows users to build a gadget lab where they arrange command blocks to control lifts and scout-copters, practicing sequencing and debugging for missions.

idea_1: This feature provides guided prompts and exercises to help you practice conversation starters, listening skills, and video introductions, offering suggestions based on your goals.
idea_2: This feature offers moderated community groups where members can post and comment on hobbies, local events, and life topics, including a section for popular discussions and events.
idea_3: This feature provides decade-based prompts and shared playlists with music clips and memory cards to help users begin conversations about their matching decades.
idea_4: This feature displays on-time replies, kept plans, verified ID and age, membership length, and optional references from past matches without ratings or judgments.
idea_5: This feature offers live captions, speech clarity controls, hearing-aid compatibility, large text, high-contrast themes, and volume normalization for chats, calls, and voice notes.
idea_6: This feature allows users to earn Companion Coins by completing profiles, replying quickly, and reporting scams, which can be used for boosts, gift cards, or donations.
idea_7: This feature allows you to choose date types such as walking buddy, museum companion, or travel partner, and add photos, plans, and stories to share your interests.
idea_8: This feature allows you to save and switch search filters, temporarily change your location using Trip Mode, and create a QR contact card to share contact information.
idea_9: This feature recommends activities based on weather and mobility, helps find accessible places, lets users browse menus, make reservations, place orders, split bills, and share plans in chat.
idea_10: This feature allows users to write a private post-date journal, get advice on boundaries and follow-ups, and share short feedback with mutual agreement.

idea_1: This feature allows you to set how quickly you respond, choose message types, control introduction timing, receive reminders, and pause chats when needed.
idea_2: This feature scans chats for money requests, excessive affection, and fake profiles, provides warnings or blocks, and offers trust badges with ID and verification options.
idea_3: This feature uses old photos and milestones to create a timeline, connects users with similar time periods, and offers conversation starters about those eras.
idea_4: This feature recommends accessible locations with ramps and seating, manages bookings and payments, arranges transportation, and adjusts plans according to weather conditions.
idea_5: This feature lets you share a limited profile and date information with selected contacts, send quick check-ins, and use an emergency button to share your live location.
idea_6: This feature offers 10-minute video calls with background blur and audio improvement, including conversation prompts, decade trivia, and simple activities to help users introduce themselves.
idea_7: This Feature identifies caregiving responsibilities, matches users with similar schedules using filters and scores, syncs calendars, and suggests shared free times and date ideas.
idea_8: This feature offers suggested messages for replying after a date, including polite declines, follow-up prompts, and advice on when to send responses.
idea_9: This feature lets users share details about mobility, walking speed, hearing preferences, and dietary needs to help tailor communication and recommend appropriate meeting locations.
idea_10: This feature arranges small group meetings of 6–10 nearby members with common interests, led by approved hosts, and allows one-on-one matching after the meeting.

idea_1: This feature uses the opener’s microphone to detect door sounds, identifies unusual noises, sends alerts, and can amplify garage audio to earbuds for clearer listening.
idea_2: This feature detects license plates, Bluetooth tags, or UWB phones to trigger settings such as lights or timed opening and manages temporary vehicle passes with time and proximity limits.
idea_3: This feature displays live AR overlays on your phone or myQ camera to identify door areas and obstructions, and offers guided steps for sensor testing and maintenance.
idea_4: This feature allows you to turn garage lights on or off or activate a locator sound on the wall console by clapping twice or using a custom whistle.
idea_5: This feature allows users to simulate door openings, alerts, and camera clips, and provides a timed, one-tap trial of premium video history and delivery options.
idea_6: This feature generates temporary or scheduled keypad PINs sent via SMS or WhatsApp. Guests verify their identity with ID and selfie, and each use logs identity, time, and photo.
idea_7: This feature closes the garage during wind or rain, turns on lights in storms, sends freeze alerts with tips, and lights the garage when family arrives in bad weather.
idea_8: This feature enables the system to run schedules, safety checks, and door controls via local Bluetooth during internet outages and stores 24 hours of events for later syncing.
idea_9: This feature monitors family members’ arrival and departure times, activates actions when they come within 300–500 feet, and sends notifications for arrivals or departures at saved locations.
idea_10: This feature uses AI to recognize and label items in shelf and floor images, lets you search for them, and suggests zones to organize space and keep doorways clear.

idea_1: This feature uses UWB to detect when your phone is nearby and approaching the garage, automatically opening the door, with encrypted LAN/BLE backup if the internet is unavailable.
idea_2: This feature uses a camera to recognize registered vehicles for automatic garage door opening, records unrecognized vehicles, and permits temporary access for guests on scheduled days and times.
idea_3: This feature generates one-time delivery passes with tracking numbers, enables access through QR or NFC scans, opens the door in delivery mode, records video, and locks afterward.
idea_4: This feature uses air-quality and temperature sensors to open the garage door partially for ventilation, then closes it automatically. It can also operate fans to remove gases.
idea_5: This feature tracks cycle counts, motor current, and door balance to assess spring and opener condition, sends notifications, offers parts or service booking, and performs safety tests.
idea_6: This feature generates unique keypad codes with scheduled access times, supports optional ID verification, records video linked to events, manages multiple properties, and expires codes automatically.
idea_7: This feature detects when a second person or vehicle follows through a door, then holds the door open, flashes lights, sends notifications, and can announce alerts needing confirmation.
idea_8: This feature shows centerlines and stop markers from a camera in the app or CarPlay/Android Auto, sends haptic and watch alerts, and saves parking profiles for each vehicle.
idea_9: This feature allows users to set up automated actions based on triggers such as presence, time, weather, or device status, using preset templates for common situations.
idea_10: This feature lets local first responders enter the garage during emergencies with approved requests, sends alerts to the owner, and tracks access by time and location.

idea_1: This feature removes background noise, adjusts audio levels, syncs mouth movements with detected phonemes, and adds optional captions that follow the timeline.
idea_2: This feature allows users to find nearby animators and join shared drawing rooms that synchronize layers, brushes, and chat through Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, or cloud connections.
idea_3: This feature lets you download brushes, textures, pose sheets, sounds, and tutorial playlists for offline use, allowing animation without needing an internet connection.
idea_4: This feature allows users to browse recommended rigs, backgrounds, and profiles, and create a shared starter scene with permissions and distance filters when both users agree.
idea_5: This feature provides a phone-style keypad to enter frame or time values and includes preset options for setting holds, loops, and staggered timing.
idea_6: This feature creates backgrounds, suggests keyframes, and generates in-between frames from a prompt or sketch, with an option to adjust the style strength.
idea_7: This feature allows you to clap to add tempo markers, whistle or snap to start or stop preview and recording, and clap to play a loud sound to locate the device.
idea_8: This feature detects strobe flashes and high-contrast flicker, offers one-tap options to reduce them, and adds a safety notice when exporting the animation.
idea_9: This feature identifies copied frames and reused assets using perceptual hashing, shows similarity heatmaps, and provides creator verification and provenance badges.
idea_10: This feature allows you to start, pause, or stop rendering on a desktop or cloud from your phone, providing live updates and notifications about the progress and completion.

idea_1: This feature generates in-between animation frames while preserving line weight, squash-stretch ratio, and negative space. It also supports locking layer attributes, setting easing, and brush editing.
idea_2: This feature divides a sketch into character parts, props, and background, and identifies pivot points and deformation areas for rigging or tweening.
idea_3: This feature adds a depth map to layers, enabling 2.5D effects like parallax, occlusion, and depth of field, and allows control of camera movement.
idea_4: This feature records a pose or movement with the phone camera and applies it to a 2D skeleton from your drawing, enabling adjustments between captured data and keyframes.
idea_5: This feature adds physics effects such as gravity, wind, and jiggle to brushes for hair, cloth, and tails, and lets users bake simulations into editable frames.
idea_6: This feature lets you add audio and automatically creates beat markers, phoneme timing, and lip-sync tracks for multiple characters, adjusting timing without changing key poses.
idea_7: This feature analyzes a character turnaround sheet to keep proportions, landmarks, and line angles consistent across frames and identifies off-model frames with correction suggestions.
idea_8: This feature adds smoke, fire, sparkles, and speed line effects that follow your strokes, interact with ink edges, and can be converted into shapes for export.
idea_9: This feature enables multiple users to collaborate on animations by using layer locks, adding frame comments and voice notes, managing scene branches, comparing timelines, and merging conflicts.
idea_10: This feature allows you to preview animations on real surfaces, adjust scale, camera movements, and lighting, and record short videos for timing tests without exporting.

idea_1: This feature listens to your singing, detects issues with pitch and breath, provides daily practice exercises, and lets friends participate in weekly singing challenges together.
idea_2: This feature offers kid-friendly car duets with avatars, large lyrics, one-tap harmonies, offline use through downloadable packs, and automatic volume control.
idea_3: This feature lets you download songs, lyrics, and practice tips for offline use, filter song packs by vocal range, difficulty, and techniques, and preload frequently used tracks.
idea_4: This feature allows you to add legal audio tracks, detects sections, tempo, and key, creates a guide melody with timestamps, and provides licensed lyrics when available.
idea_5: This feature predicts the best times to sing using humidity, sleep, and usage data. It sends alerts for vocal strain, hydration, and warmup adjustments.
idea_6: This feature allows users to join private rooms with a 6-digit code for synchronized duets, earn song credits by referring others, and verify profiles to reduce fake accounts.
idea_7: This feature shows real-time captions, gives pitch feedback through vibrations, adjusts speech clarity, monitors loudness, and provides AI-generated phonetic hints for pronunciation.
idea_8: This feature allows users to share, download, rate, remix, and combine vocal effects, harmony tracks, lyric styles, and stage visuals within a marketplace.
idea_9: This feature records vertical split-screen duet videos with pitch tracking and picture-in-picture technique demonstrations. It automatically adjusts quality and lighting and exports videos in social media formats.
idea_10: This feature offers breath, hum, and beat exercises to prepare users before recording. It tracks progress with streaks and awards tokens for completing themes.

idea_1: This feature changes the accompaniment during your singing to follow your speed, volume, breathing, and can also change the key while the song plays.
idea_2: This feature generates 5–10 minute warmup routines tailored to your vocal range, environment, and optional wearable data, adjusting the duration based on your available time.
idea_3: This feature uses the camera to track posture, jaw, tongue, and vowel shapes with AR overlays, gives vibration alerts for tension, and records areas that need stretching.
idea_4: This feature allows you to sing a lead part and generates 2 to 4 harmony parts in various styles, matching vocal ranges. You can practice with spatial audio and export individual tracks.
idea_5: This feature helps you practice lyrics by hiding words, rearranging lines, and adding speaking tasks. It also monitors your microphone and suggests adjustments if needed.
idea_6: This feature adds reverb and crowd sounds that change with your singing and gives real-time feedback on microphone use and possible feedback problems.
idea_7: This feature lets users sing live duets with minimal delay, offers a private in-ear pitch guide, and automatically generates synchronized multicam split videos when exported.
idea_8: This feature analyzes phrasing, breath placement, vibrato, and tone to provide a score, suggest retakes, and offer genre-specific phrasing while keeping your vocal tone.
idea_9: This feature selects your best 16 or 32-bar clips from recordings, removes silences, exports them in the chosen key with piano or click, and generates a share link, QR code, and optional one-page summary.
idea_10: This feature listens to a song segment, separates vocals, identifies key and tempo, syncs lyrics, suggests a key, and provides harmonies and guidance.

idea_1: This feature tracks consecutive successful plays to fill a momentum meter, which unlocks special plays or temporary boosts. It also offers drills to practice timing against moving defenders.
idea_2: This feature offers short training sessions with basic plays, rhythm-based drills to improve motor skills, coaching prompts, and a timer that recommends breaks and stretches.
idea_3: This feature shows an overlay that allows drawing routes, measures first-down distance, displays field-goal chances, and calculates yards-to-stick, target separation, and punt angles.
idea_4: This feature provides 3D replays of important plays, weekly retro-uniform giveaways, global leaderboards with a calendar, and trial periods with countdowns and simple cancellation.
idea_5: This feature allows you to manage travel plans, accommodations, and facilities, monitor player fatigue and injury risk, and view a travel map with arrival times and rest recommendations.
idea_6: This feature allows you to record voice notes connected to players, plays, or draft boards, which are transcribed and saved in your scouting hub with options to create highlight clips.
idea_7: This feature allows you to add limited-time promotions such as ticket deals, mascot events, or concession coupons to the schedule, providing bonus rewards for specific game combinations.
idea_8: This feature shows multi-year salary costs, lets users create deals with options and bonuses, displays free agent eligibility, and identifies financial risks before contract approval.
idea_9: This feature allows you to collect and improve play cards, arrange them into tagged decks for different situations, and practice using these decks against AI or other players.
idea_10: This feature lets you arrange stadium and facility items on a grid to gain benefits and provides tools to create and export custom logos, mascots, and uniforms.

idea_1: This feature allows players to create and save custom plays and formations, tracks play tendencies using AI, and enables sharing and downloading playbooks with others.
idea_2: This feature lets players use focus points to change plays before the snap by flipping runs, adjusting protections, or modifying routes according to the defense.
idea_3: This feature provides a Film Room displaying opponent tendencies with heatmaps and down-and-distance reports. Users can spend scouting credits to access additional insights and practice counters.
idea_4: This feature assigns player roles and bonuses according to the coordinator’s strategy. Players aligned with the scheme perform better and have higher morale, while others perform less effectively.
idea_5: This feature provides weekly skill drills and mini-camps as short challenges where users can earn specific XP by selecting either higher intensity with injury risk or lighter practice for slower progress.
idea_6: This feature enables contract negotiations with agents, including adding clauses and incentives such as team or player options, performance bonuses, and no-trade clauses that impact morale, salary cap, and signing likelihood.
idea_7: This feature adjusts ball physics, player footing, fatigue, and injury risk according to weather and field conditions. Players can modify gear, strategies, and stadium upgrades in response.
idea_8: This feature introduces momentum, sideline energy, and coach’s challenges as limited resources that influence player ratings and crowd noise during the game.
idea_9: This feature offers weekly challenges with set schedules and roster limits, allows players to compete on leaderboards, and lets them view replays of top performances.
idea_10: This feature lets you relocate the team to a different city, change uniforms and logos, and updates revenue and player interest based on market factors.

idea_1: This feature connects small clues such as signs, road markings, and driving side in a timed sequence to earn multipliers, requiring smooth movements to keep the combo.
idea_2: This feature allows you to press and hold a button to record a short voice note during a game, which is then transcribed and saved with your round.
idea_3: This feature limits rounds to 10–15 seconds, lets users lock their guesses with one tap, and shows feedback immediately after each round.
idea_4: This feature lets users download specific offline map packs with fixed images to play without internet and syncs scores and progress when connected again.
idea_5: This feature asks you to locate and photograph specific objects in Street View, verifies the photo using on-device vision, and offers hints or bonus points.
idea_6: This feature conducts a short calibration, places you in a ranked tier, and gives a list of skills to practice, including phone codes, vegetation, and pole types.
idea_7: This feature divides regions into 11x11 grids where players capture tiles by scoring above local medians, form chains for bonuses, and compete with others to take tiles.
idea_8: This feature lets users play multiple maps in a row with options to shuffle, repeat, and move to the next map automatically. Creators can add notes between rounds.
idea_9: This feature provides optional tools such as a compass, sun-angle clock, and ruler for measuring distance and area, usable in practice and custom game modes.
idea_10: This feature lets you or a team find titan positions using limited moves, tracks time spent, adjusts conditions, and gives badges when tasks are completed.

idea_1: This feature allows you to rotate your phone to change the view using the gyroscope, providing small vibrations when aligned with cardinal directions or the estimated sun position.
idea_2: This feature allows you to tap and hold to highlight visual details like script type, road markings, pole shapes, and driving side, then shows what was detected after guessing.
idea_3: This feature creates 2-minute practice sessions targeting locations you frequently confuse and tracks your progress using specific types of clues rather than just countries.
idea_4: This feature allows you to download specific scene packs for offline use, with scoring that updates when you reconnect online. You can filter packs by difficulty, location, rules, or skills.
idea_5: This feature allows you to view a location in different years or seasons using Street View and make guesses about both the place and the time.
idea_6: This feature allows you to replay a finished seed displaying a top player’s route with timed notes, and lets you record and share your own annotated runs.
idea_7: This feature gives vibration and color changes that decrease as you move your pin closer to the target in practice modes.
idea_8: This feature allows you to tap on signs to see their language, script, and possible regions, with an option to view a full translation that uses some of your score.
idea_9: This feature lets teammates take short turns of 10–15 seconds each to make moves or leave notes before the next player takes their turn.
idea_10: This feature offers optional spatial audio and haptic feedback to show nearby environment details, along with high-contrast overlays and color-blind friendly color settings.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons on credit, income, and references, provides a practice application with a score and checklist, and saves a resume for filling applications automatically.
idea_2: This feature allows you to share listings privately, where others can add pros, cons, and checklists, and it shows feedback and differences from your saved preferences.
idea_3: This feature allows users to choose preferences such as pets, parking, and move-in date, updates price and terms, submits applications to several listings, and schedules self-guided tours.
idea_4: This feature gathers verified resident reviews on noise, maintenance, water pressure, package security, and internet providers, requests move-out feedback, and shows summarized living-experience scores.
idea_5: This feature offers live and virtual tours with speech-to-text captions, adjustable audio volume, and a noise meter that measures and records room sound levels.
idea_6: This feature allows users to earn points by verifying their profile, attending tours, submitting reviews, and maintaining search streaks, which can be redeemed for rewards.
idea_7: This feature lets users find verified roommates nearby, set a shared budget and wish list, start a joint application with assigned roles, split fees, and track a shared timeline.
idea_8: This feature allows you to download neighborhood details such as maps, photos, tours, transit, schools, and safety information for offline access, syncing notes and photos when online.
idea_9: This feature displays flood, wildfire, heat, air quality, and storm risk information on listings, predicts sunlight and shade, and sends severe weather alerts for saved homes or move-in dates.
idea_10: This feature stores documents, extracts information to complete landlord applications, enables sharing through temporary links, supports electronic signatures, and tracks applications and payments.

idea_1: This feature allows you to choose lease length, start date, parking, pets, and furnished options to see updated pricing, upfront costs, and monthly rent with a 24-hour quote lock.
idea_2: This feature shows estimated hourly noise levels, air quality, and natural light for each unit using traffic, sensor, and sun-angle data, including sound profiles and quiet hours.
idea_3: This feature calculates travel times for several household members and activities, considering transit reliability and weather, and compares weekly time and costs for driving, transit, biking, and walking.
idea_4: This feature creates a route for your selected listings, shows travel and visit times, allows ride bookings, and sends access codes when provided.
idea_5: This feature shows suggested offers, concessions, and move-in dates based on listing information, and generates negotiation messages with alerts for updates like price changes or listing duration.
idea_6: This feature displays a building’s health score using inspection results, maintenance response times, elevator status, pest reports, and resident feedback. It also lets users request and sign maintenance agreements in the app.
idea_7: This feature calculates move-in costs by date, including deposits, rent, movers, permits, and utilities. It also lets users book vendors and tracks insurance certificates automatically.
idea_8: This feature allows you to upload a lease to get summaries of important clauses, fees, legal details, calculate monthly costs, and ask questions before signing.
idea_9: This feature helps users find roommates for 2–3 bedroom apartments by matching budget, schedules, cleanliness, and lease preferences, and manages shared deposits, bills, and agreements online.
idea_10: This feature gives a reliability score for each listing by checking images, prices, duplicates, and owner details. Application fees are held until verification and a viewing occur.

idea_1: This feature allows you to create reusable groups of selected ID fields, preview the data to be shared, and generate signed tokens for login purposes.
idea_2: This feature lets users queue multiple eID logins and access several services with a single NFC scan, avoiding the need to scan repeatedly.
idea_3: This feature helps align the device for NFC using voice and vibration signals, highlights on-screen tiles, and allows basic voice commands such as “start” and “cancel.”
idea_4: This feature shows a searchable list of eID-enabled services and portals, organized by category, with links or options to book appointments for in-person steps.
idea_5: This feature displays nearby Bürgerämter and partner locations on a map, showing opening hours, appointment availability, directions, and allows offline access.
idea_6: This feature offers a practice mode that simulates eID logins with test providers, enabling users to follow steps without real data and includes brief animated instructions.
idea_7: This feature generates a signed PDF receipt after an eID check, containing a QR code that allows offline verification by insurers, schools, or HR portals.
idea_8: This feature generates one-time offline tokens that confirm age or residency with a yes/no answer, allowing staff to verify them using QR codes or NFC without revealing personal data.
idea_9: This feature detects the chip location on your card, guides you to move your phone for scanning, adjusts in real time, and saves the best positions for future scans.
idea_10: This feature creates temporary verification links that grant limited service access for a set time and allows users to revoke access anytime from a dashboard.

idea_1: This feature allows users to choose or create data profiles that share specific information, such as age or name, for each service and saves these settings for later use.
idea_2: This feature generates signed consent receipts after each identification, displaying shared data, legal basis, and recipient. Receipts are stored on the device and can be exported as PDF or JSON files.
idea_3: This feature generates temporary QR codes from the eID to verify age or eligibility offline. Shops and venues check these codes using a companion app without internet.
idea_4: This feature lets users log in on a desktop by scanning a QR code once, then approve later logins on their phone with push notifications and biometric verification.
idea_5: This feature lets users electronically sign PDFs and forms with a certified remote device linked to the eID, verify signatures, and perform batch signing and timestamping.
idea_6: This feature displays required and optional data fields, explains legal reasons for data requests, highlights unusual demands, and offers a one-tap option to limit shared data.
idea_7: This feature guides users through recovering their PIN or PUK, provides optional video identification, and includes a PIN test and NFC orientation to avoid errors.
idea_8: This feature provides a wallet to store EUDI-compatible verifiable credentials from the eID, enabling selective sharing and offline use in multiple countries.
idea_9: This feature lets you suspend the online ID function, notify the authority, receive a status ticket, and follow the process for replacement or reactivation.
idea_10: This feature lets a trusted helper provide on-screen guidance remotely during a limited time session, with user consent and local recording, without accessing personal data.

idea_1: This feature displays an aquarium where children earn fish food by completing math questions and tapping stones for mini-questions. They can unlock and customize fish, plants, and sounds.
idea_2: This feature allows kids to practice percent-off, unit price, and tax by choosing deals on in-game items with time limits and set budget goals.
idea_3: This feature links answering questions correctly to character movements in an obstacle run and shows class-only leaderboards with rankings by topic for timed practice.
idea_4: This feature lets users record their solution steps by pressing and holding, converts them into a math journal, detects missing parts, provides hints, and enables sharing with teachers or parents.
idea_5: This feature lets players collaborate to solve math problems in timed rounds, choose roles with team advantages, and earn rewards during events.
idea_6: This feature allows kids to use transformations, symmetry, and fractions to create geometric art, customize avatars or homes, and complete related challenges.
idea_7: This feature lets family members complete quests together, share rewards, play narrated challenges with music offline, and sync their progress when online.
idea_8: This feature updates the game environment according to local weather, provides related missions, and sends alerts when new weather-based quests are available nearby.
idea_9: This feature lets users rate challenges with one tap and use emojis to give feedback on difficulty. Adults and teachers can filter topics, rewards, and problem types.
idea_10: This feature lets users download quest sets by topic or grade to play offline. Progress, streaks, and rewards update automatically when connected again.

idea_1: This feature detects incorrect answers, shows a brief visual explanation, gives a similar question with solving tools, and highlights patterns for teachers.
idea_2: This feature lets teachers or parents create storylines, select standards, generate challenges for students, and share or edit quests using codes.
idea_3: This feature allows players to work together in boss battles by solving individual problems, sharing a team health bar and timer, and unlocking team buffs through explanations.
idea_4: This feature uses the camera to detect shapes, angles, and lengths in the surroundings, checks the results, and unlocks in-game abilities while processing data on the device.
idea_5: This feature allows kids to choose a problem-solving method, records their selections, and identifies when their chosen method does not match the problem requirements.
idea_6: This feature records scratchpad steps and optional voice notes for questions, lets students review their work, and enables teachers to give feedback using quick stamps.
idea_7: This feature allows users to download offline adventure packs aligned with assigned skills and syncs progress securely with integrity checks when connected to the internet.
idea_8: This feature offers a focus mode that reduces visual effects, allows speed adjustment, includes dyslexia-friendly fonts, color-contrast settings, and optional breathing breaks with gentle prompts.
idea_9: This feature unlocks blueprints for buildings, pets, or gadgets after solving area, perimeter, fraction, and budget problems, then allows testing designs in physics mini-games.
idea_10: This feature offers live seasonal events with activities such as math escape rooms and timed challenges, supports dynamic matchmaking, and lets teachers monitor progress, add puzzles, and assign rewards.

idea_1: This feature offers daily 3-minute exercises on managing bills, negotiating, and saving, tracks user progress and confidence, and unlocks additional lessons and rewards.
idea_2: This feature allows users to earn Brigit Coins by playing mini-games and completing surveys, which can be redeemed for fee credits, gift cards, or donations.
idea_3: This feature allows you to set a budget by adding categories, adjusting rules, and assigning amounts per paycheck, with an option to repeat the previous month’s setup.
idea_4: This feature allows users to form small groups to set goals, monitor progress, and receive referral rewards when members achieve milestones, with settings to manage shared information.
idea_5: This feature allows you to adjust sliders for savings, debt, cash buffer, and credit-building speed, or select presets to update recommendations, alerts, and automatic transfers.
idea_6: This feature allows you to find local gigs, discounts, and assistance programs based on your location and schedule, and lets you apply or save them with a swipe.
idea_7: This feature allows you to set quiet hours that delay cash advances or require extra confirmation for late-night requests, while automatic payments and savings proceed as scheduled.
idea_8: This feature allows you to listen to short 60–120 second audio clips during commutes, choose kid-friendly voices, and earn points by listening and checking in.
idea_9: This feature scans bills and paystubs to identify amounts, due dates, and income, generates a payment plan, and lets users export PDFs of the plan or receipts.
idea_10: This feature provides a 14-day cash flow forecast, allowing users to view surplus or shortfall days and select options like cash advances, bill rescheduling, or earning opportunities.

idea_1: This feature helps manage bill due dates based on a user’s pay schedule, sets automatic payment buffers, offers payment plan options, and provides small cash advances when necessary.
idea_2: This feature gives a one-time virtual card restricted to certain categories and amounts, with any unused funds automatically returned after use.
idea_3: This feature allows users to repay advances through small daily or per-transaction deductions, pauses repayments when the balance is low, and lets users adjust the repayment speed.
idea_4: This feature shows how actions like payments impact your credit score and cash flow by a chosen date, and sets up scheduled payments and reminders.
idea_5: This feature identifies overdraft, NSF, or incorrect fees, requests refunds automatically, displays the likelihood of recovery, and tracks the amounts refunded.
idea_6: This feature lets you check eligibility for SNAP, WIC, utility relief, EITC, and local programs, prefill applications, upload documents, and update budgets with approved benefits.
idea_7: This feature allows users to form groups for shared bills, provides cash advances for shortfalls, tracks payments with due dates and reminders, and automatically settles balances.
idea_8: This feature links to payroll or gig apps to confirm upcoming earnings, enables automatic repayment from the next payment, and provides higher advance limits with instant deposit.
idea_9: This feature allows you to pause subscriptions, set spending limits on a Brigit card, and allocate money for essentials using advances and income, with a meter showing coverage days.
idea_10: This feature allows you to set automatic actions such as advancing cash when your balance is low, saving money for gas, or locking your card after unusual charges.

idea_1: This feature allows users to track their menu activity by earning badges and rewards, and includes optional kid profiles that show kid-friendly items and milestones.
idea_2: This feature tracks rewards using streaks and multipliers based on time and location, applies the best discount automatically at checkout, and shows points earned for each item.
idea_3: This feature suggests food combinations based on group size, preferences, and spice levels. It shows per-person cost, taxes by ZIP code, and nutrition and allergen details.
idea_4: This feature lets users personalize buckets and boxes with names, emojis, and colors, view them in augmented reality, and save the designs for future orders.
idea_5: This feature offers daily tasks like trying a new sauce or ordering pickup twice, tracks progress with a bar, and unlocks small rewards when completed.
idea_6: This feature lets multiple users join a shared cart through a link, add items, pay individually, and get instant wallet credits for any changes or refunds.
idea_7: This feature offers biometric lock, device authorization, one-tap account freeze, alerts for unusual activity, and masked delivery names or notes to help protect user identity.
idea_8: This feature allows you to choose a location to compare nearby KFC stores by wait time, menu items, and offers. You can also set a pin for curbside pickup or meeting points.
idea_9: This feature sends notifications about special offers, item availability, and order progress. Users can customize notification preferences and set quiet hours.
idea_10: This feature allows users to create and share order links that others can copy or change. It also enables sending a Bucket Gift with a message and scheduled delivery.

idea_1: This feature allows you to enter the number of adults and kids, select preferences, and automatically creates a bucket with items and costs, which you can adjust before checkout.
idea_2: This feature allows you to save your packaging and sauce preferences for wings, which the kitchen uses to prepare your order and manage preparation time.
idea_3: This feature displays current kitchen wait times and pickup status. It also lets users choose off-peak pickup times to earn rewards or get add-on discounts.
idea_4: This feature allows customers to check in using their license plate or Bluetooth, notifying the store of their arrival and assigning a curbside spot for order pickup.
idea_5: This feature allows you to schedule multiple pickups in one order and payment, notifies you about limited-time items, and automatically replaces unavailable items with approved alternatives.
idea_6: This feature organizes your order into lower-cost bundles, suggests small changes to reduce the price, allows applying all savings with one tap, and shows the total saved.
idea_7: This feature allows users to start a group order by sharing a link, so each person can add items and pay their portion including tax and tip.
idea_8: This feature allows users to split a wings order into two sauce choices with adjustable toss amounts for each half or select half tossed and half on the side. It also saves wing preferences for faster reordering.
idea_9: This feature allows users to choose when their order is cooked, shows how long the food has been ready, and provides options if the wait time is too long.
idea_10: This feature allows you to schedule visits to multiple KFC locations with coordinated arrival times, view menus and deals for each store, and reorder your usual items at each stop.

idea_1: This feature provides short lessons with practice tasks on taking event photos, writing captions, and collecting quotes. Users can submit pitches and earn badges after completing lessons.
idea_2: This feature allows you to invite contacts to form a private group where you can view their reading, saving, and discussions, along with occasional story recommendations.
idea_3: This feature displays local news, road closures, and safety alerts alongside hourly weather forecasts for your routes and destinations. It also allows saving plans for updates.
idea_4: This feature awards points for reading articles, posting comments, attending events, and participating in quizzes or polls. Points can be redeemed or donated.
idea_5: This feature lets users apply filters for neighborhood, topic, public records, and source credibility, save and share them as QR codes, and switch between Spanish and English.
idea_6: This feature isolates voices, adjusts speech speed, shows captions, and enhances audio quality for live briefings, town-hall talks, and street interviews on earbuds.
idea_7: This feature saves articles as PDFs, lets you highlight and add notes, includes related documents automatically, and allows exporting files or syncing them to your cloud drive.
idea_8: This feature adds verified badges to officials, journalists, and organizations, lets users earn reputation points, and uses checks and AI tools to support respectful discussions.
idea_9: This feature sends location-based alerts for severe weather and emergencies, shows radar and outage maps, provides a live blog, translates alerts to Spanish, and includes an offline checklist.
idea_10: This feature downloads daily audio summaries, weekend articles, important documents, and kid-friendly explainers for offline listening without needing an internet connection.

idea_1: This feature displays a map with a radius option (200 m–5 km) that filters news, alerts, and discussions nearby and marks unusual activity from local services.
idea_2: This feature displays recent news, permits, closures, and upcoming events on buildings through your camera. A time slider lets you see changes on the block from the past week.
idea_3: This feature allows reporters to contact nearby residents for quotes, photos, or tips during breaking news. Participants can submit anonymously and receive contributor badges.
idea_4: This feature shows summary cards about how news stories impact your saved addresses, like parking or school changes, and allows you to add deadlines to your calendar.
idea_5: This feature adds a bar below issue-based stories with buttons for calling or emailing local officials, sending prewritten comments, RSVPing to meetings, and setting deadline reminders.
idea_6: This feature displays local issues as timelines with key dates, progress updates, and comparisons of promises and results. Users get alerts for important events.
idea_7: This feature adds a “Verify This” button on important claims that displays sources, verification status, and reviewers, enabling community experts to provide evidence and information.
idea_8: This feature uses incident reports, lighting, and foot-traffic data to evaluate route safety at various times and displays safest arrival and exit times on event pages.
idea_9: This feature shows Spanish and English text side by side, plays audio pronunciations of local names, and lets users suggest changes to the translations.
idea_10: This feature links local service and transit updates to your saved routes, sending alerts about disruptions, detours, and estimated resolution times while respecting your quiet hours.

idea_1: This Feature offers preset game scenarios where players use spells and abilities to complete challenges within 1-3 turns, with timed attempts and scoring.
idea_2: This Feature helps you create a deck by selecting an archetype, listing required cards, showing missing cards, wildcard costs, budget alternatives, event legality, and availability.
idea_3: This feature lets you rent a full tier deck for a limited number of matches or events by paying with gold or gems, including scheduling and automatic return.
idea_4: This feature offers a subscription that grants temporary access to rotating card sets, early entry to new set test queues, monthly cosmetic items, and limited deck sharing between linked accounts.
idea_5: This feature lets teams and clubs create custom logos for sleeves, avatars, and emote stingers to use in team lobbies and tournament brackets.
idea_6: This feature offers tools such as draw-odds calculators, curve coverage alerts, color-source suggestions, a sideboard planning worksheet, and a meta map displaying matchup changes against top archetypes.
idea_7: This feature allows you to record short voice notes and highlight clips during or after matches, automatically tags them with game details, and lets you save, sync, and share them.
idea_8: This feature offers a quick game mode using 30-card decks, 15 life points, shorter turns, and rewards that grow with consecutive wins.
idea_9: This feature saves discounts on cosmetics, event entries, and mastery boosts, applying them automatically at checkout. Users earn these coupons by completing tasks or watching streams.
idea_10: This feature lets players change card styles, sleeves, and avatars with glaze and glitter effects, complete challenges, and earn cosmetic tokens that can be traded.

idea_1: This feature allows you to watch a replay after each match, highlighting important turns and exploring alternative plays with estimated win-rate changes. It works offline.
idea_2: This feature allows you to practice drafts against bots using current pick data, displays color signals during drafting, and provides curve, synergy grades, and cut suggestions afterward.
idea_3: This feature lets you use a token to rent a full tier deck for 24 to 48 hours, playable in unranked matches and certain events without crafting cards.
idea_4: This feature allows you to mark decks or cards and notifies you when they are available in the store, packs, or events. It also tracks wildcard usage.
idea_5: This feature lets users create or join brackets with automatic pairings, locked decklists, timers, prize distribution, and an optional spectator mode with delay and hidden cards.
idea_6: This feature lets friends build decks together, chat or use voice, test opening hands, view live odds, and quickly start a private group gauntlet.
idea_7: This feature uses a camera or screenshot to scan a paper deck, creates a practice deck, detects illegal cards, and suggests legal replacements for specific formats.
idea_8: This feature displays a time-of-day heatmap of common ladder archetypes, compares your decks' performance using anonymized data, and suggests queues with the highest expected value.
idea_9: This feature alerts players about mulligan rates, color-screw risk, mana curve gaps, and flood/clump variance, suggests land base adjustments, and tracks their effect on win rate.
idea_10: This feature lets players form clubs with chat, shared goals, and weekly challenges that reward cosmetics and badges. Club gauntlets combine member matches to practice sideboard strategies.

idea_1: This feature adds a combo meter that fills as you clear cards and flip without using undo or hints, activating temporary power moves at certain levels.
idea_2: This feature gives daily coupons that allow extra undo moves, show the next card, offer discounted themes, and sometimes provide 3D card sets to change the game appearance.
idea_3: This feature allows you to press and hold to record a 5–30 second voice note tied to the current board state, which is transcribed and saved on the move timeline.
idea_4: This feature records game replays with marked key moments, enables easy navigation through the replay, and allows users to export short highlight clips with optional selfie and captions.
idea_5: This feature allows you to play levels with different themes, each containing unique challenges, special cards, obstacles, and occasional boss encounters that introduce new gameplay rules.
idea_6: This feature lets users create or join clubs, customize mascots and deck-backs, track weekly league stats, and complete club goals through checkpoints.
idea_7: This feature evaluates possible moves by assessing mobility, free-column status, and deadlock risk, and displays which columns a selected run can reach before and after an intermediate move.
idea_8: This feature allows users to share a specific game deal through a link or QR code and send short text or voice messages. Family Rooms collect weekly game sets for group play without needing accounts.
idea_9: This feature offers smaller tableau layouts and a 60-second mode where cleared runs add time. It uses official seeded boards for consistent leaderboards and replays.
idea_10: This feature shows remaining trial days and upcoming charges, allows subscription cancellation, and provides focus timers, break reminders, and preset visual styles for gameplay.

idea_1: This feature provides a preview before dealing a new row, showing locked columns, preserved sequences, chances of revealing face-down cards, and simulates the top three move options.
idea_2: This feature highlights same-suit sequences, breakpoints, and movable cards, shows a purity score for each column, and filters moves to maintain or increase purity.
idea_3: This feature offers a list of solvable Spider Solitaire games, displays global leaderboards, and lets users challenge friends with the same game arrangements.
idea_4: This feature gives hints by showing the next move and explaining actions like revealing a face-down card, creating an empty column, or grouping cards by suit.
idea_5: This feature lets two players alternate moves on one game, share a set number of undos, and keep track of their combined performance.
idea_6: This feature offers 30–60 second practice drills that focus on specific tasks and adjusts exercises based on recent game performance to address areas needing improvement.
idea_7: This feature allows you to set a goal, then generates and displays the shortest legal moves to reach it, which you can play automatically or review step by step.
idea_8: This feature shows a replay of the game with markers and heatmaps indicating challenging areas, displays a timing score, and enables quick comparison of different moves.
idea_9: This feature changes the game difficulty by beginning with fewer suits and adding more suits as you clear columns or reach specific points in the game.
idea_10: This feature turns win streaks into charges that let you reveal a face-down card or preview the next deal’s top layer, usable immediately or saved for later.

idea_1: This feature offers checklists, brief lessons, and AR overlays to help you evaluate used cars and identify key areas to examine during your assessment.
idea_2: This feature lets users create a shared board to save cars, where invited people can comment, vote, and rank options using a private link that updates instantly.
idea_3: This feature lets you download saved used car listings with photos, 360° views, specifications, and comparisons to view and edit offline, syncing changes when connected.
idea_4: This feature offers model-year reviews from CarMax buyers, showing maintenance costs, MPG, comfort, issues, and a Q&A section, with ratings organized by trim and mileage.
idea_5: This feature tracks weather conditions along your route and at the store to provide test-drive times, rescheduling options, and updates for delivery or pickup during severe weather.
idea_6: This feature lets users capture voice notes, photos, and engine sounds during test drives, automatically organizing them by vehicle and condition, with accessibility support.
idea_7: This feature offers car-related mini-games, trivia, and quiet activities for children, along with optional comfort ratings and digital stickers for the car models viewed.
idea_8: This feature allows users to browse nearby used cars by swiping, view match scores based on preferences, create a shortlist, and receive alerts for price changes or new listings.
idea_9: This feature lets users set specific search filters for used cars, save these searches with alerts, and share the search results using QR codes.
idea_10: This feature allows users to earn points by completing tasks such as lessons, identity verification, test drives, and trade-in photo submissions, which can be redeemed for discounts or donations.

idea_1: This feature shows the total cost of owning a used car by VIN, including local taxes, insurance estimates, maintenance costs, and fuel or charging expenses based on your driving.
idea_2: This feature uses your camera to show if a car fits in your space and allows you to place virtual items in the trunk to check cargo capacity.
idea_3: This Feature creates a test-drive route based on your usual commute and weekend drives, offers prompts to check important features, and lets you record voice notes linked to the car.
idea_4: This feature displays a reconditioning timeline with inspection photos, replaced parts, tire and brake measurements, technician notes, and remaining OEM warranty details for each vehicle.
idea_5: This feature shows price comparisons, availability status, and expected depreciation for a car trim, and sends alerts about when to buy or wait based on price changes.
idea_6: This feature uses an AR scan and checklist to find basic improvements for a trade-in vehicle, estimates their value increase, and enables booking services before appraisal.
idea_7: This feature lets users create a shared list of used cars where participants can vote, comment, rank choices, and organize test drives and financing information.
idea_8: This feature gives a score based on your commute, climate, parking, and travel habits for gas, hybrid, and electric vehicles, including charging and road-trip information.
idea_9: This feature offers instant insurance quotes from various providers for a selected vehicle, displays the monthly cost, and enables purchasing insurance and extended protection during checkout.
idea_10: This feature offers a digital storage for imported documents, recall alerts, maintenance reminders, warranty and claim management, resale value updates, and re-offer requests.

idea_1: This feature offers brief exercises and gives real-time feedback on speaking volume, microphone distance, plosives, and sibilance to assist in improving recording quality.
idea_2: This feature estimates noise levels from your location and time, then automatically adjusts gain, noise reduction, and equalizer settings accordingly.
idea_3: This feature detects sudden loud sounds and lowers their volume to reduce impact. It also shows notifications and a timeline to review these events.
idea_4: This feature lets you adjust and switch microphone amplification settings for different environments, either automatically or manually, and works offline with minimal delay.
idea_5: This feature allows you to add and organize audio effects such as EQ, compressor, gate, de-esser, de-noise, and sides, and control them with voice commands.
idea_6: This feature lets users install modules like preamp emulations and listening modes with one tap, and allows creators to publish, update, and sell add-ons securely.
idea_7: This feature lets you create filters and profiles, assign them to apps or contacts, enable automatic activation, and share or import settings using QR codes or codes.
