idea_8: This feature increases microphone sound volume, adds animations and voice effects, limits maximum volume, and provides large controls and prompts for easier use while driving.
idea_9: This feature allows a second phone to function as a wireless microphone via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct with low delay, enabling multiple nearby listeners to connect with privacy controls.
idea_10: This feature allows users to earn rewards by rating presets, writing reviews, and maintaining listening streaks, which can be redeemed for modules or gift cards.

idea_1: This feature allows you to connect a remote microphone and combines its input with your device’s microphone to capture a specific person’s voice in noisy settings.
idea_2: This feature detects the environment and automatically adjusts equalizer, noise reduction, reverb removal, and volume settings, allowing one-tap switching with saved preferences.
idea_3: This feature reduces microphone feedback using adaptive filters and phase adjustments and shows a meter that indicates the safe volume range for speakers.
idea_4: This feature performs a 60-second hearing test to create a personalized amplification curve for each ear, saves multiple profiles, and changes them automatically according to the environment.
idea_5: This feature measures delay to Bluetooth or hearing aids, adjusts audio timing for lip-sync, and allows multiple users to receive the amplified sound through LE Audio broadcast.
idea_6: This feature shows live captions on the device, temporarily amplifies specific speech sounds, and can save a short text summary instead of recording audio.
idea_7: This feature monitors sound levels continuously, limits loud peaks, reduces sudden noises, alerts when daily exposure is high, and adjusts gain automatically.
idea_8: This feature keeps a private 30–120 second audio buffer, enabling you to rewind recent sounds, add bookmarks, and export short audio clips as needed.
idea_9: This feature uses head-tracking earbuds to keep spatial audio cues and lets users adjust stereo width to help distinguish overlapping voices in group conversations.
idea_10: This feature uses phone orientation to adjust the microphone’s focus area size and allows pressing and holding to temporarily increase the volume.

idea_1: This feature allows users to navigate a PDF by voice, enabling hands-free movement through sections such as abstract, methods, and figures using spoken commands.
idea_2: This feature records your reading time, pages, topics, and difficulty, lets you set weekly goals, suggests a reading plan, and automatically logs sessions from your devices.
idea_3: This feature estimates a suitable reading speed for each section based on the content, alerts you if important details might be missed, and can control the scroll speed.
idea_4: This feature generates vocabulary exercises, quizzes, and puzzles from the PDF and highlights, tracks progress by topic, and adds completed definitions to margin notes.
idea_5: This feature shows a translation beside the original text, lets users switch between side-by-side view and text-to-speech, and offers definitions and synonyms when words are tapped.
idea_6: This feature lets you invite others to collaborate on your document for a limited time, enabling OCR cleanup, section tagging, note adding, and task and version management.
idea_7: This feature detects claims in documents, displays related studies, indicates evidence strength and conflicts of interest, adds disclaimers for weak evidence, and suggests further sources.
idea_8: This feature allows you to create flashcards from highlights, images, and equations, review them in various modes, and switch between the flashcards and the original content.
idea_9: This feature displays a map of the PDF with markers for headings, tables, figures, and references, allows zooming from overview to details, and shows content density heatmaps.
idea_10: This feature scans a DOI, ISBN, QR code, or the PDF’s first page to find metadata, open-access links, citation counts, and document details such as length and reading time.

idea_1: This feature allows you to long-press a paragraph to see a plain-language explanation with examples and definitions, displayed as an inline note connected to the page.
idea_2: This feature displays definitions, clauses, and references in a document, lets users see all instances of a term, and enables navigation back to the original location.
idea_3: This feature allows you to select tables for cleaning and export as CSV files, save figures as high-resolution images, and zoom while keeping headers visible.
idea_4: This feature allows you to ask questions and get answer cards with quoted excerpts and page links from multiple PDFs. You can save, share, and access the quotes directly.
idea_5: This feature generates flashcards from highlighted text with fill-in-the-blank prompts, links them to the original content, and schedules brief review sessions for practice.
idea_6: This feature lets multiple users view the same PDF page with highlights and a laser pointer in real time using a secure, temporary link without sharing the file.
idea_7: This feature displays two PDF versions side by side, highlights differences in text and figures, and lets users export a report with page numbers and excerpts.
idea_8: This feature identifies personal information for redaction with one tap, applies permanent blackouts, and enables sharing via unique links that expire and have watermarks.
idea_9: This feature reads PDFs aloud with a natural voice, automatically handles footnotes by skipping or summarizing them, allows expanding footnotes with gestures, and supports offline pronunciation and acronym settings.
idea_10: This feature shows a heatmap of your reading activity, marks unread sections, offers prompts to continue or summarize, and tracks focused and distracted reading time.

idea_1: This feature displays a streak meter for consecutive valid moves, temporarily enlarges tap targets, automatically snaps cards into place, and clears some obstacle cards.
idea_2: This feature gives three coupons daily that can be used to increase text size, undo moves, or change the theme. Unused coupons accumulate weekly.
idea_3: This feature allows you to record a 5 to 20 second voice memo connected to a specific game deal, which can be played back or shared with others.
idea_4: This feature lets you control the game using voice commands such as “hint,” “undo,” “shuffle,” or “move to foundation,” with clear on-screen confirmations and pacing adjustments.
idea_5: This feature helps you choose draw mode, contrast, tap size, and session length in 60 seconds, then makes a checklist and sets the difficulty level automatically.
idea_6: This feature allows you to choose a route with multiple stops, change game rules at each stop, and download content to play without an internet connection.
idea_7: This feature allows you to add fish, stones, and lighting to an aquarium by winning games and provides breathing guidance during breaks between hands.
idea_8: This feature measures your comfortable tap range and adjusts columns, gaps, and buttons. It also lets you save profiles for different devices and hand preferences.
idea_9: This feature offers a selection of visual themes and optional short messages during wins or pauses. Users can change message settings and create a mascot for big wins.
idea_10: This feature allows you to hum into the microphone to create background sounds or record shuffle and win noises. It also lowers audio and animations during Quiet Hours.

idea_1: This feature monitors your play speed, mistakes, and pauses to adjust card size, contrast, and hint timing. It also suggests breaks and adapts on your device.
idea_2: This feature lets users control the game with voice commands or large gestures to make moves, get hints, and undo actions without requiring internet access.
idea_3: This feature inserts brief 30–60 second breathing or stretch breaks between hands and can resume the game automatically. It also provides slow-motion animations to minimize visual distractions.
idea_4: This feature allows users to set family photos as card backs and table mats, blurs photo backgrounds automatically, and can display dated photos in a daily rotation.
idea_5: This feature lets two to four players play the same game deal together, chat while playing, and allows others to watch without joining the game.
idea_6: This feature sends weekly updates about your play frequency, session length, and mood check-ins to a trusted contact, who can also send voice notes or reminders you can accept or mute.
idea_7: This feature reads the selected card aloud with adjustable speed and pitch, provides vibration feedback, and displays high-contrast suit patterns to support color-blind users.
idea_8: This feature identifies well-planned moves, assesses how clear decisions are, and gives one daily tip. Feedback is private and aimed at helping improve choices.
idea_9: This feature generates printable QR codes with large text for community centers to join a weekly leaderboard. Offline scores update automatically when the device reconnects to the internet.
idea_10: This feature allows you to select a 3, 7, or 12-minute game session, offers layouts that fit the chosen time, and shows a summary at the end.

idea_1: This feature offers daily identification exercises and brief lessons on insect anatomy and related species, using spaced repetition to help users practice and monitor their progress.
idea_2: This feature lets users add and vote on tips about insects, while experts can confirm identifications and point out common mistakes.
idea_3: This feature provides timed challenges using selected photos and trait-matching tasks. Users can earn badges and view leaderboards without affecting scientific data.
idea_4: This feature gives points for confirmed sightings, reviews, and habitat activities. Points can be exchanged for premium packs, plant discounts, or donations to conservation groups.
idea_5: This feature shows hourly insect activity forecasts based on local weather, season, and habitat, and displays charts of your insect observations throughout the year.
idea_6: This feature allows you to find nearby naturalists, organize group outings, share live species locations with distance options, invite friends, conduct surveys, and export or sync data.
idea_7: This feature lets you download local species information, images, sounds, and comparison tools for offline use. It also monitors rare species and provides notifications.
idea_8: This feature uses simple language, voice narration, and animations, offers a selection of species, and includes quizzes and stickers to support children's learning.
idea_9: This feature allows you to search insects by size, color, pattern, behavior, activity time, and habitat, and create custom trait keys for identification and sharing.
idea_10: This feature sends alerts about mosquito, tick, and stinging insect activity, provides prevention and first-aid information, and displays insect hotspots and movements on a map.

idea_1: This feature helps you take insect photos from various angles using on-screen outlines and a confidence meter, combines the images automatically, and shows missing views or scale references.
idea_2: This feature records insect sounds using the microphone and identifies species by analyzing wingbeat and stridulation patterns, showing possible species and their activity times.
idea_3: This feature lets you take photos of leaf damage such as mines, galls, chew marks, and frass to identify the insect and its life stage, along with plant details.
idea_4: This feature uses location, weather, and day length to identify insect species and life stages active nearby and shows appropriate times and habitats for observation.
idea_5: This feature uses AR to identify insect traits in real time and shows a life-size silhouette on the screen for size comparison.
idea_6: This feature identifies harmful or regulated insects, provides information based on the user's region, and lets users report invasive species with photos, location, and details to local agencies.
idea_7: This feature sends unclear identifications to experienced users for review and provides each result with a heatmap and a short explanation based on your photo.
idea_8: This feature provides focus and lighting guidance, captures multiple photos, merges them for clarity, suggests scale references, and automatically measures the insect’s body length.
idea_9: This feature displays maps using anonymous insect sightings, weather, and wind data to predict stinging-insect swarms and mosquito activity, and provides local alerts with prevention advice.
idea_10: This feature tracks an insect’s growth stages, sends reminders, shows photo timelines, and creates time-lapse videos for viewing and sharing.

idea_1: This feature allows users to watch shows, movies, and live TV content through the Philo app.
idea_2: This feature displays a 14-day schedule of shows, premieres, and marathons, sends alerts, and automatically manages DVR settings and downloads for travel.
idea_3: This feature allows users to create groups to share watchlists and live viewing status, send temporary guest invites for watch parties, and connect with viewers who have similar interests.
idea_4: This feature lets you test your hearing, create a custom audio profile, use dual audio for earbuds and speakers, and adjust how captions appear.
idea_5: This feature lets you download recorded and on-demand shows to watch offline, manages their expiration and removal, and can automatically preload upcoming episodes.
idea_6: This feature allows users to watch shows, movies, and live TV channels available on the platform.
idea_7: This feature lets verified subscribers post short reactions and reviews, organize them by categories, and take part in polls and Q&A on the episode page.
idea_8: This feature offers a kids mode with large tiles, voice search, offline playlists, and parental controls for time limits, approved channels, and fewer ads.
idea_9: This feature allows users to filter live TV, DVR, and on-demand content by various criteria and save or share their filter settings.
idea_10: This feature allows users to create a list of TV shows, track points from premieres, live viewing, and social interactions, and compete with friends each week.

idea_1: This feature offers AI-generated recaps of ongoing series, lasting 5–12 minutes, updated after each episode and tailored by characters and plotlines to summarize the story.
idea_2: This feature allows you to follow actors, directors, and topics to get updates and notifications about related shows, movies, and live TV content.
idea_3: This feature creates continuous channels based on moods or themes, automatically playing content from the catalog and letting users share a code to watch the same stream together.
idea_4: This feature lets users add comments, emojis, or voice notes with timestamps that friends can see while watching live or recorded shows together.
idea_5: This feature extends live recordings when broadcasts run late, removes duplicate re-airings, organizes content by scenes, songs, and guests, and lets users resume playback with one tap.
idea_6: This feature provides information about songs, guest stars, locations, and props while the video plays, letting users view details without pausing the content.
idea_7: This feature blurs thumbnails, hides descriptions, and blocks next-episode previews until the previous episode is completed, applying to live, DVR, and on-demand content for selected shows.
idea_8: This feature allows users to choose when and what types of ads they see and earn credits by interacting with ads to increase DVR storage or view extra content previews.
idea_9: This feature lets users switch shows to audio-only mode with scene descriptions, play audio in the background, use large playback controls, and save audio for offline listening.
idea_10: This feature allows you to browse short clips from shows, add them to your queue with a swipe, and automatically plays pilot scenes based on your preferences.

idea_1: This feature helps you estimate food portions through photo and AR exercises, tracks your accuracy, adapts to your progress, and offers short challenges with friends.
idea_2: This feature allows you to form small groups to share progress, send check-ins, track streaks, receive reminders, and use referral links for temporary premium access.
idea_3: This feature allows users to log calories, satiety, mood, and energy after meals, displays a community “Satiation per Calorie” score, and provides alternative food suggestions.
idea_4: This feature allows users to earn points by logging meals, cooking at home, and reaching nutrient goals, which can be exchanged for gift cards or donated to charities.
idea_5: This feature provides short mini-games and surveys that earn coins, which can be used for meal plans or donations, and suggests alternatives or delay options based on your history.
idea_6: This feature lets users log food offline by scanning labels and using a downloadable food pack, with photo recognition processing delayed until Wi-Fi is available.
idea_7: This feature updates hydration and nutrient suggestions according to weather and generates a grocery list of non-perishable foods before storms or trips.
idea_8: This feature lets users log meals with voice commands and earbud gestures, shows high-contrast visuals and captions, provides vibration alerts, and reads meal details aloud.
idea_9: This feature lets users order from partner restaurants, customize ingredients with nutrition information, save preferences, get budget-based suggestions, and select contactless pickup.
idea_10: This feature lets users add diet modules to filter foods by diet type, hide off-plan items, read QR menus, export logs, and import lab results for customization.

idea_1: This feature uses augmented reality to display portion sizes on your plate, converting utensils and handfuls into grams to help track macronutrient amounts during meal preparation.
idea_2: This feature estimates your blood sugar response after a meal using a food photo and profile information, with optional glucose monitor data, and shows color-coded guidance before eating.
idea_3: This feature scans grocery receipts to record items, prices, and expiry dates in a virtual pantry, then recommends meals based on those items and a specified budget.
idea_4: This feature generates a 24–48 hour meal and activity plan following a high-calorie meal and lets you add a shopping list or change the cuisine with one tap.
idea_5: This feature compares raw and cooked food weights, records your cookware and cooking methods, and updates future entries to provide more accurate tracking.
idea_6: This feature records your mood and energy levels, connects them to your food, sleep, and stress data, and recommends alternative foods and snacks during low-energy periods.
idea_7: This feature adjusts meal times, fiber, fat, and portion suggestions based on medications and conditions, tracks side effects, and identifies patterns for healthcare providers.
idea_8: This feature translates menus, estimates portion sizes from photos, suggests food options, and works offline with regional settings to help track meals while traveling.
idea_9: This feature tracks your weekly micronutrient intake, highlights recurring deficiencies, and recommends food substitutions for your next 2–3 meals, updating as you log entries.
idea_10: This feature assesses meals' carbon and water impact, tracks calories and macronutrients, suggests seasonal or lower-impact options, and records consecutive low-impact meal choices.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons and practice tasks to help users learn about BNPL options, track their progress through challenges, and earn rewards for regular use.
idea_2: This feature displays verified reviews, delivery and return information for merchants and items bought with Zip, and shows ratings during the checkout process.
idea_3: This feature displays your installment amounts, upcoming payments, and repayment progress. It allows you to set weekly goals, receive reminders, and track on-time payment streaks.
idea_4: This feature saves receipts, warranties, and order details from Buy Now, Pay Later purchases in one place and lets users easily export proof of purchase when required.
idea_5: This feature lets a host create a shared cart, divide payment amounts among participants, and send each person their Zip payment plan and reminders.
idea_6: This feature lets customers start payments after the trial or return period ends. If the item is returned, the payment plan cancels automatically; if kept, payments begin.
idea_7: This feature sends payment alerts using vibration, visuals, and optional voice reminders. Users can set quiet hours and escalation rules until they respond.
idea_8: This feature allows users to enter their phone number to get a link or code that fills in identity and shipping details for faster Zip approval. Users can also choose to receive text links to manage payments and view plan information.
idea_9: This feature tracks users' on-time payments, provides short money quizzes, and holds occasional bonus draws, allowing users to earn points redeemable for gift cards or cash back.
idea_10: This feature shows subscriptions linked to Zip, provides renewal dates and yearly costs, allows cancellations with one tap, and prevents future charges after cancellation.

idea_1: This feature aligns payment due dates with your paycheck schedule using bank or payroll information and offers a one-time extension each cycle to avoid late fees.
idea_2: This feature monitors price changes on purchased items during the return period and automatically applies any lower price difference to your payment plan or Zip balance.
idea_3: This feature lets you list eligible purchases for resale in the app, provides shipping labels, and uses the sale proceeds to lower or pay off your remaining payments.
idea_4: This feature combines monthly subscription payments into one annual payment to the merchant, lets you pay Zip monthly, allows pausing payments, and applies prorated credits.
idea_5: This feature splits a purchase into multiple payment plans, enabling each person to pay their share separately by approving through a shared link or QR code.
idea_6: This feature pauses upcoming payments with one tap when a return starts, generates return labels, and updates payment plans automatically after the return is processed.
idea_7: This feature offers a small wage advance through payroll partners to cover payments, with specified fees, instant transfer, and automatic repayment on the next payday.
idea_8: This feature shows a 60-day calendar with upcoming Zip payments, card charges, and bills, highlights days with high spending, and lets users reschedule Zip due dates.
idea_9: This feature allows users to turn a recent purchase into a Zip payment plan by scanning the receipt or linking the payment card within 24 hours, creating installments.
idea_10: This feature reports on-time payments to credit agencies, automatically sets aside extra funds to cover payments, and provides a tool to estimate possible credit score changes.

idea_1: This feature offers daily cipher exercises with tips, gradually harder challenges, tracks progress and streaks, and includes a confidence meter to monitor skill levels.
idea_2: This feature uses the microphone to detect and decode Morse, DTMF, or knock codes with noise reduction, and uses the camera to capture and read cryptograms for decoding.
idea_3: This feature lets users submit ciphers or puzzles to get ratings, comments, and suggestions focused on their strength, fairness, and clarity.
idea_4: This feature allows you to invite contacts to join teams, complete timed missions together, share hints, chat within the app, and unlock extra missions via referral links.
idea_5: This feature allows users to create cipher sequences by combining transforms, adjust settings, save presets, apply them to text, share results, and browse community-created recipes with filters.
idea_6: This feature connects you with players of similar skill for live decoding challenges and displays nearby puzzles on a map with optional instant alerts.
idea_7: This feature offers a gallery and API for users to add, manage, and update algorithms, detectors, analyzers, or skins with one-tap installation and automatic updates.
idea_8: This feature allows users to earn keys by completing tasks, then use keys for hints, extra time, moderator roles, or share them with other users.
idea_9: This feature provides number pads for different numeric ciphers, formats long sequences, checks input accuracy, and displays mappings to support working with number-based codes.
idea_10: This feature lets users download puzzle sets and drills for offline use and offers a kid mode with simpler ciphers, narration, and different visuals.

idea_1: This feature tracks your solving patterns to offer hints, mini-lessons, and challenge suggestions. It shows mistakes with replays and recommends solving methods.
idea_2: This feature lets users hide messages inside photos, short videos, or voice notes and retrieve them within the app using various methods and settings.
idea_3: This feature allows 2–4 players to collaborate in real time on code-breaking tasks, each handling a separate part, with timed challenges and shared hints.
idea_4: This feature allows users to create puzzles by arranging ciphers, adding decoys, setting difficulty, publishing to a gallery with ratings and analytics, and sharing them.
idea_5: This feature uses AR to place virtual Enigma or Typex machines on a table, letting users operate rotors by moving the phone and scan keys to adjust settings.
idea_6: This feature identifies possible cipher sequences used on a message and lets you remove each layer one at a time, displaying frequency graphs and analysis information for each step.
idea_7: This feature offers daily tournaments with identical puzzles for all players, regional leaderboards, tie-breaker puzzles, timing checks to detect cheating, and optional ghost runs.
idea_8: This feature uses the flashlight and microphone to send and receive Morse or binary signals through light and sound, with options for noise filtering, speed control, and silent mode.
idea_9: This feature allows you to send encrypted challenge messages that unlock after solving ciphers, include time limits and expiration, track attempts without showing content, and share a QR rescue key.
idea_10: This feature records code changes, key findings, and tests in a timeline while solving puzzles, and allows exporting step-by-step explanations for sharing.

idea_1: This feature guides users through brief security tasks to recognize phishing, review permissions, and adjust settings, adapting difficulty based on user actions and tracking a security score.
idea_2: This feature offers high-contrast visuals, adjustable vibrations, and clear alert sounds, automatically raising volume when background noise is loud or the phone is in a pocket.
idea_3: This feature allows you to share cleaned alerts with trusted contacts and invite them to perform a guided scan using a secure link, showing results and suggested actions.
idea_4: This feature allows you to select or create security task groups, runs them automatically, shows progress updates, and provides an option to undo changes if necessary.
idea_5: This feature records activities such as patching, scanning, and reporting scams to accumulate points that can be redeemed for rewards or donated to digital safety initiatives.
idea_6: This feature identifies cloned apps, invalid developer certificates, excessive permissions, fake Wi-Fi names, and checks SMS links and phone numbers for possible spam or scams.
idea_7: This feature shows reputation scores, user comments, and expert reviews for apps, links, and numbers, enabling users to submit verified reports and information.
idea_8: This feature shows daily risk levels and malware activity based on location, carrier, and Wi-Fi type, and includes an outbreak map, threat updates, and travel security settings.
idea_9: This feature scans files on external storage devices without internet access, using stored definitions to check over 200 file formats without opening the files.
idea_10: This feature lets users install add-ons such as IoT scanner, USB firewall, and business MDM connector, which are kept separate, checked, and updated automatically.

idea_1: This feature generates virtual copies of sensitive data, such as contacts, locations, or photos, for apps with risky permissions and adjusts settings according to app behavior.
idea_2: This feature hides files and monitors their activity for encryption. If detected, it blocks storage access, restores files, and isolates the application causing the activity.
idea_3: This feature reviews app update signatures and metadata using transparency logs, detects changes in permissions or certificates, and can run the update in a separate test environment.
idea_4: This feature opens unknown links in a temporary remote browser with sensors and downloads disabled, allowing access in the regular browser only after security checks are completed.
idea_5: This feature detects harmful domains using a small on-device model and blocks them via a local VPN. The model updates weekly and functions offline.
idea_6: This feature continuously scans for Bluetooth and NFC signals, detects repeated devices, sends alerts with timeline details, and enables quick disabling of connections in selected areas.
idea_7: This feature monitors changes to SIM or eSIM profiles, network identity, and call or SMS routing, and triggers security measures if a SIM-swap is detected.
idea_8: This feature provides compressed filters of URL, IP, and file-hash data for offline matching, with small updates to minimize battery and data consumption.
idea_9: This feature offers a firewall for individual apps, explains unusual network activity in clear terms, suggests rules, and uses behavior controls to prevent misuse without affecting normal functions.
idea_10: This feature creates a temporary isolated workspace to install and run unknown apps with limited clipboard and network access, allowing easy removal or transfer to the main profile.

idea_1: This feature adds special tiles that move pieces on the hex grid and includes weekly routes with moving obstacles and time trials for practicing move sequences.
idea_2: This feature lets players record and replay voice notes, automatically transcribes key moments, and allows users to share clips with others during sessions.
idea_3: This feature offers a trial period with a countdown timer, sends reminders before charging, and allows users to cancel or modify the trial within the app.
idea_4: This feature allows players to use rare power-ups for one run by paying a fee or watching an ad, then displays usage statistics and tips afterward.
idea_5: This feature displays area coverage, path lengths, and clearance probabilities before a move, and allows users to view heatmaps for detailed score analysis.
idea_6: This feature allows users to collect Hex Coupons from events or challenges, apply them automatically at checkout, share them with others, and monitor their expiration times.
idea_7: This feature allows pieces to snap to a hex grid with preview outlines of valid positions. A long-press activates free-aim mode with vibration feedback for alignment.
idea_8: This feature allows players to create and switch between custom sets of six power-up cards and test them in seasonal arenas and friend matches without using items.
idea_9: This feature offers play sessions focused on goals, includes break reminders, allows difficulty adjustments, and lets parents set schedules and rewards to manage playtime.
idea_10: This feature lets users download puzzle sets, music, and effects for offline use, and syncs their progress with a small bonus when they reconnect to the internet.

idea_1: This feature adds wrap-around edges and movable portals that allow pieces leaving one side to re-enter from the opposite side, enabling new movement options in advanced modes.
idea_2: This feature allows users to send shots by flicking, including spin and banked shots, and offers a practice mode with angle guidance, haptic feedback, and slow-motion replay.
idea_3: This feature offers a one-tap Assist Remix that resets the puzzle with the same theme and fewer branches after several failures, showing changes to help recognize patterns.
idea_4: This feature lets two to four players take timed turns on the same board, connect powerups across games, and access shared rewards and weekly rankings.
idea_5: This feature displays the game board in augmented reality on a table, enables hand-tracked piece movement, plays sounds based on distance, and allows spectators to send limited cheers that create small powerups in party mode.
idea_6: This feature connects board effects to real-world weather and time, applying changes like ice slides at night and wind on windy days, with an option to turn it off.
idea_7: This feature allows players to equip a few skill modifiers that adjust game rules. Leaderboards change regularly to support fair competition and encourage using different setups.
idea_8: This feature allows users to race against friends’ recorded runs on the same course with verified random settings and automatically generates highlight clips after each race.
idea_9: This feature allows players to create targets by drawing and choosing difficulty, verifies if they can be solved, and marks popular creators with badges and seasonal highlights.
idea_10: This feature provides an endless mode with simple puzzles, guided breathing exercises, and changing background sounds. Completing sessions adds a small daily streak bonus.

idea_1: This feature helps users set up camera placement, detection zones, and privacy masks by providing lessons, skill assessments, and practice scenarios.
idea_2: This feature increases quiet sounds, minimizes wind and rain noise, shows live captions, directs audio to the loudest source, and sends alerts for chosen keywords.
idea_3: This feature allows users to apply preset mode bundles that adjust sensitivity, zones, LEDs, and notifications, and to create, save, and schedule custom modes.
idea_4: This feature records security activities and referrals, assigns points for them, and lets users redeem points for extra cloud storage, AI usage, or hardware discounts.
idea_5: This feature offers an add-on store to install approved analytics modules, allows one-tap enable or disable per camera, and monitors resource usage.
idea_6: This feature lets nearby users share temporary alert cards, compare sightings, transfer tracking between cameras, restrict access to full video histories, and verify user identities.
idea_7: This feature changes motion sensitivity, infrared settings, and notifications according to weather, activates storm mode in severe conditions, and delays non-urgent recordings to prioritize safety alerts.
idea_8: This feature creates local event playlists and timelapses, lets users review and annotate clips offline, and syncs changes to the cloud when an internet connection is available.
idea_9: This feature lets users filter recorded videos by objects, sounds, zones, faces, vehicles, time, and weather, save filters, and share clips through QR codes or links temporarily.
idea_10: This feature lets users set automation rules using triggers from cameras, sensors, weather, and neighbor alerts, and provides an option to test the rules before activation.

idea_1: This feature merges videos from multiple cameras into a single timeline, displays synchronized thumbnails and movement paths, and lets users tap to see the original camera view and time.
idea_2: This feature blurs faces, license plates, and screens in real time on the device, allows scheduled privacy zones, and shares links with blurred content while keeping originals accessible.
idea_3: This feature changes video quality by reducing bitrate in inactive areas and increasing frame rate and quality for moving objects, with optional re-encoding of key frames near events.
idea_4: This feature detects obstructions, lens spray, glare, and changes in angle or focus using visual and orientation data, then sends alerts, activates nearby cameras, and marks the event.
idea_5: This feature securely saves video and related data with timestamps, then exports a case bundle containing videos, access logs, and custody reports via temporary, permission-controlled links.
idea_6: This feature identifies typical motion patterns at each location, detects unusual activities such as loitering or irregular paths, and updates the global model without sending raw video.
idea_7: This feature lets users search video clips by using natural language and filters for objects, colors, clothing, direction, dwell time, and entry or exit zones on all cameras.
idea_8: This feature displays camera coverage areas and blind spots using augmented reality and replays recorded incidents as overlaid paths with time markers.
idea_9: This feature allows two-way voice communication with live transcription and automatic translation, shows captions, supports translated replies, and provides scripts and dialogue transcripts for later use.
idea_10: This feature lets nearby devices save video locally when the main recorder or internet is unavailable and automatically syncs the footage once the connection is back.

idea_1: This feature allows you to take or upload photos to make zipper wallpapers, add handwritten notes that become text labels, and share your designs in a community gallery.
idea_2: This feature allows you to set map wallpapers with various styles, adjust their visibility, add a route as the zipper track, highlight landmarks, and switch themes automatically.
idea_3: This feature changes resolution, frame rate, and animation according to device and network conditions, and compresses and streams theme packs to save storage, memory, and data.
idea_4: This feature allows you to partially unzip the lock screen to see filtered notifications, QR codes, and pinned passes, and view secure documents after biometric verification.
idea_5: This feature lets users create custom lock screen themes using an editor with text translation, copy and paste, tags, visual effects, and live previews.
idea_6: This feature displays zipper animations that reflect current weather and alerts, and automatically updates to show the destination’s forecast and hourly conditions in traveler mode.
idea_7: This feature allows you to unlock your phone by completing 1v1 challenges with friends using tasks based on accuracy, rhythm, or memory without revealing phone content.
idea_8: This feature allows you to create a playlist of themes that change based on the day, event, or sports league, displaying team colors and live scores on the lock screen.
idea_9: This feature allows users to earn points by using the app daily, creating themes, and inviting friends, which can be exchanged for premium packs or gift codes.
idea_10: This feature shows the size of each theme, lets you compress, offload, or delete files to save space, and backs up designs to the cloud for later download.

idea_1: This feature allows users to set custom zipper paths for unlocking, with the unlock action and animation following the selected route, using adaptive hitboxes to reduce accidental unlocks.
idea_2: This feature adds vibration and sound effects that vary with drag speed to simulate different materials and includes an accessibility mode for improved tactile feedback.
idea_3: This feature connects each zipper tooth to a recent app notification and lets users pause on a tooth to view and interact with the notification without unlocking the device.
idea_4: This feature automatically updates zipper skins and wallpapers according to weather, time, location, or calendar events, and lets users create schedules and automations.
idea_5: This feature lets users unlock the screen with various zipper gestures and includes a decoy unzip that opens a guest profile instead of the main screen.
idea_6: This feature lowers animation detail and limits frame rate when the battery is low. The zipper chain displays the battery level by filling or emptying as you drag it.
idea_7: This feature allows unlocking the screen by using a short voice or hum, processes the input on the device, and includes a silent option for privacy.
idea_8: This feature asks users to complete a brief action, such as a 3-second breath or posture check, before unlocking and records usage streaks with related data.
idea_9: This feature lets users create and customize zipper pulls, chains, sounds, and reveals, share or sell themes in a community marketplace, and apply them with one tap.
idea_10: This feature allows users to access emergency tools and a hidden call option by pulling or swiping on the lock screen, with a customizable interface.

idea_1: This feature offers roleplay exercises and negotiation scripts for users to practice alone or with others, tracks progress, and provides prompts to help discuss boundaries.
idea_2: This feature allows members to suggest friends or couples by adding private badges that become visible only when both parties show mutual interest.
idea_3: This feature lets users create and customize plans by choosing activities, boundaries, safewords, aftercare, and venues, and includes group polls and checklists for coordination.
idea_4: This feature generates temporary codes for users to share contact details or connect outside the app when both agree, using Bluetooth or NFC in low-signal areas.
idea_5: This feature shows live captions for voice notes and video calls, adjusts audio volume, provides haptic safeword alerts, and automatically transcribes media with privacy options.
idea_6: This feature gives users temporary access to premium discovery and filters for 24 hours, lets them activate passes near events, and shows a countdown timer.
idea_7: This feature awards users credits for completing verification, learning modules, and respectful reporting, which can be used for profile boosts or partner event access.
idea_8: This feature forms temporary groups based on nearby locations and events, allowing users to join, chat in a short-term room, and then the group ends after the event.
idea_9: This feature gathers private feedback on consent, punctuality, and aftercare after dates, displays trust badges for positive behavior, and provides reminders and resources for recurring issues.
idea_10: This feature lets users create and edit profile sections, share chosen parts, import or export templates, and attach consent agreements in common file formats.

idea_1: This feature allows users to create and share a consent profile with preferences, records a time-stamped agreement when both parties agree, and manages updates, expirations, and check-ins.
idea_2: This feature allows users to create plans involving multiple people with assigned roles and activities, set risk levels, schedule across time zones, and add checklists, safety signals, and a check-in timer.
idea_3: This feature displays an anonymous map of sex-positive events and venues with pseudonymous RSVPs and arrival times, showing presence indicators until two users mutually unlock profiles.
idea_4: This feature allows users to temporarily change their identity mode, such as solo, couple, pod, or role, for a session, with settings returning to default afterward.
idea_5: This feature matches users according to their aftercare preferences and allows them to send or receive post-date check-ins and adjust future match settings.
idea_6: This feature allows users to connect their relationship network, control who sees their partners and boundaries, offer introductions, and use a shared calendar without showing names or locations.
idea_7: This feature offers verified skill credentials through workshops or peer endorsements and uses badges to filter users, manage event access, or suggest mentors.
idea_8: This feature allows you to manage who can see parts of your profile, block certain contacts, and hide your profile from coworkers by verifying your work email.
idea_9: This feature lets users send voice notes with prompts, offers transcripts that can be edited, and identifies possible differences in boundaries or expectations before meeting.
idea_10: This feature allows users to turn on 24-hour settings for certain interests, changing discovery and prompts temporarily before automatically returning to the original state.

idea_1: This feature offers brief lessons on breathing, posture, and seat selection, provides AR practice cues while waiting in line, and tracks progress with badges that can be shared.
idea_2: This feature lets users submit location-verified ride and show reviews with tags, see live crowd levels in queues, and get personalized suggestions.
idea_3: This feature allows guests to choose toppings for funnel cakes, nachos, or burritos, save favorite orders, schedule contactless pickup, apply discounts, and get group add-on recommendations.
idea_4: This feature uses AR to create a verified height badge, filters rides based on eligibility, and stores allergy and emergency contact information in a consent-based QR safety card.
idea_5: This feature delivers live captions, clear announcements, and ride instructions through earbuds, guides users along a quiet route, and provides low-sensory showtimes with break reminders.
idea_6: This feature offers queue-time mini games and AR scavenger hunts that let users earn coins to redeem for snacks, merchandise, ride skips, daily streaks, or charity donations.
idea_7: This feature adds AR skins to coasters and characters in the camera, allows users to apply park-approved stickers to photos and maps, and lets users unlock and trade event-limited skins.
idea_8: This feature allows users to share their live locations, send invitations, create group plans based on shared interests, and find nearby rides using a swipe-based system.
idea_9: This feature provides a one-day trial of membership benefits, including one photo download, one mobile skip, dining discounts, a visible timer, and no automatic charges.
idea_10: This feature saves maps, schedules, tickets, and purchase history for offline use, updates data when online, and lets users search and claim photos or receipts by phone number.

idea_1: This feature creates a daily plan based on your group’s preferences and current conditions, updating routes in real time to minimize walking and waiting times.
idea_2: This feature estimates your arrival time using current wait times, combines food orders from multiple locations into one pickup, and updates timing if plans change or rides close.
idea_3: This feature provides turn-by-turn AR arrows to guide groups to a selected location in the park, with options for stroller, step-free, and quiet routes, and functions offline.
idea_4: This feature shows the chances and countdowns for ride reopenings based on maintenance and weather, suggests nearby rides, and sends alerts for return times.
idea_5: This feature connects your phone to ride cameras via Bluetooth or UWB, gathers photos and videos, and creates a highlight reel that you can share with privacy options.
idea_6: This feature provides a 60-second pre-ride briefing with breathing instructions and ride intensity information, then gathers feedback to help customize future ride recommendations.
idea_7: This feature displays shaded routes, water refill and mister locations, sends hydration reminders, and changes the app to low-power, high-contrast mode if the device overheats.
idea_8: This feature allows guests to enter sensory, mobility, and seating preferences to locate quiet areas, step-free routes, appropriate showtimes, seat alerts, and request discreet assistance with live location.
idea_9: This feature lets organizers add money, set spending limits for individuals, approve purchase requests, and see real-time receipts and allergen details from all vendors.
idea_10: This feature coordinates rideshare, tram, and carpool pickups with your last ride, shows the nearest exit gate, and notifies your driver when you finish the final attraction.

idea_1: This feature allows users to set quiet hours or sleep times to silence notifications, require additional verification, block approvals, or allow only OTP access during those times.
idea_2: This feature allows you to specify trusted devices, networks, locations, and times. Access requests outside these settings are flagged, limited, or automatically denied after a cooldown period.
idea_3: This feature saves TOTP secrets and app settings to an encrypted ID.me Vault or chosen cloud provider, enabling restoration on a new device with login and biometric verification.
idea_4: This feature allows users to create custom authentication rules using biometrics, device presence, and location, and to apply preset templates for various account types.
idea_5: This feature allows users to practice identifying simulated security threats such as push-bombing, QR phishing, and lookalike domains, while tracking progress and providing rewards.
idea_6: This feature displays the verified domain, certificate owner, and issuance time when scanning login QR codes, alerts users to mismatches, and can save fingerprints for offline warnings.
idea_7: This feature offers high-contrast code cards, stronger vibration and hearing aid–friendly tones, reads digits aloud after biometric unlock, and mutes sounds automatically when near others.
idea_8: This feature offers a keyboard and share-sheet to enter OTPs, backup codes, and magic links into apps, with permissions for each app. It also scans and formats backup codes using the camera.
idea_9: This feature shows recent and pending authentications with information such as location, device, network, and reason, and allows reporting phishing, blocking access, and exporting receipts.
idea_10: This feature verifies access by detecting a nearby device through Bluetooth, ultrasound, or QR code and sends approval requests to the closest or chosen enrolled device.

idea_1: This feature shows the verified site name, domain, and saved safe word for approval requests, blocks approval if they do not match, and enables one-tap phishing reports.
idea_2: This feature allows users to select personal details to share for each approval, saves these choices for each site, and provides a receipt of the shared information.
idea_3: This feature allows the app to sign QR codes offline, display a short code for browser verification, and use Bluetooth or ultrasonic signals to approve nearby devices.
idea_4: This feature lets users link dependent or elder profiles with restricted access, allows caregivers to approve actions temporarily or co-sign, and logs related activities for agencies.
idea_5: This feature helps recover an account by verifying a selfie and confirming approval from several trusted contacts using temporary codes in their ID.me app.
idea_6: This feature generates temporary offline approval tokens for login without a strong connection and blocks high-risk actions. A toggle can revoke these tokens when necessary.
idea_7: This feature provides a weekly report of new devices, unusual sign-ins, and risky locations, and allows revoking sessions, quarantining users, and exporting audit logs.
idea_8: This feature imports TOTP accounts from other apps, secures them with hardware, backs them up with encryption and a recovery phrase, guides passkey upgrades, and offers an SMS 2FA retirement checklist.
idea_9: This feature allows users to verify their identity at desks or kiosks by tapping their device using NFC or BLE and confirming with biometric authentication.
idea_10: This feature displays the fastest verification options with estimated times during risky sign-ins and automatically chooses the most suitable method based on user settings and situation.

idea_1: This feature uses phone and vehicle sensors to deliver short lessons on parking, merging, and eco-driving, provides personalized practice, and tracks progress with badges.
idea_2: This feature allows users to rate ride quality, report issues, and provide service feedback after a trip, including vehicle and trip details for review.
idea_3: This feature detects nearby sirens or horns, plays a directional alert sound, lowers music volume briefly, and can make speech sounds clearer for easier conversation.
idea_4: This feature allows you to download and use preset settings for alerts, routes, lighting, and display, and create and share custom seat, climate, audio, and lighting settings.
idea_5: This feature allows users to message or send short voice notes to verified Toyota owners, view their profiles and ratings, and follow their ownership and dealership experiences.
idea_6: This feature tracks smooth, efficient, and distraction-free driving, awarding points that can be exchanged for service credits, Toyota gift cards, or local donations.
idea_7: This feature downloads offline maps, charging and fuel stops, audio content, and simple games to the vehicle for use with limited data during long trips.
idea_8: This feature lets you enter your license plate once to manage tolls, parking, and inspections across states, view combined receipts and spending limits, and add or remove temporary plates.
idea_9: This feature uses weather forecasts, your calendar, and routes to suggest departure times, check tire and wiper status, prepare the cabin, and provide weather alerts or alternate routes.
idea_10: This feature automatically stores service, parts, warranty, tire, and accessory receipts in one place and offers maintenance forecasts with estimated costs for future planning.

idea_1: This feature uses vehicle data to create a digital model of your Toyota, predict potential issues, explain warning lights, assess repair timing, and allow service appointment booking.
idea_2: This feature schedules EV charging during low-cost and low-emission periods, connects with home solar and utility rates, supports V2H/V2G, tracks carbon saved, and manages monthly limits.
idea_3: This feature creates a trip plan that includes driving, parking, and transit or scooter passes with guaranteed parking and paid tickets, adjusting options based on delays.
idea_4: This feature uses your phone camera to provide step-by-step instructions for vehicle checks and minor repairs, scans tire tread, detects brake or belt noises, and connects to parts or support.
idea_5: This feature creates temporary digital keys with restrictions on area, time, and speed, and provides trip summaries including events, routes, and driving scores without showing exact locations.
idea_6: This feature uses sensors, an inclinometer, and a camera to provide driving suggestions, offline trail maps, recovery checklists, and syncs trail conditions and vehicle settings to the dashboard.
idea_7: This feature lets you pay tolls, parking, and EV charging with one Toyota account, sends nearby cost alerts, and automatically exports work trip reimbursement data.
idea_8: This feature lets users send silent help by sharing live location and audio/video with trusted contacts or Toyota agents, control horn and lights remotely, and detect crashes with emergency support.
idea_9: This feature lets Toyota owners share home chargers by setting schedules, prices, and ratings. Drivers can book, pay ahead, and access verified charging while traveling.
idea_10: This feature shows recall and service bulletin details, part availability and ETAs, lets users select service options, schedule updates, and track tasks, costs, and vehicle return time.

idea_1: This feature offers daily short lessons on media literacy and reporting, including exercises, quizzes, headline rewrites, and tracks skill progress with badges.
idea_2: This feature separates voices, enhances sound clarity, balances volume levels, offers adjustable live captions, and includes a mode to reduce sudden loud noises and flashing visuals.
idea_3: This feature allows users to send links to friends that open specific stories or live segments, enabling shared viewing and chat. Invites can provide temporary ad-free access or trial periods.
idea_4: This feature allows you to create offline news playlists that automatically download articles as audio, videos in low data mode, and podcasts, with Wi-Fi syncing and skip controls.
idea_5: This feature lets users send feedback on articles about clarity, sources, typos, and missing information, which is then forwarded to editors and tracked with status labels.
idea_6: This feature creates local discussion groups by location, allowing verified users to share updates such as tips, outages, and school news, with important posts highlighted.
idea_7: This feature verifies contributors with government IDs and connects each photo or video to device, time, and location data. Author pages display verification status and correction history.
idea_8: This feature offers one-tap access to hotlines and donation links in related stories, auto-fills forms with your saved phone number, and saves contact numbers for offline use.
idea_9: This feature shows destination summaries with local news, advisories, and hourly weather radar for chosen dates. It lets users follow multiple cities and receive disruption alerts.
idea_10: This feature allows users to swipe through headline cards to skip, save, or follow topics, with a real-time updating feed and a distance filter for nearby stories.

idea_1: This feature allows you to slide between side-by-side summaries of the same story from different sources and switch views between facts and opinions.
idea_2: This feature allows users to view original documents related to key claims, including bills, court filings, transcripts, datasets, and timestamps, along with information about who made each statement and when.
idea_3: This feature allows you to follow ongoing stories on an interactive timeline, highlights changes since your last visit, and sends notifications for major updates.
idea_4: This feature displays your representatives, their schedules, public comment periods, and contact details, and offers customizable email and call templates with factual information.
idea_5: This feature lets users submit and upvote live questions during interviews, while producers choose some questions to show on-air using user verification and location tags.
idea_6: This feature lets users send tips to reporters securely by encrypting data, removing personal information, providing a temporary inbox, and sharing legal and safety details before submission.
idea_7: This feature lets you change tax or spending settings and see estimated impacts on your county, household, or industry using public data. You can save and share scenarios.
idea_8: This feature lets users create 60–180 second video clips from Newsmax segments with captions, lower-thirds, and source credits, and share them on a community channel or social media.
idea_9: This feature monitors rumors in a single card, displays their verification status with timelines and links, and sends alerts when the status of a viewed claim changes.
idea_10: This feature displays the edit history of each article and video, including timestamps, change details, reasons, and a correction ratio for each author and show.

app_name: Quran Pro: Read the Holy Quran
idea_1: This feature listens to your Quran recitation, detects pronunciation and tajweed errors, offers practice exercises, and tracks your progress with charts and short practice sessions.
idea_2: This feature offers a collection of verified reciters, qirā’āt, tafsīr packs, calligraphy fonts, and themes with one-tap installation of reviewed and rated content.
idea_3: This feature lets users write private notes or share brief reflections on verses, view highlighted scholar comments, upvote entries, and follow chosen contributors.
idea_4: This feature schedules Quran readings for trips or busy weeks, downloads content for offline access, adjusts reminders for time zones, and provides a Car Mode with large controls and voice commands.
idea_5: This feature sends optional notifications of selected Quranic verses and supplications triggered by events like severe weather, hospital visits, or dates of bereavement.
idea_6: This feature enables users to navigate to specific juz, hizb, surah, or ayah by number and search using natural language with filters for recitations, translations, and tafsīr.
idea_7: This feature tracks reading, memorization, and tafsīr study progress, allowing users to earn points that can be donated, gifted, or combined for family sadaqah goals.
idea_8: This feature offers a child-friendly mode with simple controls, short recitation playlists, sticker rewards, progress tracking for parents, content restrictions, and offline download capabilities.
idea_9: This feature enables users to create or join group recitations with scheduled sessions, synchronized text, turn-taking cues, host verification, attendance tracking, and invite links.
idea_10: This feature enables users to create and customize Quran recitation sequences with options for tajwīd colors, translation, tafsīr, repetition, speed control, and audio clarity.

app_name: Quran Pro: Read the Holy Quran
idea_1: This feature listens to your Quran recitation, detects pronunciation errors based on tajweed rules, suggests practice exercises, creates a personalized review plan, and functions offline.
idea_2: This feature offers a slider to view each verse alongside linguistic, tafsir, and jurisprudential explanations, enabling side-by-side comparison of summaries and detailed interpretations.
idea_3: This feature shows an interactive graph grouping Quran verses by topics, enables creating topic-based playlists for recitation and memorization, and provides cross-references with hadith links.
idea_4: This feature plays two Quranic recitations per verse simultaneously, highlights letter and harakat differences, and lets users tap differences to hear and see brief tajweed explanations.
idea_5: This feature enables teachers to assign Hifz tasks, review recordings with comments, track student progress, schedule revisions, and identify frequently missed verses for group practice.
idea_6: This feature gradually hides words or lines for memorization, allows single-tap word reveal, and provides optional stylus tracing to practice and verify Arabic handwriting.
idea_7: This feature shows Quran verses in chronological order with Meccan or Medinan context, links related sirah events, and allows one-tap reordering for historical reading.
idea_8: This feature lets users tap any word to see its root, pattern, grammar with examples, create root packs for memorization, and view translations in multiple languages.
idea_9: This feature sends reminders with Quranic passages related to events like travel, rain, illness, or Fridays, including audio and transliteration for each passage.
idea_10: This feature lets users record voice reflections, converts them to text, tags them by theme, saves them securely on the device, and exports them as a formatted booklet.

idea_1: This feature allows you to connect quick matches to raise a multiplier. Special tiles shift numbers to maintain combos. Missing timing resets the streak.
idea_2: This feature allows players to collect booster coupons that are automatically used at the start of a round or checkout to lower coin costs for hints, shuffles, and skins.
idea_3: This feature enables hands-free play with voice commands and lets users add 10-second voice notes to puzzles that delete after solving or can be shared.
idea_4: This feature tracks your progress through themed stops with different rules, displays local leaderboards, and allows you to reserve upcoming stops for rewards and reminders.
idea_5: This feature allows you to select a small set of power cards to use in each game, enabling varied strategies and balanced gameplay.
idea_6: This feature displays the expected chain length, affected areas, and estimated value when you tap and hold, and suggests one or two alternative high-yield moves.
idea_7: This feature shows a live countdown, sends pre-charge reminders, allows one-tap cancellation, saves progress, and displays subscription change details for Premium users.
idea_8: This feature adds optional 3D glimmer tiles and a Glider piece that moves one cell after matches. On weekends, it provides free skins or boosters to active players.
idea_9: This feature connects numbers to musical notes, lets users create melodies by matching numbers, export the created loop, and use a metronome for timing.
idea_10: This feature detects numbers in photos taken on the device, creates puzzles from them, and lets users share links so others can solve the same puzzles.

idea_1: This feature displays a daily rule and provides a 30-second practice board demonstrating it, rotating through different rules to offer varied practice and number range exposure.
idea_2: This feature offers an adaptive coach that highlights possible matches, explains strategies, lets you press and hold to preview effects, and changes guidance based on your errors.
idea_3: This feature shows a faint shadow path of a previous run or a friend’s replay a few seconds ahead during gameplay for comparison.
idea_4: This feature allows players to customize daily boards by changing diagonals, wrap-around, target sum, and size, and share a link for others to access the same board.
idea_5: This feature lets two players play on connected boards, send brief signals to indicate possible matches, and earn bonuses for clearing the boards quickly.
idea_6: This feature runs weekly Swiss-style tournaments with adjustable handicaps and limits, enabling players of different skill levels to compete. It also verifies replays and enforces fair play.
idea_7: This feature offers a mode with softer visuals, gentle vibrations, and brief breathing prompts between sets. It also suggests breaks when error rates rise.
idea_8: This feature displays heatmaps of attention, missed pairs, and dead-end creation after each game, provides 2-minute practice drills, and tracks progress with skill ratings.
idea_9: This feature offers high-contrast themes, large numbers, colorblind-friendly colors, shape overlays, voice and vibration feedback, and a layout designed for one-handed use.
idea_10: This feature adds checkpoints called Time Capsules to save progress, lets players return to them, converts unused capsules into XP, and provides a monthly retry for a missed daily.

idea_1: This feature offers short 3–5 minute relationship exercises with spaced repetition. Couples choose goal-based playlists and track their confidence progress over time.
idea_2: This feature allows couples to anonymously share short tips for each exercise, upvote useful advice, and view a summary of top insights before similar activities.
idea_3: This feature uses mood check-ins, calendars, and local data to identify times of high or low connection and sends reminders with a brief routine before possible conflicts.
idea_4: This feature monitors conversations to identify interruptions, raised voices, and talk-time imbalance, sends vibration alerts, and provides a private summary with a short lesson afterward.
idea_5: This feature offers an audio mode with hands-free prompts, quizzes, and games that work offline, including a kid-friendly option with suitable conversation starters for family trips.
idea_6: This feature allows couples to create a shared space to save documents, images, and voice notes with transcription and notes accessible to both partners.
idea_7: This feature allows couples to create private groups with friends to share date ideas, suggest prompts, plan double-dates with RSVPs, and get nearby activity suggestions.
idea_8: This feature allows couples to track shared tasks with checklists, view streaks and milestones, and see a heatmap that shows how tasks are distributed over time.
idea_9: This feature shows each partner’s time zone, commute, and weather, suggests suitable times for calls, and provides offline prompts and care-package ideas for trips.
idea_10: This feature turns couple photos into illustrated story cards, adds reflection questions, and saves them in a private album for ongoing viewing.

idea_1: This feature allows both partners to record 60-second reflections after an argument, identifies unmet needs, suggests repair sentences and next steps, and sends reminders.
idea_2: This feature tracks shared tasks and check-ins, suggests how to divide responsibilities evenly, sends reminders to the assigned partner, and provides a weekly summary.
idea_3: This feature allows couples to set boundaries, preferences, and daily comfort levels using green, amber, and red toggles, then highlights shared agreements and safe words.
idea_4: This feature provides three alternative, softer message options and lets you add a short appreciation note to your text before sending.
idea_5: This feature helps couples find and plan dates by considering budget, time, energy, and weather, offering nearby options with booking and at-home alternatives with shared prompts.
idea_6: This feature allows couples to create daily or weekly connection activities that adjust based on their mood and completion, with different themes that change regularly.
idea_7: This feature syncs time zones for couples, suggests shared available times, sends haptic and voice messages in the partner’s morning, and schedules regular check-ins automatically.
idea_8: This feature displays a shared timeline of check-ins, mood tags, and milestones, identifies relationship patterns, and offers small activities to try while tracking their effects.
idea_9: This feature allows couples to play short scenario games to reveal each partner’s priorities and differences, then offers scripts to support joint decision-making.
idea_10: This feature monitors how long each person speaks and interruptions, suggests when to pause or reply, and summarizes the main points from both participants after the conversation.

idea_1: This feature allows you to control a character during bonus rounds to collect multipliers and combo wilds, which are saved for the final spin. Successful jumps fill a streak meter that transfers to certain machines.
idea_2: This feature shows a countdown to trial end, displays upcoming charges, allows one-tap cancellation, sends renewal reminders, and pauses auto-renew with budget limits until confirmed.
idea_3: This Feature saves the last 20 seconds of gameplay, allows adding a voice reaction, and automatically creates a vertical highlight clip for sharing.
idea_4: This feature allows you to set your playtime and coin budget, then provides bet size, machine volatility, and break suggestions that update as your balance changes.
idea_5: This feature displays upcoming flash jackpots, tournaments, and club battles, enables seat reservations with auto-join, and shows friends’ locations to join their rooms.
idea_6: This feature allows you to earn coupons by completing tasks and automatically applies the best available discount on bundles and power-ups at checkout, showing expiration and stacking rules.
idea_7: This Feature syncs spins to your music and allows you to tap on-beat during short sequences to fill an Encore meter, which activates animations and small boosters.
idea_8: This feature displays your progress on a travel map, highlights rooms that help you reach the next milestone faster, and lets you mark points of interest.
idea_9: This Feature allows you to collect and upgrade boost cards, set up a loadout before playing, and unlock seasonal bonuses by combining cards with matching effects.
idea_10: This feature allows you to gather pebbles and shells to create a fish tank, unlock and name fish from events, and earn daily rewards by caring for the tank.

idea_1: This feature allows 4–10 players to join a timed event where spins add to a shared meter. Completing stages grants team rewards, and the final prize is split by contribution.
idea_2: This Feature allows you to connect with one friend for 24 hours to combine bonus progress on specific machines, sharing bonuses and multipliers when either player activates a feature.
idea_3: This feature allows you to collect reel sets, symbol packs, and bonus modules to build slots with specific RTP ranges, share them with others, and earn tokens from plays.
idea_4: This feature allows players to participate in 2–3 minute real-time spin races on the same slot machine, with live leaderboards, matchmaking based on streaks, and seasonal trophies.
idea_5: This feature allows you to start an AR Jackpot Pot at a table for nearby friends to join. Spins add confetti and coins to the pot, which splits rewards and saves a highlight clip when it bursts.
idea_6: This Feature creates group quests based on player activity, tracks progress with real-time bars, adjusts difficulty automatically, and sends voice notifications to update teams.
idea_7: This Feature allows you to set time and coin limits, take breaks or lockouts during play, and connect with a friend for reminders and shared rewards.
idea_8: This Feature allows you to stream live to friends with minimal delay, enabling viewers to send sparks that trigger visual effects and shared rewards during watch parties.
idea_9: This Feature allows you to collect Sidekicks that unlock quests and synergies when friends use matching companions. Leveling up grants avatars, frames, and bonus-entry tickets.
idea_10: This feature allows all players’ spins to reduce a large boss’s health, which changes mechanics across machines. Defeating phases grants rewards, ranks, badges, and loot based on contribution.

idea_1: This feature gives coupons from streaks and events that automatically apply discounts to mod packs, skins, and setlists at checkout, and shows limited-time bundles and sale alerts.
idea_2: This feature allows you to create training or marathon playlists, shuffle songs by BPM, difficulty, or artist, save your last order, and receive track suggestions based on weak patterns.
idea_3: This feature lets users split songs into sections, rearrange them, combine parts from different mods, and apply tempo alignment and transition effects for seamless mashups.
idea_4: This feature adds optional flicks, slides, and holds that extend combos and increase style multipliers, allowing players to unlock cosmetic finishers without altering core gameplay.
idea_5: This feature allows you to repeat specific sections at different speeds or until a target accuracy is met, with options for phrase shuffling and a timing overlay.
idea_6: This feature records gameplay with automatic highlight capture and a selfie overlay using themed frames. It exports vertical videos with beat-synced edits and captions with one tap.
idea_7: This feature lets users download mod packs for offline use, automatically saves favorite content, and offers temporary offline access to certain rare or limited tracks.
idea_8: This feature allows you to hum, clap, or speak a rhythm to generate a backing beat and playable chart, which you can edit and share as mini-mods.
idea_9: This feature provides daily pattern puzzles to practice jacks, streams, polyrhythms, and reading skills, with progression unlocking badges and display settings.
idea_10: This feature uses softer colors, gentle vibrations, calming music, and paced intros, while adjusting difficulty during challenging moments to support continuous gameplay.

idea_1: This feature combines two mods during a song by adjusting patterns and blending sounds on the beat, enabling players to set mashups at specific points for varied gameplay.
idea_2: This feature detects missed beats, offers practice drills based on those patterns and tempos, adjusts drills between attempts, and recommends warm-ups before challenging songs.
idea_3: This feature enables online duet and squad play with synchronized timing and assigned roles, where coordinated actions trigger team bonuses.
idea_4: This feature lets users create charts by drawing swipe paths and tapping rhythms, automatically adjusts timing, checks difficulty, and allows sharing through a code.
idea_5: This feature creates an AR rhythm arena in your room with notes and bosses, allowing dodge, tilt, and tap actions, and includes safety boundaries and low-motion settings.
idea_6: This feature lets users import their own songs, split them into instrument parts, choose specific instruments to play, and change difficulty without reloading the charts.
idea_7: This feature allows you to play a campaign with a branching map, collect mod cards that alter game mechanics, and encounter different synergies and bosses in each run.
idea_8: This feature lets users merge art and audio from one mod with gameplay mechanics from another, automatically adjusting BPM, colors, and hit windows while managing compatibility and versions.
idea_9: This feature allows you to compete against recorded opponent performances with timing details and join weekly remix challenges that include voting and rewards for track reworks.
idea_10: This feature allows viewers to spend in-app points to apply modifiers during gameplay, while the player receives bonuses. It also includes controls to manage usage and minimize delays.

idea_1: This feature offers interactive radar lessons with 30-second drills that help users learn to interpret echoes, velocity, and storm structures, adjusting difficulty by skill level.
idea_2: This feature allows you to share a live radar session with others, displaying precipitation times, shared locations, and check-ins, using temporary invites that expire automatically.
idea_3: This feature allows you to create weather alert tiles, select alert delivery methods, save alert groups, and switch between them from the launcher dock.
idea_4: This feature allows you to rate the daily forecast accuracy and submit local corrections. It updates data and displays nearby user reports on the timeline.
idea_5: This feature allows users to complete weather tasks, earn points for rewards or donations, and unlock early access to new features by keeping activity streaks.
idea_6: This feature gives alerts with text-to-speech, adjusts earbud volume, uses vibration patterns for hazards, and provides optional real-time captions.
idea_7: This feature lets users view radar, lightning forecasts, and detailed weather models with past storm data for seven days without automatic billing.
idea_8: This feature downloads radar images, hourly forecasts, and lightning data for selected areas using Wi-Fi, enabling offline map access and alerts within storage limits.
idea_9: This feature shows a 4-week weather forecast with probability and confidence levels, suggests alternative time windows, and lets users export summaries or share updated links.
idea_10: This feature lets users add or remove options like ski snowfall, marine wind, pollen, and wildfire smoke to the app.

idea_1: This feature displays an interactive radar wallpaper that allows you to swipe left or right to view different times, pinch to zoom, and double-tap to switch weather layers.
idea_2: This feature changes your home screen layout based on weather and time, displaying relevant apps like transit during rain, while keeping selected apps fixed.
idea_3: This feature sends lightning proximity alerts with distinct vibration patterns and a dim lock-screen glow at 25, 10, and 5 km distances, reducing alert frequency to conserve battery.
