idea_4: This feature uses radar, road temperature, dew point, and precipitation data to detect hydroplaning or black-ice risks and provides safer departure times or alternate routes with estimated arrival times.
idea_5: This feature displays a map indicating shade times for each area based on sun position and surroundings, and lets you add suggested times to your calendar with one tap.
idea_6: This feature loads radar loops and severe weather alerts, works offline with low-bandwidth data when necessary, and allows pausing animations to reduce battery use.
idea_7: This feature displays storm cells approaching your saved locations with information on speed, direction, hail chance, lightning rate, and estimated arrival time. A widget shows a countdown to the storm.
idea_8: This feature monitors air quality, pollen, humidity, temperature, and wind to identify suitable 2–3 hour periods for opening windows and can control purifiers or HVAC via Google Home.
idea_9: This feature allows users to report current weather conditions such as rain, snow, hail, or fog, which updates local forecasts and radar displays immediately.
idea_10: This feature checks your calendar and inbox for locations and flights, monitors weather at each place, adds checklists, and sends alerts when risks are high.

idea_1: This feature provides daily 3-minute exercises that help users recognize misinformation, evaluate sources, write headlines, and optionally challenge friends to monitor progress.
idea_2: This feature enhances audio in articles and live reports by adjusting sound settings, reducing noise, providing large captions, and offering vibration alerts for Bluetooth LE Audio devices.
idea_3: This feature allows users to create private Reading Rooms to share weekly story lists, get article recommendations, invite friends with limited access, and use audio and offline options.
idea_4: This feature allows you to create offline news playlists that automatically download articles, audio briefs, and explainers over Wi-Fi and play them continuously like a podcast.
idea_5: This feature allows users to provide quick feedback and report errors or follow-up information, which editors review and use to update news stories.
idea_6: This feature allows you to add upcoming trips and relatives’ cities to receive scheduled updates on local news, weather, advisories, strikes, event disruptions, and alerts.
idea_7: This feature identifies phone numbers in stories, verifies them with official sources, allows calling, texting, saving, shows warnings for suspicious numbers, and supports sharing.
idea_8: This feature delivers live updates with maps, radar, evacuation routes, and milestones based on your location, along with offline safety checklists and a battery-saving mode.
idea_9: This feature allows users to swipe through local news and service updates in a specific area and participate in reporter-led Q&A threads with filtered, summarized comments.
idea_10: This feature simplifies language, filters sensitive content, offers narrated summaries with tappable glossaries, and lets parents approve topics, set time limits, and queue educational explainers.

idea_1: This feature provides local information related to national and global news, showing impacts on prices, jobs, and policies in chosen areas, with links to local sources and comparison tools.
idea_2: This feature displays the story’s source information, including the original AP wire, reporter names, timestamps, source documents, photo and video details, and an update and corrections log.
idea_3: This feature shows context cards with a 30-second summary, timeline, key people, glossary, and map for complex topics, updating across articles and allowing sharing.
idea_4: This feature delivers real-time text updates, verified social media posts, live video, and a map with confirmed and unverified information, including offline and low-data options.
idea_5: This feature delivers twice-daily updates with top world news, local civic information, school notices, transit, weather, air quality, sports, and an optional 90-second audio summary.
idea_6: This feature allows users to swipe through different versions of the same story from various AP bureaus and partners, displaying translations, context notes, and variations in content.
idea_7: This feature monitors bills, executive actions, and court cases across local, state, and federal levels, offering alerts, summaries, voting records, district information, and source links.
idea_8: This feature shows a board with photo and video requests from editors. Users can submit geotagged media with licenses, and approved submissions are credited.
idea_9: This feature offers articles with interactive charts about local topics such as inflation, housing, wildfires, and elections. It also lets users share statistics and set alerts.
idea_10: This feature shows live election results with detailed maps, explains how race calls are determined, displays confidence levels, and provides sample ballots and district information.

idea_1: This feature offers brief lessons and tips on fuel efficiency based on your vehicle and recent trips, tracks your mpg changes, and lets you share your progress.
idea_2: This feature shows station reviews verified by receipts, including photos and checklists on pump speed, restroom cleanliness, lighting, and staff courtesy, with summaries and alerts.
idea_3: This feature allows users to create and save station filter presets, share them through QR codes, and scan station QR codes to connect and complete payments.
idea_4: This feature offers a short fueling mini-game where users clean virtual engine deposits, customize a digital vehicle, and collect limited-time bonuses without ads.
idea_5: This feature allows users to invite friends to a road-trip group, coordinate stops, see live estimated arrival times, and combine rewards for shared discounts and credits.
idea_6: This feature saves receipts, tracks fuel usage, schedules maintenance reminders, and lets users export trip and receipt data as PDF, CSV, or to Concur and QuickBooks.
idea_7: This feature updates Chevron stop suggestions, buffer times, and fuel range according to weather, and uses offline maps and saved payment tokens when there is no internet connection.
idea_8: This feature lets users complete tasks such as surveys, product lessons, or vehicle health checks to earn fuel credits or make donations to local causes.
idea_9: This feature allows you to order snacks, drinks, or car wash codes in advance, choose pickup options, and schedule the order to your pump number for collection.
idea_10: This feature offers audio stories and mini-games for children with a sleep timer, and provides rest break reminders and calming sounds when the vehicle is parked.

idea_1: This feature displays pump availability and estimated wait times, allows you to join a virtual queue, notifies you when a pump is free, and temporarily holds your spot.
idea_2: This feature lets users subscribe to lock a fuel price for a set number of gallons monthly, share unused gallons with family, and redeem them at any location.
idea_3: This feature connects your vehicle or OBD-II device to provide fuel grade and cleaning suggestions based on engine data and driving patterns, and offers discounts at certain cleaning times.
idea_4: This feature allows users to plan trips with gas, EV charging, or hydrogen, pre-book chargers at Chevron locations, and combine fueling with pickup stops.
idea_5: This feature allows you to order ExtraMile items while driving and have them delivered to your pump using license plate recognition, with prep time matched to your arrival and age verified through the app.
idea_6: This feature creates driver profiles with budget limits, fuel-type restrictions, and location-based station access, and verifies transactions using FaceID and license plate matching.
idea_7: This feature allows users to add up to 5¢ per gallon to support local carbon projects, see trip emissions estimates, and earn points for lower-emission choices.
idea_8: This feature lets users report pump outages, air and water availability, restroom cleanliness, and EV charger status by submitting photos. Reports are sent to site operations.
idea_9: This feature activates emergency mode to display stations with power, fuel, backup generators, real-time wait times, and allows rationed fills, priority access, and offline QR payments.
idea_10: This feature uses phone sensors and car data to calculate driving scores, provide fuel discounts, and support smoother driving, tire maintenance, and trip planning with challenges.

idea_1: This feature offers daily 3–5 minute exercises for speech-in-noise, sound localization, and tone recognition, personalized to your hearing profile, with progress tracking and level updates.
idea_2: This feature detects sirens, alarms, and vehicle horns on your device and sends vibration alerts with a directional arrow to your hearing aids, including in Do Not Disturb mode.
idea_3: This feature adjusts sound settings for music by track or genre, lets users save playlist presets for offline use, and provides optional downloadable genre packs.
idea_4: This feature allows you to invite trusted people to add notes, create voice profiles with permission, and share feedback with your audiologist.
idea_5: This feature lets you browse and rate custom programs, try settings within set limits, and manage style presets for various environments.
idea_6: This feature turns on wind block in windy weather, reminds you to dry your devices after moisture exposure, and displays nearby hearing-friendly and induction loop locations.
idea_7: This feature identifies spoken numbers, names, and addresses during calls or voicemails and shows them on screen for viewing and saving with one tap.
idea_8: This feature lets users try advanced algorithms or accessories temporarily, compare them with A/B tests and wear-time logs, and get a summary based on usage and ratings.
idea_9: This Feature allows you to browse nearby sound environments and select one. It also provides filters to adjust speech clarity, reduce wind noise, and lower traffic sounds.
idea_10: This Feature lets users reorder domes, wax guards, and chargers with size assistance and delivery reminders, and track hearing aid wear time and training progress.

idea_1: This feature automatically adjusts programs, noise reduction, and microphone settings based on location, calendar events, and detected environments, and provides rule suggestions over time.
idea_2: This feature shows live captions with speaker names, lets you mark important moments, and saves secure transcripts with optional summaries for sharing.
idea_3: This feature displays arrows on the camera view to show where speech and noise are coming from and their signal strength. Tapping an arrow changes the hearing focus.
idea_4: This feature allows nearby phones to connect by scanning a QR code and sends sound from their microphones directly to your hearing aids with low delay.
idea_5: This feature monitors noise levels, conversation activity, and biometric data to estimate listening fatigue, suggests breaks, and automatically lowers loud environmental sounds.
idea_6: This feature adjusts masking sounds to match your tinnitus pitch and loudness, changes soundscapes periodically, and records your progress over time.
idea_7: This feature quickly measures the ear canal to detect leaks, blockages, or fit issues, offers basic adjustment suggestions, and tracks ear-tip use over time.
idea_8: This feature detects sounds such as sirens, alarms, doorbells, and your name, then sends alerts using vibrations and brief voice messages. Sensitivity and permissions can be adjusted.
idea_9: This feature lets you register a partner’s voice so the hearing aids can improve and stabilize it, with an optional mode to focus on that speaker.
idea_10: This feature allows you to record 30-second sound samples with notes about problems, then offers adjustment options to apply or share with your audiologist.

idea_1: This feature sharpens text balloons, increases contrast, enlarges sound effects using a slider, and provides optional read-aloud with character tags for earbuds without altering the artwork.
idea_2: This feature lets you find and connect with nearby fans of the same series to join or organize meetups and group reading events within the app.
idea_3: This feature allows you to enable ambient sounds and page-turn vibrations, or activate Silent/Safe mode to disable animations and receive warnings about strobe-heavy pages. Preferences are saved per series.
idea_4: This feature offers step-by-step drawing exercises with manga panels, includes onion-skin overlays and stylus support, and provides feedback on proportions and techniques.
idea_5: This feature allows you to turn pages using voice commands or clapping, scroll panels by tapping earbuds, detects whispers to lower noise, and create voice-labeled bookmarks.
idea_6: This feature allows you to schedule offline time, downloads chapters from your active series with emphasis on cliffhangers, compresses images on cellular data, removes completed chapters, and syncs reading progress.
idea_7: This feature allows you to find a specific chapter and panel by pasting a quote, describing a scene, or uploading a screenshot.
idea_8: This feature shows release times, hiatus status, and confidence scores for several series, and sends one daily notification to update you on new chapters.
idea_9: This feature allows users to request and vote for out-of-print chapters, get notifications when they become available, and scan print volume ISBNs to unlock digital copies.
idea_10: This feature lets subscribers share 48-hour access to a chapter or first-volume sampler and provides a clear schedule of free content and access times.

idea_1: This feature shows an interactive map of story arcs with chapter ranges and your reading progress. Tapping an arc displays a summary, main characters, and a brief recap.
idea_2: This feature displays English and Japanese text side by side with matching panels. Tapping a speech bubble shows the original Japanese text, furigana, glossary, and audio pronunciation.
idea_3: This feature shows original Japanese sound effects and provides optional translations as overlays or on tap, with adjustable placement, opacity, and language settings.
idea_4: This feature displays creator and editor comments, sketches, draft pages, and notes linked to each page, which can be accessed again for every chapter.
idea_5: This feature allows you to scan manga, magazines, or posters with your camera to access AR animations and digital content, and capture photos or videos with characters.
idea_6: This feature allows you to download upcoming chapters or a full story arc within a chosen time frame and automatically removes content after reading or when storage is limited.
idea_7: This feature offers synchronized page reading with chat, stickers, and reactions available after each page, and allows leaders to add polls, trivia, or prompts.
idea_8: This feature displays the anime episodes corresponding to your current manga chapter, notes filler and adaptation details, and allows opening and bookmarking episodes on linked streaming platforms.
idea_9: This feature allows users to complete reading tasks, earn badges and avatars, access early artwork, and participate in global team events with shared reading goals.
idea_10: This feature offers accessibility options including dyslexia-friendly text, high-contrast speech bubbles, guided panel zoom, text-to-speech that follows panel order, and optional haptic feedback.

idea_1: This feature is a one-handed rhythm game that plays with lullabies and can be used during late-night rocking. Completing a daily level gives a small points bonus.
idea_2: This feature lets parents rate diaper fit, leakage, and skin friendliness according to baby weight, body type, and sleep position, then generates a Smart Fit Score.
idea_3: This feature generates monthly photo cards from baby pictures with cropping, stickers, and filters. Users can share or order prints to receive rewards.
idea_4: This feature connects retailer loyalty accounts and email to track Pampers purchases, convert them into points, enable instant redemption, apply cash-back boosters, and filter available offers.
idea_5: This feature lets multiple caregivers use one points account with set roles and spending limits, manage tasks together, and earn extra points with contributor badges.
idea_6: This feature gathers scans, receipts, and online orders into a timeline displaying diaper unit prices. Users can export PDFs and reorder from their selected store with one tap.
idea_7: This feature plays white noise, lullabies, and heartbeat sounds with adjustable volume and baby-age settings. It tracks quiet hours and suggests overnight diaper change times.
idea_8: This feature uses on-device AI to estimate your next diaper size and supply needs, then generates a shopping plan with price alerts and calendar reminders.
idea_9: This feature uses the camera to show guides for diaper placement, leg-cuff checks, and waistband fit. It also saves before and after photos for comparison.
idea_10: This feature lets users earn rewards by inviting friends, assisting with their first scan and redemption, gaining bonuses for continued activity, and sharing points for group gifts or donations.

idea_1: This feature links retailer accounts to import digital receipts, award points immediately, display unclaimed orders, and enable retroactive credit with a single tap.
idea_2: This feature allows families to combine points from different caregivers, assign roles and limits, and share a secure QR code for adding points to main or child accounts.
idea_3: This feature estimates when you may need more items based on past scans, displays prices from nearby stores and online, and enables one-tap checkout using saved settings and points.
idea_4: This feature lets users redeem points for discounts at checkout with a barcode or QR code, allows partial redemptions, and updates point balances immediately.
idea_5: This feature allows users to convert points into diaper donations, join group drives, monitor progress with meters, and earn badges for community participation.
idea_6: This feature offers a daily potty training plan with tasks, sticker charts, and milestones that earn points, and provides coupons based on recorded progress.
idea_7: This feature enables offline batch scanning with AI glare correction for quick pack scanning in low light, syncing data later, and supports damaged codes using receipt and packaging photos.
idea_8: This feature suggests diaper sizes and products based on age, weight, and feedback, notifies when to increase size, and displays current prices with bonus point offers.
idea_9: This feature allows parents to create a baby-shower registry that earns points from gift purchases made via retailer links or UPC scans and includes temporary point multipliers.
idea_10: This feature provides a late-night tool that checks partner stores for your size availability and offers small coupons that can be redeemed using points and payment.

idea_1: This feature enhances image and video quality by improving details, reducing noise, fixing compression issues, and provides voice enhancement along with automatic captions.
idea_2: This feature shows different prompt and style options to browse, tracks your past selections, and recommends styles that match your preferences for new or empty inputs.
idea_3: This feature recommends backgrounds, textures, and color changes based on your city, weather, and time, and provides access to local video clips that Kling styles automatically.
idea_4: This feature offers short lessons that analyze your prompts and results, giving editing tips on composition and color. It also provides daily challenges and options for peer feedback.
idea_5: This feature detects claps, snaps, or short voice cues during recording to add markers and automatically inserts beat-aligned b-roll, transitions, or motion graphics at those points.
idea_6: This feature detects strobing, rapid contrast changes, and loud audio spikes in videos, then automatically adjusts them or generates a version with warnings.
idea_7: This feature lets you download style and texture packs to create images and short videos offline, queue tasks, run rendering in the background, and sync files when connected.
idea_8: This feature adds provenance and invisible watermarks to exports, detects prompts involving real people or brands, and offers licensed doubles or lookalike-safe templates for compliance.
idea_9: This feature lets you set numeric values in prompts, create multiple versions, automatically rank them by quality, and choose the best result for your timeline.
idea_10: This feature analyzes the scene, uses the phone flashlight and screen as lighting sources, and adds virtual lights to create combined images and videos.

idea_1: This feature lets users speak commands during preview to adjust actions, camera movements, lighting, or style, updating only the affected frames for editing without manual input.
idea_2: This feature captures camera movements with the phone’s gyroscope and camera, then uses them to create virtual paths in AI scenes with adjustable lens, focus, and stabilization.
idea_3: This feature creates a character profile with face, clothing, voice, and movements, and automatically adjusts prompts to keep these elements consistent in images and videos.
idea_4: This feature analyzes a track to identify beats, sections, and mood, then synchronizes cuts, motion, and effects. It also provides lip-sync and rhythm-matched options.
idea_5: This feature uses AR to insert generated actors into your environment, allowing scene arrangement and scale preview, while capturing depth, lighting, and camera movement data for rendering.
idea_6: This feature lets users apply physics effects such as gravity, wind, cloth, and fluids using sliders and toggles, and create collision shapes for object interactions.
idea_7: This feature allows you to scan a room or object with your phone to create a simple 3D background that reflects real textures, lighting, and occlusions for videos or images.
idea_8: This feature uses 10–20 selfies and a short voice clip to create images and videos of your likeness, with previews on the device and optional cloud upscaling.
idea_9: This feature creates a shot list, camera angles, and pacing from a script, produces storyboards and animatics, lets users select shots to render, and gives time and cost estimates.
idea_10: This feature creates transitions between two video clips by blending colors, lighting, and object positions, using effects such as morphs and wipes, with a timeline tool to generate frames.

idea_1: This feature allows players to identify logos, use modifiers such as reverse and speed-up for score multipliers, and avoid incorrect jingles that end streaks.
idea_2: This feature allows players to collect temporary hint coupons from a rotating feed, which can be used at the start of a round to lower hint costs or solve a jingle automatically. Unused coupons expire.
idea_3: This feature allows you to record a short audio clip by holding the mic button, identifies the sound, creates a challenge for others, and awards credits when played.
idea_4: This feature evaluates your skills, generates a personalized plan with weekly goals and content suggestions, displays event availability in real time, and lets you set reminders.
idea_5: This feature plays remixed brand logos as background music. Users tap floating notes to earn coins and experience points, and can unlock new themes and sounds.
idea_6: This feature lets users replay jingles with controls for looping, pitch, speed, and equalizer, and supports external microphones with noise reduction for recordings.
idea_7: This feature lets users download quiz packs to play offline and offers a large-button mode that supports voice answers for easier use during travel.
idea_8: This feature scans logos using the camera, plays their jingles when identified, awards a badge for finding them, and provides optional AR frames for recording and sharing reactions.
idea_9: This feature allows you to drag letter tiles to spell brand names after hearing jingles, arranging overlapping letters like a crossword. Scores are based on speed and moves.
idea_10: This feature displays a compass-style hint that shows how close your guesses are to the correct category and suggests the next guess to guide your progress.

idea_1: This feature plays jingles in various styles such as 8-bit, lo-fi, reversed, or pitch-shifted. Players guess the brand and may use a hint to hear the original audio.
idea_2: This feature plays a muffled jingle and shows a blurred logo, letting you select which one to clarify with each hint to find the correct answer.
idea_3: This feature allows users to unlock music packs by era and region, track their progress on a world map, and earn stamps and power-ups by completing sets.
idea_4: This feature allows players to join live timed matches and weekend tournaments with skill-based matchmaking, where answering quickly and correctly increases points, and slow or incorrect answers reduce points.
idea_5: This feature lets users create playlists from unlocked jingles, share challenge links with others, and earn bonus coins when others complete their playlists.
idea_6: This feature allows you to record humming or whistling a jingle, uses AI to identify the closest brand, and lets friends guess and score accuracy.
idea_7: This feature allows you to guess songs by listening to rhythm-only versions with drums or vibration patterns and offers short melody hints if needed.
idea_8: This feature allows users to review missed jingles through daily exercises that use spaced repetition and focus on important parts of the music to aid memory.
idea_9: This feature enables location-based challenges with local brand jingles near malls or events and provides limited-time badges for playing during these periods.
idea_10: This feature allows users to choose a point in a music waveform to play a 1–2 second clip. Guessing without choosing awards a bonus.

idea_1: This feature offers step-by-step instructions for repotting, pruning, and propagation with timed guidance and optional AR visuals. It also tracks progress and includes quizzes.
idea_2: This feature shows community review cards for plants, soils, pots, and fertilizers with information on watering, light tolerance, and pest resistance to guide care.
idea_3: This feature allows you to invite others to assist with plant care, share schedules and instructions, and temporarily transfer task control easily.
idea_4: This feature tracks care streaks, diagnoses, and completed lessons to earn Leaf Points, which can be used for discounts, gift cards, or donations. Seasonal challenges offer extra points.
idea_5: This feature adjusts watering, misting, and shading according to local hourly weather and creates a care schedule with tasks to complete before you travel.
idea_6: This feature sends alerts about frost, heatwaves, storms, wildfire smoke, and pest outbreaks for specific plants, and offers instructions along with radar and timeline views.
idea_7: This feature lets you search for plants using filters such as light, humidity, pet safety, skill level, size, and appearance, and generates QR pot tags with care details.
idea_8: This feature allows you to add virtual plants and pots to a space, simulate sunlight changes, adjust spacing and soil, and save or share your designs.
idea_9: This feature offers a location-based board to share plant cuttings, borrow tools, or find a plant sitter, including options for chat and scheduling within the chosen area.
idea_10: This feature lets users import plant logs and photos from CSV or XLSX files, export care sheets or plant passports as PDFs or QR codes, and use species guides and reminders offline.

idea_1: This feature maps light, temperature, and humidity in each room using phone and optional plant sensors. It recommends plant locations and updates care schedules accordingly.
idea_2: This feature analyzes the plant and pot to recommend a container size, calculates soil requirements, indicates root trimming areas, and notifies about drainage or pot size problems.
idea_3: This feature schedules weekly photos of plant leaves, analyzes them on the device to identify pests or diseases, provides treatment suggestions, and offers expert contact if necessary.
idea_4: This feature uses weather, indoor conditions, pot size, and soil type to determine watering schedules and sends alerts to adjust watering before heatwaves.
idea_5: This feature identifies where to cut plants for propagation, estimates rooting success by method, schedules care tasks, and generates QR-coded listings for plant exchanges.
idea_6: This feature creates a checklist of plant care tasks with photos and QR codes, sets reminders for a plant sitter, and enables optional remote photo updates.
idea_7: This feature uses photos taken from the same angle to monitor plant growth, measure leaf area, identify root issues, and provide light or nutrient recommendations.
idea_8: This feature generates potting mix ratios based on your watering habits and home climate, provides scoop measurements with local ingredient options, and tracks pH for adjustment suggestions.
idea_9: This feature allows you to organize plants in outdoor beds by dragging and dropping, provides scores for pest control, nutrients, and spacing, schedules crop rotation, and exports a seasonal plan with sowing and harvest reminders.
idea_10: This feature tracks potential problems such as overwatering, sunburn, nutrient deficiencies, and pests using your logs, local climate, and season, then provides step-by-step guidance to resolve them.

idea_1: This feature lets hosts conduct live practice sessions with prompts, timers, shared canvases, and AI feedback, while viewers join challenges and earn progress badges.
idea_2: This feature allows users to schedule live streams based on location, showing weather information, route maps, and packing lists, with safety alerts and automatic controls during the stream.
idea_3: This feature allows users to send invite links that open a shared watch room with recommended creators and a follow carousel, then suggests streams based on individual preferences.
idea_4: This feature lets viewers send feedback linked to specific times during a live stream, which creators can review, summarize with AI, and use to make polls for future streams.
idea_5: This feature allows users to filter live video chats by topic, language, vibe, content safety, and camera/mic quality, and save filters for future matches. Hosts get QR codes that apply filters and join their room automatically.
idea_6: This feature allows users to download highlights or full live streams for offline viewing, with compression and chapter markers. Reactions and notes sync when online again.
idea_7: This feature improves audio by increasing voice clarity, minimizing background noise, allowing individual volume adjustments, and showing low-delay captions in various languages during live video chats.
idea_8: This feature verifies users through real-time selfie gestures, device motion, and optional ID checks, displays nearby live streams with approximate locations, and offers safety prompts before meetups.
idea_9: This feature allows hosts to use tools like polls, mini-games, whiteboards, and voting cards during live video chats, while viewers can play games and place orders.
idea_10: This feature allows viewers to make predictions during live streams, earn points and streaks, participate in team leaderboards, and redeem points for in-app rewards and digital items.

idea_1: This feature connects creators based on tags and audience overlap, enables a 30-second private chat before streaming, and applies shared layouts and moderation tools automatically.
idea_2: This feature offers real-time captions and AI dubbing in various languages, translates chat messages both ways, and displays summarized questions from different languages to hosts.
idea_3: This feature lets viewers add temporary AR stickers and polls to objects in the host’s scene during live streams, subject to the host’s approval.
idea_4: This feature lets nearby users share short live video clips synchronized with the host’s audio. Hosts can switch between views or use picture-in-picture during the stream.
idea_5: This feature enables short private video chats between hosts and VIP supporters before or after the show and allows hosts to record recaps while keeping backstage talks separate.
idea_6: This feature allows users to hide their video, blur faces, and lock the chat using a panic phrase or gesture, while alerting moderators and safeguarding sensitive information.
idea_7: This feature provides AI suggestions for scene changes, polls, and shoutouts during live video chats. Users can control overlays, sounds, and markers using hand gestures or voice commands.
idea_8: This feature plays back live chat messages, polls, and reactions alongside the video. Viewers who join late can leave comments that the host receives as a summary.
idea_9: This feature lets selected viewers join private audio chats with the host while others view text highlights. Private messages can be made public briefly.
idea_10: This feature allows users to create small community-funded challenges, unlocks actions when goals are met, and uses light, sound, and video clips to indicate completion.

idea_1: This feature lets users record voice notes during runs, automatically adds track, corner, and setup information, and converts the speech into text for tuning and memos.

idea_1: This feature displays recommended drift lines, angles, and speeds using vibration and sound cues. It also replays your last run with suggested changes for score comparison.

idea_1: This feature requires each new word to include at least one letter from the previous word while avoiding obstacles. Higher levels add score multipliers and a bounce re-roll option.
idea_2: This feature gives daily letter coupons that reduce re-roll costs, unfreeze a letter automatically, or allow a one-time wildcard change. Coupons vary by theme and expire each session.
idea_3: This feature lets you enter candidate words during timed rounds and highlights matching dice on the device without providing word suggestions.
idea_4: This feature shows a campaign map with various themed locations, each having unique rules and bonuses. Players use limited vehicle power to travel between stops.
idea_5: This feature allows players to select letter power cards and special dice, then play against others in different game modes with specific rules.
idea_6: This feature syncs game rounds to a beat, applies multipliers for on-beat answers, activates special phases for rhymes or alliteration, and lowers the meter if the beat is missed.

idea_1: This feature allows players to create a custom scorecard by choosing different word constraints to change the rules and challenges for each game.

idea_6: This feature includes timed boss rounds with specific letter challenges. Using these letters causes extra damage and unlocks cosmetic dice or power-ups.

idea_1: This feature offers brief tutorials on making 3D wallpapers, provides AI help with templates, and lets users share their creations on their profiles.

idea_1: This feature moves animated wallpaper elements around icons and widgets to keep them visible and reduces motion near areas where you often tap.

idea_1: This feature offers practice sessions with sample data to help you learn basic car diagnosis, tracks your progress, and provides exercises tailored to your performance.

idea_1: This feature detects sensor problems, shows a live risk score, estimates fuel loss and delay costs, and recommends the next cost-effective action to take.

idea_10: This feature uses your vehicle’s VIN to identify related service bulletins, recalls, and warranties, and generates documents and appointment requests for dealer service.

idea_1: This feature offers 30-second AR exercises showing dunking, toast flipping, and box stacking, tracks progress with badges, and lets users share achievements and earn rewards.

idea_1: This feature lets friends add money to a shared goal, keeps funds secure until the goal is met, and supports refunds, multiple currencies, and partial payments.

app_name: TV Remote App for All TV
idea_1: This feature offers practice exercises for gestures, voice commands, and macros, lets users customize channel-logo shortcuts, and tracks their progress with badges.

idea_1: This feature edits videos to align with the song’s beat by adjusting cuts, zooms, and transitions, and lets users manually adjust timing using taps and haptic feedback.
idea_2: This feature groups photos by people, location, and time, suggests title cards and transitions, and lets you accept or rearrange these groups with a single tap.
idea_3: This feature transcribes lyrics, shows them as captions synced with the music, links lines to photos, animates highlighted words on the beat, and lets users pin lines to images.
idea_4: This feature separates vocals, drums, and instruments in music, lets you adjust their volume levels, and syncs transitions and animations with drum beats or bass sounds.
idea_5: This feature generates 3D parallax effects from single photos using AI depth maps, enabling adjustment of camera movement and speed, with optional particle layers based on the scene.
idea_6: This feature adds background sounds related to the photos, reduces music volume during voiceovers, and includes sound effects synchronized with important moments.
idea_7: This feature lets users add media through a shared link without needing accounts, organizes and adjusts the content automatically, and saves earlier versions for restoration.
idea_8: This feature detects strangers, minors, screens, and license plates in photos or videos and lets users blur, pixelate, cover them with stickers, or create consent request links.
idea_9: This feature creates video clips of 6, 15, 30, or 60 seconds by selecting key faces and events and adjusting the screen time for chosen subjects or themes.
idea_10: This feature creates templates by analyzing fonts, colors, transitions, and pacing, matches project colors to photos, and synchronizes animations with the music.

idea_1: This feature lets users import audio files, assign sounds to objects and actions, adjust audio with an equalizer, detect beats for effects, and control playback speed.
idea_2: This feature lets users stream their sandbox to others, cast to TV or Chromecast, schedule sessions, and allow viewers to vote on hazards, gravity, or replays.
idea_3: This feature adjusts bone counts, physics update rate, and texture resolution to optimize performance on various devices. It also offers a one-tap benchmark showing FPS before and after adjustments.
idea_4: This feature simulates wind, rain, snow, temperature, and puddles, affecting friction, buoyancy, and elasticity, and provides a 14-hour weather forecast with severe weather alerts.
idea_5: This feature enables quick 1v1 or 2v2 ragdoll matches on small arenas with elastic obstacles, offering capture, bowling, and sudden-death modes, with bots and private rooms.
idea_6: This feature lets users create and modify off-road vehicles with tires, suspension, winches, and trailers to move ragdolls across mud, rocks, and water, with traction affected by surface and tire pressure.
idea_7: This feature lets users create storefronts with blueprints, skins, and prefab logic, including ratings, analytics, coupons, tipping, and curated highlights for sharing.
idea_8: This feature allows users to create, set difficulty for, share, and attempt flashcard-style micro-goals with automatic validation and daily updates.
idea_9: This feature lets a host connect multiple devices with a code, allowing participants to trigger events or respond to prompts that generate objects in the main sandbox.
idea_10: This feature lets users build conveyors, lifts, and vehicles to transport items through checkpoints, providing live status updates and a replayable timeline for monitoring and troubleshooting.

idea_1: This feature includes sliders to adjust stiffness, damping, and friction, shows a live stress heatmap, provides haptic feedback, and enables saving and sharing material presets.
idea_2: This feature lets users connect points with springs, ropes, and hinges, allowing adjustable breakable links that can trigger chain reactions in the structures.
idea_3: This feature captures a pose from a photo or silhouette, rigs a ragdoll to match using an on-device model, and creates clones that start or transition into that pose.
idea_4: This feature offers a timeline to control gravity, wind, and time scale, enabling slow motion, freeze frames, rewinds, and exporting clips or GIFs.
idea_5: This feature adds soft gels and fluids that stretch, splash, and stick to ragdolls, with adjustable viscosity, elasticity, and color, and fluids respond to impacts.
idea_6: This feature allows 2–4 players to join a shared sandbox with synchronized physics, quick invitations, basic pings, and gesture controls for cooperative interaction.
idea_7: This feature provides no-code logic blocks such as triggers, sensors, and timers to apply forces, spawn objects, play sounds, and create mini-games and obstacle courses.
idea_8: This feature enables an AR mode that places ragdolls on real surfaces with occlusion and lighting, allowing users to scale, pin, and record their interactions.
idea_9: This feature changes rope tension and length into pitch and volume, enabling users to create and record sound loops by interacting with elastic objects.
idea_10: This feature offers daily remix challenges with a starting contraption and limited parts. Players complete specific goals and can share their creations with others.

idea_1: This feature allows users to browse menu cards, access personalized add-on coupons, and get location-based suggestions for nearby Hardee’s limited-time offers.
idea_2: This feature lets users in a specific area join a group order, combine purchases for bundle pricing, pay separately, and keep their information private.
idea_3: This feature allows users to customize their burgers by completing quick challenges that earn small loyalty rewards and displays an augmented reality preview of the burger before ordering.
idea_4: This Feature sends drive-thru audio to your phone with live captions and sound controls, letting you type responses or confirm your order on the screen.
idea_5: This Feature lets users view and share verified mini-reviews and modification tips, filter them by taste and location, and includes spam checks and staff-selected suggestions.
idea_6: This feature allows you to use a clap, whistle, or on-screen button to activate lights and sounds on your pickup cubby or bag tag and alerts staff for curbside orders.
idea_7: This Feature lets users save rewards, gift cards, and barcodes for offline use and set a default order that submits and pays automatically when online again.
idea_8: This feature allows users to add multiple locations or routes to find nearby Hardee’s®, view their open status, see estimated wait times, and get item suggestions based on weather.
idea_9: This feature allows users to play short word and puzzle games within the order tracker to earn small rewards such as extra stars or sauce upgrades.
idea_10: This feature lets users buy a monthly Biscuit Pass for daily free or discounted breakfast biscuits, view usage details, pick up orders with priority, and cancel easily.

idea_1: This feature lets users create, name, and save custom biscuit sandwiches, set pickup times, and share their orders for others to reorder easily.
idea_2: This feature allows you to schedule a five-minute drive-thru pickup window that adjusts based on your arrival using Bluetooth or license plate detection to start order preparation.
idea_3: This feature tracks your commute to suggest stops, schedules order preparation for your arrival, offers lane guidance via CarPlay/Android Auto, and allows hands-free reordering with voice commands and quick access to recent breakfasts.
idea_4: This feature displays a live countdown to the next biscuit bake and grill cycle, lets users hold orders for the fresh window, and provides alerts for selected items.
idea_5: This feature lets users set allergen and preference profiles for family members, filters the menu based on these settings, suggests substitutions, and notifies the kitchen with the order.
idea_6: This feature provides limited-time local menu items that unlock after enough pre-orders, allowing users to vote to add popular items to more locations.
idea_7: This feature finds locations with large parking and truck access, enables curbside delivery to the truck bay, allows split payments, and provides detailed, time-stamped receipts.
idea_8: This feature generates a shared order link to collect individual orders and payments by a set time, organizes items for curbside pickup, and assigns a pickup bay in the app.
idea_9: This feature allows users to scan packaging to access an AR biscuit game, earn loyalty points, collect badges, unlock filters, and join weekly challenges.
idea_10: This feature allows users to choose a local school or cause at checkout to receive part of their order, track funding, view match hours, and access yearly summaries.

idea_1: This feature performs a deep scan to find data on flash storage and lets users adjust noise removal and interpolation settings before recovering photos and videos.
idea_2: This feature allows you to swipe right to keep or left to discard recovered images, automatically groups similar photos, and highlights months with many lost originals.
idea_3: This feature detects app caches, ad thumbnails, and resized copies, showing their source path, resolution, and integrity status to assist in finding original files.
idea_4: This feature recovers data from damaged files, converts recoverable content into accessible formats, and restores missing parts and broken file headers.
idea_5: This feature detects when system cleaners, low storage, or OS updates might delete files and enables one-tap backup or snapshot creation before the event.
idea_6: This feature allows users to recover specific files or scan storage using voice commands, guides them through recovery modes, and provides explanations for each step.
idea_7: This feature temporarily restores a limited number of files in a secure viewer for 24 hours, allowing you to review them before confirming to unlock export.
idea_8: This feature repairs damaged photos by filling missing areas, fixing corrupted pixels, and restoring faces or textures without altering the original image.
idea_9: This feature tracks deleted files on multiple devices, enables remote scanning, streams recovered files to a main device, and offers filters to block certain content.
idea_10: This feature scans for deleted files offline with the screen off, monitors battery and temperature, saves progress if interrupted, and displays blurred thumbnails until chosen.

idea_1: This feature recovers deleted photos from app caches, browser thumbnails, and camera temporary folders, then merges similar images to restore photos with enhanced quality and metadata.
idea_2: This feature shows a quality score and a detailed map of damaged areas for each file, allowing you to export, repair, or fill gaps using AI.
idea_3: This feature analyzes your phone’s storage and scans areas where deleted files are likely located to shorten scan time and recover lost files more efficiently.
idea_4: This feature monitors storage for errors, detects possible data loss, automatically saves vulnerable photos and documents, and prioritizes recovering damaged files in a dedicated mode.
idea_5: This feature finds missing files from connected services such as Google Photos and WhatsApp, then restores the highest-resolution versions with original EXIF data, timestamps, captions, and album details.
idea_6: This feature groups similar or duplicate files together and automatically selects the best version based on resolution, file quality, and metadata. Users can restore one or more copies.
idea_7: This feature displays recovery results during scanning for immediate restoration and supports remote capture through ADB or Wi-Fi for phones with broken screens or boot problems.
idea_8: This feature repairs damaged photos and files by rebuilding headers and indexes for different formats and provides optional AI-based image enhancement and color correction.
idea_9: This feature records recovery details with timestamps, device IDs, and SHA-256 hashes, enables exporting signed reports, and supports verifying files against the recovery log.
idea_10: This feature restores your gallery timeline and albums by using leftover media data, recovering captions, face tags, locations, and edit history even if the original database is damaged.

idea_1: This feature allows you to begin a tap-to-jump mini-run after several spins, where you collect tokens, earn points, and obtain cosmetic items without changing slot results.
idea_2: This feature lets users create and manage coin and perk combinations with time-limited offers and reserve seats for upcoming tournaments that use the selected combination automatically.
idea_3: This feature records the last 15 seconds of gameplay with optional voice, creates a clip, and lets users share it on Club feeds or export it with privacy and mute options.
idea_4: This feature collects your preferences, suggests games using community data, offers a map-style browsing view with filters, and displays progress on missions and collections.
idea_5: This feature lets you combine slot sound effects with your device’s music, adjust audio settings, emphasize win sounds, and change audio profiles automatically between games.
idea_6: This feature offers a coupon book with time-limited deals that apply automatically at checkout, tracks savings, and provides suggestions to help use coupons more effectively.
idea_7: This feature allows users to set monthly coin limits, track spending, receive reminders, use playtime timers, view countdowns for trials and subscriptions, and cancel them easily.
idea_8: This feature lets users temporarily access premium visuals, 3D lobbies, or turbo UI packs by spending coins or tickets, and create themed routes with rewards.
idea_9: This feature lets clubs create custom crests and mascots, join weekly team events, and send voice notes that are transcribed in the club chat.
idea_10: This feature allows players to earn stars to build and upgrade a Casino City, unlock cosmetic items, access mini-challenges, receive daily rewards, and join seasonal team events.

idea_1: This feature lets teams of up to five players spin the same slot for 10 minutes, filling a meter to trigger a multi-phase bonus boss and earn shared rewards.
idea_2: This feature allows players to create slot games by choosing themes, symbols, and settings, balances payouts automatically, and lets others play these games to earn points and cosmetics.
idea_3: This feature displays spin predictions like "3+ wilds in next 15 spins" or "Bonus within 25 spins" and gives boosters or coin multipliers when predictions are accurate.
idea_4: This feature lets players lock one or two reels and buy a single respin after a near win, using tokens earned from quests and limited per session.
idea_5: This feature places daily AR treasure chests in your room that you can open to start a 30-second mini-game where you catch symbols to earn bonuses. Rewards adjust based on your activity.
idea_6: This feature automatically generates short vertical clips of big wins, rare bonuses, and near-misses, includes links to the games, and shares weekly community reels.
idea_7: This feature lets users set time and coin limits, receive break reminders based on play activity, and track progress through badges and coin rewards.
idea_8: This feature lets users join synchronized spin sessions as ghosts, watch live community wins and streaks, and take part in prediction games with drop-based rewards.
idea_9: This feature lets players exchange duplicate collectibles for symbol shards, which can then be used to create single-use power-ups like sticky wilds or bonus-entry re-rolls.
idea_10: This feature allows players to join clubs with upgradeable lounges, complete weekly slot quests for team rewards, and communicate using chat, emotes, and banners during gameplay.

idea_1: This feature offers short lessons and AR visuals to help with packing and labeling. An AI coach analyzes your photos and gives space-saving suggestions.
idea_2: This feature allows users to complete declutter tasks, scan inventory, and set autopay to earn points that can be exchanged for rent credits, supplies, gift cards, or donations.
idea_3: This feature allows you to send personalized referrals linked to your facility, track rewards after one month, and share digital passes with access controls and visit records.
idea_4: This feature allows you to choose a storage unit, add options such as climate control or supplies, view prices, schedule your rental, and complete check-in without contact.
idea_5: This feature enhances intercom audio, displays real-time captions for gate messages, offers large-button controls, and sends optional alerts for alarms or water leaks during visits.
idea_6: This feature allows you to view unit details with photos, size information, location, access hours, and climate options. An AI recommends units based on your items, budget, and visit frequency.
idea_7: This feature displays common storage unit arrangements in your city, including sizes, shelving, and layouts, with instructions and ratings. It also provides packing guides and lets you add items to your cart.
idea_8: This feature saves gate codes, unit numbers, insurance documents, and receipts offline and generates a rotating QR or NFC pass for gate access without needing a signal.
idea_9: This feature lets you reserve a unit for 24–48 hours with AR size testing and a virtual walk-through, then switch units with prorated charges and updated leases.
idea_10: This feature allows users to join a local group to donate, sell, or swap items, arrange box trades and hauls, and see manager posts and community comments.

idea_1: This feature uses your phone’s camera to scan items and generates a 3D packing plan with a supply list, showing how the items fit in different unit sizes.
idea_2: This feature uses QR-labeled boxes with photos and search to identify items and their locations in your unit, and provides a suggested path for retrieving them.
idea_3: This feature lets users create temporary guest passes with entry records, revoke access immediately, and receive optional door-open notifications via Bluetooth smart lock connection.
idea_4: This feature shows maps from the gate to your unit, displays cart availability, elevator status, restrooms, and allows reserving loading bays or elevator times.
idea_5: This feature automatically opens the gate and assigns a lane when you arrive, enables hands-free exit, and lets you adjust a privacy setting.
idea_6: This feature connects an optional sensor kit to the app to monitor temperature, humidity, and door vibration, providing alerts and displaying trend graphs.
idea_7: This Feature lets you request boxes for home pickup or delivery using QR codes and provides tracking with time-stamped photos and electronic signatures.
idea_8: This feature shows current prices for changing unit sizes, allows reserving an adjacent unit, and provides a step-by-step move plan with automatic proration and overlap management.
idea_9: This feature monitors your current rate against nearby options, notifies you of potential savings, and provides a checklist and transfer credits to assist with moving.
idea_10: This feature allows you to list items from your storage, schedule pickups for buyers or donors, and generate shipping labels to send items from your unit.

idea_1: This feature tracks consecutive fast answers to increase score multipliers and provides options for teams to either risk or secure points during challenges.
idea_2: This feature allows hosts to record questions by holding a button, converts audio to text, reduces background noise, matches answers, and sorts clips into categories for rounds.
idea_3: This feature connects trivia results to venue coupons, applies rewards automatically at checkout using a QR code, and tracks team visits to unlock special events.
idea_4: This feature allows players to take photos as answers, uses AI and crowd voting to evaluate them, and provides a photobooth with themed frames for team pictures.
idea_5: This feature offers brief, five-second trivia questions and tap-to-guess puzzles during breaks. These do not change the main score but unlock cosmetic items and sounds.
idea_6: This feature lets hosts play or upload music clips for Melody Match rounds, scores answers using pitch and tempo analysis, and includes a setlist builder for organizing mini-games.
idea_7: This feature allows teams to mark locations or draw areas on a map for scoring and includes puzzles that require placing items in a specific order by time or location.
idea_8: This feature organizes weekly games into a season where teams complete challenges, earn perks for boss rounds, and play episodes in any sequence.
idea_9: This feature displays upcoming trivia nights on a map with table availability, allows RSVP and waitlist, provides directions, checks team readiness, and suggests a difficulty level.
idea_10: This Feature lets guests use temporary links to access premium content, displays trial time left, sends payment alerts, allows cancellations, and shares purchased packs with a group.

idea_1: This feature uses an AI host to read questions, time rounds, control the game pace, add themed comments, and allow tone selection or manual control.
idea_2: This feature changes question difficulty for each team during the game based on how quickly and accurately they answer. Hosts can control the adjustment level.
idea_3: This feature allows players to set their confidence using a slider, adjusts points according to accuracy and confidence, and shows a calibration score after the game.
idea_4: This feature lets teams submit custom questions for the AI to answer live and provides sources when available. Teams earn points if the AI cannot answer or cite sources.
idea_5: This feature helps players locate objects nearby and answer trivia questions about them. It also lets remote players join by using images from home.
idea_6: This feature connects to Spotify or Apple Music to create music trivia using the group’s combined listening history, playing short clips with adjustable filters and era settings.
idea_7: This feature lets team members send emojis, taps, and short disappearing drawings, with an optional setting that limits text clues during the game.
idea_8: This feature provides each team with a set number of tokens per night to use for hints, category vetoes, or answer challenges, with unused tokens adding to an end-round bonus.
idea_9: This feature creates practice sessions with missed questions using spaced repetition and mnemonics, helping users review weak categories and earn streak multipliers by improving.
idea_10: This feature shows the same question to each player in their selected language and difficulty level while the host controls the game. It compares answers from all players.

idea_1: This feature offers a variety of small activities for different developmental areas that teachers assign and parents complete at home. It tracks progress and recommends next steps.
idea_2: This feature lets parents add trusted individuals for pickups and emergencies with set permissions, and provides real-time information on nearby childcare centers’ backup care availability and referrals.
idea_3: This feature offers weekly surveys and open feedback for each classroom, summarizes responses into trends, and enables families to post public recognition for staff.
idea_4: This feature provides hourly weather updates to recommend outdoor times, clothing reminders, sunscreen permissions, indoor activities, and sends alerts with adjusted pickup times during severe weather.
idea_5: This feature lets parents select meals and substitutions according to allergies, preferences, and portion sizes. The kitchen gets updated counts, and meal confirmations and nutrition reports are provided.
idea_6: This feature lets centers give points for activities such as on-time payments, form completion, volunteering, or reading logs, which families can use for teacher wishlists or classroom funds.
idea_7: This feature lets users record check-in/out, attendance, photos, and incident notes offline, then securely syncs the data and handles conflicts when online again.
idea_8: This feature verifies authorized pickups using selfies, QR codes, and ID scans, sends alerts for unknown visitors, and records when safety messages are received.
idea_9: This feature offers a marketplace for add-on modules and a no-code builder to create custom forms, automations, and reports with e-signature and auto-fill capabilities.
idea_10: This feature monitors classroom noise levels and notifies staff when limits are exceeded. It also offers captions, transcriptions, and enhanced audio for accessibility.

idea_1: This feature tracks expected arrivals and departures to recommend break times, substitute calls, and room merges, ensuring staff-to-child ratios are maintained. Changes can be made with one tap.
idea_2: This feature detects milestones from notes, photos, and videos, connects them to guidelines, recommends activities, and organizes related information for meetings.
idea_3: This feature reviews meals and medications for allergies, dosing schedules, and consents, and alerts users about unauthorized items or children in group photos and menus.
idea_4: This feature records authorized pickups with live ETA, photo, and PIN or QR code, manages child staging, and logs contactless handoff details and signatures at dismissal.
idea_5: This feature provides a summary of naps, meals, activities, and key moments with photos, includes one-tap translation, and suggests follow-up actions for home.
idea_6: This feature records children’s moods, sleep, and meals, identifies behavior patterns, offers classroom strategies and parent tips, and tracks how well these approaches work.
idea_7: This feature tracks supply usage for each child and classroom, sends low-stock alerts, and lets families and admins reorder items within set budget limits.
idea_8: This feature provides checklists, tracks headcounts, assigns roles, and manages reunification steps during drills or emergencies, working offline and updating parents on status.
idea_9: This feature blurs children without media consent, removes location information from photos, and displays consent prompts in the camera viewfinder before sharing images.
idea_10: This feature predicts waitlists, room changes, and staffing needs, verifies subsidy eligibility and attendance, creates claims and documents, identifies issues, and recommends payment plans.

idea_1: This Feature involves completing sequences of various game types or bet amounts to earn MGM Rewards, avatars, or draw entries, with optional rules that do not change game odds or risk.
idea_2: This Feature allows users to record voice notes to set bankroll goals, track mood, and use voice commands to open favorites, set limits, timers, or activate cooldowns.
idea_3: This feature automatically saves short, muted clips or images of key hands and events, allows private review with adjustable amounts and badges, and lets you manually bookmark moments.
idea_4: This feature calculates a monthly budget from your inputs, sets deposit and loss limits, adds session timers, and displays a checklist of active safeguards with adjustment options.
idea_5: This feature shows live dealer table information such as occupancy, minimum bets, side bets, and wait times, enables one-tap seat joining, and recommends similar tables.
idea_6: This feature allows you to save offers, automatically use the best combination when depositing or betting, display expected value and terms, and track your redemption progress.
idea_7: This feature tracks wagering progress across games, displays contribution rates, estimates time to complete playthrough requirements, provides house-edge details, and identifies plans unlikely to finish on time.
idea_8: This feature allows you to organize games into a play order with optional breaks and rewards badges and raffle entries for completing groups of games.
idea_9: This feature allows you to select a 3D lobby with seasonal effects and subscribe to flash giveaways that display countdowns and send notifications when you qualify.
idea_10: This feature allows you to save and reuse chip placements using gestures and haptic feedback, and includes a Quick Play widget to start your last game with saved settings.

idea_1: This feature allows you to set time, budget, stop-win, and stop-loss limits for a session, enforces them with pauses and optional locked cashouts, and provides a summary.
idea_2: This feature displays real-time game volatility and pace, estimates how fast your bankroll changes per minute, and provides options for lower volatility games if requested.
idea_3: This Feature automatically moves a portion of your winnings into a locked wallet when specific amounts are reached, restricting access to those funds temporarily.
idea_4: This feature connects you with 20–50 players for 3–5 minute slot tournaments using your regular spins, showing a live leaderboard and awarding small bonus prizes.
idea_5: This feature lets you complete tasks in slots, blackjack, and roulette to earn non-cash rewards and free-play tokens.
idea_6: This feature allows friends to watch a live dealer game together with synchronized video, chat, and shared side challenges that provide cosmetic badges.
idea_7: This feature creates a play-style profile from your risk tolerance and game preferences, then recommends lower-volatility or longer-playtime games when Calm Mode is activated.
idea_8: This feature captures important moments from slots or table games and generates a short video clip with game details and responsible-play information for sharing.
idea_9: This feature connects online play with MGM locations, enabling users to check in at the site to access tasks, quicker payments, and shared loyalty rewards.
idea_10: This feature gives reminders about betting risks and may ask users to complete a brief pause task before they can continue playing.

idea_1: This feature shows your coloring time by day, week, and month, tracks completion patterns, identifies busy hours, highlights favorite palettes, and recommends similar artworks.
idea_2: This feature sends notifications about new packs, ending events, and streak status for followed tags or creators, and offers a watchlist to monitor active challenges.
idea_3: This feature provides timed mini-games that fill random cells to earn hints and boosters, and includes a mode with larger controls and preloaded sets for offline use.
idea_4: This feature offers short exercises on scan order, mistake reduction, and palette recognition that adapt to your performance and display progress charts for speed and accuracy.
idea_5: This feature tracks Color Coins earned from missions, streaks, and combos, allowing users to exchange them for premium packs, discounts, or specific gift cards. Temporary events increase earnings.
idea_6: This feature estimates the time needed to complete a coloring piece, suggests canvases for specific time frames, and enables scheduling with reminders and offline downloads.
idea_7: This feature lets users sort images by different options, save filter settings, hide complex or sensitive content, and turn photos into pixelated numbered templates.
idea_8: This feature tracks consecutive correct fills and number sequences, providing multipliers, brushes that fill nearby cells, bonus stars, and leaderboards for combos and flawless runs.
idea_9: This feature allows users to compete in real-time 1v1 coloring races with identical canvases and medals, and join seasonal leagues to earn weekly points by selecting artworks with friends.
idea_10: This feature lets you rotate and zoom 360° panoramas and 3D dioramas, then color numbered scenes on walls, floors, and objects within them.

idea_1: This feature lets users change colors in completed or ongoing pictures with one-tap palette swaps while keeping the original number layout. Users can also share these variations.
idea_2: This feature allows you to press and drag to fill connected cells with the same number or draw a lasso to fill a chosen area using a brush that aligns with cells.
idea_3: This feature lets multiple users join a room with a code to color the same canvas together by assigning colors or areas and taking turns periodically.
idea_4: This feature uses the camera to display numbered pixels in your surroundings, enabling you to move and locate groups of pixels to complete the coloring task.
idea_5: This feature generates coloring templates from text or sketches and lets users adjust style, difficulty, grid size, palette count, and dithering directly on the device.
idea_6: This feature provides breathing cues, highlights the next area to color, and plays ambient sounds that change according to the colors selected.
idea_7: This feature lets you color 2–4 keyframes, generates smooth pixel animations between them, and allows you to export the animation as a GIF, video, or live wallpaper.
idea_8: This feature connects each palette color to a specific sound and vibration pattern, generating a soundtrack from completed color clusters and saving it with your timelapse.
idea_9: This feature offers the same puzzles to all players, displays global leaderboards, shows ghost replays, and records input logs to verify time submissions.
idea_10: This feature allows you to earn pigments by coloring, mix them to make custom palettes, use these palettes on templates, and grow plants that match the colors.

idea_1: This feature adds a timed mode where forming valid words quickly increases a multiplier, dice move over obstacle tiles, and maintaining combos removes obstacles and unlocks bonuses.
idea_2: This feature shows a rotating coupons bar where players choose limited-time boosts before a match and use them during or after the round for extra points.
idea_3: This feature allows you to record voice memos of words or patterns, converts them into text in an Idea Pad, and can insert recognized words during solo play.
idea_4: This feature allows you to explore a themed world map, reserve destinations to preload rule changes, earn badges for completing routes without hints, and collect passport stamps.
idea_5: This feature allows players to collect letter-dice sets and power cards, create a 10-die loadout before matches, and applies rules and limits to keep gameplay balanced.
idea_6: This feature lets up to six players join a group with weekly shared goals, access common puzzle packs, and includes a Kids Mode with easier difficulty and screen break alerts.
idea_7: This feature allows you to design a team crest or mascot with shapes, colors, and fonts, apply it to dice faces, and export it as in-game stickers.
idea_8: This feature offers 3D dice with physics and haptic feedback. It also gives all online players random cosmetic items or one-use wilds through Glimmer Drops.
idea_9: This feature allows you to roll seven letter dice, lock selected dice, and place them on an 11x11 board with special squares. You can play turn-based games against other players or bots using updated scoring and live dictionaries.
idea_10: This feature automatically captures a selfie or board image with AR dice effects after significant words or wins and compiles a highlight reel of key plays.

idea_1: This feature raises a volatility meter with each reroll, which can activate high-value letters, locked dice, and score multipliers. Players choose when to save bonuses.
idea_2: This feature offers daily word challenges with specific requirements. Completing consecutive challenges unlocks new dice designs and experience point bonuses.
idea_3: This feature lets 2–4 players take turns of 20 seconds each using the same seed, working together to build a shared combo meter with one team reroll per match.
idea_4: This feature lets you change a special die to display the most suitable letter, lock that letter in place, and switch the die between vowel and consonant modes using a charge.
idea_5: This feature generates a unique code for each roll, allowing others to play the same board, view leaderboards, and optionally watch replays with timing and paths.
idea_6: This feature displays missed high-value words, letter heatmaps, and affix options after each round, and provides a one-tap 60-second practice drill with the same dice.
idea_7: This feature introduces challenges like frozen dice, limited vowels, and rotating letters with timers. Players complete goals to earn power-ups and cosmetic badges.
idea_8: This feature lets players customize dice faces with letter shards, save their setups, and use standard dice in ranked games, while custom dice are for solo and friend games only.
idea_9: This feature displays dice on a flat surface using AR, enables angle-based bonuses by tilting the device, and allows tapping for local pass-and-play gameplay.
idea_10: This feature adds dice with affixes and phonemes that use charges to form longer words. It also provides contextual tips explaining the word parts.

idea_1: This feature allows you to tap tiles to reveal 10-second trivia questions with vibration and sound, and earn small rewards that carry over to your next full game.
idea_2: This feature offers rotating power coupons that reduce hint costs, add extra time, or unlock premium categories, and applies them automatically during match checkout.
idea_3: This feature allows players to earn combo points by answering questions consecutively, skip questions, or convert them into bonus challenges, with penalties applied for incorrect answers.
idea_4: This feature lets users answer questions by speaking, hear spoken prompts, recognizes speech in noisy settings, and send 15-second voice challenges with mini-quizzes to contacts.
idea_5: This feature offers short practice drills on elimination tactics, pacing, and association linking, includes adaptive coaching, weekly skill assessments, and unlocks small in-game benefits.
idea_6: This feature offers a family mode with a narrator, larger buttons, music during questions, age-based question packs, offline play, no ads, and fast pass-the-phone turns.
idea_7: This feature allows users to filter games by difficulty, year range, spoiler sensitivity, media type, and question length, save these filters as presets, and share them using a QR code or link.
idea_8: This feature sends push notifications about trending topics, displays a radar of category popularity changes, and lets users opt into location and time-based content packs.
idea_9: This feature allows players to participate in timed raids against Knowledge Titans by answering questions correctly, which deals damage, unlocks new stages, and awards badges and banners.
idea_10: This feature records important moments such as saves and streaks with selfie reactions in picture-in-picture, adds audio effects, and enables quick sharing of short clips.

idea_1: This feature allows you to select a confidence level after each question, adjusts points accordingly, and shows weekly statistics to monitor your accuracy and confidence.
idea_2: This feature combines answers from previous rounds into a final puzzle. Solving it applies a multiplier, and progress is saved across multiple days.
idea_3: This feature allows players to reveal audio or images in questions by tapping and holding, affecting their score based on the number of reveals used.
idea_4: This feature allows two players to share one timer and take turns answering questions each round while maintaining their streaks and activating score multipliers for correct answers.
idea_5: This feature lets experienced players submit incorrect answers for multiple-choice questions, which are reviewed before being added to other players’ games.
idea_6: This feature organizes 16 players into groups that compete in weekly seasons with daily matches, rankings, playoffs, and movement between groups based on performance.
idea_7: This feature allows a team to answer trivia questions with varying rules. Completing stages provides shared rewards and cosmetic badges for the team.
idea_8: This feature allows both players to ban two categories, choose two favorite categories, and adds a randomly selected wildcard category before the match starts.
idea_9: This feature offers brief practice sessions on topics you answered incorrectly, using spaced repetition to review and add questions between matches to help improve accuracy.
idea_10: This feature lets players mark unclear questions with a source, review challenges as they happen, and monitor challenge results to keep questions accurate.

idea_1: This feature lets players clear tiles in set sequences to trigger combo multipliers and unlock challenges. Weekly layouts include obstacles for practicing these sequences.
idea_2: This feature allows you to save a game snapshot, replay it multiple times, compete against your previous attempt, and share the saved position with others.
idea_3: This feature allows users to earn changing coupons by completing small tasks, which can be automatically applied for discounts on hints, undos, or theme packs.
idea_4: This feature uses a short qualification run to set difficulty, unlock pro daily games, provide a personalized checklist, and display a monthly roadmap of upcoming layouts.
idea_5: This feature allows you to schedule puzzles for future days and download them for offline play. It also displays your progress on a map with optional routes and rewards.
idea_6: This feature allows you to create a koi pond that expands with your streak, add decorations by finishing daily tasks, and play ambient sounds for relaxation.
idea_7: This feature allows you to change 3D tile materials and adjust gloss, depth, and shadows, with animations and haptic feedback during gameplay.
idea_8: This feature creates a short timelapse of each win, showing important unblocks and the final reveal, and lets users export it as a video or split image with one tap.
idea_9: This feature displays matches that free tiles, estimates puzzle solvability, and shows how many tiles each move releases in Practice Mode.
idea_10: This feature provides small layouts for 60–90 second games with sprint scoring and speed bonuses to enable fast gameplay and track daily streaks.

idea_1: This feature offers a daily puzzle that is guaranteed solvable and consistent in difficulty. It also lets users undo recent moves a limited number of times without impacting time or streak.
idea_2: This feature lets you mark a blocked stack and request a friend to remove one legal pair from your board. Both players gain small XP, and the game verifies solvability.
idea_3: This feature places the tile set on your desk using AR, lets you move and tilt it to see different layers, and records short AR game clips to share.
