idea_4: This feature provides weekend tournaments with 2–3 minute game boards that have changing effects such as fog-of-war and rotating layers. Leaderboards reset every week.
idea_5: This feature lets players create Mahjong boards by dragging and dropping tiles, checks the boards automatically, sets par scores, and shares chosen boards in a daily community queue.
idea_6: This feature offers breathing cues, gentle vibrations, and simple visuals to support focus. Completing a session grants a hint credit and temporarily removes ads.
idea_7: This feature offers high-contrast themes, colorblind-friendly colors, larger touch areas, optional tile voice prompts, and a one-hand mode that selects the nearest valid match.
idea_8: This feature adds a new tile to a Mahjong Mosaic each day you finish a puzzle, enabling you to unlock themes and share your progress with others.
idea_9: This feature displays possible future moves and dead-ends in a move tree and can highlight the safest match to help maintain available options.
idea_10: This feature lets you keep your streak by finishing a 90-second challenge or watching a short ad within 24 hours, using tokens that recharge weekly.

idea_1: This feature allows users to complete themed offer sequences within time limits to build a combo meter, with expired or rejected offers resetting it and streak milestones granting multipliers and bonus crates.
idea_2: This feature allows you to earn coins by playing, which can be spent to feed fish and unlock decorations, stones, and new fish species in a virtual tank.
idea_3: This feature allows users to record 10–30 second audio responses to prompts about apps or shopping, with automatic transcription and guided prompts to assist recording.
idea_4: This feature allows users to clip digital coupons and earn rewards by redeeming them online or in-store, using receipt scans or linking loyalty accounts.
idea_5: This feature tracks subscription trials started through Scrambly, displays countdowns and reminders, and offers one-tap cancel links and dispute options to manage charges.
idea_6: This feature allows you to complete local food-related tasks by trying partner menu items or delivery options, with extra challenges providing additional rewards.
idea_7: This feature lets parents activate Family Mode, set play times and daily limits, and manage a wallet that stores rewards redeemable for treats or gift cards.
idea_8: This feature allows users to create slimes, textures, and sounds in the ASMR Fidget Lab, unlocking cosmetic items and earning coins through daily use.
idea_9: This feature displays a live map with location-based tasks, calculates distances and routes, allows filtering by reward per mile, and sends alerts near task locations.
idea_10: This feature allows players to participate in team missions to defeat a shared boss, monitor their individual contributions, and receive rewards according to their progress and final hits.

idea_1: This feature calculates your expected earnings and time needed using your history, device, and tasks, then starts a 30–60 minute session with suitable rewards.
idea_2: This feature offers quests in various games that unlock higher multipliers when you complete tasks within a time limit, with an additional reward for finishing all steps.
idea_3: This feature tracks play time and milestones on the device to give small rewards instantly, keeping data private and sending only hashed information when needed.
idea_4: This feature allows you to join squads with friends or auto-match to complete weekly goals, earning shared rewards based on combined experience points and assist bonuses.
idea_5: This feature displays reliability scores and estimated times from past data, and lets users filter and sort offers by earnings per hour, reliability, and effort.
idea_6: This feature lets users earn and schedule 30–60 minute 2x multipliers that can be activated during set times to increase their rewards.
idea_7: This feature collects data such as install references, timestamps, and progress, generates a dispute ticket with an estimated resolution time, and enables one-tap submission with live status updates.
idea_8: This feature retries validating offers using a backup system if the original offer is delayed and provides partial compensation from an insurance pool if the issue remains unresolved.
idea_9: This feature provides bonuses for downloading large games over Wi-Fi and automatically launches games once their downloads are complete.
idea_10: This feature offers local tasks and augmented reality token drops, enabling users to check in at partner locations or collect AR coins to earn limited-time rewards.

idea_1: This feature provides short 15–30 second trivia rounds that give tokens for cash-entry tickets and includes customizable animations, sounds, and seasonal visual themes.
idea_2: This feature gives higher multipliers for consecutive correct answers, extra bonuses for fast responses, no hints, or perfect category runs, and includes obstacles plus a limited-use power-up.
idea_3: This feature shows a dashboard with accuracy, earnings, and playtime by hour, day, week, and month, plus category heatmaps, yearly trends, and suggested play times and topics.
idea_4: This feature provides live updates on prize amounts, competition levels, and win rates by category, and lets users set alerts using chosen filters.
idea_5: This feature offers digital coupons for brands or categories from the game round, which can be saved and used in-store or online with Swagbucks earnings.
idea_6: This feature offers short lessons, reviews incorrect answers with AI, applies spaced repetition for practice, and unlocks advanced rooms or reduces entry fees when skill milestones are reached.
idea_7: This feature offers audio trivia rounds with adjustable speed and sound settings, lets you download practice packs for offline use, and updates your audio trivia rating.
idea_8: This feature lets users create quiz playlists with different categories, host public or private tournaments with shared prize pools, and earn bonuses from playlist activity and ratings.
idea_9: This feature allows players to answer timed questions together to lower a boss's health. Players who contribute more receive bigger rewards and unique cosmetic items.
idea_10: This feature detects poor network connections, switches to a simpler interface, preloads questions, allows time to reconnect, and provides refunds or rematches if issues persist.

idea_1: This feature allows users to use earned SB to buy streak insurance that covers one wrong answer per game and keeps their multiplier active.
idea_2: This feature lets players create teams to share lifelines and jackpots, view weekly league rankings, and earn experience points to unlock perks such as category bans and bonus rewards.
idea_3: This feature lets users create and share trivia packs with AI assistance for fact-checking and difficulty adjustment. Creators can earn ad revenue and bonuses from popular packs.
idea_4: This feature allows players to choose and exclude trivia categories before multiplayer rounds, determining which questions will appear during the game.
idea_5: This feature allows you to join timed trivia games based on your location, with local sponsors providing bonus points and themed questions, and rewards for playing in different areas.
idea_6: This feature lets you select a low-risk or high-risk prize ladder before playing and use the "Bank now" option to save part of your winnings during the game.
idea_7: This feature allows users to complete different tasks, such as winning rounds or answering quickly, to earn rewards like payout multipliers, extra entries, or lifeline credits.
idea_8: This feature lets players trade, craft, or auction lifelines within daily limits and convert practice streaks into lifelines like 50/50, time freeze, or category swap.
idea_9: This feature lets users join short sponsor quizzes between rounds to earn 24-hour payout boosts, free re-entries, or streak insurance, with limits on how often and when they appear.
idea_10: This feature lets users activate Fair Play mode with selfie and device verification to join higher-stakes rooms, get priority matchmaking, and earn a small SB cashback on entries.

idea_1: This feature shows a HUD, radar ring, and speedometer with maps, speed limits, and hazard heatmaps, and automatically switches to trail GPS after parking.
idea_2: This feature adjusts the 3D HUD according to windshield angle and daylight to minimize reflections and displays navigation and trip information that syncs with watch or tablet.
idea_3: This feature lets you choose route options such as fewest stops, smooth acceleration, or lowest elevation gain, evaluates your trip, and awards tokens for safe, efficient driving.
idea_4: This feature minimizes the HUD for 10 minutes, displaying only the next turn, current speed compared to the speed limit, and lane guidance with haptic signals.
idea_5: This feature plays offline audio stories and geography lessons triggered by GPS locations, delivering sound to the rear seats while keeping the driver display unchanged.
idea_6: This feature displays a compass overlay pointing to the Qibla direction and provides nearby prayer or quiet stop locations with parking and hours, functioning offline beside the speedometer.
idea_7: This feature displays radar rings indicating potholes, school zones, wildlife crossings, and ice risk with timing, adding more detectors and extending alerts while driving.
idea_8: This feature generates a vertical summary video after parking, combining speed, elevation, and scenic segments without revealing exact locations, which can be shared with others.
idea_9: This feature offers daily driving tasks like keeping speed within limits or avoiding hard braking, and records progress with streaks and HUD badges.
idea_10: This feature lets you pre-order fuel, food, or parking along your route and pay without using your hands. The HUD shows pickup or pump instructions when the vehicle is stopped.

idea_1: This feature uses the front camera to detect your eyes and windshield angle, adjusts the HUD projection to align with the road, and changes brightness to reduce glare.
idea_2: This feature uses the phone camera and map to identify your current lane and shows the correct lane on the HUD for upcoming exits, merges, or toll booths with speed and ETA.
idea_3: This feature uses live precipitation radar, road temperature, and tire noise data to estimate traction, update the speedometer display, and provide speed recommendations for slippery conditions.
idea_4: This feature uses elevation, upcoming speed limits, and traffic light timing to indicate when to reduce acceleration for smoother slowing without braking.
idea_5: This feature combines sensor data and optional OBD-II input to provide accurate speed and location information in tunnels and urban areas, enabling the HUD to show guidance without GPS.
idea_6: This feature shows a risk bar that updates in real time using local enforcement data, recent reports, patrol routes, and your current speed compared to speed limits.
idea_7: This feature detects speed limit signs with the device, compares them to mapped limits, updates the HUD speed limit, and sends differences for community review.
idea_8: This feature uses phone sensors to detect potholes, speed bumps, and rough roads, shares anonymized data, and shows icons with alternative lane or route options on the HUD.
idea_9: This feature uses the microphone and directional processing to detect approaching sirens, shows an arrow with distance on the HUD, and indicates which shoulder or lane to clear.
idea_10: This feature uses Bluetooth to share alerts about nearby hazards, speed traps, and road closures between devices within a few hundred meters, updating the HUD without internet.

idea_1: This feature offers brief lessons and daily exercises on breathing, labor positions, swaddling, and bottle preparation, allowing users to practice and monitor their progress.
idea_2: This feature offers a daily plan that considers weather, air quality, and pollen levels, adjusts activities and hydration, and provides pregnancy-safe weather alerts and hospital route options.
idea_3: This feature tracks prenatals, basal temperature, hydration, walks, kick counts, and class attendance, allowing you to earn points that can be exchanged for partner discounts or donations.
idea_4: This feature shows verified ratings and reviews of OBs, midwives, hospitals, and pregnancy or TTC products, with filters for location, cycle phase, and health conditions.
idea_5: This feature filters content according to your cycle stage or pregnancy trimester and lets you scan a clinic QR code to import visit summaries and next steps automatically.
idea_6: This feature offers animations, songs, and small activities that show baby development and support positive behaviors to keep children occupied during car rides.
idea_7: This feature lets users create private groups with assigned roles and helps find nearby prenatal classes and support groups within a chosen distance.
idea_8: This feature shows nearby restaurant menus with pregnancy- and fertility-safe options, marks ingredients to avoid, and enables one-tap reordering with contactless pickup.
idea_9: This feature lets users download weekly guides, lessons, audio tracks, and timers for offline access, and syncs the data when connected to the internet.
idea_10: This feature lets you upload health documents, extracts key information into your timeline, and enables sharing summaries with your care team.

idea_1: This feature uses LH strip photos, temperature readings, and cervical mucus records to create an hourly fertility schedule, adjusting for illness, schedule changes, and travel.
idea_2: This feature gives weekly 60-second updates and practical suggestions for your partner, including goals and small tasks related to symptoms or pregnancy week.
idea_3: This feature scans barcodes on products to provide safety information by trimester, lets users save approved items, and alerts for conflicts with recorded symptoms.
idea_4: This feature tracks local temperature, air quality, water advisories, pollen levels, and vector alerts, offering travel destination checks with packing and precaution lists.
idea_5: This feature changes the app’s appearance to a neutral look, removes sensitive words from notifications, and offers a quick-exit option for privacy on shared devices.
idea_6: This feature records your baby’s movement patterns from kick logs, notifies you of notable changes, offers movement reminders, and allows one-tap calls to your provider.
idea_7: This feature records prenatal lab results and vital signs, provides clear explanations, displays trends in graphs, generates PDF reports, and identifies possible health concerns.
idea_8: This feature uses 3D AR to estimate fetal position, monitor weekly posture and center of mass changes, and provides exercises for pelvic floor, ligament relief, and sleep positioning.
idea_9: This feature lets you create questions for appointments, convert answers into tasks and reminders, share summaries, and add follow-up events to your calendar.
idea_10: This feature generates a nutrition and grocery plan based on preferences, nausea, and cultural factors, checks for mercury and listeria risks, suggests alternatives for gestational diabetes, and offers barcode safety scans.

idea_1: This feature allows you to speak your next word, adds it to the chain, records voice notes of your turns, and includes pauses to avoid accidental entries.
idea_2: This feature activates combo multipliers when users complete specific word patterns and timed challenges, including alternating letters, rhymes, palindromes, and avoiding certain letters.
idea_3: This feature allows players to earn word coupons from daily challenges and events, then use them before a turn to access letter swaps, hints, or timer pauses.
idea_4: This feature allows users to play in a calm mode where each word adds a fish or stone to an aquarium, with sounds and tap-to-feed interactions.
idea_5: This feature allows you to choose content packs with various themes and offers accessibility options such as dyslexia-friendly fonts, color-safe themes, and moderated teen areas.
idea_6: This feature breaks progress into steps with checklists and drills, matches players weekly by skill level, and suggests skills to practice next.
idea_7: This feature allows you to take a photo to identify objects, displays optional AR letters on them, and creates a shareable video clip with frames and stickers.
idea_8: This feature displays a live meter that compares differences between consecutive words by spelling, sound, and meaning, and shows a map of word connections during the session.
idea_9: This feature allows you to play on an 11x11 grid by adding words that begin with the last letter of the previous word, connecting like a crossword.
idea_10: This feature offers offline word challenges with different difficulty levels and timed sessions. Premium access removes ads, shows detailed statistics, adds custom themes, and allows family sharing for five accounts.

idea_1: This feature introduces rule cards that change word requirements for bonus points. Players can save or block these cards to adjust the game's difficulty and risk.
idea_2: This feature shows a live meter of how uncommon the chosen ending letter is, gives extra points for rare letters, and adds a small penalty if the opponent replies.
idea_3: This feature connects word chains across languages using shared sounds or transliteration, offers optional live translation, and applies language-specific dictionaries and difficulty settings.
idea_4: This feature uses the camera to capture words from objects within a time limit, prevents repeated words, and applies bonuses based on the user's location.
idea_5: This feature adds cooperative raid bosses that lose health as teams create word chains following changing rules. Using rare letters and long words increases damage, and shared power-ups support teamwork.
idea_6: This feature generates a list of missed or new words with definitions and audio after each match and provides brief practice sessions before games using daily rules.
idea_7: This feature allows players to create custom game modes with options like prime-length words or palindromes and view a feed of selected and popular modes.
idea_8: This feature offers chain surgery puzzles where you connect two words by adding the fewest valid words according to rules, with optional hints available for points.
idea_9: This Feature lets players add new words to a daily chain, prevents duplicate entries, organizes players by region, tracks streaks, and gives bonuses to the last unique contributor.
idea_10: This feature adds a mode where players use each word in a sentence to continue a story, with AI scoring based on word rules and story quality.

idea_1: This feature generates daily exercises from your sources on summarizing, argument mapping, and citation. It tracks progress, offers review links, and changes difficulty as needed.
idea_2: This feature records and transcribes lectures on the device, generates linked summaries with action items, and allows marking questions by clapping or double-tapping earbuds.
idea_3: This feature simplifies paragraphs at various levels, highlights key sentences, allows choosing reading difficulty, and plays audio of selected important lines.
idea_4: This feature lets collaborators rate claims, add linked comments, suggest rewrites with automatic citations, and shows source details including possible AI-generated or low-credibility indicators.
idea_5: This feature saves sources, embeddings, and a small model on the device for offline question answering, and allows queuing and navigating insight playlists without internet.
idea_6: This feature offers sample datasets for users to try functions without uploading files and lets them switch to their own data without interrupting the workflow.
idea_7: This feature creates a shared notebook with assigned roles, manages turn-taking, resolves conflicting notes, and generates a summary based on group contributions.
idea_8: This feature lets nearby users join a shared notebook by scanning a QR code, automatically gathering related materials and enabling a chat about those contents.
idea_9: This feature extracts tables, formulas, and units from different file types, organizes them, supports number-based queries and calculations, compares units, and shows source citations.
idea_10: This feature monitors your sources and feeds for new papers, retractions, and contradictions, sends alerts, and displays a timeline of trends, disputes, and note updates.

idea_1: This feature records audio, transcribes it in real time, captures images of slides or whiteboards, organizes content by topic, tags speakers, and generates follow-up questions.
idea_2: This feature finds conflicting information from various sources, displays related evidence with confidence scores, and recommends searches or questions to help clarify the differences.
idea_3: This feature saves highlights, screenshots, PDFs, and links to notebooks with tags, organizes content, extracts important information, and adds citations automatically.
idea_4: This feature allows you to search all notebooks, view links between ideas, and access related information by selecting nodes to see supporting text and merge topics.
idea_5: This feature allows you to capture an image of a whiteboard, book page, or table and converts it into editable text, tables, or diagrams with source references.
idea_6: This feature creates watchlists for claims, statistics, and topics, tracks updates from trusted sources, summarizes changes, explains their importance, and adds notes with citations.
idea_7: This feature turns a notebook into a narrated slide deck or short video with visuals and speaker notes, which can be exported to Google Slides or shared.
idea_8: This feature generates short quizzes from your notes, schedules them in Calendar, and sends them as lock-screen notifications with answers connected to the original content.
idea_9: This feature saves sensitive notebooks on the device and uses local models to search, summarize, and redact content. It can also create a cleaned version for sharing.
idea_10: This feature saves your search queries, added sources, and edits, then generates an exportable appendix with timestamps and citations for reference.

idea_1: This feature allows users to practice conversations with an AI coach that gives prompts, manages the pace, helps with listening skills, and lets users invite friends and monitor progress.
idea_2: This feature opens welcome rooms when you invite friends, schedules weekly group chats, and gives trust badges to users who write helpful reviews.
idea_3: This feature allows users to earn coins by getting positive feedback, hosting activities, and completing daily mini-games or surveys, which can be exchanged for rewards.
idea_4: This feature connects you with nearby users, translates messages automatically, adjusts meeting times for different time zones, and displays popular chat times based on location and weather.
idea_5: This feature shows live captions, reduces background noise, offers sound settings, increases volume safely, and adjusts audio to make quiet or distant voices easier to hear.
idea_6: This feature generates a summary post from each live chat, lets users comment on it to continue discussions, and tracks user reputation through comments and reviews.
idea_7: This feature offers age-restricted, moderated chat rooms with avatars and sound effects. Parents can set time limits and approve hosts for controlled use during car rides.
idea_8: This feature allows users to set chat preferences such as size, topic, energy, language, and vibe, then begin a match and include options like icebreakers, games, or translation.
idea_9: This feature lets users save and download audio highlights with permission, skip sections during playback, and attach documents that can be previewed and translated in the chat.
idea_10: This feature displays conversation mood and speed, notifies users of negative or intense interactions, suggests pausing or leaving, and can involve moderators when needed.

idea_1: This feature enables users to have real-time conversations in multiple languages by translating speech on the device and showing text captions, dubbed audio, or both.
idea_2: This feature lets users set conversation rules before a call and includes a safe word button that blurs video, mutes audio, and offers block or report options.
idea_3: This feature connects users by matching short audio clips and profile details, allowing them to choose a mood before starting a conversation.
idea_4: This feature offers shared activities like question cards, drawing games, and storytelling during calls, allowing both users to skip or switch activities without leaving the chat.
idea_5: This feature allows users to use 3D avatars instead of their faces and change their voices during calls, with the option to switch between avatar and real appearance by swiping.
idea_6: This feature creates temporary chat rooms based on popular keywords, connects users for one-on-one conversations, and closes the rooms automatically after a short period.
idea_7: This feature lets users start or schedule 5-minute skill-swap sessions to teach or learn brief lessons and earn tokens for premium matches.
idea_8: This feature provides an optional summary after calls, showing key points, shared links, and tasks, with a one-tap option to follow up. Data is private and deletable.
idea_9: This feature detects connection problems, switches to voice-first mode with animated avatar lip-sync and transcripts, and displays network status to help users handle pauses and retries.
idea_10: This feature uses temporary kudos based on traits like “respectful” or “good listener” instead of star ratings, which fade over time and affect matching and feedback.

idea_1: This feature allows you to enter your needs, insurance, and location to find nearby or telehealth providers, view match scores and reasons, then shortlist and book them.
idea_2: This feature uses your location to check you in automatically, displays your QR code and wait time, and offers nearby or telehealth options if wait times are long.
idea_3: This feature offers live captions, adjustable text size, improved audio with noise reduction, and optional real-time translation during televisits to assist communication.
idea_4: This feature adjusts brightness and uses AR guides to help take clear wound or skin photos and document scans, detects blur or glare, and attaches images to messages or forms.
idea_5: This feature gathers medication, appointment, and alert details for approved family members from various providers into one dashboard and lets users share updates with selected relatives.
idea_6: This Feature allows users to access medication, allergies, instructions, insurance cards, and emergency contacts offline, shows an emergency card on the lock screen, and syncs forms and messages when online.
idea_7: This feature records in-person or virtual visits with consent, creates a secure transcript of important details, and allows sharing the transcript with caregivers.
idea_8: This Feature divides your care plan into scheduled steps such as medication, exercises, and wound care, provides audio prompts, works offline, and shares progress with your care team if allowed.
idea_9: This feature shows trust badges on messages from verified practices, blocks look-alike senders, warns about suspicious links, and uses a QR code to connect new practices securely.
idea_10: This feature gathers short feedback on wait time, clarity, and empathy after visits, plus private notes for the care team, to help refine provider search results.

idea_1: This feature records your preferred times and locations, then shows appointment cancellations that match your preferences for quick acceptance with one tap.
idea_2: This feature shows your place in the visit queue, clinician arrival time, and delays, and uses location technology for touchless check-in, parking help, and late arrival alerts.
idea_3: This feature estimates out-of-pocket costs for services and medications, displays lower-cost in-network and covered alternatives, considers deductibles and HSAs, and allows setting up payment plans.
idea_4: This feature generates a visit agenda based on symptoms and goals, fills intake forms, reviews medications and history, and requests photos, home readings, or accessibility details.
idea_5: This feature shows lab and imaging results in clear language, tracks changes over time, suggests next steps, enables follow-up appointments, and helps prepare questions for your clinician.
idea_6: This feature allows you to scan pill bottles to update your medication list, check for interactions and duplicates, compare prices, and manage refills and authorizations.
idea_7: This feature lets users share specific data, tasks, and reminders with caregivers, manage multiple patients, view color-coded medication schedules, and send secure group messages to the care team.
idea_8: This feature monitors prior authorizations and referrals by displaying status, required actions, and deadlines. It also auto-fills forms, collects e-signatures, and manages delays.
idea_9: This feature turns care plans into daily checklists, syncs with wearable devices to monitor health data, updates tasks as needed, and sends alerts to clinicians.
idea_10: This feature stores and manages consent for data sharing and research, sends expiry reminders, allows revoking consent, links external records and devices, controls sharing settings, and exports care summaries.

idea_1: This feature uses AR to guide you during your first Waymo ride by showing where to stand, how doors unlock, what the car says, and includes practice tasks and comfort tracking.
idea_2: This feature allows you to set climate, lighting, music, door preference, child seat or pet kit, trunk space, and stops before booking, with options to save presets.
idea_3: This feature changes your pickup location to covered areas, suggests sheltered curb spots, updates walking directions, accounts for weather in arrival times, and recommends earlier departures during storms.
idea_4: This feature shows live captions, large-text alerts, and adjustable vibrations for vehicle prompts, and allows notifications to be sent to your phone, hearing aids, or as text messages.
idea_5: This feature shows estimated wait times, demand, and service reliability by time and location, provides suggested departure times, and automatically applies credits for late arrivals.
idea_6: This feature lets verified users in certain areas share rides with nearby passengers traveling the same route, with assigned seats, shared costs, and an option to stop sharing at any time.
idea_7: This feature shows a trip history with maps, times, stops, carbon impact details, spending summaries, receipt downloads, and ride types organized by calendar dates.
idea_8: This feature tracks points earned from car-free days, off-peak rides, pooling, and safety quizzes, allowing users to redeem them for Waymo credit, partner gift cards, or donations.
idea_9: This feature shows a pickup PIN on your app and the vehicle screen, and lets you unlock the doors using your phone if you choose to enable it.
idea_10: This feature offers children’s media and games on cabin screens, explains vehicle actions simply, and lets parents monitor trips, control content, and manage door and lock settings.

idea_1: This feature allows you to schedule several short stops with instructions, coordinates pickup times at nearby places, and changes the route to match your arrival time.
idea_2: This feature helps you walk a short distance while the vehicle moves slowly nearby, using visual cues to indicate the exact pickup location.
idea_3: This feature saves your driving preferences, including acceleration, lane changes, route type, and cabin settings, and applies them automatically to each ride.
idea_4: This feature allows you to share a temporary link so a caregiver can see the ride’s live location, seatbelt status, arrival updates, and send push-to-talk messages.
idea_5: This feature offers a 60-second interactive guide that explains how the vehicle responds to unusual events, such as construction, police interactions, or emergency stops, with one-tap actions and automatic activation on first use.
idea_6: This feature shows nearby stops such as restrooms, coffee shops, or pharmacies based on your time limit and curb availability, allowing one-tap approval without rebooking.
idea_7: This feature allows you to choose an entrance or meeting spot inside large venues and provides door-to-door directions, including entry details and safer routes at night.
idea_8: This feature gives audio and vibration directions to the correct door, announces vehicle position, allows voice control for doors and trunk, and uses a high-contrast interface with larger touch targets.
idea_9: This feature allows users to quietly activate Safe Assist, send the vehicle to a nearby staffed location, start a live chat with Waymo support, and optionally alert a trusted contact.
idea_10: This feature chooses drop-off locations with shade or rain cover when available and sets the cabin temperature according to your preferences and the current weather.

idea_1: This feature combines both users’ preferences for food, atmosphere, budget, and accessibility to create a shared date plan that can be edited and confirmed in the app.
idea_2: This feature lets users share their location and plans with trusted contacts, set timed check-ins, send an SOS alert, and request monitoring until they arrive safely.
idea_3: This feature connects your music apps to add playlists to your profile and lets you join listening rooms to chat live with others who have similar music interests.
idea_4: This feature allows you to send voice notes that are transcribed with captions and translations, pin voice messages on your profile, and get wording suggestions before sending.
idea_5: This feature allows users to record short introduction videos with automatic captions and one-tap translation, add fandom tags, and post weekly clips for themed discovery sections.
idea_6: This feature shows a map with venue details such as seat width, aisle space, armrests, booth options, and restroom access, including filters, ratings, notes, and booking.
idea_7: This feature offers a route planner that avoids hills and long walks, includes rest stops, considers weather and air quality, provides travel options, and shares live ETA with your match.
idea_8: This feature allows you to create and organize your profile sections and browse other profiles by swiping or scrolling, with an option to view quick previews.
idea_9: This feature identifies potentially disrespectful messages before sending and offers alternative wording. It can also auto-reply to flagged messages and provide quick block and report options.
idea_10: This feature provides moderated live group chats based on interests, timed one-on-one speed rounds, gifting options, cooperative word games, and icebreaker prompts to facilitate conversation.

idea_1: This feature shows a map with venue details like seat size, chair type, spacing, aisle width, and restroom access, along with photos, user confirmations, and booking or ride options.
idea_2: This feature uses AI to detect messages with fetishizing, weight-shaming, or diet-related content and alerts users before sending, allowing edits or blocking according to settings.
idea_3: This feature allows members to set preferences for topics, compliments, physical pace, greetings, and touch, displays a summary with the first message, and notifies users if boundaries are crossed in chat.
idea_4: This feature gives real-time advice on lighting, angles, and framing, allows multiple photos to be taken at once, suggests the best images, and crops photos automatically.
idea_5: This feature recommends clothing brands and sizes based on fit, activity, and weather, and lets users share outfit previews privately for feedback from matches or friends.
idea_6: This feature recommends size-friendly activities using a comfort map, estimates walking and standing times, highlights tight seating areas, and offers XL ride options before booking.
idea_7: This feature awards a verified-ally badge after completing lessons on body-positive dating etiquette. Badges expire over time and can be removed based on user reports.
idea_8: This feature offers 20–30 second guided audio introductions about personality, optional face-only video, and matches users based on compatible answers to help begin conversations.
idea_9: This feature gathers short feedback after chats and dates about respect and kindness, creates a private score, adjusts match rankings, and supports moderation.
idea_10: This feature arranges small-group events at verified, size-inclusive locations with seating and layout information. Users RSVP with seating details and can rate the venues afterward.

idea_1: This feature lets users practice conversations with AI role-plays, lessons, and prompts, while tracking tone, pacing, and empathy to monitor their progress.
idea_2: This feature allows friends to verify your profile and add private endorsements that matches can see after a mutual like. Both users get a weekend premium trial and a small profile boost.
idea_3: This feature allows users to add small apps to chats, including games, icebreaker cards, date planners, playlists, a shared spark meter, and virtual plants or pets.
idea_4: This feature lets users quickly filter matches by distance, availability, and interests, and generates a personal QR code for connecting at events without sharing contact information.
idea_5: This feature lets you privately share feedback and boundaries after a date, helps update match suggestions, and allows you to rate venues for others.
idea_6: This feature shows a timeline of verification steps, account age, consistency badges, and optional in-person check-in tokens from partner locations for local matches.
idea_7: This feature offers noise-reduced voice notes, live captions during video calls, adjustable text size, vibration alerts for messages, and automatic transcripts for profiles and video introductions.
idea_8: This feature lets you choose future cities and dates, provides match and date suggestions based on current conditions, and enables sharing and editing an itinerary card in chat.
idea_9: This feature allows users to add a 30-second audio introduction with playlists and stickers to their profiles. Drive Mode reads messages aloud, sends quick replies, and queues responses.
idea_10: This feature lets users share temporary or masked phone numbers with consent, sync contacts after approval, and send scanned files with personal ID information removed automatically.

idea_1: This feature slowly shows photos as both users finish verification steps, and either user can stop or undo the photo reveal at any time.
idea_2: This feature records a 10-second voice clip from each user, exchanges the clips after submission, provides two openers based on tone and pace, and deletes the clips after 24 hours.
idea_3: This feature allows two users who select the same interest within 48 hours to start a 20-minute timed chat with a topic and nearby venue, which can be extended.
idea_4: This feature suggests meeting spots with wait times and prices, lets users share arrival times without live tracking, and provides one-tap check-in and a silent safety alert.
idea_5: This feature allows users to create shared date plans with details like vibe, budget, playlist, dress code, and backup options, as well as reserve venues, split costs, and add an icebreaker game.
idea_6: This feature allows users to end a match with one tap by sending a reason, and they can reopen the chat once within 7 days if both agree.
idea_7: This feature allows users to rank their micro-interests, displays a match alignment bar, and gives a short explanation for each suggested profile.
idea_8: This feature detects users who visit the same indie locations or events within certain time frames and sends matches a notification with a message and an offer.
idea_9: This feature allows users to add and remove simple tags on profiles and limits the visibility of accounts blocked by many verified users without revealing who blocked them.
idea_10: This feature sorts chats into categories such as food, travel, and pets, sets daily message limits at first, and removes limits when both users enable Freeflow to merge categories.

idea_1: This feature allows players to perform flight moves such as flips, cliff-edge skims, and shockwave bounces, which increase scores and offer short evasive opportunities. Weekly challenges emphasize precise flying.
idea_2: This feature offers a Glide Pass membership that includes early access to prototype drones, special skins, weekend events, giveaways, a trial with easy cancellation, and a rotating 3D showroom preview.
idea_3: This feature records match videos, spatial audio, and flight paths, generates highlight reels and killcams, and lets players export or add notes to clips for review.
idea_4: This feature lets players record a voice command that activates a sequence of movements and weapon switches, with options to adjust timing and safety settings.
idea_5: This feature provides drones with a Recon Calculator that measures distances, areas, and lines of fire on a live 3D map, marking landing zones and artillery arcs.
idea_6: This feature offers hangar coupons for parts, ammo, and repairs, provides mission supply codes for use during loadout or at depots, and sends reminders about available deals.
idea_7: This feature lets players rent drones or modules for missions, try them before buying, and collect reserved kits at designated drop zones with preset configurations.
idea_8: This feature lets users record voice notes with one tap during matches and missions, automatically transcribes them, and links the notes to specific replay moments for sharing.
idea_9: This feature lets players download offline campaigns, sniper trials, and puzzle missions to play without internet, with progress and rewards updating when reconnected.
idea_10: This feature provides a set of tactical cards called the Protocol Deck that define attack patterns, drone behaviors, and abilities. Players can build decks and change protocols during battles.

idea_1: This feature simulates wind effects from explosions, weather, and buildings that influence flight and projectile paths. Players can equip parts to lessen these effects.
idea_2: This feature lets players choose control and video channels, operate directional jammers, spoof transponders, frequency-hop, and monitor overheating and power use.
idea_3: This feature lets drones attach to surfaces, fold their rotors, recharge or repair slowly, and from that position, deploy sensors or make precise shots.
idea_4: This feature lets two players operate a drone together, with one controlling flight and the other handling weapons, sensors, and countermeasures using a shared interface. Power and bandwidth are allocated among thrust, sensor range, and targeting accuracy.
idea_5: This feature lets players deploy small drones that carry out reconnaissance, jamming, decoy, or attack tasks, using gestures to control their formations and movements.
idea_6: This feature lets players capture relay towers, fuel barges, and data nodes to expand spawn areas, allow mid-air resupply, and interfere with enemy minimap, communications, and respawn.
idea_7: This feature lets users view maps as tabletop models, set waypoints, share routes with teammates, and review matches using heatmaps and path overlays.
idea_8: This feature lets users change control settings, propeller pitch, motor timing, and payload weight within power limits, and share or exchange these configurations with others.
idea_9: This feature monitors damage from heat, G-forces, and collisions that impact flight and handling. Players can repair drones during or between matches to restore performance.
idea_10: This feature allows players to create contracts with tasks such as escorting, intercepting, or salvaging, each having specific rewards and time limits in public lobbies.

idea_1: This feature leads users through brief activities on a Bible passage by asking questions about what it says, means, and how to apply it, providing tools like word studies and cross-references.
idea_2: This feature allows you to download scripture and commentary playlists for offline use, enabling continuous playback, speed adjustment, and reduced file size to save storage.
idea_3: This feature downloads future readings ahead of time, updates reminders for different time zones, changes schedules during travel, and offers offline maps and images of biblical locations.
idea_4: This feature displays cross-references on a map-style layout, highlighting themes such as “covenant” or “mercy.” Users can filter results by author, genre, theology, or difficulty.
idea_5: This feature helps you review Bible verses by asking you to remember key phrases to grow a virtual plant. If you answer incorrectly, it provides hints.
idea_6: This feature creates 2-minute sing-along explanations of selected Bible passages using voices and mascots. Parents can make playlists and get short lesson summaries.
idea_7: This feature lets users share brief, checked notes on specific verses, vote on these notes, and participate in private group discussions to add comments to reading plans.
idea_8: This feature adjusts audio settings to enhance commentary sound, shows live captions that match the audio, and highlights Bible verses as they are spoken.
idea_9: This feature lets users add, organize, and switch on or off content packs such as notes, commentaries, reading styles, and sermon examples within the app.
idea_10: This feature records your daily study activity, allows you to earn points for resources or donations, supports group challenges, and helps set weekly goals without ads.

idea_1: This feature allows you to enable overlays that provide background information on social, legal, and cultural topics related to verses. You can tap to see brief, referenced notes without leaving the text.
idea_2: This feature shows the structure of each book, highlighting patterns and key transitions, with linked ribbons that explain how each paragraph contributes to the author’s message.
idea_3: This feature compares various Bible manuscripts and translations, explains differences in meaning using simple language, shows how confident these explanations are, and provides links to detailed notes.
idea_4: This feature uses an AI coach to ask questions as you read, highlights key connections, and helps you organize ideas before you review commentaries, according to your settings.
idea_5: This feature generates activities based on a passage, such as prompts, prayer templates, and habit trackers, and provides weekly reviews to track related patterns.
idea_6: This feature assigns roles to group members during timed study sessions and automatically creates a summary of the group's agreements, disagreements, and planned actions.
idea_7: This feature shows Bible commentary from Catholic, Orthodox, and Protestant sources, allowing users to compare views by adjusting sliders to see each tradition’s interpretations.
idea_8: This feature displays Bible verses on interactive maps with travel times, festival dates, coin values, artifacts, and climate details. It also includes optional sounds and 3D scenes.
idea_9: This feature generates outlines, discussion questions, and slides from a Bible passage, and identifies problems such as proof-texting, out-of-context verses, and missing references.
idea_10: This feature reviews your notes for common interpretation errors and suggests corrections. It also supports word studies with reverse interlinear tools, repetition, and pronunciation practice.

idea_1: This feature allows users to subscribe to RSS feeds or listservs as chats, receive daily headline summaries, verify sources, and organize news in a single muted thread.
idea_2: This feature places messages from new senders or with risky content into a review queue, displays their source and encryption information, and lets users approve them for the main chat.
idea_3: This feature allows you to schedule messages by recipient’s time zone or quiet hours, send messages in batches when offline, undo sending briefly, and resend failed messages automatically.
idea_4: This feature allows you to set monthly data limits and media quality restrictions, compresses images and videos before sending, delays large files until Wi-Fi is available, and displays data usage for each chat.
idea_5: This feature allows users to change chat appearance by applying skin packs, bubble styles, reaction emotes, group icons, and themes using webxdc bundles.
idea_6: This feature blocks tracking pixels, changes tracking links, removes EXIF data from media, detects hidden content, and applies specific rules for unknown contacts.
idea_7: This feature displays your account’s IMAP/SMTP status, storage usage, and folder setup, allows running maintenance tasks, and can generate a support email with diagnostic details.
idea_8: This feature lets you share your location with adjustable accuracy for a set time using encrypted updates, send alerts when entering or leaving areas, and create temporary group chats via QR codes when nearby.
idea_9: This feature limits cache size for each chat, moves older media to an IMAP folder with thumbnails, re-downloads media when requested, manages auto-save settings, and offers one-tap cleanup.
idea_10: This feature monitors your privacy actions such as backups, fingerprint verification, and secure contacts, updates contact trust levels, and displays a private safety score.

idea_1: This feature lets nearby phones send messages and attachments directly via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct when email servers are unavailable, then forwards them to the server later.
idea_2: This feature sends large media by dividing it into smaller parts across emails, allowing uploads and downloads to resume and recipients to reuse parts already received.
idea_3: This feature saves a verified key fingerprint from signed messages and notifies users if the key changes unexpectedly to help identify possible security issues.
idea_4: This feature copies your keys to a new email address, informs your contacts and groups, and gradually sends and receives messages using the new address.
idea_5: This feature lets you set storage limits per chat, summarizes old messages, deletes large media automatically, and lets you request original files from participants with one tap.
idea_6: This feature generates temporary email aliases connected to a chat or QR invite. Messages sent to the alias appear in a separate chat and are deleted automatically after a set time.
idea_7: This feature groups newsletters and notifications into a Feeds view with compact cards, enables one-tap unsubscribe, sharing as broadcast chats, and automatic summary of long items.
idea_8: This feature formats messages as regular emails for non-Delta Chat users, including hidden data to support threaded conversations and encryption if they use Delta Chat later.
idea_9: This feature keeps a shared list of group members signed by several participants. Everyone sees the same list and gets alerts about new users or changed messages.
idea_10: This feature offers transcription, translation, and smart replies for voice notes and messages using optional packages. Models remain on the device and can be shared or updated in chats.

idea_1: This feature provides instructions on recording videos with proper framing, stabilization, consent, and interviewing techniques, and gives a badge after completing the training modules.
idea_2: This feature improves live stream audio by making voices clearer, lowering background noise, and balancing dialogue. It also provides adjustable captions and vibration alerts for key words.
idea_3: This feature lets users create a watch party with a shareable link for synchronized live streaming and temporary chat, allowing group upvotes to send questions to the anchor.
idea_4: This feature provides a one-tap survey after each story to collect feedback on clarity, impact, and missing information, allowing users to submit and upvote follow-up ideas.
idea_5: This feature enables DVR rewind, multi-camera views, and ad-light mode during emergencies, provides a 7-day trial without requiring a card, and displays a countdown banner.
idea_6: This feature displays action cards below news stories with verified hotlines, one-tap call or text options, official forms, and secure donation methods via Apple or Google Pay.
idea_7: This feature connects reporters with nearby viewers who share information, enabling moderated chats and media uploads using limited verified profile details.
idea_8: This feature allows users to add locations to get weather, traffic, and safety alerts, share live streams, and adjust alert preferences for each place.
idea_9: This feature allows users to browse local deals from nearby businesses, with options to adjust the search distance and manage data sharing settings.
idea_10: This feature lets users save audio of newscasts, weather updates, and playlists for offline listening, and includes a Drive Mode that reads headlines and plays clips with large controls.

idea_1: This feature allows you to select an area near a location to receive live news and alerts about crime, schools, traffic, utilities, and events there.
idea_2: This feature allows users to submit and vote on questions during live broadcasts. An AI organizes similar questions and marks answered ones with time stamps for reference.
idea_3: This feature offers short video summaries with key clips after live events and includes an audio-only playlist for offline listening through Commute Mode.
idea_4: This feature separates live streams of city council and school board meetings by agenda items using speech-to-text and allows users to receive alerts for selected topics.
idea_5: This feature allows you to view maps, past reports, key facts, and definitions during a live news stream, and save local resources such as shelters and closures.
idea_6: This feature provides a live map with verified alerts for road closures, weather, police advisories, outages, and air quality, and lets users set quiet hours and alert preferences.
idea_7: This feature allows you to create a private watch room to stream news together with synchronized video, basic reactions, and muted chat during severe weather. Links expire after the broadcast.
idea_8: This feature allows you to switch between the main studio feed, reporter cameras, traffic cameras, and selected viewer videos during breaking news, with picture-in-picture viewing.
idea_9: This feature offers live captions with one-tap translation in several languages, a plain language overlay to simplify terms, and an optional ASL interpreter during major briefings.
idea_10: This feature shows timelines of local projects, budgets, and officials, including promises, approvals, deadlines, and updates, and sends alerts for missed or completed milestones.

idea_1: This feature offers a mode where tapping fish and particles produces sounds, enabling users to collect coins and unlock visual and audio customization options.
idea_2: This feature adds special tiles such as jump gaps, flicks, holds, and trampoline notes that enable players to perform combos and earn multipliers through specific actions.
idea_3: This feature allows players to collect coupons while playing songs and automatically applies the best available discount to purchases like song unlocks, continues, boosters, or cosmetic packs.
idea_4: This feature records a melody or beat, converts it into a tile chart with selectable difficulty levels, and enables users to edit or share the created track.
idea_5: This feature allows real-time 1v1 music challenges with short clips, matches players by skill, awards medals for performance, and includes quick emotes and weekly ranked events.
idea_6: This feature unlocks hidden rooms in songs by playing specific patterns, showing short 3D scenes and alternate endings. Players collect story shards to complete mini-stories.
idea_7: This feature offers large tiles, playlists suitable for children, easy one-finger controls, offline access, and a locked interface to prevent accidental exits during use.
idea_8: This feature adjusts the music and visuals according to the local weather and pauses the game with a safety alert during severe weather warnings.
idea_9: This feature measures touch accuracy and device delay, adjusts timing, filters edge touches, and displays visual data to help users make input settings.
idea_10: This feature offers multi-song challenges with patterns that adjust to your performance. Defeating bosses unlocks instrument avatars that provide passive bonuses and visual effects.

idea_1: This feature changes the track’s speed in real time to align with your taps without altering the pitch. An indicator shows when it is active, and it disables in competitive modes.
idea_2: This feature lets two to four players perform parts live or separately, then combines their performances into one video with a shared score and harmony effects.
idea_3: This feature displays a heatmap of early or late notes, repeats challenging sections with gradually increasing speed, and includes short drills between attempts to improve accuracy.
idea_4: This feature lets users create and edit song charts by tapping to map notes, uses AI for beat alignment and difficulty settings, and provides access to challenges with creator details and rewards.
idea_5: This feature allows players to earn mana by keeping streaks, which can be used during songs to slow time, prevent misses, or preview upcoming notes.
idea_6: This feature allows you to create setlists, select outfits and stage effects, and receive fan feedback that unlocks story events, endorsements, and venue upgrades.
idea_7: This feature provides 60-second mini games that practice subdivisions, syncopation, and pitch memory, with daily streaks granting small improvements like wider timing windows.
idea_8: This feature offers accessibility settings including one-thumb lane layouts, colorblind-friendly note designs, adjustable contrast, beat-synced vibrations, and audio cues for users with low vision.
idea_9: This feature lets viewers vote on game modifiers and send visual effects, while hosts can add audience song requests from the in-game library to the queue.
idea_10: This feature plays test sounds and records them through the microphone to detect and adjust audio and touch delays, saving settings for different devices to keep timing accurate.

idea_1: This feature generates a temporary link that shares your live location as a stream, letting others view your recent movements and control playback without installing the app.
idea_2: This feature allows you to draw shapes on the map to share locations or request check-ins, save places by name or ZIP code, and set repeating time periods.
idea_3: This feature allows users to verify their location by taking a guided selfie and panoramic photo with time and GPS data, which is then blurred and shared as a “verified here” badge.
idea_4: This feature lets groups edit pins, routes, lists, and comments on shared maps together, both online and offline, with a history to track and undo changes.
idea_5: This feature shows an on-screen arrow to guide you to a friend’s indoor location, provides entrance and floor information, and allows previewing meeting spots in a basic VR view.
idea_6: This feature creates location-based shifts and tasks that begin and end automatically when members enter or leave a designated area, showing who is on duty with time-stamped records on the map.
idea_7: This feature shares your location regularly with a selected group, notifies them if updates stop, and lets you send quick status replies for help or confirmation.
idea_8: This feature lets you change the style of your live location path temporarily and automatically generates a 60-second summary of your movements to share.
idea_9: This feature lets group members browse suggested meeting spots based on their locations and displays selected places on a shared map with travel time, cost, and accessibility information.
idea_10: This feature shares your live route via CarPlay or Android Auto, lets trusted contacts suggest stops, marks your parked location, and sends EV charging notifications.

idea_1: This feature provides estimated arrival time ranges with confidence levels using live traffic, transit data, and your typical speed, and suggests departure times for meetings.
idea_2: This feature tracks your location and missed check-ins, notifies chosen contacts with your route if necessary, and can automatically place an emergency call with a preset message.
idea_3: This feature adjusts location accuracy based on place, time, and calendar, enables temporary location sharing with one tap, and shares precise location only with nearby selected contacts.
idea_4: This feature suggests meeting locations based on travel time, transit options, opening hours, lighting, and accessibility, and provides synchronized directions with updated arrival times.
idea_5: This feature sends alerts when you or a contact enter a specified distance, with options to pause, set expiration, and limit notifications for each contact.
idea_6: This feature shares a temporary location trail that gradually blurs older sections and hides selected areas, showing followers real-time positions without storing past location data.
idea_7: This feature saves location data offline, shares it securely via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct mesh, and uploads the data to the cloud when a cellular connection is available.
idea_8: This feature changes how often and how accurately location is updated based on battery, movement, and network, sending small position and direction updates between full GPS readings.
idea_9: This feature generates signed, timestamped location records for deliveries, handoffs, or mileage claims, enabling recipients to confirm the location without viewing your entire route.
idea_10: This feature automatically shares your location during calendar events and trips, sending invited participants a link with meeting details and your estimated arrival time.

idea_1: This feature displays an aquarium or terrarium that expands as children finish lessons. Tapping items plays letter sounds and number facts, and children can add earned decorations.
idea_2: This feature allows parents and teachers to filter activities by skill, time, language, and offline access to create a “Quick Play” queue. QR scans open matching mini-lessons.
idea_3: This feature offers an art studio where children trace shapes, symmetry, and letters, then turn their drawings into stickers and room decorations with optional sounds.
idea_4: This feature offers an offline mode with sing-alongs and tap-based games using large buttons and voice prompts. It supports switching between sibling profiles and plays age-appropriate content.
idea_5: This feature is a platform game where children jump by answering phonics or math questions, with short levels that change based on the child’s skill level.
idea_6: This feature shows mixed questions after each unit, introduces helpers for skills learned, gradually increases difficulty, and uses animations to indicate progress.
idea_7: This feature records children reading aloud, provides feedback on pronunciation and pacing, allows playback with voice filters, and enables parents to share progress with teachers.
idea_8: This feature awards coins for learning progress and parent-recorded actions, allows kids to collect changing coupons for items, and provides basic lessons on saving, spending, and donating.
idea_9: This feature creates a daily 10-minute learning plan based on recent activity and available time. It notifies parents when practice is needed and provides access to exercises.
idea_10: This feature provides individual mini-challenges in math, phonics, or memory, includes sticker rewards, and displays weekly leaderboards with personal best scores and effort stars.

idea_1: This feature creates customized learning activities in reading, math, science, and art, adjusting to each child's interests and skill levels with different practice options.
idea_2: This feature uses the device camera to help children locate letters, shapes, colors, and patterns nearby, giving feedback through touch and visual signals.
idea_3: This feature lets a caregiver join remotely with voice chat, a shared pointer, and coaching tips while children complete short cooperative challenges involving turn-taking and language use.
idea_4: This feature lets children create stories and mini-games by dragging and dropping coding blocks related to vocabulary and math, with narration and comprehension questions included.
idea_5: This feature allows children to choose their mood, provides related mini-activities, and adjusts difficulty, including breathing exercises, movement tasks, kindness activities, and learning exercises.
idea_6: This feature allows caregivers to assign daily tasks, monitor their completion, and unlock rewards and badges within the game.
idea_7: This feature allows children to tap to translate words, hear read-aloud in two languages, and receive pronunciation feedback. It can be turned on or off for each activity.
idea_8: This feature increases touch target size, provides high contrast, haptic feedback, and audio descriptions, supports switch input, and lets families adjust settings for each child.
idea_9: This feature tracks progress by growing plants through regular review sessions and schedules these sessions. Seeds earned unlock new areas and challenges.
idea_10: This feature offers step-by-step instructions, timers, and prompts for kitchen experiments, and includes a lab journal to record observations with stickers and voice notes.

idea_1: This feature shows a small game during matchmaking, downloads, or updates, lets users collect tokens for launcher themes and sounds, and pauses when a game starts.
idea_2: This feature gathers sales, coupons, and bundle offers from different stores, lets users save deals, sends expiration alerts, and applies codes or links during checkout.
idea_3: This feature allows users to record short voice notes connected to recent game stats and highlights, automatically transcribes and tags them, and enables sharing or saving privately.
idea_4: This feature offers a reflex training game using tap, swipe, and gyro actions, measures device latency, and awards experience points for earning badges.
idea_5: This feature allows you to filter your games by different options, organize them into groups called stacks, and share or import these stacks using QR codes or links.
idea_6: This feature shows an overlay for Discord, SMS, and WhatsApp with quick replies, voice notes, do-not-disturb settings for games, auto-collapsing, and message summaries.
idea_7: This feature allows users to sort games into color-coded categories based on mood, difficulty, and time, create a weekly list, and earn coins to unlock options.
idea_8: This feature offers different modes for Kids, Teens, and Comfort Play with specific content and timers, a Car Ride mode for offline use, and profile switching using PIN or biometrics.
idea_9: This feature tracks progress in multiple games and lets users complete missions to unlock cosmetics, badges, and hidden content within the app.
idea_10: This feature displays network ping and jitter to game servers, provides outage and update alerts, recommends the best region to play, and offers pre-download prompts before trips.

idea_1: This feature adjusts settings such as refresh rate, brightness, and network priority before starting a game, manages background tasks during play, and restores settings afterward.
idea_2: This feature displays real-time FPS, frame times, touch latency, and network jitter, uses color codes to indicate device or network issues, and offers one-tap setting adjustments.
idea_3: This feature allows you to set time and battery limits for gaming, estimates battery usage and heat, activates focus mode, gives cooldown reminders, and displays a summary.
idea_4: This feature connects players based on schedule, region, and skill, creates temporary voice rooms with push-to-talk, mutes other apps, and allows sharing invites via Discord or WhatsApp.
idea_5: This feature records gameplay, detects important moments such as wins and streaks, and creates short clips with captions and game information for sharing.
idea_6: This feature uses on-device OCR to recognize bosses or levels, shows brief guides or route overlays, hides during PvP, and saves tips for offline use.
idea_7: This feature organizes local and cloud games into a single library with images and playtime tracking. It also backs up and restores game saves, handles conflicts, and supports phone transfers.
idea_8: This feature monitors touch movements, gyro stability, and reaction times during games, offers daily 3-minute practice drills with haptic feedback, and records progress over time.
idea_9: This feature monitors device temperature and battery use, suggests framerate or graphics settings to control heat, and limits charging speed to 80% during gameplay when available.
idea_10: This feature identifies unused game files and large caches for removal, schedules big updates during low Wi-Fi usage, and prioritizes smaller patches to reduce download time.

idea_1: This feature offers daily writing prompts, small challenges, and exercises, along with AI and peer feedback to support users in practicing and tracking their writing progress.
idea_2: This feature customizes text-to-speech audio using a hearing test, enabling adjustments to sound quality, dialogue levels, background noise, and volume alerts.
idea_3: This feature lets readers add emojis and short comments to specific lines, and includes a Review Hub that shows summaries of overall reactions and themes.
idea_4: This feature lets authors and readers add extra content such as background information, alternate perspectives, character images, and side stories that can be enabled or disabled per chapter.
idea_5: This feature awards coins for streaks, quizzes, and reviews, allows using coins for tips, chapters, or gift cards, and tracks all coin activity history.
idea_6: This feature automatically downloads the next chapters and chosen story collections from your list using Wi-Fi and manages storage for offline reading.
idea_7: This feature allows you to mix tropes, settings, and characters to generate sample chapters, adjust format and length, and save filters to locate similar stories.
idea_8: This feature recommends reading partners and nearby clubs based on interests and location, verifies user profiles, confirms authenticity, and enables in-app messaging.
idea_9: This feature displays a calendar of upcoming chapter releases, tracks possible delays and reading pace trends, and sends alerts for major story events.
idea_10: This feature lets users invite others through SMS links for easy setup and enables shared shelves and joint challenges that reward both participants.

idea_1: This feature offers an AI reading companion that answers questions, explains references, and provides spoiler-free chapter summaries with selectable voice options.
idea_2: This feature creates and updates a Story Atlas with relationship graphs, location maps, and timelines that appear while reading. Tapping a node shows related notes, highlights, and quotes.
idea_3: This feature lets users join group reading rooms with chat, reactions, and timed sessions. An AI offers discussion prompts, quizzes, and reading pace guidance.
idea_4: This feature allows you to set reading time to divide chapters into shorter parts and provides a focus mode that changes fonts, contrast, and interface for easier reading.
idea_5: This feature allows authors to create branching story scenes with small polls for readers to select paths and shows real-time data on the popularity of each option.
idea_6: This feature offers instant narration using various character voices and background sounds, and automatically plays recaps when you return after a break.
idea_7: This feature allows you to search for stories using filters like mood, themes, emotional progress, and options to exclude certain content or story elements.
idea_8: This feature delivers letters, chat messages, or voicemails from characters according to your progress and time, sending notifications without showing future story details.
idea_9: This feature allows users to choose reading orders for multi-POV stories and helps track continuity by identifying missing sections and recommending a reading sequence.
idea_10: This feature shares quotes without spoilers for friends who are behind and reveals them when they catch up. It also enables private co-annotation in shared threads.

idea_1: This feature uses AI to adjust sound settings like beam width, reverberation, noise reduction, and equalization. Users can create and share custom sound profiles.
idea_2: This feature helps you find the strongest speech source using screen and vibration signals, allows you to lock focus with a tap, and add audio bookmarks with a double tap.
idea_3: This feature lets you view and swipe through cards of nearby approved sound sources, displaying their distance, sound clarity, and crowd noise level.
idea_4: This feature lets users join private audio feeds by entering a short code, with limits on time and the number of devices allowed.
idea_5: This feature detects location, plays notice tones, records and logs user consent within the app, and stops recording if notification is not given.
idea_6: This feature allows you to control remote microphone hubs to hear sounds from other rooms, adjust settings, monitor battery levels, and stream audio securely.
idea_7: This feature lets users set alerts for specific sounds, like loud noise or TV volume, and start a live listening session without recording.
idea_8: This feature enhances speech clarity in echoing halls and lets organizers share a low-delay audio feed with attendees using a join code or QR code.
idea_9: This feature allows you to specify a sound to hear clearly, then adjusts the app to focus on that sound. You can save these settings for future use.
idea_10: This feature connects nearby microphones at public meetings to combine audio from multiple phones, enhancing hearing range and direction, and displays live audio focus with anonymous contributor details.

idea_1: This feature links your phone, watch, and a consented friend’s device to focus on a chosen speaker in the room using directional audio technology.
idea_2: This feature uses the camera to show arrows and a heatmap of voice locations, lets you tap to lock focus, and automatically tracks the sound source.
idea_3: This feature allows you to select a person’s face to track their voice by detecting lip movement, helping to distinguish it from background sounds, with a status indicator.
idea_4: This feature allows you to use a spare phone, smartwatch, or earbud as a remote microphone with one tap and streams audio securely with adjustable quality based on battery level.
idea_5: This feature lets you rewind and listen to the last 60 seconds with enhanced sound or captions and save specific moments without keeping all the audio.
idea_6: This feature allows you to change the listening direction using a tactile wheel or automatic head tracking, with a live signal-to-noise ratio gauge showing the current aim.
idea_7: This feature detects your name, chosen keywords, or alarms and sends a gentle vibration. Tapping the vibration briefly highlights the detected sound.
idea_8: This feature displays live captions of distant speech with color-coded speakers and confidence indicators, and can also provide translated subtitles below the captions.
idea_9: This feature uses geofences to restrict recording in certain areas, shows indicators during audio capture, pauses recording where not allowed, and logs user consent with expiration.
idea_10: This feature conducts a 2-minute hearing and room test to create a personal profile that adjusts sound for distance and controls volume using adaptive compression.

idea_1: This feature records runs with audio and visual effects applied by tapping, enables exporting replays for sharing, and lets viewers turn effects on or off individually.
idea_2: This feature lets users join seasonal Beat Leagues with promotion and relegation, take part in live cups and brackets, watch instant replays, and RSVP to timed festival events.
idea_3: This feature allows users to play 60-second head-to-head duels synced to the same part of a track, with skill-based matching, offline bots, rematch links, and ghost replays.
idea_4: This feature allows users to create levels by arranging patterns in a “Beat Recipe” editor that calculates BPM, density, and difficulty. Users can also import and remix community patterns.
idea_5: This feature adjusts scroll speed and obstacle density according to your performance and offers weekly drills and track suggestions based on your play data.
idea_6: This feature opens a dashboard with adjustable gauges for timing offset, hold accuracy, jump precision, and fatigue, allowing users to filter data by song, mod, or session.
idea_7: This feature automatically aligns near-miss inputs to the beat, lets users queue actions with swipe gestures, and displays a small on-screen hint for the next move.
idea_8: This feature adjusts track segments according to your habits and lets you earn Augment Chips that change gameplay, with higher levels reducing assists for increased difficulty.
idea_9: This feature allows users to create and modify neon colors, trails, and particle effects, synchronize light pulses with music beats, and share and rate themes in the app.
idea_10: This feature displays friends’ locations on a live map with their status and recent scores, enables racing against their best runs, and allows turn-based play with chat.

idea_1: This feature generates levels matched to song beats from your library using on-device analysis. You can adjust density and obstacle styles, then publish to share.
idea_2: This feature changes the tempo, obstacle timing, and checkpoint spacing based on your gameplay. You can enable or disable it whenever you want.
idea_3: This feature allows you to race against recorded runs, shows where time was lost, and gives one suggestion for improvement after each attempt.
idea_4: This feature links two players to take turns completing parts of a level. They switch at checkpoints, and their total time is recorded on a team leaderboard.
idea_5: This feature allows you to draw a path with your finger, snaps it to a beat grid, and adds hazards and pickups for testing and publishing.
idea_6: This feature lets you place neon platforms on real surfaces to create a small course and share a code so others can load the same layout.
idea_7: This feature assigns kicks, snares, and cues to specific vibrations, allowing silent play with adjustable intensity and patterns tailored to each device model.
